{"uri": "2024-05-346897029", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:47:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:47:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:16:52Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.843137264251709, "url": "https://www.aol.com/live-watch-met-gala-us-191652823.html", "title": "LIVE: Watch the Met Gala with us, see the best-dressed celebrities and our favorite style", "body": "LIVE: Watch the Met Gala with us, see the best-dressed celebrities and our favorite styleNaledi Ushe, USA TODAYMay 6, 2024 at 9:16 PM\n\nWe're counting down the hours until the Met Gala along with you.\n\nWe're excited to see Zendaya return to our annual favorite fashion event. And we always want to see what Rihanna has for us.\n\nWe've got you covered with everything you need to know from how to watch to who is going to be at The Met. And you can follow along live with us as we share our favorite looks, best moments and all the fashion from the 2024 Met Gala.\n\nWe'll be at The Mark hotel in NYC where lots of celebs are getting ready. We also have our entertainment and fashion editor Anika Reed on the stairs of the Met for all of your best coverage.\n\nWhat does the Met exhibit look like?\n\nWe got a sneak peek Monday morning, with Anna Kaufman walking through the \"Sleeping Beauties\" exhibit.\n\nMet director and CEO Max Hollein shared the internal logic of the exhibit, which seems to be - fashion is to be felt, not just admired, and no number of years passed should preclude that original purpose. While you cannot touch the clothing on display, the museum has created clever ways to allow visitors to experience the fashion through all senses.\n\nDrawn exclusively from the Met's permanent collection, the exhibition houses some 220 pieces dating back to the 17th century, head curator Andrew Bolton told the crowd Monday. Many of the galleries showcase a \"sleeping beauty\" or a dress lying flat, too delicate to even stretch around a mannequin for display.\n\nSee the exhibit The Met Gala's theme is Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion. Here's what that looks like.\n\nWho is going to the Met Gala?\n\nThe list is kept secret each year, but we know the co-chairs of the event will be there. So you'll definitely see Latin music superstar Bad Bunny, actress and singer Jennifer Lopez, \"Euphoria\" actress and Hollywood A-lister Zendaya and \"Thor\" himself, Chris Hemsworth, who will join Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour.\n\nHonorary chairs are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew. TikTok is the gala's sponsor this year, with support from Loewe.\n\nWe don't know if the Kardashians will all be there. But Kim Kardashian, Blake Lively and Beyonc\u00e9 - as well as Rihanna are expected.\n\nIs Taylor Swift going to the Met Gala?\n\nAll signs point to no. The singers resumes her Eras Tour in France on May 9. Even with a private jet, it seems the Grammy-winner won't be walking the carpet with Travis Kelce this year.\n\nThe 2016 Met Gala is where Swift supposedly met Joe Alwyn.\n\nWhat is Jennifer Lopez going to wear?\n\nIt's almost surprising that Jennifer Lopez has attended the Met Gala 13 times - with looks ranging from Catholic chainmail to 18th century lacey goddess.\n\nShe told Good Morning America that the night isn't about comfort. \"\"But it's exciting, it's exciting. It's a fun night for fashion,\" she said.\n\nWho was best-dressed at the 2023 Met Gala?\n\nOur eight favorite looks from last year included Rihanna and Dua Lipa.\n\nMore: Met Gala 2023 best dressed: See Rihanna, Dua Lipa, Janelle Mon\u00e1e, more stars channel Karl Lagerfeld\n\nWhy is Rihanna so important to the Met Gala?\n\nRihanna is known for taking big fashion risks - from her pregnancy announcement to her iconic look at the Met Gala in 2018 that had her dubbed \"Pope Rihanna.\"\n\nShe is known as the unofficial queen of the Met Gala for nailing the themes.\n\nRihanna's evolving red carpet style, including her unforgettable Met Gala looks\n\nWhen is the Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala is the first Monday in May, as is tradition. The exact date for the 2024 event is May 6.\n\nHow do I watch the Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala will be livestreamed on Vogue's website and social media channels beginning at 6 p.m. ET. The \"hautest\" event of the year will air live on E! starting at 6 p.m. ET.\n\nWhere is the Met Gala held?\n\nThe Met Gala is held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City\n\nWhat is the Met Gala?\n\nThe Costume Institute Benefit, commonly known as Met Gala, is a fundraiser for the museum's Costume Institute. Last year, the event hit a record and raised over $22 million, according to Vogue Business.\n\nWe almost all think of the Gala as the red carpet on the giant steps leading to the actual event, which is closed to media. The steps are where we see all the looks, who each celebrity brought as their +1 (if they were granted a +1) and who wore what.\n\nInside, guests can tour the exhibit, have cocktails and then sit down for dinner. There is a strict no-phones policy, so the only photos that we typically see are bathroom selfies.\n\nWhy does the Met Gala matter?\n\nIt is the best night of fashion - far exceeding any awards show or fashion week. You bring together celebrities, designers, fashion people - and art. It's a night to impress - and the looks aren't meant to be wearable, but rather tell a story on the theme of the night.\n\nYou'll see experimental fashion, gowns you cannot sit down in, wild looks and beauty. We saw Zendaya wave goodbye to her Disney roots in a Cinderella ball gown, Kim Kardashian in in Marilyn Monroe's iconic \"Happy Birthday, Mr. President\" dress and Jared Leto \"feline\" himself as Karl Lagerfeld's famous Birman cat Choupette.\n\nHow much does it cost to go to the Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala is invitation only - and Vogue Editor Anna Wintour holds the list.\n\nTickets are $75,000 each, according to The New York Times, and even if you buy a table for $350,000, you don't get to pick where you sit. You can't simply buy your way in. The event holds about 400 people.\n\nWhat is this year's Met Gala theme?\n\n\"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nThe \"sleeping beauties\" is not inspired by Disney princess, but rather treasured garments in the museum's collection that are so fragile that they need to be housed in special glass \"coffins\" rather than on mannequins, curators said. Garments will be displayed in a series of galleries organized by themes of nature.\n\nContributing: Taijuan Moorman, Anna Kaufman\n\nThis article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Met Gala live updates: From red carpet moments to best-dressed celebs", "source": {"uri": "aol.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Aol"}, "authors": [{"uri": "naledi_ushe@aol.com", "name": "Naledi Ushe", "type": {"uri": "2024-05-346763305", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:01:31", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:01:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:56:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8352941274642944, "url": "https://www.azcentral.com/story/entertainment/media/2024/05/06/where-to-watch-the-met-gala-2024/73586387007/", "title": "Where to watch the Met Gala red carpet? Here's what to know, including theme and who is attending", "body": "One of fashion's biggest events of the year is here: the Met Gala.\n\nThe first Monday in May has arrived and with it, every fashion lover's dream -- an evening of celebrities dressed in iconic looks walking up the steps of The Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC.\n\nWith its exclusive, mostly under-wraps guest list of 400, the Met Gala aims to raise money for the Met's Costume Institute, which is the only department at the museum required to pay for itself, according to the Associated Press.\n\nThere are cocktails, dinner and no phones allowed making it that much more enticing.\n\nSome of the most iconic Met Gala looks have come from stars including Rihanna, Blake Lively, Naomi Campbell, Jacqueline \"Jackie\" Kennedy Onassis and Lil Nas X.\n\nWant to see who stuns the carpet this year? Here's where to watch the 2024 Met Gala Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nWhat time is the Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala red carpet livestream starts at 6 p.m. Eastern time or 3 p.m. Pacific time on Monday, May 6.\n\nWhere can I watch the Met Gala 2024?\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala livestream is hosted exclusively by Vogue. It is then broadcast across Vogue's digital platforms, including TikTok and YouTube.\n\nThe Met Gala will also be broadcast through \"Live From E!\" on the E! network. You can get E! network through streaming platforms, including Hulu + Live TV, Fubo, DirecTV and Sling.\n\nWhat is the theme of the Met Gala 2024?\n\nThe theme for the Met Gala 2024 is Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion in honor of the Costume Institute's new spring exhibition.\n\nThe dress code of the Met Gala will be \"The Garden of Time\" taking inspiration from the 1962 short story by J.G. Ballard.\n\nEmily Stone?Emma Stone would like to be known by her real name, please: 'Just call me Emily'\n\nWho is going to the Met Gala 2024?\n\nThe co-chairs for Met Gala 2024 are Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, Bad Bunny and Anna Wintour. You can expect to see them in attendance along with honorary chairs Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Chew.\n\nWho attends the Met Gala is usually kept under wraps until the actual red carpet. Still, a few celebrities have let it slip that they will be there, including Rihanna, Lily Gladstone and Dua Lipa.\n\nFans may also see some of the hosts' significant others, including Tom Holland and Ben Affleck.\n\nIs Taylor Swift going to the Met Gala?\n\nIt's looking like Taylor Swift will not attend the 2024 Met Gala. This annual event is held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City and is an important night in the fashion world.\n\nThis year's benefit is arising the \"sleeping beauties\" of fashion, following last year's gala, which honored designer Karl Lagerfeld, who died in 2019.\n\nIconic moments at the Met Gala in the past include Zendaya waving goodbye to her Disney roots in a Cinderella ball gown, Kim Kardashian in Marilyn Monroe's iconic \"Happy Birthday, Mr. President\" dress and Jared Leto \"feline\" himself as Lagerfeld's pet Birman cat, Choupette.\n\nThink of the Met Gala as a royal ball in fairy tale movies. Here is what to know.\n\nWhat is the Met Gala?\n\nMet Gala, also known as The Costume Institute Benefit, is actually a fundraiser that benefits the museum's Costume Institute. Last year, the event set a record and raised over $22 million, according to Vogue Business.\n\nIs the Met Gala the same every year?\n\nThere is a different theme every year, as it matches an exhibit at the Met. This year's theme for the benefit \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" also the name of the accompanying exhibit at the Costume Institute.\n\nThe \"sleeping beauties\" are not inspired by the Disney princess, but rather refer to treasured garments in the museum's collection that are so fragile that they need to be housed in special glass \"coffins\" rather than on mannequins, curators said. Garments will be displayed in a series of galleries organized by themes of nature.\n\nIs the Met Gala theme also the dress code?\n\nThe theme and the dress code are different, but related. This year's dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by J.G. Ballard's 1962 short story of the same title, according to Vogue.\n\nDoes the Met Gala have hosts?\n\nYes -- they're called co-chairs and honorary chairs who work with Anna Wintour, the editor-in-chief of Vogue. Chairs for the Met Gala are usually celebrities who actually do some work before the actual Gala, such as helping with decorations, choosing the menu, curating guest lists, and hosting the guests as they arrive. Think of it as a committee that's planning a big event.\n\nFor invited individuals, the cost of entry to this year's gala is $75,000, according to CBS.\n\nWhen is the Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala is the first Monday in May, as is tradition. The exact date for the 2024 event is May 6.\n\nWhat time is the Met Gala red carpet? How to watch live, stream\n\nThe Met Gala will be livestreamed on Vogue's website and social media channels beginning at 6 p.m. ET, and will air live on E! starting at 6 p.m. ET.\n\nWho will be at the Met Gala?\n\nGuests at the Met Gala are typically a surprise, but the co-chairs are among the handful of confirmed attendees. Several guests at the Met Gala have already been confirmed, including Rihanna, Sydney Sweeney, Josh O'Connor, Mike Faist, Nicholas Galitzine and Kelsea Ballerini, according to Capital UK.\n\nRecent attendees have been Rihanna, Kim Kardashian, Cardi B, Serena Williams, Usher, Doja Cat, Barry Keoghan and couple Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade. It's unclear if they will give their best on the carpet again this year.\n\nWhat happens after the red carpets?\n\nWhat happens inside the Met Gala event is not recorded. This night includes a dinner followed by performances, according to CBS. ( Image Source :Getty )\n\nMet Gala 2024: The annual celebration is here! Every year, the most famous people turn to Met Gala in their trendiest outfits for an exclusive party. The Costume Institute Benefit -- officially known as the Met Gala -- raises funds at New York City's Metropolitan Museum of Art. This is the most prestigious fashion event of the year, and this year's Met Gala will take place on May 6th.\n\nAs fashion enthusiasts eagerly await the Met Gala 2024, let's get to know about the buzz around this year's theme.\n\nMet Gala 2024 theme\n\nThe Met Gala 2024 theme focuses on \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" However, the gala itself is themed around \"The Garden of Time,\" drawing inspiration from J.G. Ballard's short story of the same name.\n\nMany might wonder what this theme entails, and how guests interpret it through their attire. So, the gala's dress code evokes a creative exploration of time and its manifestations. It invites attendees to embody elements of the story's narrative within their fashion choices.\n\nVogue has hinted at an expected surge of floral and botanical-inspired looks on the red carpet. The gala's theme, 'The Garden of Time', is sure to inspire attendees to embrace nature's beauty and incorporate it into their attire.\n\nThe gala's theme is divided into three main zones: Land, Sea, and Sky. It mirrors the richness of natural resources, inviting guests to explore themes of conservation.\n\nAccording to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\", \"will explore notions of rebirth and renewal, using nature as a metaphor for the impermanence of fashion.\"\n\nAt a press conference held in November, Andrew Bolton, the curator in charge of the Anna Wintour Costume Centre at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, revealed that the theme for the year 2024 would combine technological elements with fashion items that are generally lifeless in order to arouse the senses.\n\n\"Sleeping Beauties will heighten our engagement with these masterpieces of fashion by evoking how they feel, move, sound, smell and interact when being worn\", said Max Hollein, CEO and director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, in a statement. \"Sleeping Beauties will ultimately offer a deeper appreciation of the integrity, beauty and artistic brilliance of the works on display.\"\n\nHow to watch Met Gala 2024 in India?\n\nIn India, Met Gala 2024 will be available for streaming beginning at 6:30 pm on May 6th. Vogue Magazine's YouTube account, Instagram, and webpage will provide live coverage of the Met Gala 2024.\n\nWho will host Met Gala 2024?\n\nZendaya, Bad Bunny, Jennifer Lopez, and Chris Hemsworth For fashion enthusiasts, this event is nothing short of a celebration. Since 2005, it has been celebrated on the first Monday of May each year. In this case, the event will take place on May 6 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York.\n\nThe Met Gala 2024 will be exceptional in a variety of ways and therefore, here is the theme, and dress code, who will be hosting and who will take part in this event.\n\nWhat's this year's theme?\n\nThis year's topic is 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion', which is also the title of the Costume Institute's Spring 2024 exhibition. Sleeping Beauty will feature celebrities recreating unusual clothing from four eras, providing viewers with a new perspective on fashion.\n\nWhat is the dress code for the Met Gala 2024?\n\nThis time, attendees have been advised to dress for 'The Garden of Time,' which is titled after JG's 1962 short novel.\n\nAlso read: Shreyas Talpade suspects his heart attack could be due to COVID-19 vaccine, questions the side-effects\n\nAbout Met Gala 2024\n\nThe Met Gala, also known as the Met Ball, is an annual fundraising gala held in Manhattan to benefit the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute. The Met Gala is widely recognized as the world's most renowned and spectacular fashion event and social gathering, dubbed \"fashion's biggest night\".\n\nAn invitation is highly sought after. The Met Gala, produced by the fashion magazine Vogue, invites personalities who are believed to be culturally relevant to contemporary culture from a variety of professional domains, including fashion, cinema, television, music, theater, business, sports, social media, and politics. {"uri": "8113248072", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "06:23:27", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T06:23:27Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T06:22:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://metro.co.uk/2024/05/06/2024-when-met-gala-theme-guestlist-what-happens-20781036/", "title": "When is the 2024 Met Gala? Theme, guestlist, and what happens at the event", "body": "From Rihanna serving boujee priest, to Jared Leto's severed head and Kim Kardashian dressing head to toe (literally) in black, the Met Gala has given the world some truly iconic moments.\n\nAnd now, as the first Monday in May approaches, we're bracing ourselves for the most anticipated red carpet of the year.\n\nAnyone who follows Anna Wintour's annual celebrity bash will know that each year, the Met Gala, which takes place at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, has a theme.\n\nWhile each is more vague and confusing than the last, the A-listers attempt to do their best to look the part.\n\nHere's everything you need to know about this year's Met Gala theme - and who will be attending.\n\nSince 1948, the Met Gala has been held every year (apart from one break in 2020 due to the pandemic). Known as the 'fashion Oscars', it's actually a fundraising event, to raise money for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute in New York.\n\nThe event marks the opening of the Costume Institute's annual fashion exhibition. Each year, the exhibition has a theme - hence the themed outfits we love to see on those now-famous stairs.\n\nVogue editor Anna Wintour is the lead chairperson of the event, and oversees the guest list - but just because you've been invited, it doesn't mean it won't cost you.\n\nTickets for the Met Gala this cost a reported $75,000 per person - that's $25,000 up on 2023. Typically, designers or brands will buy tickets themselves, and invite celebrities who, in exchange for a ticket, will have to wear that brand's clothes.\n\nAnd even then, every guest has to be approved by Anna, of course.\n\nThe event takes place on the first Monday in May every year, which means the 2024 Met Gala will be on Monday, May 6.\n\nThe museum itself is closed on that day to allow everyone to get ready for the festivities.\n\nIn 2020 the event was cancelled due to Covid, before returning in 2021, albeit four months late, when it was held in September.\n\nThe theme this year is Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nAccording to Vogue, Andrew Bolton, curator of the Costume Institute, said the exhibit will span 400 years of fashion history and focus on 50 historically significant pieces that are to delicate to be worn again. 'These are the 'Sleeping Beauties' of the title,' he said.\n\nPieces on display include an Elizabethan bodice and a satin silk ball gown. Many of the fragile exhibits will be shown along with the help of AI, CGI and light projection.\n\nDesigners featured will include: Phillip Lim, Stella McCartney, Yves Saint Laurent, and Christian Dior, among others.\n\nThis however, is not to be confused with the dress code, which is 'Garden of Time', inspired by the J.G. Ballard short story of the same name. A dystopian fiction, according to Vogue, the book (as well as the theme, and dress code) is about 'fleeting beauty'.\n\nLast year, the Met Gala theme was Karl Lagerfield: A Line of Beauty, which paid homage to the late creative director of Chanel.\n\nHowever, many disagreed that he should have been honoured in such a way, given various contentious comments made throughout his life.\n\nFrom the #MeToo movement to the Syrian refugee crisis and all things female bodies - there were many that disputed the fact Lagerfeld is a figure to honour on such a global scale.\n\nThis year, while far less controversial, the theme did raise a few eyebrows among some.\n\nMany will remember that in 2023, Kim Kardashian arrived at the event in a vintage gown that Marilyn Munroe wore to sing Happy Birthday to JFK in 1962.\n\nCritics questioned why the reality star had been allowed to wear a piece of fashion history, and Ripley's Believe It or Not, who lent Kim the dress, was widely criticised for allowing her to don the fragile gown.\n\nAfter the event, images were circulated by various sources which seemed to show damage to it, including stretched fabric and missing crystals.\n\nHowever, these claims were refuted by Ripley's vice-president of publishing and licensing, Amanda Joiner: 'From the bottom of the Met steps, where Kim got into the dress, to the top where it was returned, the dress was in the same condition it started in.'\n\nGiven that this year's theme is all about preserving and displaying historical fashion garments, some question whether Anna Wintour is having a little dig at Kim.\n\nEach year, the gala has co-chairs, who host the event along with Anna Wintour. The 2024 Met Gala hosts are Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, and Chris Hemsworth - meaning they're all going to be in attendance. This means we may also see Tom Holland and Ben Affleck join their spouses.\n\nZendaya hasn't been seen on the Met Gala red carpet since 2019, when she turned up looking incredible in a Cinderella-esque outfit, complete with a fairy godmother (her stylist) a wand, and a light-up gown.\n\nRihanna recently confirmed we'd be seeing her on the red carpet, telling Vogue she would be wearing 'Fenty something', but also stressing she'll go for a more modest look than previous years: 'I've had my nipples out, my panties out. But now... I guess as a mum and an evolved young lady... there are things I feel like I would never do.'\n\nAccording to a Page Six report, Met Gala newcomers for 2024 include actress Lily Gladstone, Ayo Edebiri, famous for her role in The Bear, and Saltburn star Barry Keoghan.\n\nPage Six also reported that Olivia Rodrigo, Uma Thurman and Sarah Paulson will be attending.\n\nWe can expect some regulars to show up too: Sarah Jessica Parker (she's been 11 times), Kendall Jenner - and a selection of other Karadashians - and Cara Delevingne.\n\nThere are some A-listers however who have publicly denounced the Met Gala. Tina Fey described it as a 'jerk parade' in 2010 and in 2013, Gwyneth Paltrow told USA today: 'I'm never going again. It was so un-fun,' but was left eating her words when she did in fact accept an invite in 2019. Comedian Amy Schumer has said that going to the Met Gala was 'punishment.'\n\nAnna Wintour has also reportedly banned some celebrities, these include Jameela Jamil and Lena Dunham.\n\nAnd it's bad news for Swifties, as we won't see Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce make their red carpet debut. Despite being invited, they have both declined.\n\nIn short, nobody really knows.\n\nAfter the guests disappear up the steps, it's a bit of a mystery. We know there's a dinner, and that there's an opportunity to wander around the exhibition. And, there's high profile performances - Lenny Kravitz, Madonna and Blondie have all showcased their talents in the past.\n\nBut invitees have to abide by a strict no phones policy, so bar official BTS photographs released by Vogue photographers, we remain in the dark.\n\nMORE : Neem London is the hot new menswear brand for all the fashion dads out there\n\nMORE : Met Gala: 8 celebrities who didn't understand the assignment", "source": {"uri": "metro.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Metro"}, "authors": [{"uri": "kristina_beanland@metro.co.uk", "name": "Kristina Beanland", "type": {"uri": "2024-05-346699040", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:54:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:54:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:46:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://www.rollingstone.com/product-recommendations/lifestyle/how-to-watch-met-gala-online-live-stream-red-carpet-1345210/", "title": "2024 Met Gala Live Stream: How to Watch the Red Carpet Online", "body": "The Met Gala returns on the first Monday in May -- here's how to live stream the red carpet online free\n\nIf you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Rolling Stone may receive an affiliate commission.\n\nQuick Answer: You can watch the 2024 Met Gala online for free with Vogue's livestream, and the catch red carpet coverage Live from E!: Met Gala with a free trial to DirecTV Stream or fuboTV.\n\nThe world's most exclusive party is here. The 2024 Costume Institute Benefit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, also known as the \"Met Gala,\" is taking place tonight, and as usual, the gala is shaping up to be a glamorous event, with A-list appearances and newsworthy outfits in tow.\n\nIf you're still figuring out how to watch the Met Gala online, you've got a couple options: both E! News and Vogue will have live streams of the 2024 Met Gala, letting you watch the stars on the red carpet as they arrive. Read on to find out how to watch the Met Gala online with a free live stream, plus everything else you need to know about the annual fashion event.\n\nMet Gala 2024: Date, Time, Location\n\nThe annual Costume Institute Benefit always takes place on the \"first Monday in May,\" and this year is no different. The 2024 Met Gala will take place tonight, Monday, May 6, with Live from E!: 2024 Met Gala's red carpet coverage starting at 3 p.m. PT / 6 p.m. ET and going until 6:30 p.m. PT / 9:30 p.m. ET. As always, the event will be held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.\n\nHow to Watch the Met Gala on TV\n\nLooking to watch the Met Gala on TV? Tune into E!. On the channel's Live from E! talk show, fans can watch the Met Gala red carpet live on TV (note: the actual gala is a private dinner inside the museum that is not broadcasted).\n\nHow to Stream the 2024 Met Gala Online\n\nLuckily, it's not too hard to watch the Met Gala online this year. Even without cable, you can watch the Met Gala red carpet online free through E! with a live TV streaming service that carries the network, like DirecTV Stream or fuboTV.\n\nBelow are a few ways to find a 2024 Met Gala live stream online.\n\nBecause Vogue is owned by Cond\u00e9 Nast (one of the Met Gala's sponsors), the fashion magazine is offering a stream of the Met Gala on its website, as well as digital platforms like TikTok and YouTube. This livestream will be co-hosted by actors Gwendoline Christie and La La Anthony along with model Ashley Graham along with Emma Chamberlain, who'll return as Vogue's special correspondent. Head to Vogue.com on the big night to watch the Met Gala red carpet live. 5 other channels, including ABC, CNN, Discovery, Disney Channel, E!, MSNBC, Nickelodeo\n\n2. Stream the Met Gala on DirectTV Stream\n\nThe best way for cord-cutters to watch E!'s full Met Gala coverage online is through a subscription like DirecTV Stream's package, which offers a five-day free trial and starts at $69.99 a month after the trial. The Entertainment package will get you E! and includes more than 75 other channels, including ABC, CNN, Discovery, Disney Channel, MSNBC, Nickelodeon and others.\n\n3. Stream the Met Gala on fuboTV\n\nUse the fuboTV's seven-day free trial to watch the Met Gala red carpet online free, with E!'s celebrity interviews, commentary and extensive behind-the-scenes coverage. E! will have the most Met Gala coverage online so you'll want to take advantage of the fuboTV trial to stream the Met Gala arrivals online free.\n\n4. Stream the Met Gala on Hulu + Live TV\n\nGood news: Hulu + Live TV now offers a three-day free trial, meaning you can snag a test run of the streaming service to watch the Met Gala red carpet coverage free before paying the $76.99 monthly subscription. The plan comes with Disney+ and ESPN+, in addition to around 95+ channels. That comes in handy if you're trying to watch shows that air on local networks like ABC.\n\n5. Stream the Met Gala on Sling TV\n\nSling TV is one of our favorite cord-cutter services -- and one of the best ways to watch the Met Gala online. The platform's Sling Blue subscription tier gets you access to E!, and right now the live TV streaming service is on sale for $10 off your first month, so you can watch the red carpet for as low as $35 for your first month and then $45 monthly afterward.\n\nSling Orange + Blue includes a total of 46 popular channels, including FOX, TBS, and CNN, all in one package. Sling lets you watch the Met Gala from your phone, laptop, tablet, or on your connected TV through the Sling TV app.\n\nMet Gala 2024 Hosts and Co-Chairs\n\nEach year, Anna Wintour -- who has put on the Met Gala since the Nineties -- chooses celebrity co-chairs to host the event. This year, the Vogue editor-in-chief will be joined by co-hosts Bad Bunny, Zendaya, first-time attendee Chris Hemsworth and Jennifer Lopez, and the honorary chairs Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew. Previous Rolling Stone cover star Emma Chamberlain also returns as a special correspondent.\n\nMet Gala 2024 Theme, Explained\n\nThis year's Met Gala theme is \"The Garden of Time,\" and attendees have been asked to make their dress inspired by the 1962 short story by J.G. Ballard. The theme coincides with the Costume Institute'' new exhibit, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, which will be on display at the museum from May 10 to Sept. 2.\n\nRevisit: Most Memorable 2023 Met Gala Looks\n\nThe concept was created by Costume Institute chief curator Andrew Bolton, and the exhibit will spotlight 250 pieces from across four centuries, \"visually united by iconography related to nature, which will serve as a metaphor for the fragility and ephemerality of fashion and a vehicle to examine the cyclical themes of rebirth and renewal,\" according to the Met.\n\nMet Gala 2024 Guest List: Confirmed and Likely Stars\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala guest list is expected to include stars like Lily Gladstone and Ayo Edebiri for the first time. Additionally, there are reports that Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Cara Delevingne, Sarah Paulson, Barry Keoghan and Olivia Rodrigo will be gracing the Met steps.\n\nDesigners expected to make the Met Gala guest list include Stella McCartney, Michael Kors, Tory Burch, and Tom Ford. While it's not been confirmed yet, the Kardashians and Jenners will also most likely be in attendance.\n\nAnd fashion and music fans alike are always hoping for appearances from the likes of Harry Styles and Beyonce, though none of them have confirmed their attendance just yet for 2024.\n\nWhat Is the Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala is an annual fundraiser and opening celebration of the Costume Institute's newest fashion exhibit. Unlike other A-list celebrity events like the Oscars and the Grammys, the prestigious Gala is not an awards ceremony. Those famous enough to be invited by Anna Wintour, the event's chairperson, will still have to fork over $30,000 for a single ticket or up to $300,000 for a table (oftentimes, fashion labels will pay the price of a celebrity's ticket in exchange for wearing their clothing).\n\nAs previously mentioned, this year's Costume Institute exhibition will be inspired by a 1962 short story by J.G. Ballard. The 1199-page tome traces the legendary writer's career, including tales about \"musical orchids, human cannibalism, or the secret history of World War III.\" The book's description aptly says the Complete Stories \"evokes the hallucinations of Kafka and Borges.\"\n\nYou don't need to have read the short story beforehand, so you can just tune into the Met Gala online without cable with a free trial to DirecTV Stream or fuboTV. {"uri": "8114343523", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:27:22", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:27:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:24:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/live-watch-met-gala-us-191652190.html", "title": "LIVE: Watch the Met Gala with us, see the best-dressed celebrities and our favorite style", "body": "We're excited to see Zendaya return to our annual favorite fashion event. And we always want to see what Rihanna has for us.\n\nWe've got you covered with everything you need to know from how to watch to who is going to be at The Met. And you can follow along live with us as we share our favorite looks, best moments and all the fashion from the 2024 Met Gala.\n\nWe'll be at The Mark hotel in NYC where lots of celebs are getting ready. We also have our entertainment and fashion editor Anika Reed on the stairs of the Met for all of your best coverage.\n\nThe list is kept secret each year, but we know the co-chairs of the event will be there. So you'll definitely see Latin music superstar Bad Bunny, actress and singer Jennifer Lopez, \"Euphoria\" actress and Hollywood A-lister Zendaya and \"Thor\" himself, Chris Hemsworth, who will join Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour.\n\nHonorary chairs are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew. TikTok is the gala's sponsor this year, with support from Loewe.\n\nWe don't know if the Kardashians will all be there. But Kim Kardashian, Blake Lively and Beyonc\u00e9 - as well as Rihanna are expected.\n\nAll signs point to no. The singers resumes her Eras Tour in France on May 9. Even with a private jet, it seems the Grammy-winner won't be walking the carpet with Travis Kelce this year.\n\nThe 2016 Met Gala is where Swift supposedly met Joe Alwyn.\n\nOur eight favorite looks from last year included Rihanna and Dua Lipa.\n\nMore: Met Gala 2023 best dressed: See Rihanna, Dua Lipa, Janelle Mon\u00e1e, more stars channel Karl Lagerfeld\n\nRihanna is known for taking big fashion risks - from her pregnancy announcement to her iconic look at the Met Gala in 2018 that had her dubbed \"Pope Rihanna.\"\n\nShe is known as the unofficial queen of the Met Gala for nailing the themes.\n\nRihanna's evolving red carpet style, including her unforgettable Met Gala looks\n\nThe Met Gala is the first Monday in May, as is tradition. The exact date for the 2024 event is May 6.\n\nThe Met Gala will be livestreamed on Vogue's website and social media channels beginning at 6 p.m. ET. The \"hautest\" event of the year will air live on E! starting at 6 p.m. ET.\n\nThe Met Gala is held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City\n\nThe Costume Institute Benefit, commonly known as Met Gala, is a fundraiser for the museum's Costume Institute. Last year, the event hit a record and raised over $22 million, according to Vogue Business.\n\nWe almost all think of the Gala as the red carpet on the giant steps leading to the actual event, which is closed to media. The steps are where we see all the looks, who each celebrity brought as their +1 (if they were granted a +1) and who wore what.\n\nInside, guests can tour the exhibit, have cocktails and then sit down for dinner. There is a strict no-phones policy, so the only photos that we typically see are bathroom selfies.\n\nIt is the best night of fashion - far exceeding any awards show or fashion week. You bring together celebrities, designers, fashion people - and art. It's a night to impress - and the looks aren't meant to be wearable, but rather tell a story on the theme of the night.\n\nYou'll see experimental fashion, gowns you cannot sit down in, wild looks and beauty. We saw Zendaya wave goodbye to her Disney roots in a Cinderella ball gown, Kim Kardashian in in Marilyn Monroe's iconic \"Happy Birthday, Mr. President\" dress and Jared Leto \"feline\" himself as Karl Lagerfeld's famous Birman cat Choupette.\n\nThe Met Gala is invitation only - and Vogue Editor Anna Wintour holds the list.\n\nTickets are $75,000 each, according to The New York Times, and even if you buy a table for $350,000, you don't get to pick where you sit. You can't simply buy your way in. The event holds about 400 people.\n\n\"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nThe \"sleeping beauties\" is not inspired by Disney princess, but rather treasured garments in the museum's collection that are so fragile that they need to be housed in special glass \"coffins\" rather than on mannequins, curators said. Garments will be displayed in a series of galleries organized by themes of nature.\n\nContributing: Taijuan Moorman", "source": {"uri": "ca.news.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, {"uri": "8113861835", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:20:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:20:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:20:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://www.today.com/popculture/news/met-gala-2024-rcna150251", "title": "Why Anna Wintour says this year's Met Gala theme 'unleashed confusion'", "body": "May has arrived and spring is in full bloom, which means it is almost time for fashion's biggest night of the year: The 2024 Met Gala, also known as the Costume Institute Benefit.\n\nEvery year, A-list celebrities dress to the nines and make their way to The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York for the exclusive event, which was first organized by fashion publicist Eleanor Lambert in 1948, according to Vogue, as a midnight supper party.\n\nNearly 80 years later, the charity benefit, which supports the art museum's Costume Institute, has turned into a major spectacle where photographers and journalists line the steps of the Met hoping to catch a glimpse of the stars who walk the red carpet.\n\nThere will be plenty of famous faces to see. According to Vogue around 450 stars land an invite to the annual event.\n\nAnna Wintour, the global editorial director of Vogue, has become synonymous with the Met Gala since she started overseeing the event in 1995.\n\nWintour, who is also a Met trustee, appeared on TODAY May 6, ahead of the evening's festivities, and spoke to Jenna Bush Hager about prepping for the gala.\n\n\"It's relatively quiet,\" she shared. \"Everything is in the details. We plan these exhibitions in the evening so far in advance that if we're not relatively calm in this point, we're in big, big trouble.\"\n\nShe revealed that teams start working on each gala two or three years in advance.\n\nWintour joins a group of celebs every year who serve as co-chairs and help plan the gala.\n\nSo who will co-host the exhibition this year and what is the theme? Find out everything you need to know about the 2024 Met Gala below.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala will kick off on Monday, May 6, at the historic Metropolitan Museum of Art in Manhattan.\n\nAccording to Vogue, the Met Gala has been held the first Monday in May ever since Wintour took over as co-chair in 1995.\n\nThe tradition has continued since then with the exception of the 2021 Met Gala, which was postponed until September of that year due to the COVID-19 pandemic.\n\nLive coverage of the 2024 Met Gala arrivals will begin on Vogue.com starting at 6 p.m. ET. The livestream will also appear on the magazine's digital platforms, TikTok and YouTube.\n\nLa La Anthony, Ashley Graham and \"Wednesday\" star Gwendoline Christie will host the livestream. Internet personality Emma Chamberlain will be the magazine's special correspondent on the red carpet.\n\nIn addition to Wintour, a few celebrities are asked every year to co-host the event. For the 2024 Met Gala, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth will be the co-chairs along with two honorary chairs: Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Chew.\n\nOn TODAY, Wintour complimented each co-chair. She mentioned that this year's Met Gala will mark Lopez's 14th visit to the Costume Institute opening. The editor also gushed about Bad Bunny after seeing him perform recently in Brooklyn.\n\n\"And then Zendaya, you know, a couple of years when she couldn't come, I felt gloom hung over the internet. Like, you know, a cloud of sad emojis because everyone always looks forward to what she's gonna wear. And I know she will not disappoint,\" Wintour said.\n\nFor the Marvel star, she playfully added, \"Who would be a better prince than Chris Hemsworth to wake up the sleeping beauties? And I can only talk for the corridors of Vogue, but the level of excitement when his name was mentioned rose several degrees. And I dare to guess that it might be the same here at the Met, too.\"\n\nLast year, Michaela Coel, Pen\u00e9lope Cruz, Roger Federer and Dua Lipa were co-hosts.\n\nInvitations to the Met Gala are usually hidden from the general public. The guest list isn't officially confirmed until the celebrities arrive on the red carpet.\n\nAll the actors, musicians, athletes and models who attend the Met Gala are selected months in advance.\n\n\"We start with a seating document when the names come together in December,\" Eaddy Kiernan, who organizes the seating chart, told Vogue.\n\n\"The actual seating chart doesn't come together until about a month before the event, when we get a sense for the layout of the room, and the flow of the evening,\" Kiernan revealed.\n\nKiernan said her team meticulously maps out which celebrities will be at the same table.\n\n\"We really try to think very carefully about who's sitting next to each other. Our ideal pairing would maybe be two people who we think will just get on like a house on fire, but who may not even realize that they have a lot in common. So with each person, we really do take time to think, 'What will they talk about?'\" she explained.\n\nAlthough we won't know who received an invitation until May 6, there are a few stars who make dramatic entrances almost every year. Rihanna, Blake Lively, and Jared Leto are some of the celebrities who always deliver a unique interpretation of the theme. Viewers should also expect to see the Kardashian-Jenner family posing for photos -- at least one family member has attended the Met Gala since 2013.\n\n\"It's often wonderful to hear after dinner, people say, 'Oh, we had the most wonderful conversations.' And so that's the idea -- that life can exist without a picture on your cell phone,\" she explained.\n\nSo are chives, onions and garlic, Wintour confirmed to TODAY. \"Those are three things I'm not particularly fond of. And so yes. That's true,\" she said.\n\nThe dress code of each Met Gala is paired to the spring exhibition at the Met's Costume Institute.\n\nWintour said this year's exhibition broke her \"cardinal rule.\"\n\n\"We came up with the title 'Sleeping Beauties.' It's wonderful, it's poetic, its romantic, but actually it could be many, many things,\" she said.\n\nThat, paired with the \"Garden of Time\" dress code, she said, may have caused mixed signals.\n\n\"I fear we have unleashed a lot of confusion out there for which I deeply apologize,\" she contined.\n\nThe new exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" features about 250 pieces from the Costume Institute's archives.\n\n\"Sleeping Beauties\" is not a reference to the classic fairytale, \"but rather the celebration of clothing and fashion so fragile that it can't ever be worn again -- and are thus sleeping beauties in the scrupulous archives of the Costume Institute,\" Vogue explained.\n\nDuring Wintour's appearance on TODAY, she spoke more about the meaning behind \"Sleeping Beauties.\"\n\n\"The idea of 'Sleeping Beauties' is taking these masterpieces from different periods. And because so many of them are very fragile, and have to be laid flat, they can't even be displayed on a mannequin or in any other way. They are laid flat, behind glass wall and around them are the inspirations that are muses, as (curator Andrew Bolton) calls them,\" she said.\n\nWhen speaking about the exhibition to TODAY, Bolton said, \"The idea is to try and reawaken garments in our collection through the senses. So, you're gonna be able to smell a garment, you'll hear it. You can't wear it, but you can see something being in movement.\"\n\nHe later explained, \"Nature's the throughline throughout the exhibition.\"\n\nThe paired dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by the 1962 short story of the same name written by J. G. Ballard, Vogue reported.\n\nBallard wrote about two married aristocrats who are under attack. The couple lives in a castle with a garden that contains magical flowers. When the flowers are removed from the stem, the garden loses time and motion.\n\nGuests might choose to embrace the floral aspect or focus on the importance of time and fragility.\n\nWintour predicted there would be plenty of flowers on the red carpet and hinted that her gown might have floral elements.\n\nIn 2023, the Met Gala paid tribute to iconic German designer Karl Lagerfeld, who died in 2019 at 85, with the theme of \"Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty.\"\n\nMultiple celebrities honored Largerfeld with their looks, like Anne Hathaway, Lily Collins, Keke Palmer, Brian Tyree Henry, Jessica Chastain, Kim Kardashian, Kendall Jenner, Kylie Jenner, Rihanna and A$AP Rocky.\n\nAs Jenna mentioned on TODAY, the 2023 Met Gala raised $22 million.", "source": {"uri": "today.com", "dataType": The 2024 Costume Institute Benefit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, also known as the \"Met Gala,\" is taking place tonight, and as usual, the gala is shaping up to be a glamorous event, with A-list appearances and newsworthy outfits in tow.\n\nlivestream met gala free\n\nIf you're still figuring out how to watch the Met Gala online, you've got a couple options: both E! News and Vogue will have live streams of the 2024 Met Gala, letting you watch the stars on the red carpet as they arrive. Read on to find out how to watch the Met Gala online with a free live stream, plus everything else you need to know about the annual fashion event.\n\nThe annual Costume Institute Benefit always takes place on the \"first Monday in May,\" and this year is no different. The 2024 Met Gala will take place tonight, Monday, May 6, with Live from E!: 2024 Met Gala's red carpet coverage starting at 3 p.m. PT / 6 p.m. ET and going until 6:30 p.m. PT / 9:30 p.m. ET. As always, the event will be held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.\n\nLooking to watch the Met Gala on TV? Tune into E!. On the channel's Live from E! talk show, fans can watch the Met Gala red carpet live on TV (note: the actual gala is a private dinner inside the museum that is not broadcasted).\n\nLuckily, it's not too hard to watch the Met Gala online this year. Even without cable, you can watch the Met Gala red carpet online free through E! with a live TV streaming service that carries the network, like DirecTV Stream or fuboTV.\n\nBelow are a few ways to find a 2024 Met Gala live stream online.\n\nBecause Vogue is owned by Cond\u00e9 Nast (one of the Met Gala's sponsors), the fashion magazine is offering a stream of the Met Gala on its website, as well as digital platforms like TikTok and YouTube. This livestream will be co-hosted by actors Gwendoline Christie and La La Anthony along with model Ashley Graham along with Emma Chamberlain, who'll return as Vogue's special correspondent. Head to Vogue.com on the big night to watch the Met Gala red carpet live. 5 other channels, including ABC, CNN, Discovery, Disney Channel, E!, MSNBC, Nickelodeo\n\nThe best way for cord-cutters to watch E!'s full Met Gala coverage online is through a subscription like DirecTV Stream's package, which offers a five-day free trial and starts at $69.99 a month after the trial. The Entertainment package will get you E! and includes more than 75 other channels, including ABC, CNN, Discovery, Disney Channel, MSNBC, Nickelodeon and others.\n\nget free trial at DirecTV Stream\n\nUse the fuboTV's seven-day free trial to watch the Met Gala red carpet online free, with E!'s celebrity interviews, commentary and extensive behind-the-scenes coverage. E! will have the most Met Gala coverage online so you'll want to take advantage of the fuboTV trial to stream the Met Gala arrivals online free.\n\nget free trial at fubotv\n\nGood news: Hulu + Live TV now offers a three-day free trial, meaning you can snag a test run of the streaming service to watch the Met Gala red carpet coverage free before paying the $76.99 monthly subscription. The plan comes with Disney+ and ESPN+, in addition to around 95+ channels. That comes in handy if you're trying to watch shows that air on local networks like ABC.\n\nget free trial at hulu + live tv\n\nSling TV is one of our favorite cord-cutter services -- and one of the best ways to watch the Met Gala online. The platform's Sling Blue subscription tier gets you access to E!, and right now the live TV streaming service is on sale for $10 off your first month, so you can watch the red carpet for as low as $35 for your first month and then $45 monthly afterward.\n\nget sling tv subscription\n\nSling Orange + Blue includes a total of 46 popular channels, including FOX, TBS, and CNN, all in one package. Sling lets you watch the Met Gala from your phone, laptop, tablet, or on your connected TV through the Sling TV app.\n\nEach year, Anna Wintour -- who has put on the Met Gala since the Nineties -- chooses celebrity co-chairs to host the event. This year, the Vogue editor-in-chief will be joined by co-hosts Bad Bunny, Zendaya, first-time attendee Chris Hemsworth and Jennifer Lopez, and the honorary chairs Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew. Previous Rolling Stone cover star Emma Chamberlain also returns as a special correspondent.\n\nThis year's Met Gala theme is \"The Garden of Time,\" and attendees have been asked to make their dress inspired by the 1962 short story by J.G. Ballard. The theme coincides with the Costume Institute'' new exhibit, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, which will be on display at the museum from May 10 to Sept. 2.\n\nRevisit: Most Memorable 2023 Met Gala Looks\n\nThe concept was created by Costume Institute chief curator Andrew Bolton, and the exhibit will spotlight 250 pieces from across four centuries, \"visually united by iconography related to nature, which will serve as a metaphor for the fragility and ephemerality of fashion and a vehicle to examine the cyclical themes of rebirth and renewal,\" according to the Met.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala guest list is expected to include stars like Lily Gladstone and Ayo Edebiri for the first time. Additionally, there are reports that Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Cara Delevingne, Sarah Paulson, Barry Keoghan and Olivia Rodrigo will be gracing the Met steps.\n\nDesigners expected to make the Met Gala guest list include Stella McCartney, Michael Kors, Tory Burch, and Tom Ford. While it's not been confirmed yet, the Kardashians and Jenners will also most likely be in attendance.\n\nAnd fashion and music fans alike are always hoping for appearances from the likes of Harry Styles and Beyonce, though none of them have confirmed their attendance just yet for 2024.\n\nThe Met Gala is an annual fundraiser and opening celebration of the Costume Institute's newest fashion exhibit. Unlike other A-list celebrity events like the Oscars and the Grammys, the prestigious Gala is not an awards ceremony. Those famous enough to be invited by Anna Wintour, the event's chairperson, will still have to fork over $30,000 for a single ticket or up to $300,000 for a table (oftentimes, fashion labels will pay the price of a celebrity's ticket in exchange for wearing their clothing).\n\nAs previously mentioned, this year's Costume Institute exhibition will be inspired by a 1962 short story by J.G. Ballard. The 1199-page tome traces the legendary writer's career, including tales about \"musical orchids, human cannibalism, or the secret history of World War III.\" The book's description aptly says the Complete Stories \"evokes the hallucinations of Kafka and Borges.\"\n\nYou don't need to have read the short story beforehand, so you can just tune into the Met Gala online without cable with a free trial to DirecTV Stream or fuboTV. Here's all you need to know about this extravagant affair:\n\nAs per a report by USA Today, the Met Gala is scheduled for May 6 and will commence at 6 p.m. ET. Fashion enthusiasts can tune in to Vogue's website and social media channels for a livestream of the event. Additionally, E! will broadcast the gala live, ensuring viewers don't miss a moment of the haute couture extravaganza.\n\nThe Met Gala serves as a fundraiser for the museum's esteemed Costume Institute. Last year's event set a remarkable record, raising over $22 million to support the institute's endeavors, as reported by Vogue Business, according to a report by USA Today.\n\nWhile the theme of the starry night is \"sleeping beauties\" it is not at all inspired by Disney Princesses. Interestingly, this year's theme is inspired by delicate garments housed in the museum's collection, also known as \"sleeping beauties.\" These fragile treasures have special glass encasements, similar to coffins, rather than conventional mannequins. The accompanying exhibit at the Costume Institute will showcase these garments, organized per the theme around the elements of nature: Land, Sea, and Sky.\n\nWhile distinct from the theme, the dress code for the Met Gala 2024 is equally powerful. All You Need To Know: Theme, Co-Chairs & More", "body": "The biggest night in fashion is just around the corner. Yes! The annual Met Gala returns to the Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 6th as has been its custom since 2005: the event has occurred on the first Monday in May except in 2020 when it wasn't held at all and in September 2021 because of the COVID-19 pandemic.\n\nThe Met Gala or Met Ball officially known as The Costume Institute Gala is an annual fundraising gala held for the benefit of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Costume Institute in Manhattan and it will be held at New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art which has served as its venue since its inception in 1948.\n\nConsidered to be the most prestigious, glamourous and highest profile fashion event of the year, the Met Gala has housed all the biggest and most famous names in the fashion, art, and music industries and it promises to be another unforgettable night of fashion and fundraising as invitees showcase looks that properly represent and interpret the theme of the year.\n\nVogue's iconic editor-in-chief, Anna Wintour, has been a champion of the Costume Institute for decades and to honour her dedication, the Institute's home is now named the Anna Wintour Costume Center.\n\nThe Met Gala this year draws inspiration from the Costume Institute's exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\". However, the main event itself has a separate dress code: \"The Garden of Time\".\n\nThis intriguing theme is inspired by a 1962 J.G. Ballard short story of the same name, hinting at a deeper exploration of the connection between fashion and the fleeting nature of life set against a backdrop of nature.\n\nThe exhibit will feature approximately 250 rare items drawn from the Costume Institute's permanent collection. Spanning over 400 years of fashion history. The pieces will include designs by Schiaparelli, Dior, Givenchy, and more.\n\nWith this theme and the dress code, we are expecting to see a lot of nature-inspired and vintage pieces on the red carpet.\n\nWho will host the 2024 Met Gala?\n\nThe event's co-chairs include Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, Bad Bunny and Anna Wintour.\n\nWhile the guest list for the Met Gala is highly confidential and kept a secret, we know to expect the hosts and Anna Wintour herself, a couple of regular attendees like Rihanna, Blake Lively, Adut Akech and a host of other celebrities.\n\nWe also know a lot of Stylistas are hoping to see African stars like Tems and Burna Boy again, might this wish come true? {"uri": "2024-05-346607577", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:30:23", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:30:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:25:57Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://eu.cincinnati.com/story/entertainment/2024/05/06/when-is-the-met-gala-2024-everything-you-need-to-know/73585703007/", "title": "Met Gala: Everything to know about fashion's biggest night - and the sleeping beauties theme", "body": "The stars were out for the 2023 Met Gala in New York City. USA TODAY's Anika Reed covered the red carpet, speaking with Kim Kardashian and more.\n\nThe annual event held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City always meets its promise of being the biggest night in fashion with experimental looks like Zendaya waving goodbye to her Disney roots in a Cinderella ball gown, to Kim Kardashian in in Marilyn Monroe's iconic \"Happy Birthday, Mr. President\" dress and Jared Leto \"feline\" himself as Karl Lagerfeld's famous Birman cat Choupette.\n\nThis year's benefit is arising the \"sleeping beauties\" of fashion, following last year's gala, which honored Lagerfeld who died in 2019.\n\nHere's everything you need to know about the grandiose event:\n\nWhen is the Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala is the first Monday in May, as is tradition. The exact date for the 2024 event is May 6.\n\nWhat time is the Met Gala red carpet? How to watch\n\nThe Met Gala will be livestreamed on Vogue's website and social media channels beginning at 6 p.m. ET. The \"hautest\" event of the year will air live on E! starting at 6 p.m. ET.\n\nWhat is the Met Gala?\n\nThe Costume Institute Benefit, commonly known as Met Gala, is a fundraiser for the museum's Costume Institute. Last year, the event hit a record and raised over $22 million, according to Vogue Business.\n\nMet Gala 2024 theme, explained\n\nIn November, Vogue and the Met revealed the 2024 Met Gala theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" also the name of the accompanying exhibit at the Costume Institute.\n\nThe \"sleeping beauties\" are not inspired by the Disney princess, but rather refer to treasured garments in the museum's collection that are so fragile that they need to be housed in special glass \"coffins\" rather than on mannequins, curators said. Garments will be displayed in a series of galleries organized by themes of nature.\n\n\"More modern, less delicate pieces imbued with the same spirit as the spotlight fashions will be showcased alongside them, and broken up into three sub-themes: Land, Sea, and Sky,\" per Vogue.\n\nWhat is the Met Gala 2024 dress code?\n\nThe theme is different from the dress code, but still related. This year's dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by J.G. Ballard's 1962 short story of the same title, per Vogue.\n\n\"Think melancholic florals (as moody florals aren't moody enough),\" the magazine added.\n\nZendaya on American and British Vogue covers in rare feat, opens up about beau Tom Holland\n\nWho will be at the Met Gala?\n\nGuests at the Met Gala are typically a surprise, but the co-chairs are among the handful of confirmed attendees.\n\nThe Met Gala has brought all types of lavish looks to the red carpet from Blake Lively's transformative Atelier Versace gown in 2022 that paid homage to Lady Liberty, to Lady Gaga's four-time outfit change in Brandon Maxwell in 2019 and Diana Ross looking like a vision in a ruffled dress made out of bird feathers in 1981.\n\nThe exhibit will be open to the public from May 10 to Sept. 2, 2024.\n\nCurator Andrew Bolton, the mastermind behind the Costume Institute exhibit each year, explained that this year's annual display includes both rare historical garments and corresponding contemporary fashions.\n\nAbout 250 garments and accessories spanning four centuries will be on view. The exhibit will unfold in a series of rooms, each displaying a theme inspired by the natural world. \"Within each space, historical fashions will be juxtaposed with their contemporary counterparts in an immersive environment intended to engage a visitor's sense of sight, smell, touch, and hearing,\" the museum stated.\n\nExamples will include a space decorated with the \"insectoid embroidery\" of an Elizabethan bodice, or a ceiling projecting \"a Hitchcockian swarm of black birds\" surrounding a black tulle evening dress from before the outbreak of World War II.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8113745529", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:05:18", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:05:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:04:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://www.vanityfair.com/style/story/how-to-watch-the-2024-met-gala-live-stream", "title": "How to Watch the 2024 Met Gala Live Stream", "body": "On the first Monday in May, fashion takes over The Metropolitan Museum of Art.\n\nOn Monday, May 6, the 2024 Met Gala will take over The Metropolitan Museum of Art. It's on the storied steps of the New York City art museum that award-winning actors, fashion designers, titans of technology, supermodels, influencers, professional athletes, and more come together to show off their sartorial sensibilities in support of the Costume Institute. Want to watch the Met Gala 2024 live stream? Tune in here.\n\nThe Met Gala is traditionally held on the first Monday in May. The 2024 Met Gala will take place on Monday, May 6, at The Metropolitan Museum of Art, located near Central Park on New York City's Upper East Side. The ultraexclusive event is more than a glamorous night out; it is a ticketed fundraiser that supports the Costume Institute's exhibitions, publications, acquisitions, operations, and more. It also marks the opening of the Costume Institute's spring exhibition.\n\nAs for what the attendees will be wearing, the 2024 Met Gala dress code is \"the Garden of Time.\" It's inspired by a 1962 short story written by J.G. Ballard. Like every Met Gala theme, it is open to interpretation by the evening's guests and could result in a range of renditions -- including ones featuring colorful florals, garlands of ivy, and dramatic timepieces. The \"Garden of Time\" theme connects to the Costume Institute's spring exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" Featuring approximately 250 objects, the show hopes to \"reactivate the sensory capacities of masterworks in the museum's collection through firsthand research, conservation analysis, and diverse technologies -- from cutting-edge tools, artificial intelligence, and computer-generated imagery to traditional formats of X-rays, video animation, light projection, and soundscapes,\" according to a press release from The Metropolitan Museum of Art. The objects will be united by iconography related to nature, which, the museum says, will serve as a metaphor \"for the fragility and ephemerality of fashion.\"\n\nThe Met Gala red carpet is unique in that each guest is allotted a time slot for their entrance. Arrivals on the Met Gala red carpet usually begin around 5:30 p.m., often with the event's hosts. {"uri": "8113926888", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:04:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:04:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:03:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://www.vanityfair.com/live/met-gala-2024-live-updates", "title": "Met Gala 2024 Live Updates: What to Know Before the Red Carpet Begins", "body": "On the first Monday in May, the Met Gala takes over The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Affectionately nicknamed fashion's biggest night, the storied event is not just a showcase of style, where attendees are instructed to follow a predetermined theme, but a fundraiser for the museum's Costume Institute. The glamorous occasion -- which is sometimes also referred to as the Met Ball -- first began in 1948 when fashion publicist Eleanor Lambert created it as a philanthropic opportunity for New York society (Lambert also founded New York Fashion Week, the Council of Fashion Designers of America, and the International Best-Dressed List). While what's in fashion has surely changed since then, the Met Gala's role as a benefit has not. According to The Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Met Gala provides the Costume Institute \"with its primary source of funding for annual exhibitions, publications, acquisitions, operations, and capital improvements.\"\n\nEvery year, a lengthy red carpet sprawled out across the New York City landmark's iconic steps welcomes an exclusive guest list consisting of designers, actors, athletes, supermodels, tech gurus, billionaires, and more as they make their way toward the museum in their themed finery. The Met Gala 2024 dress code is \"The Garden of Time.\" It's inspired by a 1962 short story written by J.G. Ballard and celebrates the opening of the Costume Institute's spring exhibit, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nAt the helm of the Met Gala 2024 are the event's cochairs. This year, Jennifer Lopez, Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, and Bad Bunny join Anna Wintour as cochairs. Meanwhile, Shou Chew, chief executive officer of TikTok, and Jonathan Anderson, creative director of Loewe, will serve as honorary chairs.\n\nFrom attendees getting ready to make their Met Gala debut to our picks for best dressed, follow along for all the updates from the Met Gala.", "source": {"uri": "vanityfair.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Vanity Fair"}, "authors": [{"uri": {"uri": "8113900797", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:47:01", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:47:01Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:45:24Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7137255072593689, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/met-gala-2024-watch-fashions-093000690.html", "title": "Met Gala 2024: How to Watch Fashion's Biggest Night", "body": "If you're wondering how to watch the 2024 Met Gala, you're in luck: for the fourth year in a row, Vogue will host the official Met Gala red carpet livestream on its website and across its digital platforms on Monday, May 6. This will give viewers an inside look at one of the most extravagant -- and star-studded -- events of the year.\n\nThe event, as always, will take place in New York City at The Metropolitan Museum of Art. It will celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nBelow, find out how to watch the 2024 Met Gala livestream, what the theme means, who will attend, and everything else you need ahead of Met Monday.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala will celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" and the official dress code is \"The Garden of Time.\" As always, attendees interpret each year's theme differently, so expect to see looks that are literal and others that are purely conceptual. The event's curators told Vogue that the exhibition will be shaped around three main zones -- Land, Sea, and Sky -- that pay tribute to the natural world.\n\nThe exhibit will feature approximately 250 rare items from the Costume Institute's permanent collection that span more than 400 years of fashion history, including designs by some of the world's most revered fashion visionaries and houses including Dior, Schiaparelli, Givenchy, and more. According to Vogue, some of the garments are too fragile to wear -- including a Charles Frederick Worth ball gown from 1877 -- and will be displayed via video animation, light projection, AI, CGI, and other forms of sensory stimulation.\n\nIn addition to Vogue editor in chief Anna Wintour, this year's celebrity co-chairs are multi-hyphenate Jennifer Lopez, actor Zendaya, musician Bad Bunny, and actor Chris Hemsworth.\n\nOrganized and presided over by Wintour since 1995, the Met Gala has become a truly iconic yearly celebration of high fashion (it's known colloquially as \"the Oscars of Fashion.\") A fundraiser for The Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute, it's usually timed to mark the opening of its annual fashion exhibition in May of every year. The one exception was in 2021, when the gala was held in September due to COVID-19 restrictions. The event raises eight-figure sums and invites around 600 of world's most famous actors, models, designers, captains of industry, editors, and generally some of the world's most highly influential and Celebrities have been known to show up late, like Beyonc\u00e9 who arrived last in 2015 and Rihanna who is often among the latecomers.\n\nLast year, Rihanna showed up around 10 p.m., with her partner A$AP Rocky by her side. She was pregnant with their second son, Riot Rose, and wore an all white gown with a large hood that transformed into a cape.\n\nThe star is always one to watch at the Met Gala, proving why it's called \"fashionably late.\"\n\nMuch of what happens inside the Met Gala remains shrouded in secrecy. steps and into the museum, there is some kind of party inside with dinner and music.\n\nThe event raises money for the museum's Costume Institute, and guests have a chance to explore its latest Take a look!\n\nThe Met Gala, often dubbed as the fashion industry's Oscars, is an annual fundraising event for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute in New York City. Renowned for its extravagant themes and star-studded guest list, the Met Gala serves as a platform for celebrities, designers, and influencers to showcase their creativity on the red carpet. Each year, the event is centred around a specific theme that sets the tone for attendee's attire, sparking anticipation and speculation months in advance.\n\nMoreover, beyond its glamorous facade, the Met Gala holds cultural significance, with attendees using fashion as a means of storytelling and self-expression. Every year actors, models, billionaires, fashion designers and many other profound names attend the event following the theme. For the fourth year in a row, Vogue will host the night's exclusive livestream, where you can watch all of the action from the red carpet in real time.\n\nThis year, the Vogue Met Gala livestream will be hosted by actor Gwendoline Christie, producer and actor La La Anthony, and model Ashley Graham. Of course, the Met Gala's star-studded red carpet on the first Monday in May cannot to be missed, either.\n\nBelow, everything to know about the 2024 Met Gala livestream -- from how (and where) to tune in, to what the night's dress code and themes entail.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala livestream will be hosted exclusively by Vogue, and broadcast live across its digital platforms, as well as TikTok and YouTube. Multi-hyphenate Emma Chamberlain will also return as Vogue's special correspondent to interview some of the biggest stars on the carpet.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala will celebrate the opening of The Costume Institute's new spring exhibition, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion. The exhibition -- which will be on view at The Metropolitan Museum of Art from May 10th to September 2nd this year -- will spotlight 250 items drawn from the Costume Institute's permanent collection, including some very rarely seen in public before. All of the works will be displayed in entirely new ways -- utilizing elements such as video animation, CGI, AI, and more.\n\nEvery year, the Met Gala provides The Costume Institute with its primary source of funding for exhibitions, publications, acquisitions, operations, and capital improvements.\n\nThe dress code for the 2024 Met Gala will be \"The Garden of Time.\" The dress code takes inspiration from a short story of the same title, written by J.G. Ballard in 1962.\n\nZendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, Bad Bunny, and Vogue's Anna Wintour will serve as the evening's co-chairs. {"uri": "8114048179", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:26:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:26:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:25:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7019608020782471, "url": "https://www.thestar.com/life/what-to-expect-at-the-2024-met-gala-from-hosts-and-guests-to-theme-and/article_422420b4-0bb4-11ef-94e8-1fc8e935f7b7.html", "title": "What to expect at the 2024 Met Gala, from hosts and guests to theme and controversies", "body": "What will the celebrities be wearing? Who did Anna Wintour ban this year? All the burning questions, answered.\n\nIt's the first Monday in May, which can only mean one thing: The Met Gala 2024 is upon us. (Also: tree pollen is off the Richter scale, but that's not nearly as chic.)\n\nHere's everything you need to know about this year's so-called \"fashion Oscars,\" otherwise known as the annual charity gala that reliably raises tens of millions for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute in New York City -- and is a reliable showcase for sartorial peacocking by a guest list that's hand-plucked from the style and celebrity firmament by Vogue's editor-in-chief and the event's driving force, Anna Wintour.\n\n\u00d7\n\nAlready a Subscriber? Sign in You are logged in Switch accounts What is the theme of the 2024 Met Gala?\n\nThis year's official dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" which Vogue, the official media mouthpiece of the Met Gala, says was inspired by a 1962 short story by the English novelist J.G. Ballard. Coles Notes: It's dystopian science fiction about a garden filled with flowers that can slow down (but not stop) the passage of time, and there's an angry mob en route to attack the garden's aristocratic owners.\n\nARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW\n\nIt seems the Met Gala will lean more into the enchanted garden's nature theme than the juxtaposition of a countess playing her harpsichord as the downtrodden proletariat storm the walls of her Arcadia in a society plagued by inequality. Says Vogue, \"We'll likely see many a floral and botanical look grace the famed Met Gala red carpet.\" Some have pointed out the \"delicious irony\" of an event that charges $300,000 for a table choosing this story as its theme in a time of financial hardship, such as this BBC article.\n\nAs is tradition, the broader theme is tied to a new exhibit at the Costume Institute. This year, it's \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which will feature 250 \"rare\" items from the museum's collection that encompass 400 years of fashion history, and will include high-tech simulacrums of pieces that are too fragile to be displayed. The exhibit is loosely organized into land, sea and sky-themed zones. \"It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,\" says curator Andrew Bolton.\n\nWho are the co-chairs for this year's Met Gala?\n\nThis year's co-chairs are Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth. This A-list group bring guaranteed star power to the event, but apparently are also put to work helping to curate the guest list and nail down the theme. They also give a speech on the night, not that we plebes will ever see it: While the red carpet is a public spectacle, once guests enter the museum itself the event is a strictly no camera zone where a veil of secrecy over proceedings descends.\n\nWhich celebrities will be at the Met Gala this year?\n\nIt's never guaranteed until they actually show up on the famous carpeted stairs, but this year's rumoured guests include Beyonc\u00e9, Ariana Grande, Pamela Anderson, Gigi Hadid, Sydney Sweeney, Amanda Seyfried, Lea Michele, several Kardashian-Jenners, crowd favourite Blake Lively and previous co-chair Dua Lipa.\n\nRihanna, who made a dramatically late entrance to last year's Met Gala, has actually confirmed she'll be attending, and that she'll be wearing something from one of her Fenty brands. (Whether that's skincare, makeup or lingerie is unclear.)\n\nWe've also got a few confirmed \"no\" RSVPs, notably Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, and Jared Leto, who last year attended dressed as Karl Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette.\n\nIs there any controversy surrounding the Met Gala this year?\n\nDoubling down on that \"delicious irony\" aspect of the theme, there's a strong chance that this enchanted garden of rarified privilege may have its own dissatisfied crowd to deal with. Unionized workers from Cond\u00e9 Nast, the media company that owns Vogue, have threatened to set up a picket line outside the event. \"Meet us at the table or meet us at The Met on Monday,\" the union posted on social media on Saturday.\n\nThere's also an Italian model, Eugenio Casnighi, currently going viral on TikTok for claiming he was \"fired\" from working as a greeter on the red carpet after he \"upstaged\" Kylie Jenner at last year's gala when the Internet couldn't get enough of him when he appeared in the background of a picture of her.\n\nHow can I watch the Met Gala?\n\nVogue will be live streaming it on vogue.com and we will be sharing the highlights from the red carpet on thestar.com as the evening gets underway.", "source": {"uri": "thestar.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Star"}, "authors": [{"uri": "sarah_laing@thestar.com", "name": "Sarah Laing", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Met_Gala", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Met Gala"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Wintour", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Anna Wintour"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "J.
