{"uri": "8114371707", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:52:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:52:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:51:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6352941393852234, "url": "https://uproxx.com/viral/what-time-does-the-met-gala-2024-red-carpet-start/", "title": "What Time Does The Met Gala 2024 Red Carpet Start?", "body": "Dust the Cheetos off your finest tuxedo t-shirt: the Met Gala is tonight.\n\nZendaya, Bad Bunny, and Chris Hemsworth are among the co-chairs of the 2024 Met Gala, which takes place at The Metropolitan Museum of Art in [extremely Matt Berry voice] New York City. This year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" while the dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" which sounds like the title of a fantasy novel for teens.\n\nWhen does the fun start? The Met Gala red carpet coverage will begin on Monday, May 6, at 6:00 pm EST / 3:00 pm PST on Vogue's website. You can also watch the arrivals on the \"Live from E!: 2024 Met Gala\" broadcast, which airs on E! from 6 p.m. EST / 3 p.m. PST to 9:30 p.m. EST / 6:30 p.m. PST.\n\nAnna Wintour, editor-in-chief of the newly-unionized Vogue, apologized for the confusing theme of this year's Met Gala. \"This exhibition broke my cardinal rule,\" she said in an interview with TODAY on Monday. \"When we came up with the title 'Sleeping Beauties,' it's wonderful and poetic and romantic, but actually, it could be many, many things.\" She added, \"I fear that we've unleashed a lot of confusion out there, and for which I deeply apologize.\"", "source": {"uri": "uproxx.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "UPROXX"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Met_Gala", "type": "wiki", {"uri": "8113820614", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:54:11", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:54:11Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:53:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6313725709915161, "url": "https://www.cbsnews.com/detroit/news/iconic-met-gala-looks-best-dressed/", "title": "29 iconic Met Gala looks from the best-dressed guests since 1973", "body": "Bad Bunny will be among the Met Gala co-chairs this year, along with Zendaya, who also made the best-dressed list, Jennifer Lopez and Chris Hemsworth.\n\nComing off a red-hot year in 2022, when he released his chart-topping album \"Un Verano Sin Ti,\" the Puerto Rican star was a vision in white at the 2023 Met Gala.\n\nLast year's theme was \"Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty,\" and Bad Bunny wore a white tweed suit from Jacquemus with a bold cutout revealing his back. He carried a 26-foot cape with flower details and finished the look with pearl stud earrings.\n\nIt was designer Simone Porte Jacquemus' first time at the Met Gala and he told Vogue he knew who he wanted to bring as his guest.\n\n\"Bad Bunny is my favorite artist, it's a dream to dress him for my first Met Gala,\" Jacqumeus said in the interview. \"I was so inspired by him, he is the ultimate Jacquemus muse.\"\n\nMichaela Coel was a co-chair for the 2023 Met Gala and she dazzled in a floor-length gown by Schiaparelli that was covered in crystals, accompanied by a large diamond necklace and chunky gold earrings.\n\nThe \"I May Destroy You\" creator's skin was glowing, with the help of makeup artist Bernicia Boateng, who told Vogue she \"wanted her skin to beam and almost speak for her.\"\n\n\"Anna [Wintour] has been a real champion of me, she put me on the cover of American Vogue,\" Coel said in a behind-the-scenes interview as she got ready for the gala. \"She said that I am not afraid to be myself... and that's why she asked me to co-chair.\"\n\nHer fellow co-chairs included Pen\u00e9lope Cruz, Roger Federer and Dua Lipa.\n\nLove it or hate it, Doja Cat did not hold back for the 2023 Met Gala. It was her first time attending, and she fully embraced -- and embodied -- the theme, dressing up as Karl Lagerfeld's beloved cat, a Burmese named Choupette.\n\nDoja Cat wore an Oscar de la Renta gown with cat ears on the hood and a large diamond that dangled in front of her forehead. To complete her cat transformation, her makeup featured black cat eyeliner and made her nose look more cat-like.\n\nThe Grammy winner famously stayed in character for her red carpet interview, answering every question with \"meow.\"\n\nChoupette, who Lagerfeld reportedly received as a gift from French model Baptiste Giabiconi, has her own Instagram account with more than a quarter million followers.\n\nBlake Lively has been gracing the Met Gala for more than a decade, and she ramped up the drama in recent years. She wore a stunning Atelier Versace gown for the 2022 Met Gala, drawing inspiration from New York City landmarks to fit the theme \"In America: An Anthology of Fashion.\"\n\nLively made an entrance on The Met steps worthy of her \"Gossip Girl\" character Serena Van Der Woodsen. Her first look featured a metallic bodice and bow inspired by the Manhattan skyline and Empire State Building, then it transformed into a long blue-green train based on Grand Central's constellation ceiling. She also wore a seven-tier crown to symbolize the Statue of Liberty.\n\nHusband Ryan Reynolds was by her side to co-chair the event in a black velvet tuxedo by Ralph Lauren.\n\nLively also made the best-dressed list with another Versace gown at the 2018 Met Gala in a jeweled bodice and detailed embroidery, paired with a halo headpiece.\n\nSpeaking of epic entrances, Lil Nas X put on a show at the 2021 Met Gala with three distinct looks from Donatella Versace.\n\nHe started in a large, gold cape that was then removed to reveal a golden suit of armor underneath, which he later shed to show off a crystal-covered body suit.\n\nThe fashion house called it a \"three-part LGBTQ+ American fairytale.\" The cape was meant to conceal his identity, the armor symbolized protection against prejudice, and finally the body suit represented \"living life as your true, unguarded self.\"\n\nThe artist is known for his daring fashion choices, including his purple prom look at the MTV Awards just days before.\n\nNobody does it quite like Iman. The supermodel has worn so many iconic looks over the years, but the 2021 Met Gala will go down as one of her best.\n\nHer outfit from Harris Reed, supported by Dolce & Gabbana, featured a gold strapless jumpsuit under a massive hoop skirt and matching headpiece made of feathers.\n\nReed told Vogue they were inspired by 18th-century hooped cage skirts that could \"take up space in a way that says, 'I deserve to be here and I own it.'\"\n\nIman first attended the Met Gala in 1981 with Calvin Klein and later appeared alongside her husband and fellow fashion icon, David Bowie.\n\nMaluma was the first reggaet\u00f3n artist to attend the Met Gala when he made his debut in 2019 and he continues to push the envelope.\n\nHe joined Donatella Versace for the 2021 Met Gala in a red-hot leather suit with bejeweled accents and accessories.\n\n\"My favorite part of my outfit was everything,\" Maluma told Vogue. \"I loved the cowboy inspiration, as I ride horses, but the highlight was the belt... It was a signature Versace cowboy belt inspired by the late Gianni Versace's classic '90s looks.\"\n\nHe also wore a 14-karat gold chain link glove with his nickname, Papi Juancho, written in stones.\n\nZendaya joins Bad Bunny as this year's co-chairs, and the fairy princess is quickly becoming a queen of the Met Gala. First there was Joan of Arc in 2018, then her Cinderella gown was among the highlights of the wacky and weird 2019 Met Gala, \"Camp: Notes on Fashion.\"\n\nWith the wave of a wand from her stylist and fairy godfather Law Roach, the dress lit up The Met steps, literately. It magically changed from gray to blue, prompting a large cheer from the crowd.\n\nRoach said the gown, by Tommy Hilfiger, represented Zendaya's transformation from the Disney Channel to \"Euphoria\" and more adult roles.\n\nAs for this year's look, he says Zendaya's dress won't even be fitted until Saturday, two days before the big event.\n\n\"I haven't seen Zendaya's dress!\" he told The New York Times in an interview published Thursday. \"We've been on two press tours - 'Dune 2' and 'Challengers' - and doing two Vogue covers.\"\n\nTime to work their Met Gala magic.\n\nThe Kardashians walked The Met steps together for the 2019 Met Gala and posed for an epic family photo.\n\nKim Kardashian donned a skin-tight corset dress from Thierry Mugler that looked as though she had just emerged from water. She was accompanied by her then-husband Ye, formerly known as Kanye West.\n\nHer sisters, Kendall and Kylie Jenner, wore coordinated sheer Versace dresses embellished with bright orange and purple feathers, respectively. Kylie was joined by her on-again-off-again boyfriend, Travis Scott.\n\nAnd of course it wouldn't be a Kardashian photo-op without mom, Kris Jenner. She had on a navy blue Tommy Hilfiger jumpsuit with oversized gray shoulders, plus a platinum blonde wig that was reportedly a last-minute suggestion from Kylie.\n\nThe Kardashian sisters have been known for some hit-or-miss looks over the years, including Kim's infamous \"black-out\" look in 2021.\n\nOh Billy Porter, where to begin. His 2019 Met Gala look was one for the ages.\n\nPorter entered the event lounging on a platform carried by six shirtless men. He then climbed down to spread a pair of giant, golden wings.\n\nIn a behind-the-scenes interview before the big reveal, he told Vogue that \"Camp\" is often discounted or \"thought of as cheesy,\" but, \"when it's done properly, it's one of the highest forms of fashion and art.\"\n\nPorter enlisted New York City-based brand The Blonds to design the Ancient Egypt-inspired look.\n\n\"Given the massive collection of Egyptian art The Met has, it was also our way to pay respect to that,\" he said.\n\nBefore Lil Nas X and Blake Lively pulled off multiple outfits, Lady Gaga was the original shapeshifter at the 2019 Met Gala. It was almost like the star was born to take on the theme.\n\nLady Gaga rocked four different looks all designed by her friend, Brandon Maxwell. First, she arrived in a massive pink dress with a 25-foot train and five dancers carrying umbrellas. As she entered The Met steps, her team unzipped the cape to reveal another black gown underneath.\n\nThen she unveiled another pink dress paired with large black sunglasses, appearing to apply makeup and pose for selfies. And finally, she shed that dress and stripped down to a black bra, panties, stockings and boots.\n\nThe whole theatrical performance lasted about 15 minutes and sent the crowd into a frenzy.\n\nCardi B made a bold statement in head-to-toe ruby red at the 2019 Met Gala. Her feathered gown featured a hood, giant train and reportedly 44 carats worth of rubies on the bodice.\n\nDesigner Thom Browne told Vogue he created this dress for her because she \"has the ultimate beauty in a woman's body.\"\n\nThe Bronx rapper was also covered in jewels at the 2018 Met Gala, when she was several months pregnant with her first child, daughter Kulture.\n\n\"Wifey is the truth, she just killed the Met Gala,\" her then-husband, Migos rapper OFFSET, posted on social media after the 2019 gala.\n\nJared Leto has been known for his extreme costumes, and the 2019 Met Gala was no different. He turned heads with a lifelike prop that looked much like his own head.\n\nAccording to Vogue, Leto took a page from Gucci's Fall 2018 runway show when model Unia Pakhomova carried a replica of her head as a clutch. His red gown and crystal harness were designed by Alessandro Michele for the fashion house.\n\nLeto outdid himself in 2023 when he showed up in a fluffy, full-body cat suit.\n\nSadly for his fans, he is reportedly sitting out the 2024 Met Gala because his band, \"30 Seconds to Mars,\" is touring in Europe.\n\n\"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination\" was the Met Gala theme in 2018, and Katy Perry soared in a giant set of angel wings from Versace.\n\nShe rocked a platinum blonde pixie cut with a gold mini dress and thigh-high boots. On top of that sat her huge wings that stretched from the floor to well above her head.\n\nThe singer pulled up in a vintage convertible before posing with the wings on The Met steps.\n\nThen, who could forget her outfit the following year, when she wore a crystal chandelier on her head and then dressed in a burger suit for the afterparty.\n\nFrances McDormand had the most fun with a whimsical headpiece from Valentino at the 2018 Met Gala.\n\nThe Oscar winner was photographed striking her best movie-star-pose as the massive headpiece nearly covered her whole face.\n\nShe was later seen in a social media video rocking out to the song \"Where's Your Head At\" inside the museum.\n\nTwo years later, McDormand appeared on the cover of Vogue, telling the publication, \"to still be culturally relevant as a 63-year-old female is so deeply, deeply gratifying.\"\n\nIt was almost impossible to pick the best Rihanna look, but her arrival for the 2015 Met Gala stole the show.\n\nThe giant yellow gown was designed by Chinese designer Guo Pei for that year's theme, \"China: Through the Looking Glass.\" Her dramatic train seems to have ushered in era of these dresses and their grand entrances.\n\nRihanna had back-to-back hits for the \"Rei Kawakubo/Comme des Gar\u00e7ons: The Art of the In-Between\" theme in 2017 and for \"Heavenly Bodies\" in 2018.\n\nThen, of course, in 2021, she walked the red carpet with her partner, A$AP Rocky, while pregnant with their first child, RZA, and again in 2023 while expecting their second son, Riot Rose.\n\nThe naked dress isn't exactly new, but jaws dropped when Beyonc\u00e9 walked in wearing this to the 2015 Met Gala.\n\nThe floor-length dress from Givenchy's Riccardo Tisci featured strategically placed jewels but was otherwise see-through.\n\nBeyonc\u00e9's stylist Ty Hunter says her 2015 gown was the heaviest one to wear.\n\n\"A lot of the rhinestones and gems, the rocky crystals, they were very heavy,\" he told Women's Wear Daily. \"It looked like the lightest ones because she looked naked under it, but it was one of the heaviest.\"\n\nQueen Bey's younger sister also made the list for the 2015 Met Gala with a head-scratching mini dress.\n\nSolange Knowles sported a futuristic design from Giles. While she told Refinery29 the dress \"gave the illusion of the fan,\" others compared it to an oyster, a sting ray or a computer background.\n\nSolange is known for taking fashion risks, and in 2018 she made headlines for asking her followers to vote for her outfit.\n\nAndre Leon Tally was a fixture at the Met Gala since 1974 and he hosted its red carpet correspondence until 2018. The former Vogue creative director died of a heart attack in 2022 at the age of 73.\n\nHe is seen here leaving The Mark Hotel as he prepares to host the 2015 Met Gala. That year, he praised Rihanna's gown as \"indulgent\" and \"luxurious,\" calling her the \"queen of the night.\"\n\nTalley's fashion career began at the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute where he took an unpaid apprenticeship under Diana Vreeland. Those who knew him said he didn't merely study fashion, he was obsessed with it since his childhood. He went on to work for Women's Wear Daily and Vogue, ultimately becoming the first Black man to be named creative director.\n\nSupermodel Kate Moss was the darling of the 2009 Met Gala in a metallic mini dress and matching headwrap from Marc Jacobs. That year's theme was \"The Model as Muse: Embodying Fashion,\" and she couldn't have been more right for the part.\n\nMoss and Jacobs have worked on runways and campaigns together since the 1990s, dating back to his controversial grunge collection.\n\nMoss also gets points for her 1995 Met Gala look, when she wore a pale yellow Calvin Klein slip dress with a plunging back.\n\nIt goes without saying, but Sarah Jessica Parker is always one to watch at the Met Gala. Her career has seen countless head-turning looks, from a thrifted dress for her first Met Gala in 1995 to her oversized mohawk for the 2013 theme \"Punk: Chaos to Couture.\"\n\nOne look that stands out is her outfit for the 2006 Met Gala theme \"Anglomania: Tradition and Transgression in British Fashion.\" She walked in with Alexander McQueen wearing a short dress while he wore a jacket, tie and kilt, and they both had coordinating plaid sashes.\n\nParker later told Vogue she was nervous because she deeply admired the late designer and even kept scraps of fabric he used from their dress fittings.\n\nThe 1999 Met Gala theme was \"Rock Style,\" so who better to make a splash than Liv Tyler, the daughter of Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler, and Stella McCartney, daughter of The Beatles' Paul McCartney?\n\nThe duo attended the gala together in matching shirts with the words, \"Rock Royalty\" scrawled on them. McCartney told Vogue she took a pack of Haynes shirts to a vintage shop in Little Italy, where she helped customize the final design.\n\n\"I didn't come at it intentionally to be rebellious at all. I didn't know what people wore,\" she said.\n\n\"It wasn't really appropriate that we wore those shirts. Officially, we weren't following the honors of the dress code. It was very cool and rebellious of Stella,\" Tyler added.\n\nFrom rock to royals, Princess Diana's appearance at the 1996 Met Gala goes down in history as one of the most memorable moments. The theme that year was \"Christian Dior.\"\n\nPrincess Diana made a statement in a blue floor-length silk slip dress from John Galliano for Dior and a pearl choker. Vogue described it as her \"most un-royal look to date,\" and said it signaled her freedom after her divorce and departure from the royal family.\n\nDozens of other royals have attended the gala over the years, including the Princess Marie-Chantal of Greece who made multiple appearances in 1989, 1995 and 2001.\n\nVersace's designs have come up several times on this list, and the siblings behind the brand are on here for their leather and gold look at the 1996 Met Gala. That year's theme was Christian Dior.\n\nGianni Versace was the theme the following year, months after he was murdered outside his Miami Beach home.\n\nHis sister, Donatella Versace, took over the fashion house and has been a staple of the Met Gala since the 1990s. She dressed some of the biggest stars, and early photos show her arriving with Naomi Campbell in 1995 and posing for a photo with Madonna and Cher in 1997.\n\nSpeaking of Naomi Campbell, she made quite the entrance in this shimmering, floor-length gown at the Met Gala in 1995, themed \"Haute Couture.\"\n\n\"I loved this dress. It was slim-fitting and body-hugging, and just glistened,\" she told Vogue in a 2020 interview. \"I remember when I saw this dress for the first time, I thought, wow, Gianni, is that for me? It seemed like one of those dresses that you read in those fairytale books.\"\n\nCampbell made her Met Gala debut in 1990 wearing a multi-colored mini dress also from Gianni Versace.\n\n\"I was in such awe to first be invited by Gianni Versace through my new roommate, Christy Turlington,\" she said. \"You dressed up in the '90s... Enjoy your clothes, enjoy your accessories, enjoy your hair.\"\n\nCampbell said her most fun look was from 2019 when she wore a sheer Valentino Couture gown with a feathered cape and lace stockings that came together just hours before.\n\nCher, the woman who needs no last name, took the 1985 Met Gala theme, \"Costumes of Royal India,\" to the next level. She wore a sparkling gold and silver body suit with a large matching ear cuff.\n\nOther notable guests in attendance that year included Henry Kissinger, Raquel Welch and Barbara Walters.\n\nCher may have also been the first to wear a \"naked dress\" at the Met Gala when she made her debut in 1974. The dress had feathered sleeves and she wore her long, dark hair down loose.\n\nThe Queen of Motown, Diana Ross, was photographed wearing a flowing, strapless feather gown at the 1981 Met Gala. That year's theme was \"The Eighteenth-Century Woman.\"\n\nRoss sported a similar feathered jacket for the 2014 American Music Awards, when she presented Taylor Swift with the first-ever Dick Clark Award of Excellence.\n\n\"I'm so blown away to just have received an award from Diana Ross,\" Swift said at the time.\n\nBianca Jagger, a 1970s muse turned social activist, is seen here wearing a dark strapless dress with a full skirt and detailed embroidery at the 1981 Met Gala.\n\nHer classic Dior style inspired Kaia Gerber to recreate the look in 2021. Oscar de la Renta designed a similar gown, and Gerber wore her hair in waves parted to the side.\n\nGerber, who is the daughter of Cindy Crawford, described the dress in one word: \"elegant.\"\n\nJacqueline Kennedy Onassis, former U.S. first lady, was known for her fashion that shaped the nation. She first attended the Met Gala in 1979 (\"Fashions of the Habsburg Era: Austria-Hungary\") and later served as co-chair.\n\nIn 2001, the Met Gala theme paid tribute to the style icon with \"Jacqueline Kennedy: The White House Years.\"\n\n\"Jacqueline Kennedy is one of history's great style icons,\" Vogue's European editor-at-large Hamish Bowles said in a statement at the time. \"Her profound influence on the way an entire generation wanted to look, dress, and behave cannot be overestimated. She set the standards that American women strove to follow, and, on the world stage, provided a visual metaphor for the youth and promise of the Kennedy administration.\"", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8114155136", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:46:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:46:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:43:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6274510025978088, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/most-surprising-stars-met-gala-163237030.html", "title": "The Most Surprising Stars Who Have Been to the Met Gala  --  from Princess Diana to Elon Musk", "body": "From athletes and TikTokers to tech bros and British royalty, these are the red carpet appearances we didn't see coming\n\nWhen the first Monday in May rolls around, we know one thing's about to go down: the Met Gala.\n\nAs the biggest night in fashion, the annual event guarantees one heck of a show, as celebrities from all walks of life flock to New York City to mingle among the who's who of the world -- like the regularly invited supermodels, musicians, actors -- you name it. But sometimes, there are a few attendees whose arrivals are just as unexpected as the looks themselves.\n\nAhead of the 2024 Met Gala on May 6, we're looking back at the most surprising guests to have walked the famous steps in years past.\n\nRelated: All About the 2024 Met Gala, from the Co-Chairs to the Theme\n\nFashion royalty met actual royalty when Princess Diana graced the carpet back in 1996. For her first and only time at the Met Gala, Princess Diana wore a Dior navy lace slip by John Galliano. On her neck lay a sapphire brooch, a wedding gift from the Queen Mother, transformed into a dazzling necklace pendant strung with pearls.\n\nNo matter where they were, you could count on 3LW's Naturi Naughton, Kiely Williams and Adrienne Bailon-Houghton to bust out their highlights, crop tops and abs, which they did in 2001. What more could you ask for with an early aughts Met Gala?\n\nHillary Clinton, a two-time attendee, made her debut in a gold ballgown to support fellow former first lady, the late Jacqueline Kennedy, who was the honoree of the 2001 \"Jacqueline Kennedy: The White House Years\" exhibit.\n\nDon't be fooled, this photo of Marilyn Manson and his now ex-wife Dita von Teese wasn't taken at a Halloween party. It was actually snapped at the 2007 Met Gala, where the rock musician wore his signature makeup with von Teese in a matching red lip.\n\nThe 2012 Met Gala was burnin' up extra hot when all three of the Jonas Brothers -- yes, Nick, Joe and Kevin -- showed face in coordinating tuxedos. This was the first and last time Kevin attended.\n\nBefore Tiger Woods and Lindsey Vonn broke up in 2015 after three years of dating, they were able to experience one date night at the Met Gala in 2013. They ditched their golf polos and ski suits in exchange for black-tie style.\n\nDerek Jeter and his wife, Hannah Davis, at the Met Gala is as unexpected as catching a flying baseball from the stadium stands. However, their debut in 2015 earned them a second invite the following year.\n\nThere's a small group of twins who've walked the red carpet: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen, Jared Leto and Alessandro Michele (they're not related, but passed as fraternal siblings once) and Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, who've been three times. Fun fact: the brothers -- who once claimed Mark Zuckerberg stole their idea for Facebook -- bumped into actor Armie Hammer, who played both Tyler and Cameron in The Social Network, at the 2017 Met Gala.\n\nRelated: Can You Guess How Many of These Celebs Have (or Haven't!) Attended the Met Gala?\n\nControversial news correspondent turned podcaster Megyn Kelly attended twice in 2016 and 2017. She hasn't been back since -- and described last year's Met Gala affair as \"trashy.\"\n\nEvery so often politicians make an appearance on the carpet, but Mitt Romney's night out on the town was the most surprising -- especially since he bought his tux on Amazon instead of going designer.\n\nJames Charles provided an eye-catching amount of influencer style to the Met Gala in 2019.\n\nThere wasn't any dancing involved, but Addison Rae's debut in 2021 still made a mark since she became one of the only TikTokers to attend. She returned the year after wearing Michael Kors.\n\nYouTuber Jackie Aina is considered one of the OG social media influencers of our time. But she didn't make her Met Gala debut until 2021.\n\nAnother TikToker who ruffled some feathers was Dixie D'Amelio. Although a newbie to the scene, she channeled a timeless look reminiscent of Audrey Hepburn in Breakfast at Tiffany's when she arrived on the Met steps in 2021. She said on The Kidd Kraddick Morning Show that the ensemble wasn't the one she originally planned on wearing.\n\nPete Davidson's got jokes -- and style too, so much in fact that he's attended three Met Galas in a row! He made his debut in 2021 solo, then was accompanied by his now-ex Kim Kardashian (who can forget their Marilyn Monroe and her bodyguard moment), and then attended by himself again in 2023. That year, he reunited with the SKIMS mogul inside the f\u00eate.\n\nOn a rare occasion a parent will tag along as their kid's Met Gala date, such as when Elon Musk brought his mom, Maye Musk, in 2022. What also added to the shock factor: the tech titan flashing a duck face for the cameras.\n\nIn 2023, Patrick and Brittany Mahomes made their debut in coordinating black-and-white looks inspired by Karl Lagerfeld. Now that he's a three-time Super Bowl champ and she's Taylor Swift's BFF, will they be gracing the carpet once again?\n\nRelated: Met Gala Co-Chairs Through the Years\n\nThe same year the Mahomeses went, WNBA star Brittney Griner made her debut with her wife, Cherelle, just months after returning home from Russian imprisonment in December 2022. \"It's everything just to be here with my wife,\" Brittney told Vogue.\n\nOkay, so athletes at the Met Gala isn't groundbreaking, but having a sports star helm as co-chair with Anna Wintour is a rare occasion. Tennis champion Roger Federer took on the role alongside Dua Lipa, Pen\u00e9lope Cruz and Michaela Coel in 2022, making him the only sportsman to do so besides Tom Brady, who co-chaired in 2017.", Mon 6 May 2024, 3:16 PM\n\nEllie Iorizzo, PA Los Angeles Correspondent\n\nThe biggest names in film, music, TV and fashion will ascend the steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York on Monday with their interpretation of the theme Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nThe Met Gala, known as fashion's biggest night, is held on the first Monday in May and celebrates the opening of the Costume Institute's spring exhibition at the New York museum.\n\nThe official dress code this year is The Garden Of Time, inspired by a story by JG Ballard about a man who turns back time by plucking each flower in his garden until it is barren - which could inspire a host of floral and botanical looks.\n\nThe guest list is kept a secret but over the years, viral looks have been delivered by stars including Lady Gaga, Kim Kardashian, Billie Eilish and Rihanna.\n\nVogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour has been running the Met Gala since 1995.\n\nThis year, her celebrity co-chairs are Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Jennifer Lopez and first-time attendee Chris Hemsworth.\n\nFashion powerhouse Zendaya most recently impressed with her futuristic, sci-fi inspired looks during the Dune: Part Two press tour, as well as her tenniscore ensembles during the Challengers press tour.\n\nMeanwhile, Lopez has been a long-time presence on the Met Gala steps, attending 13 Met Galas since 2004.\n\nLast year, the theme was Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty, in tribute to the designer who died in 2019.\n\nThe Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion exhibition will feature around 200 fragile and rare pieces from the Costume Institute's archive, inspired by the natural world.\n\nThe exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art will run from May 10th until September 2nd.\n\nRSS Syndicated Content Published: Mon 6 May {"uri": "8114031381", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:14:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:14:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:14:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6235294342041016, "url": "https://www.hola.com/us/celebrities/20240506359640/at-what-time-does-the-met-gala-red-carpet-begin/", "title": "At what time does the Met Gala Red Carpet begin?", "body": "The first Monday in May has arrived, and with it, the Met Gala. With its extravagant themes, A-list attendees, and iconic red carpet-moments, it's a night that fashion enthusiasts eagerly anticipate.\n\nOf course, the red carpet itself is central to this spectacle -- a runway where celebrities showcase their interpretation of the year's theme with jaw-dropping couture. But when does this glamorous parade of fashion and celebrity begin?\n\nThe Met Gala red carpet officially kicks off at 5:30 p.m. E.T. Hosted annually at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City, this event marks the beginning of the Costume Institute's annual fashion exhibition.\n\nAs the clock strikes half-past five, cameras flash, and the world's attention turns to The Met's grand steps, eagerly awaiting the arrival of the stars. Fans of the show can tune in to E! News or Vogue's official channels.\n\nWhile the red carpet action starts in the early evening, preparations begin long before. Media personnel set up their equipment and stake their positions hours ahead, ensuring they capture every moment as celebrities make their grand entrances.\n\nOne of the unique aspects of the Met Gala is its fluid schedule. Unlike other red-carpet events with strict timelines, the Met Gala operates on celebrity time. While the official start time is 5:30 p.m., there isn't a set end time. Celebrities are known for arriving fashionably late, adding an element of unpredictability to the proceedings.\n\nRegarding the Met Gala, being fashionably late is not just acceptable; it's almost expected. Iconic late arrivals, such as Beyonc\u00e9 in 2015 and Rihanna on numerous occasions, have become legendary moments in Met Gala history. In 2023, Rihanna, accompanied by A$AP Rocky, made a dramatic entrance around 10 p.m.\n\nWhen it comes to late arrivals, Rihanna has a master's degree. Even Vogue's Editor-in-Chief, Anna Wintour, humorously acknowledged that Rihanna is exempt from the punctuality rule. The Barbadian singer consistently pushes the boundaries of fashion and timing, solidifying her status as a Met Gala icon. {"uri": "8114285618", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:33:23", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:33:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:32:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6235294342041016, "url": "https://variety.com/2024/shopping/news/how-to-watch-met-gala-carpet-live-online-1235993089/", "title": "How to Watch the 2024 Met Gala Carpet Live Online", "body": "If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.\n\nFashion's biggest night is here. Dozens of the most stylish stars will descend on the Met steps on Monday night for the 2024 Met Gala, celebrating the Metropolitan Museum of Art Costume Institute's new exhibit \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nThis year's dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by J.G. Ballard's 1962 short story of the same name. The exhibit, which opened for press previews on Monday morning, features approximately 250 rare items drawn from the Institute's permanent collection. Spanning over 400 years of fashion history, the pieces include designs by Schiaparelli, Dior, Givenchy, and more.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala hosts are Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth. For the most part, however, the 450-plus person guest list is kept completely under wraps. That being said, stars such as repeat attendees Rihanna, Kim Kardashian, Blake Lively, Bradley Cooper, Billy Porter and others can be expected to be in attendance.\n\nOf course, for those tuning in from home, the most exciting part of the night is the red carpet, during which the attendees make their grand entrance and debut their themed looks. It's also the only part of the night that is broadcast to the public. Once the attendees enter the museum for the dinner and performance, pictures and video are strictly prohibited.\n\nThe best way to catch the red carpet arrivals online is on \"Live from E!: 2024 Met Gala,\" which airs on May 6 on E! from 3 p.m. PT/6 p.m. ET to 6:30 p.m. PT/9:30 p.m. ET. Those without cable can access E!'s coverage on a variety of live TV streamers such as DirecTV, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV and Sling.\n\nThe entire 2024 Met Gala red carpet will also be available on Vogue's TikTok and Youtube channel live streams, hosted by Gwendoline Christie, La La Anthony and Ashley Graham. Emma Chamberlain returns as the Conde Nast publication's special correspondent.\n\nOn Monday morning, after more than a year of talks, Cond\u00e9 Nast management inked an employment pact with hundreds of union workers at Vogue and other publications -- heading off a strike that threatened to disrupt Monday night's gala. Before the two sides reached an agreement on the terms of a new contract early Monday morning, Cond\u00e9 Union leaders had explicitly threatened to stage a picket line at the 2024 Met Gala. That would have presented the prospect of celebrities having to cross the picket line to get into the event. \"We're doing whatever it takes: Meet us at the table or meet us at the Met on Monday,\" {"uri": "8114282898", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:30:14", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:30:14Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:29:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6235294342041016, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-13388215/Met-Gala-worst-looks-Katy-Perry-Kylie-Jenner-Doja-Cat-Jared-Leto-walk-steps-famed-NYC-museum.html", "title": "Met Gala: The worst looks ever Katy Perry and Kylie Jenner", "body": "Stars put months into planning their Met Gala looks. But even with all that hard work, some celebrities have gotten it terribly wrong.\n\nLike that time Katy Perry wore a crystal chandelier on her head in 2019.\n\nOr Jared Leto was dressed in a fluffy white cat suit in 2023; later he took off the head. A runner up was his headless look.\n\nKylie Jenner lost a lot of points when she wore a backwards baseball cap in 2022, but no one can really knock her that hard as she was paying tribute to a late fashion designer, Virgil Abloh, who passed away in November 2021 at age 41.\n\nMadonna was heckled when she wore a camo dress in 2017.\n\nKaty Perry's chandelier look at the Met Gala in NYC in 2019 is considered one of the wackiest\n\nKylie Jenner attends The 2022 Met Gala Celebrating In America: An Anthology of Fashion at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 2, 2022 in New York City\n\nSister Kendall Jenner looked off for the 2023 Met Gala Celebrating Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty on May 1, 2023\n\nEven fashion icon Billie Eilish had a bad year once.\n\nZendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, Bad Bunny, and Vogue editor Anna Wintour will serve as the evening's co-chairs.\n\nThe dress code for the event will be The Garden Of Time.\n\nThe event marks the opening of The Costume Institute's spring exhibition. The theme is Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nThe exhibition will be on view at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on Fifth Avenue from May 10 to September 2, 2024.\n\nVogue will host the fourth annual livestream of The Met Gala Red Carpet, which will take place on May 6 in New York City.\n\nAnd the livestream will be hosted by some famous faces.\n\nStar Wars actor Gwendoline Christie, producer and actor La La Anthony, and model Ashley Graham will all be there.\n\nInternet multihyphenate Emma Chamberlain will return as Vogue's special correspondent to interview stars on the carpet.\n\nThe stream is hosted by Vogue and broadcast live across its digital platforms, as well as TikTok and YouTube, a press release shared on Monday.\n\nMadonna looked ready for war at the Rei Kawakubo/Comme des Garcons: Art of the In-Between on May 1, 2017\n\nIs that you, Rihanna? Celebrating Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty on May 1, 2023\n\nFlorence Pugh's headpiece did all the talking at The 2023 Met Gala Celebrating Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty on May 1, 2023\n\nSarah Jessica Parker looked like she was on fire at the China: Through The Looking Glass Costume Institute Benefit Gala on May 4, 2015\n\nJared Leto at The 2023 Met Gala Celebrating Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty on May 1, 2023\n\nDoja Cat as a cat on the steps of the 2023 Met Gala Celebrating Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty on May 1, 2023\n\nIman made quite the statement at The 2021 Met Gala Celebrating In America: A Lexicon Of Fashion on September 13, 2021\n\nLana Del Rey's look was interesting at Heavenly Bodies: Fashion & The Catholic Imagination Costume Institute Gala on May 7, 2018\n\nThere is excitement all around the event.\n\nBut in past years some stars have said that they were not fond of the party that is overseen by Vogue editor Anna Wintour. Here is a look at the haters.\n\nGwyneth Paltrow was the first big star who put down the party which was surprising because she has been on the cover of Vogue many times.\n\n'I'm never going again. It was so un-fun. It was boiling. It was too crowded. I did not enjoy it at all. I'm never going again,' the Iron Man actress said in 2013.\n\nBut then the GOOP founder went back in 2017 and 2019.\n\nJennifer Garner went in 2007 and never showed up again.\n\nThe 13 Going On 30 star said during Vogue's Beauty Secret series: 'I found it a little scary, so I haven't been back.'\n\nThe ex of Ben Affleck also noted that it was 'majestic and special' night.\n\nShailene Woodley wore a silver minidress with kinky boots for the 2018 Met Gala on May 7, 2018\n\nBillie Eilish had a misstep at the In America: An Anthology of Fashion, at the 2022 Costume Institute on May 02, 2022\n\nBen's current wife has been many times - with Diddy, Casper Smart, Marc Anthony, Alex Rodriguez as well as Ben.\n\nAmy Schumer told Howard Stern in 2016 , 'I don't like it.' She added, 'I have no interest in fashion. I like the idea of coming up with a way to dress that's more comfortable, that looks cool, that sounds good to me.\n\n'But other than that, I don't care.'\n\nShe said it was 'like punishment,' saying 'it's people doing an impression of having a conversation ... I don't like the farce. We're dressed up like a bunch of f***ing a**holes.' She attended again in 2017.\n\nSpeaking with Schumer, Lena Dunham said, 'You and I were literally sitting across from each other at the Met Ball, and it was like a crazy countdown to when we could escape.'\n\nShe then said of Kim Kardashian's ex Odell Beckham Jr: 'It was so amazing because it was like he looked at me and he determined I was not the shape of a woman by his standards ... I was like, \"This should be called the Metropolitan Museum of Getting Rejected by Athletes.\"'\n\nDemi Lovato had 'a terrible experience,' when she went in 2016. 'This one celebrity was a complete b***h and was miserable to be around. It was very cliquey. I remember being so uncomfortable that I wanted to drink.' She went to an AA meeting afterwards.\n\nPriyanka Chopra said: 'The Met's always like, so much work for just that carpet moment...But..I have a complaint.\n\nShe is loved, but this look was maybe too Vegas showgirl: Celine Dion at the 2019 Met Gala Celebrating Camp: Notes On Fashion on May 6, 2019\n\nThis was a very different look for Taylor Swift. At the Manus x Machina: Fashion in an Age of Technology event on May 2, 2016\n\n'There was no bread for dinner. No bread for dinner, I was so hungry after.'\n\n'My husband [Nick Jonas] ordered pizza by the time we got back to the hotel, so we were fine.' She then quipped: 'There goes my invite for next year.'\n\nLizzo said the event was 'really stingy with the liquor.'\n\nSza says she 'snuck out the back as soon as Lenny Kravitz hit the stage because I was feeling very like, \"Whoa, my anxiety's going crazy.\"'\n\nMadonna's daughter Lourdes Leon was grateful to attend in 2021 but said: 'You're just shoved into a room with all these famous people and you're supposed to talk to them and be their friend, even though you don't f***ing know them. That's not my vibe.' She added: 'I'm sure it's fun if you're someone who is friends with a lot of famous people, but I'm not. I didn't know who the f*** to talk to. I felt so awkward that I literally called my boyfriend in the middle of it.'\n\nTin a Fey said: 'It is such a jerk parade. If you had a million arms and all the people you would punch in the whole world, they're all there.'\n\nThe star who are banned from the Met Gala are Tim Gunn and Donald Trump.\n\nJENNIFER LOPEZ AT THE MET OVER THE YEARS\n\nBy Heidi Parker\n\nThe Bronx native has been at the splashy Met Gala in New York City many times over her career. Here is a look back at her glamorous statements.\n\n1999\n\nThe first time she went, the singer was on the arm of rapper and music producer P Diddy, also known as Puff Daddy and Sean Combs. The year was 1999 and she wore a pink dress with a matching fur jacket. He was dashing in a white turtleneck and button free coat. The theme was Rock Style.\n\n1999: The first time she went, the singer was on the arm of rapper and music producer P Diddy, also known as Puff Daddy and Sean Combs\n\n2004\n\nThe diva was in a black lace tiered dress when she posed with Stefano Gabbana and Domenico Dolce at the event. Her hair was up in a Swedish braid and she wore ruby red lipstick.\n\nIn 2004: The diva was in a black lace tiered dress when she posed with Stefano Gabbana and Domenico Dolce at the event\n\n2006\n\nIt was a drastic change in 2006 as Jenny From The Block opted for a one-shoulder gown in a soft white color with a sheer mermaid finish and her hair down. She added long earrings and carried a clutch purse for a very polished look. The theme was Anglomania: Tradition and Transgression in British Fashion.\n\nIn 2006: It was a drastic change in 2006 as Jenny From The Block opted for a one-shoulder gown in a soft white color with a sheer mermaid finish and her hair down\n\n2007\n\nThere was a 1920s influence for this shimmery silver dress that was off the shoulder and had a dazzling belt as she added a hair clip that matched her earrings and clutch purse. The theme was Poiret: King of Fashion.\n\nIn 2007: There was a 1920s influence for this shimmery silver dress that was off the shoulder and had a dazzling belt as she added a hair clip that matched her earrings and clutch purse\n\n2008\n\nIn the year 2008 the Wedding Planner actress went with a more feminine look as she had on a dusty green one-strap gown with heavy embellishments on the neckline and several folds. Her hair was worn in soft waves and she had on an oversized cuff that matched her earrings.\n\n2008: In the year 2008 the Wedding Planner actress went with a more feminine look as she had on a dusty green one-strap gown with heavy embellishments on the neckline and several folds\n\n2010\n\nThis year the Back-Up Plan star returned to Hollywood glamour with a sparkly strapless silver Cinderella style dress as she wore her hair up.\n\nIn 2010: This year the Back-Up Plan star returned to Hollywood glamour with a sparkly strapless silver Cinderella style dress as she wore her hair up\n\n2011\n\nThe Parker star went for a ruby look with a halter dress and flowers on her shoulders with a matching pout as she had her hair pulled back dramatically. Garner stunned in a red Valentino gown.\n\nBut after making her first Met Gala appearance, she never returned. And it's not because she broke any of the Gala rules, or because she was never extended another invite.\n\nIn fact, Garner has revealed that the decision to not attend another Met Gala was one she made on her own.\n\nWhile talking with Vogue in December, Garner admitted, while getting ready for the day, that she doesn't attend the Met Gala because it scares her.\n\n\"I went to the Met Ball exactly one time. I found it a little scary so I haven't been back,\" she explained to Vogue.\n\nBut despite finding it unnerving, that doesn't mean Garner doesn't have any fond memories from that time. As she continued, that gorgeous red gown she wore is something she will always remember.\n\n\"But I wore that night, this magical red Valentino gown and I was [Valentino's] date and that was really majestic and special,\" she added.\n\nIt's unclear if Garner will ever make the decision to return to the Gala at least one more time.\n\nThis year, the Met Gala is celebrating its \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibit which is an ode to nature, and pays tribute to the \"natural world,\" according to Vogue. The Gala is also pulling inspiration from J.G. Ballard's short story from 1962 titled \"The Garden of Time.\"\n\n\"The Garden of Time\" can be interpreted many different ways. But there is some consensus that Ballard's short story is a metaphor for the importance of preserving history and the affect time has on the past.\n\nThe night of May 6, the Met will hold its annual Gala which began in 1948. {"uri": "8114362607", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:43:29", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:43:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:42:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6196078658103943, "url": "https://www.cheatsheet.com/entertainment/plastic-surgery-nurse-reveals-met-gala-glow-cosmetic-treatment-cost.html/", "title": "Plastic Surgery Nurse Reveals the 'Met Gala Glow' Cosmetic Treatment and Cost", "body": "The 2024 Met Gala is here, and fans can't wait to see what the A-listers are wearing for this year's theme, \"The Garden of Time,\" after the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute exhibit, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" Hollywood socialites will arrive at the event dressed to the nines. Weeks before the event, many visit plastic surgeons for the \"Met Gala Glow\" cosmetic treatment. Here's what it entails.\n\nCelebrities want to look their best at the Met Gala, as it's the ideal opportunity to represent high fashion. And many A-listers visit estheticians and plastic surgeons before the event to ensure they look their best. Tara Adashev, a head nurse at Neinstein Plastic Surgery in Manhattan, spoke to The Sun about what celebrities are getting done before heading to the Met Gala.\n\n\"Many celebs have the same fears and worries about their appearance as normal people,\" Adashev shared with the publication. She noted that famous folks often opt to receive the \"Met Gala Glow\" to give their skin a \"glassy glow.\"\n\nSo, what does the \"Met Gala Glow\" entail? \"It's a cocktail that's completely just for your skin type,\" Adashev said. \"We're treating the needs of your skin -- not mine, not someone else's.\"\n\nTypically, the treatment begins with a $400 AquaGold facial. AquaGold is a 24-carat gold medical facial device that offers a microneedling procedure to deposit hyaluronic acid and fillers into the skin. This helps reduce pore size and texture. Patients who receive the procedure love it for its natural look. Celebrities receiving an AquaGold facial have it done 24 to 48 hours before an event (such as the Met Gala). The results last three to four weeks.\n\n\"By the time that kicks in, your skin is glowing, and your makeup goes on nice and smooth,\" Adashev explained. \"Everyone's really into the glassy skin, the doughnut glaze look.\"\n\nThe \"Met Gala Glow\" also includes the Lutronic Ultra laser, which costs about $800 per treatment. \"This is good seven to 10 days leading up to the Met Gala for skin tightening, skin brightening, anti-aging, pores, wrinkles,\" the nurse said of the procedure.\n\nFinally, celebrities typically top off their looks with Botox.\n\nNew York-based plastic surgeon Dr. Ryan Neinstein also discussed caring for celebrity clients before the Met Gala in 2023. He told DailyMail.com that he had to open up space the weekend before the Met Gala to ensure all of his A-list patients could be cared for.\n\n\"I am usually busy around this time of year, but for the Met Gala, we had to open up all weekend, as guests are trying to get their last-minute touches,\" he told the publication. In addition to Botox and fillers, the surgeon explained that famous folks wanted lymphatic drainage massages to release excess water and decrease swelling.\n\nTara Adashev, the head nurse who spoke to The Sun in 2024, also discussed the booming business in 2023. She explained that celebrities received Botox at the base of their nose before the event. \"An injection of 2-4 units will help the nose from down turning when you smile,\" she explained.\n\nNeinstein added that many of his clients were men in 2023. \"The male audience for these procedures has gotten bigger and bigger, and for this year's Met Gala, we are close to 50% male clients,\" he added.\n\nThe Met Gala typically hosts around 450 attendees; fans can't wait to see which celebrities attend the 2024 event. Unfortunately, the guest list is top secret until the event begins. But we know Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, and Chris Hemsworth will host this year.\n\nA fan on Reddit released additional names of celebrity attendees. {"uri": "8113623967", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "10:44:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T10:44:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:43:55Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.615686297416687, "url": "https://www.sunstar.com.ph/cebu/everything-you-need-to-know-about-me-2024-met-gala", "title": "Everything you need to know about me 2024 Met Gala", "body": "Happening May 6, 2024 in New York City, this iconic event promises to meld the past with the present in an enchanting display titled \"The Garden of Time.\" For global viewers, including those in the Philippines (May 7, PH time), here's your guide to everything about the Met Gala 2024, from the theme and hosts to viewing details.\n\nEach Met Gala revolves around a unique theme that corresponds with The Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute's new spring exhibition.\n\nThis year, the theme is \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by the exhibition \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" This thematic choice invites celebrities to explore fantastical and timeless elements in their attire, promising a night of fashion-forward interpretations and breathtaking ensembles.\n\nThe exhibition: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\"\n\nOpening to the public on May 10, the \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibition features 250 historical pieces awakened from the depths of the institute's archive. Curator Andrew Bolton has designed the exhibit to be a multi-sensory experience, incorporating not just visual splendor but also engaging sounds, scents and tactile experiences. Highlights include a living garden coat by Jonathan Anderson of LOEWE and scent recreations by smell artist Sissel Tolaas, adding layers of depth to the fashion storytelling.\n\nHosts, notable guests\n\nThis year's gala sees a star-studded lineup of co-hosts including Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth. As usual, an array of celebrities from various industries -- film, fashion, music, sports and more -- will ascend the Met's iconic steps, adorned in outfits that speak to the evening's theme.\n\nViewing details: When, where to watch\n\nThe Met Gala will take place at its traditional venue, The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City, on the first Monday of May. For those eager to catch every moment, the live stream begins at 6 p.m. EST on May 6, (6 a.m., May 7, PH time). Vogue will host the official stream on its website, and the AP will provide a live feed of the glamorous arrivals from the Mark Hotel. Additionally, local and international viewers can find spots along Fifth Avenue, behind barricades, to watch the event unfold in person or tune in from anywhere in the world for a front-row experience of the red carpet.\n\nAttendees are expected to interpret the theme \"The Garden of Time\" through their fashion choices, which could range from literal floral designs to more abstract representations of time and nature. The event not only showcases high fashion but also celebrates the intersection of culture and art through its elaborate themes and exhibitions.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala not only marks a night of extraordinary fashion but also sets the stage for a deeper appreciation of the artistry behind historic and contemporary fashion. As the night unfolds, it will surely add another memorable chapter to the storied legacy of the Met Gala.", "source": {"uri": "sunstar.com.ph", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sun.Star Network Online"}, {"uri": "2024-05-346505481", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:58:36", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:58:36Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:52:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6117647290229797, "url": "https://exbulletin.com/fashion/2687582/", "title": "'Garden of Time' Theme and Dress Code, Explained - NBC New York", "body": "This means fans can expect to see a explosion of flowers and nature-inspired creations on the red carpet.\n\n\"This innovative exhibition will push the limits of our imagination,\" museum CEO Max Hollein said in November. Vogue. \"And invites us to discover the many facets of a work, to learn more about its history and, ultimately, to better appreciate its beauty.\"\n\nBut before celebrities show off their flower power, keep reading to get the Met Gala 2024 details.\n\nThis year's Met Gala celebrates the Costume Institute's new exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nHowever, this is not a reinvention of a Disney princess. It's about honoring clothes that are so fragile that they can never be worn again. Thus, these diaphanous fabrics and unique constructions are considered \"sleeping beauties\" in the museum archives.\n\nAs Andrew Bolton, chief curator of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, said Vogue\"It's truly an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion.\"\n\nThe exhibition will also have three main zones highlighting the elements of the Earth: Earth, Sea and Sky.\n\nWhat inspired the 2024 Met Gala theme?\n\nFashion extravagance draws inspiration from everything from legendary designers to religion and futurism. But this year's Met Gala pays homage to the 1962 short story, \"The Garden of Time,\" written by author JG Ballard.\n\nThe book follows Count Axel and his wife as they listen to Mozart in their beautiful villa surrounded by a crystal flower garden. But outside their golden cage, an angry mob approaches their place of solitude. To keep the army at bay, Axel must go back in time by picking his flowers, one by one, until there is nothing left.\n\nWhat is the dress code for the Met Gala 2024?\n\nThe dress code for the 2024 Met Gala is \"The Garden of Time,\" which is inspired by the title of JG's short story. Although the theme can be interpreted in different ways, it is likely that we will see designs inspired by plants, flowers and other plants.\n\nFlowers ? For spring? Well, yes, it will be groundbreaking at the Met Gala.\n\nHow long will the fashion exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum last?\n\nThe exhibition runs from May 10 to September 2.\n\nAccording to ENCOUNTERthe show will feature approximately 250 garments and accessories, all visually connected through nature.\n\nSo expect to be transported, because the exhibition includes several sensory abilities, such as smelling hats with floral notes or touching walls embossed with embroidered fabrics. And get ready to contemplate the \"illusion technique known as Pepper's ghost,\" says the museum's website, which will show how the \"hobbled skirt\" restricted women's stride in the early 20th century.\n\nIn total, the exhibition will cover more than 400 years of fashion history and feature designs by Schiaparelli, Dior, Givenchy and others. And pieces too fragile to be worn again, such as an 1877 Charles Frederick Worth dress, will be viewed via \"animation, light projection, AI, CGI and other forms of sensory stimulation,\" the website reads. of the museum.\n\n\"By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses,\" Andrew said in a press release, \"the exhibition aims to reconnect with the works on display as they were originally conceived with dynamism, dynamism and finally with life.\n\nOver the years, the Met Gala has been the place where many great Hollywood couples have made their debut.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8113742111", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:03:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:03:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:02:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6078431606292725, "url": "https://www.cbsnews.com/news/how-much-are-met-gala-tickets-2024/", "title": "How much does a Met Gala ticket cost? A look at the price of entry for fashion's biggest night", "body": "Even the 2024 Met Gala isn't immune from inflation, it seems. The cost of attending the annual black-tie event, dubbed \"fashion's biggest night,\" is up sharply this year, with the price of an individual ticket soaring above the average down payment on a house.\n\nOfficially called The Costume Institute Benefit, the gathering of celebrities from the worlds of entertainment, design, sports and other industries supports the Metropolitan Museum of Art's acquisitions and exhibitions related to fashion. Attendees often wear outlandish attire in keeping with the event's theme.\n\nThe co-chairs of this year's benefit, held on May 6, are Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, Anna Wintour and Zendaya. It celebrates the opening of the Costume Institute's spring exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" The dress code? \"The Garden of Time,\" according to The Met.\n\nThe exhibit's description provides some clues as to how to translate that into fashion. Hint: Pick styes that evoke nature. It features 250 garments spanning four centuries, which are \"visually united by iconography related to nature, which will serve as a metaphor for the fragility and ephemerality of fashion and a vehicle to examine the cyclical themes of rebirth and renewal,\" The Met notes.\n\nBut because the gala is a fundraiser, the price of admission doesn't come cheap, even if you're on the exclusive guest list.\n\nFor invited individuals, the cost of entry to this year's gala is $75,000, The Met told CBS MoneyWatch. That's up 50% from last year's $50,000 price tag.\n\nA 10-person table starts at $350,000, according to The Met.\n\nWell, first they have to be invited. Not just anyone can buy a ticket or a table to the event.\n\nMeanwhile, many celebrities don't pay full freight. Instead, a design house typically springs for a table and invites guests they wish to host, one attendee confirmed to CBS MoneyWatch. So for some particularly glittering guests, attendance is free.\n\nAnna Wintour, who is Cond\u00e9 Nast's chief content officer, global editorial director at Vogue and a Met Trustee since 1999, controls the event's guest list. To date, under her leadership the event has raised more than $223.5 million for The Costume Institute, according to The Met.\n\nLast year's Met Gala raised raised nearly $22 million. The 2024 Met Gala will have some of the world's most prominent celebrities walking the red carpet dressed in designer best. The theme of this year's Gala stems from the latest exhibition by the Costume Institute of the Metropolitan Museum of Art- 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion'. So one can expect fairytale meets couture on the red carpet at this year's Met Gala 2024.\n\n\"When an item of clothing enters our collection, its status is changed irrevocably. What was once a vital part of a person's lived experience is now a motionless 'artwork' that can no longer be worn or heard, touched, or smelled. The exhibition endeavors to reanimate these artworks by re-awakening their sensory capacities through a diverse range of technologies, affording visitors sensorial 'access' to rare historical garments and rarefied contemporary fashions,\" curator Andrew Bolton told CBS News.\n\n\"By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses, the show aims to reconnect with the works on display as they {"uri": "8113800187", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:40:43", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:40:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:40:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6000000238418579, "url": "https://www.news18.com/explainers/why-does-met-gala-make-internet-crazy-how-it-has-become-a-tradition-in-fashion-now-8879962.html", "title": "Why Does Met Gala Make Internet Crazy? How It Has Become A Tradition in Fashion Now - News18", "body": "Fashion's biggest night out -- the Met Gala 2024 -- will see stars of film, fashion, music, sports, politics and social media descend on the Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 6 to be part of the new exhibit - 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion'.\n\nThe theme will feature about 250 items drawn from the Costume Institute's permanent collection, many of which will be publicly showcased for the first time.\n\nLet us give you the lowdown of the biggest starry event of 2024.\n\nThe Met Gala is a charity event and fundraiser for The Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute. It has traditionally been timed to mark the opening of its annual fashion exhibition. It was first hosted in 1948 as a society midnight supper.\n\nAlthough the purpose of Met Gala is to raise money for the Met's Costume Institute, which was nearly $22 million last year, its red carpet has always drawn the world's attention, with 400-plus guests.\n\nPuerto Rican singer Bad Bunny, sensational Jennifer Lopez, Marvel stars Zendaya and Chris Hemsworth and Vogue Editor Anna Wintour have been spending a lot of time in the desert lately.\n\nIn the past, tech leaders including Jeff Bezos and Tim Cook have attended the gala, this time, the primary sponsor of the Costume Institute's exhibition is Show Chew, the chief executive of TikTok.\n\nThough the guest list is still a guessing game, but some of the biggest names in the business who regularly attend the gala are Beyonc\u00e9 and Gigi Hadid to Madonna and Rihanna. You'll also see designers attend with their muses: Marc Jacobs and Kate Moss, or Nicolas Ghesqui\u00e8re and Emma Stone.\n\nIndian film actor Alia Bhatt will also be attending the event. Reports suggest that she left for New York at night of May 4 to make her second appearance this time.\n\nOther high-profile partners who are likely to attend since their significant others are hosting are Ben Affleck and Tom Holland.\n\nOscars nominee Lily Gladstone has said she will attend and has teased a fashion collab involving a major designer and an \"unbelievable Indigenous artist\".\n\nReports say that German supermodel Gisele Bundchen will attend the event with her boyfriend jiu-jitsu instructor Joaquim Valente. Kendell Jenner will be seen again, however, attendance of other members of the Kardashian-Jenner family remain uncertain.\n\nJoining this illustrious lineup are stars such as Olivia Rodriogo, Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson and Cara Delevingne.\n\nThe dress code this year is 'The Garden of Time', inspired by JG Ballard's short story of the same title, written in 1962. So, floral and botanical looks can be seen at the Met Gala Red Carpet.\n\n\"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" the title of the accompanying exhibit, refers to garments from the Costume Institute's collection that have been \"in slumber\" and now will be on display, some too fragile to hang upright lest they disintegrate. Curator Andrew Bolton picked 250 pieces spanning four centuries.\n\n\"We have pieces of a dress, but it'll be great. It'll be great. It'll be great and if it's not great, I'm just going to keep reminding people of, you know, how great I did on the 'Dune' press tour,\" Zendaya's stylist Law Roach told news agency The Associated Press.\n\nNot the common man, companies buy tables for the rich and powerful people who get the invite. For example, a fashion label will host its desired celebrities for the event. A table of 10 starts at $350,000 this year. Meanwhile, tickets are set to be priced at $50,000 per person with prior approval.\n\nMet Gala 2024 will start streaming at 3:30 am IST on May 7. The star-studded occasion will stream on Vogue Magazine's YouTube channel, Instagram and site's homepage.\n\nIt is widely known that the night includes a dinner and a performance. Cher, Rihanna, Madonna and Lady Gaga have performed in years past, among the world's most coveted art and notable artistes.\n\nLast year's gala dinner included \"dainty, colourful and healthy\", featuring chilled spring pea soup and Ora King salmon served on vintage plates with an assortment of fruits and vegetables, as mentioned in a CBS report.\n\nEntering the museum, guests walk past what is usually an impossibly enormous flower arrangement in the lobby, with perhaps an orchestra playing nearby, and over to cocktails. Or, they head to view the exhibit. Cocktails begin a half-hour earlier this year, so they start at 5.30 pm, and last for about two hours, followed by dinner, as mentioned in an AP report.\n\nThe New York Times reported, \"The spring 2022 dress code, 'gilded glamour', had little to do with the corresponding exhibition, while the next year's dress code -- 'in honor of Karl' (Lagerfeld, of course) -- was a perfect match for the 2023 exhibition, dedicated to that designer's 65-year career\".\n\nThe 2019's 'Camp' theme featured Lady Gaga in not one, not two, not three, but four outfit changes on the Met steps. The year prior, Rihanna dressed as the Pope in honour of 'Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination', as described by Vogue.", "source": {"uri": "news18.com", "dataType": "news", "title": It's also invite-only and comes with a hefty price tag.\n\nThis year's exhibition pays tribute to the natural world. \"It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,\" Andrew Bolton, curator in charge of the Costume Institute, told Vogue about the exhibition, which is shaped around three main \"zones\" -- land, sea and sky.\n\nWhile the theme is up for interpretation, expect to see co-chairs of the gala, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth, dressed to impress.\n\nAs for other attendees, the guest list is usually kept hush, hush, with people wondering who they will see walk the iconic (and long!) carpet. {"uri": "8113525813", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "09:41:52", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T09:41:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T09:41:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5960784554481506, "url": "https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/zendaya-met-gala-2024-b2540206.html", "title": "Zendaya reveals why it's 'terrifying' to go to the Met Gala", "body": "During a recent appearance on Live with Kelly and Mark, the 27-year-old spoke candidly about co-chairing the upcoming fashion extravaganza, alongside Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny. While reflecting on her first-ever Met Gala appearance, she explained that even though the event is really fun, it's also quite nerve-racking.\n\n\"I first went when I was 18 years old, and Law [Roach] and I, my stylist, we've been working together since I was like 14 years old. But I remember being 18 and it was such an exciting and new experience,\" she said about the Met Gala. \"But still terrifying.\"\n\nAs the Euphoria star described some of the specific things she's nervous about leading up to the 2024 Met Gala, she also noted that this is her first time attending the star-studded event since 2019.\n\n\"Going up the steps is very daunting, and I haven't been back for maybe four or five years,\" she explained. \"So this is, like, my first time back at the Met in quite a while.\"\n\nAfter Kelly Ripa suggested that designers \"must fight to the death to dress\" Zendaya for the event, the actor said that the TV host would \"have to talk to\" her stylist about that.\n\nZendaya then described how she looks at fashion \"as creativity\" during every occasion, whether she's walking the red carpet at a movie premiere or the red steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.\n\n\"Even in press tours, it's a way to continue the creativity from the film,\" she said. \"I like to just create characters, because ultimately sometimes, doing this for a living feels a little weird and awkward and I'm more of a shy, introverted person, so I get to create these characters. And like, 'I'm this woman today who wears a green suit.' You get to embody this character for a day and clothes can do that for you.\"\n\nThroughout the last month, Zendaya has been unofficially deemed a fashion icon for her tennis-themed outfits during the press tour for her new film, Challengers, where she plays a tennis player turned coach. With the help of her stylist, Zendaya has stunned in various green and white looks, from a dazzling dress with a silhouette of a tennis player on it to a gown embroidered with mini tennis rackets.\n\nThe Dune star will be attending the Met Gala for a sixth time next month, as she first walked the red carpet at the event in 2015. While she made an appearance at the four following Met Galas after that, she specifically turned heads in 2019, when she dressed up as the iconic Disney princess Cinderella. While walking the pink carpet at the time, she was accompanied by Roach, who was dressed as her fairy godfather and waved a wand that emitted dramatic wisps of smoke around her.\n\nBack in November, Vogue announced that the upcoming theme for the annual fashion fundraiser will be \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\". According to Vogue, the exhibit will be centred around 50 historically significant pieces, some of which are far too fragile ever to be worn again. These are the \"Sleeping Beauties\".\n\nNearly 250 items will also be drawn from the Costume Institute's permanent collection, featuring designs from Elsa Schiaparelli, Yves Saint Laurent, Christian {"uri": "8113731209", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:57:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:57:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:55:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5960784554481506, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/met-gala-cursed-13-couples-115000922.html", "title": "Is the Met Gala Cursed? 13 Couples Who Broke Up After Making Their Debut at the Event", "body": "What's the Gala got to do with it? Maybe something, as these 13 former couples could prove\n\nThe Met Gala is a big night for the stars -- and not just because of the fashion.\n\nFrom on-the-carpet costume changes to engagement announcements and baby bump reveals, celebrities often use fashion's biggest night to make a statement -- sartorial or otherwise. And it's become one of the most important nights of the year for our favorite celebrities to reveal another thing that everyone is dying to know (besides who they're wearing): their relationship statuses.\n\nBut are celebrity couples who make their red carpet debut at the Met Gala doomed? It's possible: these 13 famous pairs made the Met Gala red carpet their first together, only to break up not long after.\n\nKim Kardashian and Pete Davidson first sparked relationship rumors in October 2021 when around Halloween, the pair was seen holding hands on a ride at Knott's Scary Farm.\n\nWhile the couple's first official red carpet was technically at the 2022 White House Correspondent's Dinner, the pair made their wildly buzzy Met Gala red carpet debut together not long after, in May 2022.\n\nThat Gala was also the one at which Kardashian sparked controversy for wearing one of Marilyn Monroe's most iconic dresses -- the \"Happy Birthday, Mr. President\" dress -- that the Gentleman Prefer Blondes actress wore to sing \"Happy Birthday\" to President John F. Kennedy in 1962. For his part, Davidson let his love shine at the event, showering Kardashian in kisses and helping her navigate the famed Met Gala stairs in the super-delicate dress.\n\nOn Aug. 5, 2023, however, PEOPLE confirmed that Kardashian and Davidson had parted ways, with a source citing their \"busy schedules\" as a reason for the split.\n\nThe singer stepped out at the 2018 Gala with Bieber (then Baldwin) on his arm, causing fans to wonder if they were possibly making their red carpet debut as a couple (though they were both guests of designer Tommy Hilfiger that night, Mendes later told PEOPLE).\n\nMendes later clarified the pair's relationship in an interview with Rolling Stone.\n\n\"I think it was more of a zone of limbo,\" Mendes said in the interview. \"She's still one of the f---king coolest people ever -- she's not just a beautiful person visually, but she's one of the most beautiful hearts I've ever met. I think I'm an idiot to not, you know ... But you can't control your heart.\"\n\nThe 2018 Met Gala might just have been the catalyst for the end of the IRL \"Bughead.\"\n\nLili Reinhart and Cole Sprouse -- who met while playing lovers on-screen in the CW drama Riverdale and dated in real life for nearly three years -- made their Met Gala debut in 2018, confirming what fans had been speculating for some time.\n\nThe pair went on to date for two more years afterward, with Sprouse calling the relationship \"as real as it gets\" in an interview with GQ after the couple's 2020 split.\n\nSpaceX founder Elon Musk and Canadian electronic singer-songwriter Grimes were first linked as a couple when they made their appearance at the 2018 Met Gala.\n\nIn a Vanity Fair interview in 2022, Grimes revealed that she and Musk were back together after a 2021 breakup. In the interview, Grimes called the relationship \"very fluid.\"\n\nHowever, the same day that the Vanity Fair story was released, Grimes posted to Twitter (now X) to say that the pair's relationship status had changed since the interview.\n\n\"Me and E have broken up *again* since the writing of this article haha, but he's my best friend and the love of my life, and my life and art are forever dedicated to The Mission now, I think Devin wrote that part of the story rly well. Sique - peace out,\" she wrote.\n\nThe pair have three children together, X \u00c6 A-Xii, Exa Dark Sider\u00e6 and Techno Mechanicus.\n\nJennifer Lopez and Alex Rodriguez had a history of making moments on the Met Gala red carpet.\n\nThe newly minted couple made their debut at the 2017 Met Gala, where Lopez stood out in a flowing mint-colored dress straight out of Old Hollywood.\n\nTwo years later the pair debuted another relationship milestone on the red carpet: their engagement! Lopez stood out again, but onlookers' eyes were only drawn to her 16-carat engagement ring.\n\nIn between these two events, the couple attended the Met Gala together again in 2018.\n\nBut the pair announced that they had called off their engagement in 2021, saying in a statement that they had \"realized we are better as friends and look forward to remaining so.\"\n\nAfter meeting for the first time at the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show in 2015, where they both performed on the runway, Selena Gomez and The Weeknd were spotted a year later on a dinner date at Giorgio Baldi in L.A. -- after the stars had split from their respective partners, Justin Bieber and Bella Hadid.\n\nThe singers made their relationship official on the red carpet at the 2017 Met Gala, one year after The Weeknd made his debut with Hadid.\n\nIn October, just five months after attending the Gala together, sources confirmed to PEOPLE that the pair had split.\n\nZayn Malik and Gigi Hadid -- who share daughter Khai, now 4 -- were an on-again/off-again couple from 2015 to 2021. The ex-One Directioner and the supermodel split officially in 2021 after Malik was accused of \"striking\" Hadid's mother, Yolanda Hadid.\n\nBut long before that, in the early stages of their relationship, the two walked the red carpet at the 2016 Met Gala, making their red carpet debut as a couple. The pair's outfits were complementary, both on point for the event's theme of \"Manus x Machina: Fashion in an Age of Technology.\"\n\nAlex Rodriguez is no stranger to gracing the Met Gala red carpet.\n\nIn 2016, the baseball player walked the red carpet with his then-girlfriend, 23andMe co-founder Anne Wojcicki, reportedly arriving together in the same car as Wojcicki's ex, Google co-founder Sergey Brin, according to Vanity Fair.\n\nThe pair dated through 2016, but split up. The next year, Rodriquez was back at the Met sans Wojcicki, this time attending with J.Lo.\n\n\"He is on a press tour and she is working on her new album. And I think it's timing,\" said the source. \"They've been all over the place. They have not seen each other in probably two months.\"\n\nAfter beginning their relationship in February 2014, this couple made their official debut that May at the Met Gala.\n\nSarah Silverman and Michael Sheen went on to date for nearly four more years, eventually breaking up in late 2017 over Christmas.\n\nIn 2018, Silverman appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live!, where she discussed her past relationship with Sheen.\n\n\"He moved back to the U.K. and his life is really there and my life is really not there, but I love him to pieces,\" she explained. \"If he's in town and we're both single, we will make love.\"\n\nChristina Ricci and Chris Evans dated for a brief period of time, appearing together on the red carpet at the 2007 Met Gala. However, the sparks fizzled soon after.\n\nIn July 2004, however, it was confirmed that the pair had called it quits.\n\n\"Kirsten and Jake remain the best of friends. Details regarding when and why their romantic relationship stopped are not being provided, but suffice it to say it happened some time ago.
