{"uri": "8114275588", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:24:12", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:24:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:23:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5921568870544434, "url": "https://www.the-star.co.ke/news/world/2024-05-06-everything-you-need-to-know-about-met-gala-2024/", "title": "Everything you need to know about Met Gala 2024", "body": "The Met Gala has exploded in popularity under the eye of Vogue's global editorial director Anna Wintour\n\nA-listers are getting ready to sashay down the red carpet for fashion's biggest night out - the Met Gala.\n\nActors, musicians and business magnates will be among those dressing to impress at the Metropolitan Museum of Art fundraiser in New York City.\n\nThe 2024 edition of the black-tie extravaganza is inspired by The Garden of Time, a short story by the British New Wave sci-fi author JG Ballard.\n\nThe annual gala raises money for the museum's Costume Institute.\n\nThis year's theme has been chosen to complement the Costume Institute's forthcoming exhibit Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nThe BBC didn't get a ticket either - but here's a quick guide to the event.\n\nWhen is the Met Gala?\n\nThose outside of fashion's inner sanctum never get to see the private cocktail and dinner events that comprise this multimillion-dollar fundraiser.\n\nBut fashion critics everywhere do get to watch their favourite actors, artistes and influencers walk a lengthy red carpet.\n\nGuests begin arriving at the Met and walk up the iconic New York landmark's grand staircase to the click of a thousand cameras from 18:00 EST (22:00 GMT).\n\nBut expect late arrivals - we're looking at you, Rihanna.\n\nHow can I watch the Met Gala?\n\nFashion magazine Vogue, which organises the event, will exclusively livestream the red carpet on its website and all of its digital platforms. Streams will also be available to US viewers on NBC's Peacock streaming platform and E!.\n\nInternational viewers can tune in via TikTok, YouTube, Instagram and X.\n\nYou can follow the BBC's live blog for updates.\n\nThe gala and its explosion in popularity has been overseen by Vogue's global editorial director Anna Wintour.\n\nWhat is this year's theme?\n\nThe Met Gala's theme often serves as a prelude to the Costume Institute's spring 2024 exhibition - and this year is no different.\n\nThe exhibit - Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion - uses technology to \"breathe new life\" into garments from the Met's archives so fragile they can no longer be worn and must remain under glass.\n\nArtificial intelligence, computer-generated imagery, X-rays and soundscapes will be used in \"creative and immersive activations designed to convey the smells, sounds, textures, and motions\" of these items, according to the museum's website.\n\nThe dress code for Monday's red carpet is The Garden of Time, which shares its name with a dystopian tale written in 1962 by JG Ballard, in which the last bastion of the super-rich is overrun by a working-class mob of the \"great unwashed\".\n\nCommentators are calling it an exploration of rebirth and renewal, and of humanity's tendency towards cycles of creation and destruction.\n\nFor an event that celebrates affluence and excess in an age of economic uncertainty and global volatility, the theme may sound a little on the nose.\n\nCan I get tickets?\n\nThe short answer is no. Fashion's biggest night is a cocktail and dinner party for about 400 to 450 invited guests.\n\nWealthy celebrities and brands snap up all the available tickets and tables at the charity benefit.\n\nAn individual ticket goes for around $75,000 (\u00a360,000), more than the average down payment on a house.\n\nA 10-seat table starts at $350,000.\n\nIn 1995, Ms Wintour's first year overseeing the event, a ticket cost just $1,000.\n\nThe gala raised about $22m last year, when its theme paid tribute to late design legend Karl Lagerfeld.\n\nWho is hosting?\n\nMs Wintour has recruited four big names to serve as co-chairs at this year's event.\n\nThey are Latino music stars Bad Bunny and Jennifer Lopez, US actress Zendaya and Australian actor Chris Hemsworth, making his debut at the gala.\n\nCo-chairs help promote the event, plan its theme and dinner, and arrive at the beginning of its red carpet portion.\n\nServing as honorary chairs are Shou Zi Chew, chief executive officer of TikTok, and Jonathan Anderson, the creative director of the Loewe's fashion house.\n\nTikTok - currently under the threat of a nationwide ban - and Loewe's are also sponsoring the gala and exhibition.\n\nWhat is the guest list for this year?\n\nThe guest list is always top secret, but several celebrities have already confirmed their attendance.\n\nRihanna has said she will be there, and we can expect her to be accompanied by her rapper-partner A$AP Rocky.\n\nPower couple Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are not tipped to attend. Neither is Jared Leto, who often stands out among the male attendees.\n\nSpeculation is also rife over the likelihood of appearances by Sean \"Diddy\" Combs, who is facing multiple sexual misconduct lawsuits, and Kendrick Lamar, who is locked in a heated war of words with rival rapper Drake.", "source": {"uri": "the-star.co.ke", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Star"}, "authors": [{"uri": "https@the-star.co.ke", "name": "https", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Met_Gala", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Met Gala"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_carpet", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Red carpet"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "J. The charity event fundraises for the museum's Costume Institute. Usually, it also marks the opening of an annual fashion exhibition which guests get a preview of. This year's exhibition theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" Using nearly 250 items from the Met's permanent collection, each piece will be displayed in a new way, relying on digital elements like video animation, CGI and artificial intelligence to alter the appearance. The pieces span 400 years of fashion history and are divided by land, sea and sky zones to pay tribute to the natural world.\n\nJust as there is an exhibition theme, there is also a red carpet theme that guests will interpret and make their own, arriving with elaborate looks. The 2024 red carpet theme is \"The Garden of Time,\" after a 1962 short story by J.G. Ballard. While costumes are up to guests and designers, fashion lovers are anticipating lots of floral and botanic looks.\n\nExpect to see some big names on the carpet who attend every year: Rihanna, Beyonc\u00e9, Madonna, Gigi Hadid and Blake Lively. Co-chairs Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, Bad Bunny and Vogue's editor-in-chief Anna Wintour will also make an appearance. {"uri": "8114275513", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:24:02", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:24:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:23:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5882353186607361, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/entertainment/hollywood/from-crystal-flowers-to-celestial-creations-exploring-2024-met-gala-dress-code-garden-of-time20240506235207/", "title": "From crystal flowers to celestial creations: Exploring 2024 Met Gala dress code 'Garden Of Time'", "body": "Washington [US], May 6 (ANI): As the countdown begins for the highly anticipated 2024 Met Gala, fashion enthusiasts and celebrity watchers are buzzing with excitement over this year's theme and dress code.\n\nWith stars like Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny set to grace the red carpet, the stage is set for a spectacular showcase of style and creativity at The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City for May 6.\n\nDubbed 'The Garden of Time,' the theme of this year's Met Gala is inspired by the Costume Institute's new exhibition, 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.'\n\nUnlike the typical fairy tale interpretation, this exhibition delves into the realm of delicate garments that are too fragile to be worn again, earning them the title of \"sleeping beauties\" within the museum's archives, as per E! News.\n\nAccording to Andrew Bolton, the head curator of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the theme is \"very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion.\"\n\nDrawing inspiration from J.G. Ballard's 1962 short story of the same name, the gala pays homage to a world where time and beauty intertwine in a lush garden setting.\n\n'The Garden of Time' dress code invites attendees to explore the theme through botanical-inspired creations, promising a red carpet adorned with florals, plants, and other elements of nature.\n\nFrom ethereal gowns to avant-garde designs, guests are encouraged to interpret the theme in their unique way, adding to the eclectic tapestry of fashion at the gala.\n\nJoining Anna Wintour as co-hosts for the evening are industry icons Bad Bunny, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, and Chris Hemsworth.\n\nWith each bringing their flair and style to the event, the lineup promises an unforgettable evening of fashion and entertainment.\n\nBeyond the glitz and glamour of the gala itself, attendees will have the opportunity to explore the 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion' exhibition, which runs from May 10 through September 2 at the Metropolitan Museum.\n\nFeaturing approximately 250 garments and accessories spanning over 400 years of fashion history, the exhibition offers a sensory journey through the evolution of style.\n\nAs per E! News, visitors can expect to engage with the exhibits through various immersive experiences, including sensory capabilities such as smelling hats with floral notes and touching walls adorned with embroidered fabrics.\n\nNotable pieces by designers such as Schiaparelli, Dior, and Givenchy will be on display, alongside innovative presentations of garments too fragile to be worn again.\n\n\"By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses, the show aims to reconnect with the works on display as they were originally intended--with vibrancy, with dynamism, and ultimately with life,\" Andrew Bolton expressed in a press release obtained by E! News.\n\nAs the fashion world eagerly awaits the unveiling of this year's Met Gala, anticipation is high for an evening that promises to blend art, culture, and style in a celebration of creativity and innovation.\n\nWith 'The Garden of Time' as its backdrop, the 2024 Met Gala is poised to transport attendees to a realm where fashion becomes an enchanting journey through the ages. {"uri": "8112998386", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "01:54:09", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T01:54:09Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T01:53:16Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5882353186607361, "url": "https://jerseyeveningpost.com/morenews/entertainment/2024/05/06/met-gala-2024-will-see-stars-interpret-sleeping-beauties-theme/", "title": "Met Gala 2024 will see stars interpret 'Sleeping Beauties' theme", "body": "The biggest names in film, music, TV and fashion will ascend the steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York on Monday with their interpretation of the theme Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nThe Met Gala, known as fashion's biggest night, is held on the first Monday in May and celebrates the opening of the Costume Institute's spring exhibition at the New York museum.\n\nThe official dress code this year is The Garden Of Time, inspired by a story by JG Ballard about a man who turns back time by plucking each flower in his garden until it is barren - which could inspire a host of floral and botanical looks.\n\nVogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour has been running the Met Gala since 1995.\n\nThis year, her celebrity co-chairs are Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Jennifer Lopez and first-time attendee Chris Hemsworth.\n\nFashion powerhouse Zendaya most recently impressed with her futuristic, sci-fi inspired looks during the Dune: Part Two press tour, as well as her tenniscore ensembles during the Challengers press tour.\n\nLast year, the theme was Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty, in tribute to the designer who died in 2019.\n\nThe Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion exhibition will feature around 200 fragile and rare pieces from the Costume Institute's archive, inspired by the natural world.\n\nThe exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art will run from May 10 until September 2.", "source": {"uri": "jerseyeveningpost.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Jersey Evening Post"}, "authors": [{"uri": "press_association@jerseyeveningpost.com", "name": "Press Association", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City", "type": "loc", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fashion", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Fashion"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 2, "label": {"eng": "J. {"uri": "8114397911", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "20:17:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T20:17:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T20:16:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5843137502670288, "url": "https://www.postandcourier.com/arena/lifestyle/every-look-taylor-swift-has-ever-worn-to-the-met-gala/article_6c2f0375-0274-52d8-8910-523a55ecc528.html", "title": "Every Look Taylor Swift Has Ever Worn to the Met Gala", "body": "While Taylor Swift may not be Hollywood's most daring fashionista, she is perhaps the biggest celebrity in the world, and with that much power come invites to the biggest events, including the Met Gala. Since she burst onto the scene in the mid-2000s, the pop star has made six appearances at the A-list event, donning stunning gowns from designers like Oscar de la Renta and Louis Vuitton. Her first appearance at the annual Met Gala celebrating the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute was way back in 2008, when Miss Swift was still in her very first era.\n\nSince her Met Gala debut, Taylor Swift has appeared on the Met's steps six times from 2008 to 2016, when she co-hosted the event (and supposedly met Tom Hiddleston and Joe Alwyn). Given her star power, it seems highly unlikely that she has not been invited most, if not every, year since that last showing. Yet for reasons unknown, Swift has not walked the red carpet on the first Monday in May since, and perhaps never will.\n\nRelated: See Taylor Swift Through the Years\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala will be held on May 6, with the theme \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" and a dress code of \"The Garden of Time.\" Anna Wintour will be presiding over the event as she has for decades now, and we're certain to see plenty of stunning looks on the red carpet for fashion's biggest night.\n\nHere's everything we know about a potential appearance by Taylor Swift in 2024 and Swift's history at the Met Gala:\n\nWill Taylor Swift be at the 2024 Met Gala?\n\nWhile you can never count out a surprise, it looks like Taylor Swift will not be attending the Met Gala for the eighth year in a row. People confirmed that Swift would not be making an appearance as she is prepping for the European leg of her Eras Tour which begins on May 9 in Paris, France. According to air traffic records, her jet is currently in Paris, which confirms that she won't be attending. TMZ did report, however, that Swift was invited to the Gala this year, and Wintour pretty much confirmed the invitation in an interview with Today's Jenna Bush Hager.\n\n\"And [Wintour] said, 'I hope she comes and enjoys the exhibit,'\" Bush Hager said. \"So that could be yes, that could be no, which is what the reports are saying.\"\n\nRelated: What to Know About Taylor Swift's New Album 'The Tortured Poets Department'\n\nEvery Look Taylor Swift Has Ever Worn to the Met GalaTaylor Swift Met Gala Looks\n\nAll six of Taylor Swift's Met Gala outfits ranging from her first appearance in 2008 at her most recent outing as a co-chair of the 2016 Met Gala.\n\nTaylor Swift first arrived on the steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art as a guest of the 2008 Met Gala. Only 18, Swift was fairly new on the scene, winding down the promotion of her self-titled debut album and no doubt already plotting the arrival of Fearless later that year. On her first outing, Swift stuck with her early career signature gold curls and a simple gold gown from Badgley Mischka. The theme of the year was \"Superheroes: Fashion and Fantasy,\" but Swift played it fairly safe.\n\nIn 2010, at the end of her Fearless era, Swift made her second appearance at the Met Gala, which offered the fairly vague theme of \"American Woman: Fashioning A National Identity.\" Not one for taking big fashion swings, Swift appeared in a simple, cream Ralph Lauren gown. This is also the first appearance of Swift's signature red lip at the Met.\n\nSwift, and her red lip, returned to the Met Gala the following year, only a few months after the release of Speak Now. Stepping outside of her comfort zone a bit for the \"Alexander McQueen: Savage Beauty\" theme, Swift donned this J. Mendel gown, which included mesh and lace layers. It's easily one of her more interesting red carpet looks.\n\nAfter taking a year off, Swift returned to the Met Gala in 2013, as a guest of J. Mendel for a second time. This time, during the RED era, Swift donned a black gown with cutouts and a jewel collar. While not the most out-of-the-box look to walk the \"PUNK: Chaos To Courture\" carpet, it was quite dramatic for the pre-Reputation Taylor.\n\nThe following year, post-haircut and pre-1989, Swift wore this sumptuous pink Oscar de la Renta dress for the \"Charles James: Beyond Fashion\" theme. This is Swift's most \"Met Gala\" look with its long train and stunning detailing. Swift kept her red lip, but paired it with the bob haircut that would define the era.\n\nThe 2016 Met Gala is one that will live forever in the minds of Swifties. To start, after five appearances in the previous eight years, Swift was asked to be a co-chair for the \"Manus x Machina\" technology-inspired gala. With her new platinum blonde hair, dark lipstick and metallic dress, Swift executed one of the most daring and iconic looks of her entire career. While her breakup with Calvin Harris, International Snake Day feud with Kanye West and Kim Kardashian, and her disappearance from the public would not take place for several months, her Louis Vuitton ensemble seem to somehow predict the upcoming Reputation era. While still publicly with Harris, this Met Gala is also supposedly where she met not one, but two of her future boyfriends, Tom Hiddleston and Joe Alwyn. The 2016 Met Gala is also noteworthy as Swift has not appeared back at the event since. Will she ever return? Only time will tell.\n\nNext, 'Mastermind' Indeed! This year's gala will unveil The Costume Institute's Spring 2024 exhibition titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" The event guarantees a stunning display of classic sophistication, and bespoke creations influenced by the natural world. Here's your guide to the guest list, hosts, theme, and more.\n\nThe Met Gala 2024 will be co-chaired by a glittering array of celebrities including Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny, and of course Anna Wintour (Editor-in-chief of Vogue). Vogue's red-carpet hosts for the evening will be La La Anthony, Gwendoline Christie, and Ashley Graham. Adding to the star power, Emma Chamberlain has been announced as a special correspondent for the event.\n\nThe theme for the 2024 Met Gala is a tribute to the \"sleeping beauties\" in fashion -- not a reference to the Disney fairytale. The exhibit will display 250 pieces from The Costume Institute's permanent collection, some dating back to the Elizabethan era. Here's why fans suspect she'll arrive in style.\n\nKardashian-Jenner fans are eager to see which family members arrive at the Met Gala on May 6, 2024. Kim Kardashian has attended the event since 2013, when she first arrived pregnant with her daughter, North, and her then-husband, Kanye West. In 2022, she made a statement with a vintage Jean Louis dress once worn by Marilyn Monroe. In 2023, she wore a Maison Schiaparelli piece containing 50,000 pearls.\n\nIt's unclear if Kardashian plans on attending the Met Gala in 2024. So far, only Kendall Jenner is confirmed to have been invited. However, the Instagram account KimKJet tracks Kardashian's jet activity, and evidence suggests that Kardashian may be headed to the Met.\n\n\"Kim Kardashian's jet landed in Teterboro, New Jersey, United States. Apx. flt. time 4 h 13 min.\n\n2,459 mile (2,137 NM) flight from LAX to TEB,\" the account posted early on May 6, 2024. This location is just 30 minutes away from the Metropolitan Museum of Art. An earlier post from the evening of May 5, 2024, showed Kardashian's jet taking off from Los Angeles.\n\nGiven the theme, fans wondered whether Kim Kardashian would attend the Met Gala in 2024. Later, the rumors that Kardashian ruined the garment were debunked, but the chatter affected her.\n\nAccording to The Independent, fans think that Anna Wintour and the decision of this year's theme aimed to dig at Kardashian's past choices.\n\n\"It's so ironic how this year's Met Gala theme is about fragile historic garments, but Kim Kardashian wore and destroyed the Marilyn Monroe dress to the Met two years ago, the call is coming from inside the house,\" a fan wrote on X.\n\nKim Kardashian posted about attending the Met Gala in the past. In 2023, she posted photos to Instagram of her with the late Karl Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette Lagerfeld. On May 5, 2024, she posted photos of her in Santa Barbara, California, next to her Tesla Cybertruck. {"uri": "2024-05-346310569", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "10:05:25", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T10:05:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:00:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5803921818733215, "url": "https://nypost.com/2024/05/06/lifestyle/everything-to-know-about-the-2024-met-gala-date-and-sleeping-beauties-reawakening-fashion-theme-explained/", "title": "Everything to know about the 2024 Met Gala: Date and 'Sleeping...", "body": "We hope you got your beauty sleep -- the biggest night in fashion is finally here.\n\nThe Met Gala, held on the first Monday in May at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, fundraises for the Costume Institute and marks the opening of its spring 2024 exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nHowever, the charity event is more of a fashion fanfare, as notable figures ascend the museum's iconic steps in custom, carefully crafted couture that falls in line with the year's dress code.\n\nIt's a tale as old as time -- or at least as old as 1948, the year of the very first Met Gala when tickets were a measly $50.\n\nNow, entry to the star-studded event reportedly goes for as much as $30,000.\n\nThe exclusive soir\u00e9e typically raises total donations in the eight-figure range from its 450-long guest list every year, according to Vogue.\n\nA livestream of the highly anticipated red carpet will be available exclusively on Vogue -- and their social platforms -- beginning at 6 p.m. EST on May 6.\n\nActresses Gwendoline Christie and La La Anthony plus model Ashley Graham will serve as the carpet's hosts, per Vogue, with special interviews by internet star and podcast host Emma Chamberlain.\n\nWhat to know about the theme\n\nThe theme of the evening, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" pays homage to the 250-some pieces to be displayed in the spring exhibition, which opens May 10, with some so delicate they can never be worn again.\n\n\"'Sleeping Beauties' will heighten our engagement with these masterpieces of fashion by evoking how they feel, move, sound, smell, and interact when being worn, ultimately offering a deeper appreciation of the integrity, beauty, and artistic brilliance of the works on display,\" the Met's CEO and Director Max Hollein told Vogue.\n\nSome of the garments are decades old and will be presented in an innovative style, utilizing new tech such as artificial intelligence and CGI.\n\nBut the gala also comes with a dress code: \"Garden of Time.\" The vague guidelines -- this year inspired by the 1962 short story by J.G. Ballard -- give designers creative freedom to actualize the theme in various ways, from more literal looks anticipated to incorporate floral embellishments or timepieces, to more abstract interpretations.\n\nWhat happens inside\n\nThe Met Gala's best-kept secret is what, exactly, goes on inside the museum's walls throughout the evening, with most of the fanfare occurring on the front steps ahead of the fundraiser that typically raises eight figures in donations from its 450-long guest list every year, according to Vogue.\n\nThe organizers enforce a strict no-phone policy, although a few sneaky snaps have made their way onto social platforms in years past.\n\nThere are, however, permitted photographers who release images after the gala and give eager outsiders a peek at the action, which typically involves a musical guest, dinner and a viewing of the spring exhibition.\n\nThe co-chairs\n\nEvery year, the Met Gala employs four celebrities to co-chair the event. This year's committee selection includes \"Challengers\" star Zendaya, multi-hyphenate Jennifer Lopez, actor Chris Hemsworth and singer Bad Bunny to co-pilot the evening alongside Anna Wintour, the global chief content officer of Cond\u00e9 Nast and editor-in-chief of Vogue who has helmed the gala since 1995.\n\nAccording to Vogue, this is Hemsworth's first-ever Met Gala attendance and Bad Bunny's third, while Zendaya has ascended the stairs five times and J.Lo 13.\n\nHonorary chairs for the night include prominent figures from the event's sponsors: Jonathan Anderson, Loewe's creative director, and Shou Chew, the CEO of TikTok.\n\nWintour's decision to invite Chew has sparked controversy, as the popular video-sharing app has fallen under intense scrutiny by the US government. Last month, President Joe Biden signed a bill into law that would force the sale of TikTok or ban it entirely should it not be sold.\n\nTikTok has reportedly shelled out millions to support the gala, and an anonymous insider told Page Six that the \"deal was cut way before this bill passed.\"\n\n\"What does Anna do? Does she un-invite TikTok a week before? She can't,\" the unnamed source dished. \"Anna is the total dictator of this event every year, let her talk her way out of this one!\"\n\nNotable attendees\n\nEvery year, approximately 450 guests attend the Met Gala, and it's a battle of the fittest -- err, well, the most fashionable.\n\nIn addition to the co-chairs, Rihanna, a hotly anticipated guest, confirmed she would be in attendance on May 6, noting that her ensemble would be \"really, like, chill,\" in contrast to her past looks.\n\n\"I'm coming in as an extra this year,\" she said over the weekend at an event for the cosmetic line Fenty Beauty. \"I'm coming for dinner.\"\n\nShe will instead be focusing her energy on preparing for her upcoming shows for her blockbuster Eras Tour.", "source": {"uri": "nypost.com", "dataType": In 2024, that's Monday, May 6.\n\nVogue global editorial director Anna Wintour previewed the 2024 Met Gala to TODAY. Wintour, a Met trustee, serves as a co-chair annually, along with a different batch of celebrities and public figures.\n\nGuest arrivals begin at 5:30 p.m. ET through 8 p.m. However, red carpet coverage begins a bit later.\n\nThe red carpet generally wraps up around 8 p.m., though some of the biggest stars are known to arrive later.\n\nViewers can catch the latest of the Met Gala on Vogue's digital platforms, including its TikTok and YouTube pages, starting at 6 p.m. ET.\n\nActors Gwendoline Christie and La La Anthony and model Ashley Graham will be co-hosting the livestream with Emma Chamberlain, who'll return as Vogue's special correspondent.\n\nThe red carpet will also be broadcast by E! News.\n\n\"Live from E! 2024 Met Gala\" airs from 3 p.m. PT/6 p.m. ET to 6:30 p.m. PT/9:30 p.m. ET.\n\nWintour told TODAY she expects to see flowers on the red carpet to match the \"Garden of Time\" dress code.\n\nThe event is paired with the 2024 Costume Institute's exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties.\"\n\nWintour also apologized for the theme pairing causing confusion.\n\n\"We came up with the title 'Sleeping Beauties.' It's wonderful, it's poetic, it's romantic, but actually it could be many, many things,\" she told TODAY.\n\n\"I fear we have unleashed a lot of confusion out there for which I deeply apologize,\" she {"uri": "8114138688", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:31:03", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:31:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:30:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5764706134796143, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-13387587/Met-Gala-Anna-Wintour-Vogue-Sleeping-Beauties-Garden-Time.html", "title": "Jaw dropping cost of single Met Gala ticket revealed", "body": "Despite the lofty net-worths of those in attendance, and the tens of thousands of dollars that sometimes go into a single red carpet look, even the famed and fabulous Met Gala has been hit by the soaring cost of inflation.\n\nThis year, a single ticket to the Vogue x Metropolitan Museum of Art event, will cost $75,000. A figure up 50 percent from last year's still astronomical $50,000 per ticket price.\n\nAccording to the Met, pricing for a 10-person table starts at $350,000.\n\nOne hotly-debated question each time the first Monday in May rolls around is: who ultimately foots the bill for the celebrities who populate the carpet?\n\nThe process begins with obtaining an invite - of course, not just anyone can purchase a ticket, even those willing to fork over handfuls of cash.\n\nAndrew Bolton, Anna Wintour and Jonathan Anderson attend the press conference for the 2024 Met Gala celebrating \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 06, 2024 in New York City\n\nOften, design houses, the backbone of the Met Gala's cultural relevancy, buy up tables and invite high-profile figures they hope to host.\n\nFor that reason, even the hottest celebrities, are rarely paying full freight for their spots atop the staircase.\n\nThe event is ultimately a fundraiser and has, to date, under the leadership of Anna Wintour, raised some $223.5million for the museum's Costume Institute.\n\nLast year, the gala raised about $22million.\n\nFamously, Anna Wintour - the frosty Cond\u00e9 Nast chief content officer, global editorial director at Vogue, and a Met Trustee since 1999 - supervises the tightly-controlled guest list.\n\nSome 400 guests attended the 2023 event, according to the Associated Press.\n\nThis year's Gala will take place around the Costume Institute's execution of its new exhibit: 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.'\n\nThe exhibit, which attendees will get an early viewing of this evening, celebrates the 'reanimation' of pieces from the institute's collection that have long-lived as 'motionless' artwork, as opposed to dynamic pieces that can be 'worn or heard, touched, or smelled.'\n\n'The exhibition endeavors to reanimate these artworks by re-awakening their sensory capacities through a diverse range of technologies, affording visitors sensorial 'access' to rare historical garments and rarefied contemporary fashions,' said exhibit curator Andrew Bolton.\n\n'By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses, the show aims to reconnect with the works on display as they were originally intended - with vibrancy, with dynamism, and ultimately with life.'\n\nFamously, Anna Wintour - the frosty Cond\u00e9 Nast chief content officer, global editorial director at Vogue, and a Met Trustee since 1999 - supervises the tightly-controlled guest list\n\nChris Hemsworth (pictured) was singled out by Vogue editor Anna Wintour to co-host the 2024 Met Gala, in addition to Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Jennifer Lopez, and a small handful of other fashionable names\n\nThe Gala is also being honorarily co-chaired by Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew\n\nGuram Gvasalia and Doja Cat at the Monse Maison Pre-Met Cocktail Celebration ahead of Monday's event\n\nLineisy Montero at the Monse Maison Pre-Met Cocktail Celebration held at La Mercerie on May 5, 2024\n\nZendaya, currently in the middle of promoting her high-profile new film Challengers, will make a triumphant return to the Gala's red carpet\n\nJennifer Lopez seen leaving Anna Wintour's pre-Met Gala dinner. 05 May 2024 - the superstar actress and singer is one of Monday night's co-event chairs\n\nThe dress code for tonight's celebration follows the 'sensorial' appeal of the exhibit, as well as the concept of time as it relates to fashion and specific pieces of clothing.\n\nGuests have been asked to dress with the idea 'The Garden of Time' in mind.\n\nSome 250 garments from the institute's 33,000 pieces will be on display - many of them have never been shown before, and some, are reportedly too delicate to hang, lest they fall apart completely.\n\nHence, the exhibition's title 'Sleeping Beauties,' refers to the fact that some of the extremely delicate pieces will be displayed lying in glass cases, like the fairytale princess did.\n\nMax Hollein, the Met's Director, said: '\n\nThe Met's innovative spring 2024 Costume Institute exhibition will push the boundaries of our imagination and invite us to experience the multisensory facets of a garment, many of which get lost when entering a museum collection as an object.\n\n'Sleeping Beauties will heighten our engagement with these masterpieces of fashion by evoking how they feel, move, sound, smell and interact when being worn, ultimately offering a deeper appreciation of the integrity, beauty and artistic brilliance of the works on display.'\n\nMonday night's spectacle is being co-chaired this year by Chris Hemsworth, Bad Bunny, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, as well as Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi The stunning ensemble featured a sheer pink floral top embroidered with butterflies, which is most likely a nod to this year's dress code being \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by a short story by JG Ballard.\n\nThe Dune star completed the glamorous get-up with a pair of white Christian Louboutin pointed heels, wearing her hair in loose waves around her shoulders.\n\nMeanwhile, Lopez opted for a black strapless gown designed by Diana Qerimi. The dress featured crystal-like detailing all over and she added some extra height with a pair of black Casadei platform heels. The singer completed the look with a chic ponytail and a pair of dangling diamond statement earrings.\n\nHemsworth, who attended the dinner with his wife Elsa Pataky, 47, looked dapper in an animal-print design blazer that he wore over a black satin shirt for the dinner. The Thor actor added a pair of dark trousers and some orange-tinted glasses.\n\nPataky opted for a glittering blue sequin blazer and matching hot pants that she teamed with a purple silk blouse and a high ponytail for the evening.\n\nCo-chair Bad Bunny was also pictured arriving for the dinner wearing a dark blazer that he teamed with a simple white T-shirt. He wore the casual, but chic get-up with a baseball cap and glasses.\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up to date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.\n\nRelated: Every Time Jennifer Lopez Went to the Met Gala\n\nSienna Miller, 42, and her boyfriend Oli Green, 27, were also among the attendees, with the pair enjoying a rare date night at the glitzy event. Miller donned a green suede one-sleeve mini dress for the dinner, that she teamed with some sheer black tights and a pair of pointed white heels.\n\nMeanwhile, Miller looked dapper in a black suit and white shirt that he left open at the top. It was revealed in January that the pair had welcomed their first child together. The actress is also mom to daughter Marlowe, 11, whom she shares with ex Tom Sturridge, 38.\n\nIn November 2023, Vogue confirmed that the 2024 Met Gala theme would be \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which is also the title of the corresponding Metropolitan Museum of Art Costume Institute exhibit, set to run from May 10 to September 2, 2024.\n\nLast month, co-chair Zendaya spoke about going up the Met Gala steps after a 5-year hiatus. \"Going up the steps is very daunting, and I haven't been back for maybe four or five years. So this is, like, my first time back at the Met in quite a while,\" she said during an appearance on Live with Kelly and Mark on April 23.\n\nSpeaking about her stylist Law Roach, who she's been working with since she was 14, the star said, \"It's fun in the sense that I like to look at fashion as creativity.\"\n\n\"Even in press tours, it's a way to continue the creativity from the film. ... I like to just create characters, because ultimately sometimes, doing this for a living feels a little weird and awkward and I'm more of a shy, introverted person, so I get to create these characters. 'I'm this woman today who wears a green suit.' Tonight, on May 6th, the fashion world will converge for a night of opulence, creativity, and philanthropy at the Costume Institute Benefit. With a theme that promises to ignite curiosity - \"The Garden of Time\" - this year's gala is poised to be nothing short of enchanting.\n\nAs the clock ticks closer to the event, anticipation is palpable among global fashion critics and enthusiasts. Speculation runs rampant about who will grace the red carpet, with names like Rihanna, Blake Lively, Beyonc\u00e9, Kim Kardashian, and Lady Gaga swirling in the rumour mill.\n\nBehind the scenes, meticulous preparations are underway for an evening that transcends mere glamour. Led by the indefatigable Anna Wintour, the gala serves as a vital fundraising initiative for The Costume Institute, with over $223.5 million raised to support the preservation and exhibition of fashion history. Tonight, as attendees don their interpretations of \"The Garden of Time,\" they'll not only celebrate fashion but also contribute to a noble cause.\n\nHere's all you need to know about the 2024 Met Gala:\n\nFor those unable to secure a coveted ticket, fear not! Vogue's got you covered for the fourth consecutive year, offering audiences an exclusive (and free) front-row experience to the fashion spectacle. The 2024 Met Gala live stream extravaganza will grace its digital platforms, including, TikTok and YouTube, kicking off on Monday, May 6th starting at 6:00 pm ET.\n\nThe event will be hosted by actor Gwendoline Christie, producer and actor La La Anthony, and model Ashley Graham, while the versatile Emma Chamberlain returns as Vogue's special correspondent, ready to chat with the night's A-listers! Prefer the traditional TV experience? E! has got your back with a live broadcast straight from the red carpet, starting at 3 p.m. PDT. Don't forget to tune in for an evening filled with magic and fashion finery!\n\nThe Benefit (also known as The Met Gala) marks the opening of The Costume Institute's spring exhibition -- this year, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion. Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion will reactivate the sensory capacities of masterworks in the Museum's collection through first-hand research, conservation analysis, and diverse technologies -- from cutting-edge tools, artificial intelligence, and computer-generated imagery to traditional formats of x-rays, video animation, light projection, and soundscapes. Approximately 250 objects spanning four centuries will be on view, visually united by iconography related to nature, which will serve as a metaphor for the fragility and ephemerality of fashion.\n\nBut what about the dress code, you ask? This year, it's all about embracing \"The Garden of Time,\" drawing inspiration from J.G. Ballard's evocative tale of temporal manipulation (1962). Think botanical prints, archival pieces, and perhaps a nod to Botticelli's iconic \"The Birth of Venus.\" It's a theme that invites guests to explore the cyclical nature of fashion, where the past intertwines with the present to create a timeless tableau.\n\nAnna Wintour's hand-picked class of 2024 co-chairs for the full-blown-out black-tie event of the year will head the exclusive fashion spectacle. From the captivating Zendaya to the legendary Jennifer Lopez, the dashing Chris Hemsworth, and the trailblazing Bad Bunny, this dream team is set to elevate the event to new heights, alongside Wintour. Adding to the glamour are honorary chairs TikTok CEO Shou Chew and Jonathan Anderson, the creative director of Loewe, highlighting the event's esteemed lineup.\n\nAs the countdown ticks away and the Met Gala 2024 looms closer, the excitement is palpable to see a dazzling showcase of creativity and philanthropy, where fashion history will be made amidst the enchanting backdrop of the Garden of Time. {"uri": "8112597888", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "17:01:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T17:01:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T17:01:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.572549045085907, "url": "https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lifestyle/style/jennifer-lopez-met-gala-looks-1235889062/", "title": "Jennifer Lopez at the Met Gala: Look Back at All of the A-Lister's Ensembles Over the Years", "body": "Jennifer Lopez will be back at the Met Gala on Monday with official duties as a co-chair of fashion's biggest night.\n\nThe multi-hyphenate's attendance is pretty much a given at this point, after having previously attended a whopping 13 times. While it's unclear how Lopez will interpret this year's theme, the star always arrives to make a statement. \"I like things that I know that I can bring to life, things that stand out. I don't like ordinary things,\" Lopez told Vogue on last year's Met Gala red carpet. \"I'm an entertainer, so I love sparkle and glamour.\"\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala is set to take place May 6 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City. This year's Costume Institute exhibition theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth are joining Lopez on the invite as fellow co-chairs for the night. The dress code for the gala is \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by a J.G. Ballard short story. Vogue's Anna Wintour has also communicated that ensembles should convey the idea of \"fleeting beauty.\"\n\nFrom an elegant Ralph Lauren look last year perfecting the Karl Lagerfeld theme, all the way back the singer's Dolce & Gabbana 18th century inspired lacy gown at her first Met Gala 20 years ago - Lopez knows how to make a splash. See for yourself below.\n\nLopez was a showstopper in this look from Ralph Lauren. The singer told Vogue on the red carpet: \"It's a mix of Karl and Ralph and me.\"\n\nFor an atypical Met Gala in the fall due to the pandemic, Lopez stepped out in a Western-inspired Ralph Lauren look with a slew of accessories to hone in on the American theme.\n\nLopez looked ethereal in a Valentino gown, Giuseppe Zanotti shoes and Harry Winston jewels.\n\nAccompanied by the designer herself, Lopez opted for a stunning (and sheer!) custom Versace gown.\n\nIn line with the \"Punk\" theme, the star rocked a spotted Michael Kors dress and a dramatic smoky eye.\n\nLopez, joined by then-husband Marc Anthony, went with a simultaneously delicate yet extravagant Gucci gown. The floral detailing made the already vibrant red ensemble pop.\n\nDiverging from her typical form-fitting silhouettes, Lopez wore a glistening Zuhair Murad gown for the \"American Woman\" theme.\n\nWith a theme like \"Superheroes,\" Met Gala attendees had many options for interpretation. Lopez decided to stick with a subdued blue Alberta Ferretti ensemble.\n\nThe singer and actress wore a silver Marchesa gown, accompanied by Anthony. The ensemble was considered at the time to be Lopez's most extravagant Met Gala look.\n\nLopez attended her second Met in 2006, changing her look completely from her first appearance. The singer wore a simple blush pink gown by Dolce & Gabbana.\n\nMaking her Met Gala debut, Lopez joined the Dolce & Gabbana designers for the night. {"uri": "8114162750", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:50:19", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:50:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:49:52Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5686274766921997, "url": "https://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-met-gala-2024-no-selfie-policy-ticket-costing-rs-25-lakh-table-worth-rs-20-crore-inside-secrets-revealed-3088299", "title": "From no-selfie policy to ticket costing Rs 25 lakh and a table worth Rs 20 crore, inside secrets of Met Gala revealed", "body": "The Met Gala, a pinnacle event in the world of fashion, is not just about the glitz and glamour on the red carpet; it's a carefully orchestrated affair with its own set of rules! E! News recently obtained an interview where Met curator Andrew Bolton shared insights into what could lead to a celebrity's exclusion from future galas.\n\nDuring a candid conversation on CBS This Morning last May, Anna Wintour, Vogue's editor-in-chief, and Bolton revealed two cardinal rules: no smoking and no touching the artwork. Bolton emphasized, \"Those would be no-nos,\" recalling past incidents where stars flouted the rules, including smoking in restrooms despite strict policies.\n\nDespite the lack of an exact formula for scoring an invite, Wintour explained that the guest list depends on various factors, including the theme of the exhibition and the cultural zeitgeist. \"We're always interested in trying to reflect a cultural moment,\" she said.\n\nHowever, securing an invitation comes with a hefty price tag. A solo ticket to the Met Gala costs a staggering USD 30,000 (over Rs 25 lakh), while a table sets one back USD 275,000 (over Rs 20 crore). Yet, not everyone has to pay their way in; Wintour often extends invitations to up-and-coming designers and celebrities showcasing designers' work.\n\nThe event's exclusivity extends beyond its price tag. Organizers strive to maintain an intimate atmosphere, with attendee numbers typically capped at 500 to ensure a personalized experience. Even celebrities must earn a plus-one invite for their partners, as per E! News.\n\nBehind the scenes, meticulous planning begins immediately after the previous gala, with approximately 100 people working year-round to orchestrate the event. From the seating chart, meticulously crafted to foster networking opportunities, to the menu selection, personally curated by Wintour, no detail is left to chance.\n\nEntertainment plays a crucial role, with high-profile performers adding to the gala's allure. However, booking such acts often entails navigating significant budgetary hurdles, as documented in the behind-the-scenes glimpse provided by the 2016 flick The First Monday in May.\n\nSecurity measures are paramount, particularly for the valuable jewellery adorning attendees. The event's security protocols, shrouded in secrecy, ensure the safety of priceless pieces and guests alike.\n\nDespite its opulent facade, the Met Gala is not immune to controversy. Guests must adhere to a strict no-selfie policy, instituted by Wintour in 2015 to preserve the event's exclusivity. However, some celebrities, like Kylie Jenner, have flouted this rule, as per E! News.\n\nAs the world grappled with the COVID-19 pandemic, the 2021 gala saw stringent health protocols, including mandatory face masks and proof of vaccination. Yet, even with these measures, controversies arose, as seen in rapper Nicki Minaj's decision to opt-out due to vaccination concerns.\n\nIn essence, the Met Gala remains an enigmatic affair, steeped in tradition and exclusivity, where adherence to rules and protocols is paramount for securing coveted invites in the future.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala will be held on May 6 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City. The Met Gala, often hailed as fashion's biggest night, will uphold its tradition by returning on the first Monday of May. This year's theme is Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion. Unlike previous themes, this year's focus will be on reviving unique garments from various centuries, offering a novel perspective to fashion enthusiasts.\n\nWhile the gala will celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, the official dress theme is The Garden of Time. This year's exhibition will feature significant pieces spanning over 400 years of fashion history, showcasing iconic designers such as Elsa Schiaparelli, Christian Dior, Yves Saint Laurent, and Hubert de Givenchy.\n\nZendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, and Bad Bunny will serve as the night's co-chairs. The theme aims to celebrate delicate pieces of fashion that are often deemed too fragile for wear, affectionately termed the sleeping beauties.\n\nExcept for the headline, this story has not been edited by DNA staff and is published from ANI\n\nREAD | Meet actor, who was thrown out of first film, had 10 flops in 4 years, one film changed his life, is worth Rs 1200 crore", "source": {"uri": "dnaindia.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Daily News and Analysis (DNA) India"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Wintour", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Anna Wintour"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E!_News", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "E! "originalArticle": null, "storyUri": "eng-9541694", "eventUri": "eng-9541694", "location": null, "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "imp": true, "date": "2024-05-06", "textStart": 3148, "textEnd": 3153}], "sentiment": 0.07450980392156858, "wgt": 145, "relevance": 1}
{"uri": "8113101672", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "04:04:02", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T04:04:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T04:03:34Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5686274766921997, "url": "https://wwd.com/business-news/business-features/the-met-gala-economy-glitters-gold-business-impact-1236353258/", "title": "The Met Gala Economy Glitters, but Is It Gold?", "body": "As millions are eager to watch red carpet arrivals at the Met Gala on Monday night, the extravaganza also strengthens all sorts of businesses.\n\nWith billions of social media views, the Met Gala's reach is global -- and its glitter doesn't just sparkle on celebrity guests, but also boosts designer and luxury brands, stylists, hotels and all sorts of businesses.\n\nThe extravaganza has morphed into a multiday celebration for fans and moneymakers alike. While guests gear up with trips to their facialists, stylists, makeup artists, dermatologists and personal trainers, the hotels, bars and restaurants that welcome them are upping their games, too. There are car services to be booked, Champagne bottles to be uncorked and $500 flower arrangements to be ordered for Met-bound out-of-towners. And the evening has become a key one for luxury brands, from fashion to fine jewelry to beauty.\n\nLast year the generated $995 million in just 48 hours in Media Impact Value over a total of 115,919 placements, according to Launchmetrics. The top five performing brands at last year's gala, which honored Karl Lagerfeld, were Chanel ($110.7 million in MIV), followed by Fendi ($32 million), Valentino ($24 million), Gucci ($20 million) and Schiaparelli ($16 million).\n\nA number of stars appeared on the gala's red carpet in looks from Lagerfeld's time at Chanel, Fendi and Chlo\u00e9, personalized iterations of the designer's own black-and-white wardrobe and kitschy tributes to Lagerfeld's beloved cat Choupette. A vintage Chanel look worn and shared by Dua Lipa (one of last year's hosts) on her Instagram account amassed $1.4 million in MIV alone. Chanel looks, designed by Lagerfeld, were seen on Nicole Kidman, Jennie Kim and Pen\u00e9lope Cruz, among others.\n\nThis year's Met Gala exhibition is called \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" and the official dress code is \"The Garden of Time.\" Fashion brands are naturally working overtime to dress celebrities for Monday night's gala, knowing that there are a lot of benefits to having a star photographed in their dress, which they hope will generate an overall boost to image and sales, especially valuable in the midst of the current luxury slowdown.\n\nRobert Burke, chairman and chief executive officer of Robert Burke Associates, the consultancy, said, \"What we've seen coming out of COVID and award seasons in general coming back is a laser focus from the brands of using this [red carpet] as a platform to tell a story about a brand, their authenticity or their heritage.\"\n\nHe said dressing celebrities for the Met Gala is a way to reach more people than they ever could through traditional media, whether it's a magazine or an ad. \"Everyone tunes in with their iPhone for the red carpet. It seems like brands really look at it as a return on their investment. They continue to make major investments. Part of this also came about because the actors were on strike for so long, so this was a major opportunity for them. It [celebrity dressing] is a revenue stream. It's a business to get your clothing or jewelry on major celebrities,\" he said.\n\nAs for whether the Met Gala red carpet is as important as the Oscars or the Grammys, Burke said, \"I think the Met Gala is starting to eclipse it in many ways. The Oscars are known for movies, Cannes is also known for the movies, Grammys is music. This is really focused on fashion.\n\n\"The jewelry brands will have the jewelry that the celebrity wore right after the Met Gala in the windows and feature it. Or they'll have the dress the celebrity wore in the window after the gala,\" he said.\n\nHe also spoke about all the New York City activity in the lead-up to the gala. \"We've seen it in the last few days, the amount of celebrities coming to the city. That certainly affects the hotels, it affects the retailers from a shopping standpoint, the restaurants are crazy busy. And I think in many ways it energizes New York, and New York is so much a part of the fashion ecosystem,\" said Burke.\n\nIt appears that companies at all price levels want a piece of the action. \"Everyone wants to get involved. The bigger houses have a lot of manpower. This year, because of the 'Sleeping Beauties' theme, I imagine you'll see dresses inspired by the house's couture or vintage, or you could see actual vintage. At the Oscars, Anya Taylor-Joy had that Dior dress, inspired by a famous 1949 dress. This means a lot to the consumer. One, it's educational, but two, it separates these big heritage legacy brands from everyone else.\"\n\nBut, he added, \"Don't underestimate the amount of accessories, and certainly fragrance and makeup, that these things can sell, from the Dior and Chanel and countless others.\"\n\nHowever over-the-top this year's red carpeted bash might seem to armchair critics and social media fans, the benefit is essential for the Costume Institute as its annual fundraiser. To date, more than $223.5 million has been raised for the Costume Institute under the leadership of Anna Wintour, who has been a trustee since January 1999. Her term is slated to end in September. Twenty-five years ago, that May's \"Rock Style\"-themed Met Gala was decidedly more dressed down, with Stella McCartney sporting a one-shoulder \"Rock Royalty\" T-shirt and pants and Whitney Houston in a bedazzled white coat and slim black pants.\n\nAlthough New York City's Economic Development Corp. has not measured the Met Gala's economic impact on the city, the many days of frenzy around it generates significant business for some sectors, and does help to attract visitors to the Costume Institute in the months that follow. However, it's likely to be less than that generated by the weeklong New York Fashion Week, held twice a year, which the EDC estimates contributes nearly $900 million annually to the city's economy.\n\nTo be sure, the Met Gala helps spark tourism, not just in early May but in the months that follow, as well as museum visits, both of which are key to the city's economy. In 2023, 62 million visitors came to the city and that figure is expected to be higher this year, according to a City Hall spokesperson. New York City Mayor Eric Adams has been a part of the festivities before and may be again Monday, joining Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Wintour, the evening's co-chairs. TikTok's CEO Shou Chew and Jonathan Anderson, Loewe's creative director, are the honorary chairs. In the case of Chew, the honor has sparked significant backlash and a potential political nightmare for Wintour given the looming U.S. ban on TikTok. A few of Wintour's fellow museum trustees declined comment after being approached by WWD.\n\nThe City Hall spokesperson said, \"Thanks to our city's world-renowned arts and culture, and events like the Met Gala, we are driving nearly $74 billion in economic activity into this city [as a result of the overall growth in tourism]. We look forward to welcoming back the Met Gala for another year in the greatest city in the world and seeing everyone in their finest looks.\"\n\nAs in years past, hundreds are expected to descend on the Upper East Side hoping to get a glimpse of their favorite VIPs. The New York Police Department will once again be on hand in the lead-up to and during Monday night's event. Asked if there will be an increased police detail as a precaution for any protests, a NYPD spokesperson said, \"The NYPD will have an adequate security deployment. There are no street closures.\"\n\nUpper East Side retailers, restaurants and businesses are keen to keep the traffic flowing. Matthew Bauer, executive director of the Madison Avenue Business Improvement District, said that at a recent networking event for area store managers, \"All of the stores were talking about the excitement that the Met Gala brings. How many times a year does the spotlight from virtually every media network focus specifically on fashion and in this Upper East Side neighborhood? Even if this spotlight doesn't result in sales for that particular day, it aids all of the [300-plus] businesses that are here.\"\n\nHotels in the neighborhood have been booked solid for the days leading up to the gala, and those right after, with designers using the event as a reason to come to Manhattan and do interviews, store appointments or dinners.\n\nOne beneficiary is the Mark Hotel, whose general manager Etienne Haro observed, \"Increasingly, fashion houses and brands host events around Met Gala time, making it feel like a third fashion week, and positively impacting the length of stays.\"\n\nThe Mark is fully booked, and with guests who are making their reservations further in advance, according to Haro. The early booking trend is also evident in its restaurants and bars.\n\nKnown to be a hub for celebrities and high-profile designers, The Mark has \"a strong understanding of what is required for our guests to be safe and to feel safe during this major event. Like for all other facets, we always look for ways to improve our security setup and plan for any scenario,\" he said.\n\nThe hotel doesn't shy away from its A-list status by encouraging guests and non-overnighters to check out \"The Mark Red Carpet live\" via Instagram. The Mark is also known to be a base camp for major media outlets and fashion publications all day Monday, \"making it the most watched [of the] hotel happenings in the world,\" Haro boasted.\n\nLike The Standard, the Lowell, the Carlyle and the Bowery Hotel, The Mark is at the ready for its VIPs, whether they want to hail \"The Mark Pedicab\" to wheel over to the Met, or need an all-day supply of \"the best fried chicken in town,\" Haro said. The inevitable wardrobe malfunctions can be eased with swift assistance. \"The day is all about making the impossible happen. In hindsight, it is not so dissimilar to the daily life at The Mark,\" he said.\n\nThe Lowell is also fully booked. Ernesto, director of sales and marketing, said, \"We go above and beyond for all our guests. Most requests we can't share, but we go as far as recreating ateliers for designers to work with their guests.\"\n\nCabin Creative's founder Julia Flynn, who works with brands and celebrities, said, \"Where I see companies having the largest advantages are in hospitality; no one discusses the incredible leaps and hurdles it takes to get into the actual hotels that host everyone; the Carlyle, Mark, Bowery Hotel and funny enough The Pierre. It's increasingly becoming more challenging on the Upper East Side to find lodging for the celebrities, agents, managers, makeup artists, etc.\"\n\nOscar Blandi, who brought his salon back to The Plaza seven months ago, said bookings are up 10 to 15 percent before the big event. With 150-plus clients Met-bound, many are requesting updos and more formal looks. Blandi speculated about the residual effect of the Met Gala in terms of driving tourism, fashion trends, hairstyles and color preferences: \"When the news is good, clients have the inclination to stretch. But as soon as the news is bad, people get afraid. The type of clientele that we have ranges from young to older with everything in between. So you see how much the business grows, and then when something happens it drops. But then it goes back,\" he said.\n\nFlorists are also seeing a bump in business, seemingly fitting considering this year's dress code. Ovando, which has some celebrity orders, is seeing a 40 percent two-day boost. Owner Sandra de Ovando claimed, \"When you receive flowers from Ovando, it's an experience and experiences are more valuable than things. You feel taken care of, cherished and that you're an important person. You feel loved -- and happy.\"\n\nZez\u00e9's has seen orders pick up this week, with many ordering \"very colorful\" arrangements for out-of-town visitors, according to co-owner and manager Peggy O'Dea. People are spending more, $400 to $500 as opposed to the typical $250 to $300. The floristry is an art itself with floral designer, co-owner and husband Zez\u00e9, who still amazes O'Dea with some of his creations. \"It's just a natural thing with him. It's not forced at all. It just flows,\" O'Dea said. \"He reads what people want to express on those messages on the cards and then he expresses that in the flowers. It's quite a beautiful thing.\"\n\nTo get ahead of the 100-plus demand for bouquets, Belle Fleur NYC delivered some orders Sunday, which is usually a day off, in advance of Monday's blitz. With even more orders expected Tuesday and Wednesday, co-founder and creative director Meredith Waga Perez said, \"It's not just the celebs that are spoiled with the most exquisite flowers, but there's also the post-gala thank you bouquets to grace the desks of designers, jewelers and editors.\"\n\nLast year's Belle Fleur NYC created a bouquet and a floral crown for Elle Fanning's red-carpet appearance, which \"trumped all orders and limited the quantity of deliveries,\" Perez said. \"Our gift bouquets align perfectly with this year's Met Gala's theme, embracing a secret garden aesthetic with imported blooms such as peonies, English garden roses, tulips, delicate sweet peas, button ranunculus and trailing scented jasmine vines,\" she said.\n\nEven candy is in demand. Accustomed to working regularly \"within the high-fashion circuit for all fashion weeks and special events,\" BonBon is providing candy for two designers' entire offices and the celebrities they are working with or dressing, according to Sue-Jean Kang, senior events and marketing projects manager. (The candy store is also popular on TikTok with 42.1 million views.) \"We absolutely love Met Gala week. These brands are regular, longtime supporters,\" she said.\n\nRosanna Scotto, whose family owns the restaurant Fresco by Scotto, estimated an uptick of 20 to 30 percent this week. \"There are faces that we have not seen before in our restaurant, and ones we recognize. I think they are stylists and public relations people, based on their stylishness. They have a certain stye about them. They have taken things up a notch,\" Scotto said. \"You know that this is not your regular customer, although out regular customer is always stylish. The fashionistas are doing more of the fish [choices]. They're not the pasta lovers.\"\n\nLast year Scotto, a \"Good Day New York\" host, tried unsuccessfully to crash the Met Gala with cameras in tow. The longtime New Yorker was a familiar face with many of the New York City police officers on duty. \"They just thought it was hysterical. I schmoozed my way to where I couldn't schmooze any more. I did not get to the top of the stairs,\" she said. \"I tried to pass myself off as an invited guest, but I was dressed like I was from the Amish country. Everybody was laughing around us, because they knew that I was up to shenanigans. The people at the Met Gala are very serious.\"\n\nAgreeing how the media goes into overdrive year after year over the celebrity attendees, Scotto said that she, like many, is very interested in Amazon honcho Jeff Bezos' fiancee Lauren Sanchez. \"I want to be a friend. I don't care -- I'll find a corset. I'll do something to hang out with that woman. And she was a correspondent for 'Good Day LA.'\"\n\nBut the night really is about fashion. And across the spectrum, brands have gotten involved in red carpet dressing, and have seen the benefits.\n\nTommy Hilfiger, for example, is dressing the eight-member K-pop band and Hilfiger ambassadors Stray Kids and actor Madelyn Cline, along with his wife, Dee. The Hilfiger looks will blend classic American cool with this year's theme, while staying true to the brand's signature red, white and blue color palette. The company said it views the Met Gala as an opportunity to showcase Hilfiger's designs to a global audience of style enthusiasts, stars of pop culture and media outlets on one of fashion's biggest stages.\n\nKerry O'Brien, founder, designer and CEO of Commando, the luxury intimate brand, has supplied intimates to stylists for every major award show, NYFW fashion show and red carpet moment, including the Met Gala. Although the intimate apparel is worn underneath and isn't necessarily visible on the red carpet, she sees many benefits.\n\n\"We are honored to be the brand that stylists trust for the biggest night of the year in fashion,\" said O'Brien. While she loves the media coverage, she said her goal has always been to support the stylist community and empower their clients to feel both comfortable and confident, no matter the occasion. \"Many of those celebrities have become loyal customers over the years,\" she said.\n\n\"More recently, we are finding ourselves on the red carpet not only as the perfect invisible underpinning, but our high-waisted briefs and thongs have been visibly worn by a number of A-list celebrities under sheer dresses. Our hosiery has also taken center stage paired with our high-rise bottoms (the 'no pants' trend),\" said O'Brien. She said that celebrities wearing their product on the Met Gala red carpet \"is obviously such a great endorsement of the brand.\"\n\nClaudia Cividino, president of Jared the Galleria of Jewelry, said, \"Our Jared Atelier collection has been chosen by notable celebrities for a handful of red carpets this year. This has been a very positive affirmation for us and a signal to consumers that we are elevating the Jared brand and our product. The Met is clearly one of the pinnacle events of the year. It is one of the biggest stages for high jewelry, and a perfect venue for our offering to shine with exquisite one-of-a kind styles with natural diamonds, fancy yellow diamonds, emeralds and more. We find our customers may either want to purchase these looks or seek inspiration to create a similar look using our custom design service, The Foundry.\"\n\nSpanx, too, has benefited from the red carpet action.\n\n\"Spanx has been a mainstay on the red carpet for over two decades -- since we're the inventors of modern shapewear. When it comes to special events, like the Met Gala, it goes beyond product placement for us; it's about fostering genuine connections and loyalty. Celebrities and stylists have come to rely on us for the big and small moments. Their brand love has helped maintain our leadership in the category by building consumer trust of our product,\" said Andrea Port, vice president, brand and integrated marketing at Spanx.\n\nMichael Fisher, a stylist represented by The Wall Group, feels events such as the Met Gala have really helped his career.\n\n\"I see it as an opportunity to push myself and grow as a creative. It has also been a career booster. In 2022 ['Gilded Glamour'] my client Sebastian Stan went as a guest of Instagram, and we did something out of the box dressing him in Pierpaolo [Piccioli's] Pink PP Valentino Collection while the rest of the guys were in crisp white tie. It was a padded bomber look and the first time a man wore total PP Valentino on a carpet. It caused quite a stir with so much engagement online,\" he said.\n\n\"That traction certainly had an impact on my work and professional profile. Brands, stars and publicists took notice and it has become a 'standard' -- one that has strengthened relationships and trust between brands and clients alike. They are more open to creative collaboration,\" said Fisher.", "source": {"uri": "wwd.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "WWD"}, "authors": [{"uri": "rosemary_feitelberg@wwd.com", "name": "Rosemary It's a fun night for fashion,\" remarked the 54-year-old.\n\nWhen the GMA host questioned whether she would be able to walk in her look, to which the Hustlers star replied, \"Barely, ever. The Met Gala looks are not about comfort.\"\n\nWhile talking about hosting the event alongside Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth and Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour, Lopez told GMA, \"I was really honored to be asked to host it alongside Zendaya and Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth.\"\n\n\"Anna was gracious enough to ask me. We're going to have a good time,\" she stated.\n\nReflecting on the event, This is Me Now... star mentioned, \"It's always a nice time there. It's such an interesting mix of artists and business people.\"\n\n\" It's not just music or film, it's everybody -- fashion, film, music, business -- and you get to have some really interesting interactions,\" she added.\n\nMeanwhile, Lopez disclosed she was still deciding on her look for this year's event in a Vogue's Instagram.\n\n\"I'm also one of those people who chooses at the last minute,\" she noted.\n\nLopez further said, \"Like, I like choices, and then I go, 'Okay, this is how I feel today.' {"uri": "8114352578", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:33:40", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:33:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:33:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5607843399047852, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/agency-news/entertainment-news-from-crystal-flowers-to-celestial-creations-exploring-2024-met-gala-dress-code-garden-of-time-5945706.html", "title": "Entertainment News | From Crystal Flowers to Celestial Creations: Exploring 2024 Met Gala Dress Code 'Garden Of Time' | LatestLY", "body": "Washington [US], May 6 (ANI): As the countdown begins for the highly anticipated 2024 Met Gala, fashion enthusiasts and celebrity watchers are buzzing with excitement over this year's theme and dress code.\n\nWith stars like Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny set to grace the red carpet, the stage is set for a spectacular showcase of style and creativity at The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City for May 6.\n\nAlso Read | Director Harikumar Dies at 70: From Ashokan's Jaalakam to Mammootty's Sukrutham, 7 Notable Malayalam Films Made By Late Filmmaker and Where to Watch Them Online.\n\nDubbed 'The Garden of Time,' the theme of this year's Met Gala is inspired by the Costume Institute's new exhibition, 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.'\n\nUnlike the typical fairy tale interpretation, this exhibition delves into the realm of delicate garments that are too fragile to be worn again, earning them the title of \"sleeping beauties\" within the museum's archives, as per E! News.\n\nAlso Read | Preity Zinta Is Waiting for 'Good Script' to Collab With Salman Khan, Reveals Her Fave Film With Superstar.\n\nAccording to Andrew Bolton, the head curator of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the theme is \"very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion.\"\n\nDrawing inspiration from J.G. Ballard's 1962 short story of the same name, the gala pays homage to a world where time and beauty intertwine in a lush garden setting.\n\n'The Garden of Time' dress code invites attendees to explore the theme through botanical-inspired creations, promising a red carpet adorned with florals, plants, and other elements of nature.\n\nFrom ethereal gowns to avant-garde designs, guests are encouraged to interpret the theme in their unique way, adding to the eclectic tapestry of fashion at the gala.\n\nJoining Anna Wintour as co-hosts for the evening are industry icons Bad Bunny, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, and Chris Hemsworth.\n\nWith each bringing their flair and style to the event, the lineup promises an unforgettable evening of fashion and entertainment.\n\nBeyond the glitz and glamour of the gala itself, attendees will have the opportunity to explore the 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion' exhibition, which runs from May 10 through September 2 at the Metropolitan Museum.\n\nFeaturing approximately 250 garments and accessories spanning over 400 years of fashion history, the exhibition offers a sensory journey through the evolution of style.\n\nAs per E! News, visitors can expect to engage with the exhibits through various immersive experiences, including sensory capabilities such as smelling hats with floral notes and touching walls adorned with embroidered fabrics.\n\nNotable pieces by designers such as Schiaparelli, Dior, and Givenchy will be on display, alongside innovative presentations of garments too fragile to be worn again.\n\n\"By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses, the show aims to reconnect with the works on display as they were originally intended--with vibrancy, with dynamism, and ultimately with life,\" Andrew Bolton expressed in a press release obtained by E! News.\n\nAs the fashion world eagerly awaits the unveiling of this year's Met Gala, anticipation is high for an evening that promises to blend art, culture, and style in a celebration of creativity and innovation.\n\nWith 'The Garden of Time' as its backdrop, the 2024 Met Gala is poised to transport attendees to a realm where fashion becomes an enchanting journey through the ages. Celebrities, designers, and stylists alike are all in crunch mode to prepare for tonight's Met Gala, titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" and featuring the theme \"Garden of Time.\" Expect lots of archival pieces and nods to nature. With the 2024 Met Gala mere hours away, here's everything to know ahead of that first red carpet look.\n\nThe official start time is 6 p.m., but we'll be updating you live whenever the first celebrity (or roach) hits the carpet, both here and on our socials.\n\nCo-chairs Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, and Chris Hemsworth will definitely be in attendance, and thank God. The exhibition put on by the Costume Institute is titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" and is set to focus on forgotten and fragile garments, including current pieces by designers Phillip Lim and Stella McCartney, and archival designs from classics like Elsa Schiaparelli, Yves Saint Laurent, Christian Dior, and Hubert de Givenchy, to name a few.\n\nAs for the dress code for this evening (yes, they are different), its focus is \"The Garden of Time\" and can be a chance for attendees to take it very literally and play with the garden aspect or nod to time with more archival designs and pieces.\n\nThe last Met Gala Taylor Swift attended was eight years and three boyfriends ago, but Swifties have never given up hope that she will make a big couture comeback.
