{"uri": "8113621978", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "10:43:39", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T10:43:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:42:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5568627715110779, "url": "https://lavocedinewyork.com/en/new-york/2024/05/06/met-gala-prepares-to-unfold-on-the-red-carpet-the-nypd-readies-for-disruptions/", "title": "Met Gala Prepares to Unfold on the Red Carpet, the NYPD Readies for Disruptions", "body": "The Met Gala, fashion's most anticipated event, is set to take place on May 6, 2024, with a theme that promises to blend the fantastical with the historical: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nThe event raises millions of dollars for the museum's self-funding fashion wing and is the year's highlight for A-listers who scramble to be invited by the \"grande dame\" of fashion, Anna Wintour, the longtime Vogue editor and Cond\u00e9 Nast executive.\n\nWhile normally most of the drama is created on the red carpet, with the celebrities' outrageous fashions, this year the drama has preceded the event and taken place in the boardrooms.\n\nThe union representing employees of Cond\u00e9 Nast publications including Bon App\u00e9tit, GQ, Vanity Fair and Vogue escalated the stakes in its long-running contract negotiations on Saturday, telling the company in a video posted on X that if management didn't meet the union at the bargaining table, its members would \"meet you at the Met,\" setting up the possibility of a picket line during Vogue's biggest night. A representative from the New York Police Department said that there were no street closures planned and that the police would have \"an adequate security deployment.\"\n\nIn the meantime, the attention is riveted on the fashion. This year's theme is a nod to the delicate and often untouchable pieces that will be showcased in the spring exhibition, which opens shortly after the Gala on May 10. The exhibition will feature around 250 pieces, some of which are so fragile they cannot be worn again, symbolizing the \"sleeping beauties\" of fashion's past.\n\nAndrew Bolton, the Costume Institute's curator, wrote in an essay about the exhibition, \"The extreme fragility of these garments precludes them from being dressed on a mannequin, so in the exhibition they are displayed flat in glass cases to prevent further deterioration.\"\n\nThe event, known for its exclusive guest list of A-list celebrities from various fields, including film, fashion, music, sports, and even politics, will be co-hosted by luminaries such as Zendaya and Jennifer Lopez, who are known for their iconic fashion statements.\n\nAs the world eagerly anticipates the red carpet arrivals, the event will be live-streamed for fans to witness the grandeur and creativity that define the Met Gala. This year's dress code, \"The Garden of Time,\" is expected to inspire a myriad of nature-inspired designs, with celebrities and designers bringing their interpretation of botanical beauty to the prestigious steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.\n\nThe Met Gala continues to be a celebration of fashion as an art form, where the historical significance of the garments is as important as their aesthetic appeal. The event not only honors the craftsmanship and creativity of designers but ensures the preservation and curation of fashion history for future generations.\n\nAs the countdown to the Gala begins, the anticipation builds for an evening that will surely be remembered for its opulence, innovation, and homage to the timeless beauty of fashion. {"uri": "2024-05-346643874", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:02:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:02:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:00:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5568627715110779, "url": "https://www.channelstv.com/2024/05/06/showbiz-elite-descend-on-manhattan-for-met-gala/", "title": "Showbiz Elite Descend On Manhattan For Met Gala", "body": "Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth will join Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour to host the so-called Oscars of the East Coast.\n\nThe entertainment world hits the red carpet Monday for the annual Met Gala, New York's party of the year that hosts a parade of superstars donning their most extravagant looks.\n\nZendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth will join Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour to host the so-called Oscars of the East Coast, which is a mammoth fundraiser for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute.\n\nThe extravaganza's dress code this year is \"The Garden of Time\" -- which draws inspiration from the 1962 short story of the same name written by English writer J.G. Ballard, and is in essence about the ephemeral nature of beauty.\n\nThe theme parallels the exhibit \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which focuses on the most fragile pieces of the Costume Institute's vast collection.\n\nThe show, which will be on view to the public from May 10 through September 2, features clothing so delicate it cannot be displayed on mannequins.\n\nCelebrity interpretation of the dress code is anyone's guess, but vintage couture will likely reign.\n\nZendaya's look is among the most highly anticipated: the 27-year-old has become a red carpet icon during her most recent movie press tours, with cyborg fits for \"Dune: Part Two\" and courtside chic for the tennis-themed \"Challengers.\"\n\nShe hasn't attended a Met Gala since 2019, so her return is sure to turn heads.\n\nThe Costume Institute relies on the blockbuster Met Gala to fund its work, including exhibitions and acquisitions.\n\nThe gala was first held in 1948 and for decades was reserved for New York high society.\n\nWintour, the high priestess of fashion, took over the show in the 1990s, transforming the party into a catwalk for the rich and famous.\n\nThis year, a ticket costs a cool $75,000, with tables starting at $350,000. The 2023 gala -- which celebrated the late Karl Lagerfeld -- raised nearly $22 million, a record sum.\n\n- Social media frenzy -\n\nThe spectacle is social media catnip for celebrity watchers -- and once again, both the gala and the exhibit are co-sponsored by TikTok.\n\nThe tech world will join luminaries of music, film, politics and sports on the carpet, with TikTok CEO Shou Chew, also an honorary co-chair, expected to attend.\n\nBut the 41-year-old's appearance comes as the future of TikTok in the United States teeters on thin ice, just after President Joe Biden signed a bill demanding that ByteDance -- the Chinese company behind the wildly popular video-sharing app -- sell it off or go dark stateside.\n\nPreparation for this year's Met Gala also included turmoil within, as workers at Conde Nast -which publishes Vogue, The New Yorker and Vanity Fair, among other titles - threatened to walk off the job on the fete's eve as they bargained for a new contract.\n\nWintour was the public face of worker ire: in addition to heading Vogue, she is Conde Nast's global chief content officer, overseeing all publications worldwide.\n\nContract negotiations between the union and management dragged on for months, as the company meanwhile vowed to lay off scores of employees. It has already let some go, as it consolidates, sells or closes some of its publications.\n\nEarly Monday, the union announced a deal including a higher salary floor and just severance for those on the layoff list, saying its mobilization ahead of the gala had \"moved the company.\"\n\nStars will begin arriving at the event at about 5:30 pm (2130 GMT), and the style parade run until approximately 8:00 pm.\n\nBut stars with the most clout -- ahem, Rihanna -- live by their own clocks.\n\nMore than once, the 36-year-old Barbadian mogul has arrived so late that other guests were {"uri": "8114010623", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:02:43", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:02:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:00:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5568627715110779, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/jennifer-lopez-stepped-black-corset-145300616.html", "title": "Jennifer Lopez Stepped Out in a Black Corset Dress for the Pre-Met Gala Dinner", "body": "Jennifer Lopez revealed her first look as co-chair of the 2024 Met Gala at the annual pre-dinner in New York City last night. The singer arrived in a black column gown with a corset top by Diana Qerimi, adorned with gems. Lopez accessorized with Yeprem jewelry (including a pair of diamond drop earrings), a Tyler Ellis bag, and Casadei shoes. For glam, she wore her hair in a ponytail and kept her makeup more subdued.\n\nLopez will be among the first to arrive at tonight's Met Gala, where she'll showcase her sartorial interpretation of the night's \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashon\" exhibition and its \"The Garden of Time\" dress code.\n\nLopez is pulling double duty today though, as she is also on a press tour for her upcoming Netflix film, Atlas. She stepped out in a monochromatic red ensemble this morning for an appearance on Good Morning America.\n\nShe teased during the show that she'll \"barely\" be able to walk in her actual Met Gala outfit. \"The Met Gala looks are not about comfort,\" she said.\n\nShe declined to give any more details on what she'll be wearing, saying, \"You'll have to tune in to see. But it's exciting, it's exciting. It's a fun night for fashion.\"\n\n\"It's always a nice time there,\" she added of her own experience in past years at the coveted fashion event. \"It's such an interesting mix of artists and business people. It's not just music or film, it's everybody -- fashion, film, music, business -- and you get to have some really interesting interactions.\"", "source": {"uri": "ca.news.yahoo.com", "dataType": {"uri": "8114250050", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:02:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:02:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:01:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://www.forbes.com/sites/conormurray/2024/05/06/what-we-know-about-tonights-met-gala-backed-by-tiktok-with-zendaya-and-more-co-chairing-garden-of-time-themed-event/", "title": "What We Know About Tonight's Met Gala: Backed By TikTok, With Zendaya And More Co-Chairing 'Garden Of Time' Themed Event", "body": "Murray is a Forbes news reporter covering entertainment trends.\n\nThis year's Met Gala, annually one of the biggest and most star-studded events in fashion, starts at 5:30 p.m. Monday, with stars like Zendaya and Bad Bunny set to co-chair and TikTok controversially set to sponsor the event.\n\nEach year, the Met Gala's celebrity co-chairs are always in attendance, meaning viewers can expect to see Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Hemsworth and Lopez among the attendees. PageSix reported, citing anonymous sources, that celebrities among the invitees include \"Killers of the Flower Moon\" star and recent Oscar nominee Lily Gladstone, recent \"The Bear\" Emmy winner Ayo Edebiri, and Rihanna -- a frequent Met Gala guest who is considered to have worn some of the event's most iconic looks. Other invitees, according to PageSix, include Gisele B\u00fcndchen, Kendall Jenner, Olivia Rodrigo, Uma Thurman and Cara Delevigne.\n\nTikTok is a sponsor of the event and its CEO, Shou Zi Chew, will serve as an honorary co-chair despite the app facing legislative challenges in the United States. According to a Met Gala press release, the \"exhibition and benefit are made possible by TikTok.\" TikTok has long been scrutinized by American lawmakers for its ownership by Chinese company ByteDance, and the House of Representatives passed a bill last month that would force ByteDance to sell TikTok or else face a nationwide ban. Chew was previously grilled by members of Congress in a March 2023 testimony over the app's ties to China -- though he denied the company is linked to the Chinese Communist Party -- and again in January 2024 alongside other tech CEOs about child safety. Sen. Rick Scott, R-Fla., slammed Chew's involvement as \"disturbing.\"\n\nThe \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibit will feature 250 objects spanning four centuries from the Costume Institute's archive, which the museum said were chosen because of \"iconography related to nature.\" Andrew Bolton, the curator of the exhibit, told the Associated Press the display will organize the items on display by the themes of earth, air and water, as well as around the senses. Bolton told the AP some garments will be accompanied by scent, meaning \"the scent of the person who wore it, the natural body odors that they emitted, what they smoked, what they ate, where they lived\" will be part of the exhibit. Though exhibit attendees will not be allowed to touch garments, some textures have been reproduced as touchable wallpapers through 3D printing, Bolton said. The museum also said artificial intelligence, alongside other technologies like X-rays and animation, will be used to display some of the objects.\n\n$50,000. That's how much a single ticket to attend the Met Gala cost last year, with entire tables costing as much as $300,000 -- though designers reportedly often purchase tickets for the celebrities they are styling.\n\nThe first Met Gala was held in 1948 as the Costume Institute Benefit, a midnight dinner party, though it did not begin to transform into its modern format until then-Vogue editor-in-chief Diana Vreeland joined as a consultant in the 1970s. Themes of recent Met Galas include \"Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty\" in 2023 and \"In America: An Anthology of Fashion\" in 2022.\n\nWhether any celebrities confirm they will attend the Met Gala in the coming weeks. Last year, several celebrities confirmed on social media or in interviews that they would attend, but some kept their attendance a secret until they arrived -- including Rihanna, who was one of the {"uri": "2024-05-346850959", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:44:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:44:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:48:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/10-biggest-moments-met-gala-124801888.html", "title": "10 of the biggest moments in Met Gala history", "body": "What's now known as a spectacular display of haute-couture fashion on the first Monday in May was once a midnight dinner in the fall.\n\nSpearheaded by prominent public relations expert Eleanor Lambert (who's also responsible for New York Fashion Week and the CFDA), the first fundraiser for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute was held in 1948 and cost $50 to attend, Vogue reported.\n\nDubbed the \"Party of the Year,\" the Met Gala passed through the hands of famously stylish women like Diana Vreeland and Pat Buckley before ultimately landing under the stewardship of Anna Wintour, global chief content officer of Cond\u00e9 Nast and Vogue editor in chief, in 1995. Wintour still oversees the event and decides everything from the theme to the guest list.\n\nThroughout the years, the Met Gala has transformed into a multimillion-dollar fundraiser -- last year's event reportedly raised $22 million -- filled with unforgettable fashion, controversies, and canon-level pop-culture moments.\n\nAs the world awaits all that this year's party has to offer on May 6, here's a look back at 10 memorable moments in Met Gala history.\n\nAnna Wintour co-chaired her first Met Gala in 1995 and infused the event with Vogue's youthfulness.\n\nSimply themed \"Haute Couture,\" Wintour co-chaired her first Met Gala (then known as the Costume Institute Gala) alongside Annette de la Renta and Clarissa Bronfman in 1995 and has co-chaired every Met since, with the exception of the 1996 and 1998 events, Vogue reported.\n\nAs editor in chief of Vogue, Wintour infused the event with the magazine's sensibilities, transforming the guest list with the inclusion of popular actors, musicians, and supermodels like Christy Turlington, Naomi Campbell, and Kate Moss.\n\nHer leadership has helped transform the Met Gala into the cultural phenomenon it's known as today. Its set date on the first Monday in May, dress codes, and surprise performances all took shape during her tenure.\n\nPrincess Diana attended her first and only Met Gala in December 1996 wearing a full Christian Dior look.\n\nJust months after divorcing Prince Charles, Princess Diana attended her first and only Met Gala.\n\nThe theme of the year honored Christian Dior, so Diana chose a dress designed by John Galliano, who'd just become head of the legendary fashion house.\n\nThe navy-blue slip dress with black lace detailing quickly became a key moment in fashion history, with Business Insider reporting that the dress was later displayed at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London.\n\nAnother key detail of the look was her bag; originally named the Dior Chouchou, it was renamed the Dior Lady Di bag by the fashion house in 1995, per Vogue. Dior still sells the iconic Lady Dior bag, which retails for upwards of $5,500.\n\nIn 1999, \"Rock Royalty\" Liv Tyler and Stella McCartney broke the Met's traditional dress code with their casual looks.\n\nWith the theme \"Rock Style,\" it's hard to imagine that Tyler and McCartney, the daughters of famous Aerosmith and Beatles frontmen, created this iconic fashion moment by accident.\n\nAnd yet, that's exactly what happened. \"I didn't come at it intentionally to be rebellious at all. I didn't know what people wore,\" McCartney told Vogue in a 2020 video interview.\n\nThe designer said she \"must have found out about the theme the night before,\" so the morning of the Met, she took a three-pack of white Hanes tank tops to Filth Mart, a vintage rock-and-roll store, and customized them with the owner.\n\nAfter adding some studs and ribbons to the tops, McCartney took them to Tyler, and they each created their outfits. Tyler chose a black Comme des Gar\u00e7ons slip skirt, and McCartney opted for Chlo\u00e9 trousers she'd designed.\n\n\"It was an amazing thing, in a way,\" Tyler also told Vogue. \"We were just being ourselves.\"\n\nAs a result, a moment as authentic as this will likely never happen again.\n\n\"In this day and age, people would really plan it and overthink it intentionally to get attention in the media, and like, we really didn't, and that is what is so lovely about it,\" McCartney said.\n\nIn 2009, designer Azzedine Ala\u00efa and model Naomi Campbell dropped out of the Met Gala after his work wasn't included in the exhibit.\n\nWhen you think about models as muses, Naomi Campbell's relationship with designer Azzedine Ala\u00efa instantly comes to mind. The two shared a close friendship that lasted over three decades, and Campbell even referred to the designer as \"Papa\" due to his contributions throughout her life.\n\nSo, you can imagine the duo's surprise when Ala\u00efa's work was excluded from 2009's Met Gala exhibition, \"The Model as Muse: Embodying Fashion.\"\n\nAla\u00efa had made seven dresses for the occasion but asked models not to wear them after learning of his exclusion. He told The New York Times in 2009, \"It would have been silly to have seven girls wearing my dresses at the party and not have anything of mine in the exhibit\" and said Wintour had \"too much power\" over the museum.\n\nCampbell stood by Ala\u00efa and chose not to go entirely.\n\nA spokeswoman for Campbell told The Times, \"As Naomi has been a muse of Azzedine Ala\u00efa for 23 years, she feels she doesn't want to attend unless she can represent his work.\"\n\nTen years ago, Solange Knowles attacked Jay-Z in the elevator at a Met Gala after-party.\n\nIn 2014, TMZ released footage of Solange hitting and kicking Jay-Z in an elevator at a Met Gala after-party before being restrained by security.\n\nThe family released a joint statement to the Associated Press 10 days later, acknowledging the \"great deal of speculation about what triggered the unfortunate incident,\" but said \"the most important thing is that our family has worked through it.\"\n\nThe incident, though, has reportedly been referenced several times in music released by Beyonc\u00e9 and Jay-Z in the years since.\n\nFor example, in a 2014 remix of \"Flawless\" featuring Nicki Minaj from Beyonc\u00e9's self-titled album, she sings, \"Of course, sometimes s -- t go down / When it's a billion dollars on the elevator.\"\n\nJay-Z also appeared to take responsibility for his actions in the song \"Kill Jay-Z\" from his 2017 album, \"4:44,\" where he raps, \"You egged Solange on / Knowin' it all along / All you had to say you was wrong.\"\n\nMost recently, People reported that fans have speculated that Beyonc\u00e9's lyrics on \"Cozy\" from her 2022 album \"Renaissance\" might also be in connection to Solange's actions from 2014, as she sings, \"Might I suggest you don't f -- with my sis.\"\n\nRihanna had to \"choreograph\" her entrance to the 2015 Met Gala because of her gown's large train, which in turn became a meme.\n\nRihanna is one of the Met Gala's standout attendees, thanks in large part to her consistent commitment to the theme.\n\nIn 2015, she wore a yellow gown designed by Chinese designer Guo Pei to celebrate the Met's \"China: Through the Looking Glass\" exhibit.\n\nIn an appearance on \"The Graham Norton Show\" in 2018, Rihanna said she had to \"choreograph\" her arrival on the red carpet because of the size and weight of the garment.\n\nRather than getting into her limo with the dress on, she said it actually had to be put in the car first. She then got dressed in the limo with the help of six people who also assisted her out of the car and up the Met's stairs.\n\nWhile some celebrities were criticized for cultural appropriation and insensitivity, Rihanna's look was hailed as one of the best of the night. It even became a memorable meme with fans likening the round train to things like pizzas and omelets.\n\nTaylor Swift fans believe the songs \"Getaway Car\" and \"Dress\" were both inspired by her 2016 Met Gala appearance.\n\nThe star's strikingly different appearance wasn't the only memorable moment from 2016's Met Gala. Swift, who was in a relationship with DJ Calvin Harris, turned heads with her dance-off with actor Tom Hiddleston.\n\nSwift and Harris broke up the following month and she was seen with Hiddleston in Rhode Island shortly after. What's more, Swift also reportedly met actor Joe Alwyn, whom she later dated for six years, at the same event.\n\nFans suspect these interactions helped inspire songs like \"Dress\" and \"Getaway Car\" from her 2017 album, \"Reputation.\"\n\nOn \"Getaway Car,\" Swift appears to reference Hiddleston by singing, \"You were drivin' the getaway car/We were flyin', but we'd never get far/Don't pretend it's such a mystery/Think about the place where you first met me.\"\n\nZendaya said her Joan of Arc look from 2018 is one of her \"all-time favorite Met looks.\"\n\nZendaya's Met Gala looks are always memorable, but the metallic Versace dress from 2018 is particularly iconic.\n\nIn a 2024 interview for Vogue's \"Life in Looks\" series, Zendaya said her outfit at the \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination\" Met Gala was one of her \"all-time favorite Met looks.\"\n\n\"It was so heavy because of the beading, but it was so beautifully constructed, and it's Versace,\" she said. \"And typically, you know, I can handle a night out with my heels and everything -- I've been wearing heels for a long time -- but I don't know, it was something about a mixture of like wearing these platforms and like the heaviness of my dress, I was struggling.\"\n\n\"But it was all worth it,\" she added.\n\nIn 2019, Lady Gaga performed a 16-minute entrance routine involving four different looks.\n\nThe theme that year was \"Camp: Notes on Fashion.\"\n\nIn collaboration with designer Brandon Maxwell, Gaga and her team created a 16-minute entrance routine that highlighted four unique looks. The routine ended with the singer wearing a black sparkly bra-and-underwear set inspired by her early days performing.\n\n\"Me wearing fishnets and a bra and panty playing piano onstage, this to me was camp because it harkens back to cabaret,\" Gaga told Vogue in a behind-the-scenes video captured for 2019's Met Gala. \"Camp becomes camp over time, so for my last reveal to be something -- that is something -- that I did 10 years ago or even more, it's campy now,\" she said.\n\nMaxwell added, \"I also love the idea of being at the Met, at this event that's all about the clothes, with, you know, no clothes on.\"\n\nBlake Lively arguably wore one of the best dresses in Met Gala history to 2022's \"In America: An Anthology of Fashion\" event.\n\nBlake Lively's 2022 Met Gala look was \"an homage to New York City\" and its iconic architecture. She told Vogue livestream host La La Anthony that her Versace gown was inspired by the Empire State Building, the Statue of Liberty, and Grand Central Terminal.\n\n\"My crown has seven spikes because the Statue of Liberty, she has seven spikes representing the seven seas and the seven continents, which represents inclusivity, welcomeness, and freedom. So, I thought that was sweet,\" she said.\n\nDetermined to leave no detail unaccounted for, the actor also asked jewelry designer Lorraine Schwartz to include 25 stones on the crown to match the statue's 25 windows.\n\nAnd, of course, for the grand finale, a bronze-colored bow at her waist unraveled to reveal the dress' turquoise-blue train, replicating the oxidation of the New York City landmark.", "source": {"uri": "yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dior", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": {"uri": "2024-05-346787429", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:27:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:27:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:16:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://inews.co.uk/news/met-gala-2024-time-theme-guests-watch-3043007", "title": "Met Gala 2024: Time, theme, guest list and how to watch", "body": "The annual black-tie fundraiser at the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute in New York will kick off tonight providing one of the world's most spectacular red carpet events\n\nIt's the first Monday in May, which can mean only one thing for celebrities and fashionistas alike: the Met Gala.\n\nThe annual black-tie event at the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute in Manhattan is always the hottest ticket in town and provides mere mortals with a glimpse into a world where fame and wealth collide with art and fashion to create one of the planet's most spectacular red carpets.\n\nGuests are encouraged to dress to a theme and the more extravagant the costume, the better.\n\nVogue's Anna Wintour organises the entire event, which is a huge fundraiser for the Met's Costume Institute. Last year, it raised about $22m for the department.\n\nThis year, tickets were reported to be selling for $75,000, up by 50 per cent on last year's price, so it is expected to be an opportunity no one will want to waste.\n\nWhen is the 2024 Met Gala?\n\nThe Met Gala, also known as The Costume Institute Benefit, takes place annually on the first Monday in May and marks the opening of The Costume Institute's spring exhibition.\n\nThis year's will happen on Monday, 6 May, at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, with guests arriving from 6pm (local time)\n\nWhat is this year's theme?\n\nThe title of the Costume Institute's spring exhibition for 2024 is Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nHowever, the forthcoming show is not a reference to the Brothers Grimm or Disney, but a celebration of clothing and fashion so fragile it can no longer be worn, hence the term 'sleeping beauties' from the archives of the institute.\n\nAbout 250 pieces from the institute's permanent collection, spanning four centuries - including some garments rarely seen in public and so delicate they need to be under glass - will be on view.\n\nThey will be visually united by images related to nature, which will serve as a metaphor for the fragility and fleeting nature of fashion.\n\nThe exhibition opens to the public on Friday and runs until 2 September.\n\nEach year there is also a dress code for the ball tied to the museum's exhibition.\n\nThis year's theme is \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by Empire of the Sun author J.G. Ballard's 1962 short story of the same name.\n\nIt tells of a Count Axel and his wife, the Countess, who live in a villa with a terrace that overlooks a garden of crystalline flowers. Beyond the walls of the villa, a mob draws nearer every hour.\n\nTo restore tranquility, the Count must pluck a time-reversing flower from his garden until there are none left.\n\nEssentially, the theme relates to ephemeral beauty.\n\nWho is on the guest list?\n\nRapper Bad Bunny, actors Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez and Zendaya, and Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour will serve as co-chairs for the evening as up to 400 guests turn up.\n\nAmong those reported to be attending this year are model Gisele B\u00fcndchen, singer Olivia Rodrigo, and actors Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson, Cara Delevingne, and Barry Keoghan.\n\nSinger Rihanna and actress Blake Lively are known to always make notable entrances and at least one member of the Kardashian-Jenner family is usually in attendance.\n\nAll the action will also be on US television network E! from 6 pm (local time), with livestreams on X, TikTok, Instagram and Peacock.\n\nHowever, only the event's renowned red carpet is watchable.\n\nOnce celebrities make their way up the Met steps and into the museum, the gala's cocktail hour and dinner become private events.", "source": {"uri": "inews.co.uk", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8113539966", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "09:50:07", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T09:50:07Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T09:49:47Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://www.rnz.co.nz/news/world/516135/when-is-the-met-gala-what-s-the-theme-who-is-going", "title": "When is the Met Gala? What's the theme? Who is going?", "body": "It is arguably one of the biggest fashion events of the year, with designers showing off some of their boldest designs using the biggest pop culture figures as models.\n\nHere's what to expect.\n\nOn paper, the Met Gala is a fundraising dinner for the Costume Institute of the Metropolitan Museum of Art (better known as the MET) in New York City.\n\nIt coincides with the opening of a new exhibition in the gallery.\n\nBut it's essentially a big fashion event where celebrities dress up in elaborate outfits.\n\nIt's run by Vogue, the major international fashion magazine.\n\nThe event itself is private, with a strict no-phone and no-social-media policy.\n\nBut the guests' journey between being dropped off to entering the building is extremely public, with hordes of photographers capturing the arrivals.\n\nIt's not like your usual Hollywood awards night red carpet - the outfits tend to be pretty outlandish.\n\nCelebrities typically team up with fashion houses to create a look that fits into the dress code, which changes every year.\n\nIt's almost a competition for who can be the most creative and extra, except there are no awards.\n\nThe Met Gala is held on the first Monday of May each year.\n\nThis year, that falls on 6 May.\n\nIt'll be Tuesday morning in Australia when the guests start arriving in New York.\n\nWe'll be covering the whole thing, with a live blog kicking off tomorrow morning so you can follow along as the stars arrive and the memes take over the internet.\n\nAnd we'll have a mega-wrap of the looks for you to scroll through a little later in the day.\n\nThe magazine will be broadcasting it on its website, as well as over YouTube and TikTok.\n\nThe guest list is secret up until the night before the Met Gala, Vogue magazine says.\n\nBut we know for sure that these four big names are coming:\n\nZendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth ... because they're hosting the event this year alongside Vogue editor Anna Wintour.\n\nWe also know that Gwendoline Christie, La La Anthony and Ashley Graham will be there because they're co-hosting the red carpet coverage for Vogue.\n\nAbout 450 guests go each year, with many of them being key pop culture figures - think actors, musicians, models, fashion designers, athletes and even politicians.\n\nThe magazine is being tight-lipped about who is going this year but hints that it'll be a star-studded event.\n\n\"Some of the biggest names in the business regularly attend- from Beyonc\u00e9 and Gigi Hadid to Madonna and Rihanna,\" its website says.\n\nThe theme for this year's exhibition is Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\n\"The forthcoming show has not to do with the Brothers Grimm or Disney,\" the magazine says.\n\n\"But rather the celebration of clothing and fashion so fragile that it can't ever be worn again - and are thus sleeping beauties in the scrupulous archives of the Costume Institute.\"\n\nThe official dress code for the Met Gala is The Garden of Time.\n\nThe magazine says the dress code was inspired by a short story by J G Ballard - which was called The Garden of Time.\n\nIt's about a count and countess who live in a grand villa, which is being threatened by an encroaching mob.\n\nHere's how the story was summarised in a BBC article from 2012:\n\n\"The garden contains crystalline flowers at the tops of whose stems are goblet-shaped blossoms, which when snapped from the stem, drain the garden of time and motion.\n\n\"Each evening the count snaps off one of the time flowers.\n\n\"As he carries the crystal blossom onto the terrace, the menacing rabble retreats and he and his wife are safe for another day.\n\n\"But the stems no longer bear fruit, the flowers are being used up, and the count realises that time could not be stopped forever.\"\n\nThe theme is for the exhibition, the dress code is for the event.\n\nHowever, we're expecting the two to blend.\n\nAnd, as always, we're expecting obscure interpretations of the dress code to manifest in some fabulously ridiculous outfits.\n\nIn the past few years, we've seen iconic fashion moments from Zendaya, Cardi B, Blake Lively, Rihanna, Kim Kardashian, Kylie Jenner, Lady Gaga ... the list goes on.\n\nHere are some of the looks we've been treated to in the past:", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "2024-05-346612886", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:35:18", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:35:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:33:16Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5490196347236633, "url": "https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20240506-showbiz-elite-descend-on-manhattan-for-met-gala", "title": "Showbiz elite descend on Manhattan for Met Gala", "body": "New York (AFP) - The entertainment world hits the red carpet Monday for the annual Met Gala, New York's party of the year that hosts a parade of superstars donning their most extravagant looks.\n\nZendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth will join Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour to host the so-called Oscars of the East Coast, which is a mammoth fundraiser for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute.\n\nThe extravaganza's dress code this year is \"The Garden of Time\" -- which draws inspiration from the 1962 short story of the same name written by English writer J.G. Ballard, and is in essence about the ephemeral nature of beauty.\n\nThe theme parallels the exhibit \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which focuses on the most fragile pieces of the Costume Institute's vast collection.\n\nThe show, which will be on view to the public from May 10 through September 2, features clothing so delicate it cannot be displayed on mannequins.\n\nCelebrity interpretation of the dress code is anyone's guess, but vintage couture will likely reign.\n\nZendaya's look is among the most highly anticipated: the 27-year-old has become a red carpet icon during her most recent movie press tours, with cyborg fits for \"Dune: Part Two\" and courtside chic for the tennis-themed \"Challengers.\"\n\nShe hasn't attended a Met Gala since 2019, so her return is sure to turn heads.\n\nThe Costume Institute relies on the blockbuster Met Gala to fund its work, including exhibitions and acquisitions.\n\nThe gala was first held in 1948 and for decades was reserved for New York high society.\n\nWintour, the high priestess of fashion, took over the show in the 1990s, transforming the party into a catwalk for the rich and famous.\n\nThis year, a ticket costs a cool $75,000, with tables starting at $350,000. The 2023 gala -- which celebrated the late Karl Lagerfeld -- raised nearly $22 million, a record sum.\n\nSocial media frenzy\n\nThe spectacle is social media catnip for celebrity watchers -- and once again, both the gala and the exhibit are co-sponsored by TikTok.\n\nThe tech world will join luminaries of music, film, politics and sports on the carpet, with TikTok CEO Shou Chew, also an honorary co-chair, expected to attend.\n\nBut the 41-year-old's appearance comes as the future of TikTok in the United States teeters on thin ice, just after President Joe Biden signed a bill demanding that ByteDance -- the Chinese company behind the wildly popular video-sharing app -- sell it off or go dark stateside.\n\nPreparation for this year's Met Gala also included turmoil within, as workers at Conde Nast -which publishes Vogue, The New Yorker and Vanity Fair, among other titles - threatened to walk off the job on the fete's eve as they bargained for a new contract.\n\nWintour was the public face of worker ire: in addition to heading Vogue, she is Conde Nast's global chief content officer, overseeing all publications worldwide.\n\nContract negotiations between the union and management dragged on for months, as the company meanwhile vowed to lay off scores of employees. It has already let some go, as it consolidates, sells or closes some of its publications.\n\nEarly Monday, the union announced a deal including a higher salary floor and just severance for those on the layoff list, saying its mobilization ahead of the gala had \"moved the company.\"\n\nStars will begin arriving at the event at about 5:30 pm (2130 GMT), and the style parade run until approximately 8:00 pm.\n\nBut stars with the most clout -- ahem, Rihanna -- live by their own clocks.\n\nMore than once, the 36-year-old Barbadian mogul has arrived so late that other guests were already leaving, on their way to the just-as-buzzy afterparties.", "source": {"uri": "france24.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "France 24"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Met_Gala", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Met Gala"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Wintour", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Anna Wintour"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dress_code", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Dress code"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_carpet", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Red carpet"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zendaya", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Zendaya"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City", "type": "loc", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TikTok", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "TikTok"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "J. {"uri": "2024-05-346691277", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:46:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:46:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:32:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.545098066329956, "url": "https://www.kulr8.com/news/national/showbiz-elite-descend-on-manhattan-for-met-gala/article_6a541a57-6489-5ecb-b8d7-a6928f65a0bd.html", "title": "Showbiz elite descend on Manhattan for Met Gala", "body": "Unionized staff at Conde Nast are seen during a January 2024 walkout amid layoff announcements -- a deal was announced hours before the Met Gala\n\nThe entertainment world hits the red carpet Monday for the annual Met Gala, New York's party of the year that hosts a parade of superstars donning their most extravagant looks.\n\nZendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth will join Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour to host the so-called Oscars of the East Coast, which is a mammoth fundraiser for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute.\n\nThe extravaganza's dress code this year is \"The Garden of Time\" -- which draws inspiration from the 1962 short story of the same name written by English writer J.G. Ballard, and is in essence about the ephemeral nature of beauty.\n\nThe theme parallels the exhibit \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which focuses on the most fragile pieces of the Costume Institute's vast collection.\n\nThe show, which will be on view to the public from May 10 through September 2, features clothing so delicate it cannot be displayed on mannequins.\n\nCelebrity interpretation of the dress code is anyone's guess, but vintage couture will likely reign.\n\nZendaya's look is among the most highly anticipated: the 27-year-old has become a red carpet icon during her most recent movie press tours, with cyborg fits for \"Dune: Part Two\" and courtside chic for the tennis-themed \"Challengers.\"\n\nShe hasn't attended a Met Gala since 2019, so her return is sure to turn heads.\n\nThe Costume Institute relies on the blockbuster Met Gala to fund its work, including exhibitions and acquisitions.\n\nThe gala was first held in 1948 and for decades was reserved for New York high society.\n\nWintour, the high priestess of fashion, took over the show in the 1990s, transforming the party into a catwalk for the rich and famous.\n\nThis year, a ticket costs a cool $75,000, with tables starting at $350,000. The 2023 gala -- which celebrated the late Karl Lagerfeld -- raised nearly $22 million, a record sum.\n\n- Social media frenzy -\n\nThe spectacle is social media catnip for celebrity watchers -- and once again, both the gala and the exhibit are co-sponsored by TikTok.\n\nThe tech world will join luminaries of music, film, politics and sports on the carpet, with TikTok CEO Shou Chew, also an honorary co-chair, expected to attend.\n\nBut the 41-year-old's appearance comes as the future of TikTok in the United States teeters on thin ice, just after President Joe Biden signed a bill demanding that ByteDance -- the Chinese company behind the wildly popular video-sharing app -- sell it off or go dark stateside.\n\nPreparation for this year's Met Gala also included turmoil within, as workers at Conde Nast -which publishes Vogue, The New Yorker and Vanity Fair, among other titles - threatened to walk off the job on the fete's eve as they bargained for a new contract.\n\nWintour was the public face of worker ire: in addition to heading Vogue, she is Conde Nast's global chief content officer, overseeing all publications worldwide.\n\nContract negotiations between the union and management dragged on for months, as the company meanwhile vowed to lay off scores of employees. It has already let some go, as it consolidates, sells or closes some of its publications.\n\nEarly Monday, the union announced a deal including a higher salary floor and just severance for those on the layoff list, saying its mobilization ahead of the gala had \"moved the company.\"\n\nStars will begin arriving at the event at about 5:30 pm (2130 GMT), and the style parade run until approximately 8:00 pm.\n\nBut stars with the most clout -- ahem, Rihanna -- live by their own clocks.\n\nMore than once, the 36-year-old Barbadian mogul has arrived so late that other guests were already leaving, on their way to the just-as-buzzy afterparties.\n\nmdo/sst\n\nMore from this section\n\nA look at commencement ceremonies as US campuses are roiled by protests over the Israel-Hamas {"uri": "8114362682", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:43:22", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:43:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:42:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.545098066329956, "url": "https://www.businessinsider.com/guides/streaming/where-to-watch-met-gala-live-stream-2024", "title": "Where to watch Met Gala live stream: See the 2024 red carpet entrances", "body": "When you buy through our links, Business Insider may earn an affiliate commission. Learn more\n\nThe first Monday of May is here, which means that it's officially time for the 2024 Met Gala. We've compiled everything you need to know about the event, including who will be in attendance and where to watch a free Met Gala red carpet live stream.\n\nHosted annually by Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour and a slew of high-ranking cultural figures, the Met Gala has become one of the season's glitziest and most exclusive events, often referred to as the Fashion Oscars. Tickets to the event reportedly go for about $30,000 a piece, and that's only after you've been invited by Wintour.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" with a \"The Garden of Time\" dress code. Attendees dress to impress and often interpret the themed dress code in creative ways. Memorable past themes include 2018's \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination\" and 2019's \"Camp: Notes on Fashion,\" both of which received their fair share of criticism and attention.\n\nWe've got you covered if you're hoping to catch a glimpse of the Met Gala. Keep reading to learn everything you need to know about tuning in. Plus, we have details on who you can expect to see tonight (and which global pop star might be missing).\n\nThe Met Gala will live stream exclusively through Vogue. Starting at 6 p.m. ET, the fashion magazine will stream the red-carpet arrivals. You can catch the live stream through Vogue's YouTube and TikTok accounts, as well as through the publication's website itself. The red carpet typically lasts for several hours (with most guests arriving by 8 p.m. ET, but some A-listers get there even later). No live streams or public coverage are available for the famously secretive event itself, which is held inside the Met.\n\nGwendoline Christine, La La Anthony, and Ashley Graham will host this year's live stream. Influencer-turned-coffee-mogul Emma Chamberlain will return as Vogue's special correspondent, who will be tasked with interviewing the celebs as they arrive.\n\nE! will also be covering the event starting at 6 p.m. ET. Ross Mathews will conduct interviews for the network. If you don't have cable, you can live stream E! via live TV packages like Sling TV and Hulu + Live TV. For Sling TV you'll need to select Sling Blue to access E!, which is available for $40 a month (with $20 off your first month). Hulu + Live TV costs $76.99 a month and comes with a three-day free trial. Plus, you'll get Disney+, ESPN+, and regular Hulu bundled in.\n\nVogue's website, YouTube, and TikTok will also be your live streaming answer in several other countries, including the UK. It will be a bit later in England, but the bulk of the action is expected to take place from 11 p.m. BST to 1 a.m. BST (6 p.m. ET to 8 p.m. ET), so you can probably catch the action before bed.\n\nYou should be able to access these live streams from anywhere, but if you're traveling and, for some reason, unable to access these options, you can always try setting a VPN to a US location and streaming it that way. Our go-to pick is ExpressVPN, a beginner-friendly option with a 30-day money-back guarantee. You can check out our ExpressVPN review for full details.\n\nPeople are very curious as to whether Taylor Swift will make an appearance at the Met Gala. Previously a frequent flyer at the event, Swift hasn't attended since the semi-infamous 2016 gala. While conflicting reports have emerged on Swift's possible 2024 attendance, People reports that they've confirmed that Swift won't attend this year. This would have been a tight fit, considering that the European leg of the Eras Tour picks up on May 9 in France.\n\nWhile Swift likely won't be there, several other A-listers will be in attendance. In addition to Anna Wintour, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, and Bad Bunny will co-chair the evening. Other potential attendees could be hosts and sponsors, including Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew. While the guest list is famously kept tightly under wraps, you can usually expect to see at least a few members of the Kardashian-Jenner family. It's an invitation-only extravaganza, and the guest list is a closely guarded secret.\n\nThe gala is an annual event, but this year there may be more than the usual crowd of photographers and celebrity spotters outside. Cond Union, which represents workers at Vogue, the fashion magazine run by Anna Wintour, who has been the brains behind the Gala for 25 years, and other Cond Nast publications threatened to go public. {"uri": "8114099930", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:03:42", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:03:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:02:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5411764979362488, "url": "https://exbulletin.com/fashion/2687753/", "title": "Met Gala 2024: everything we know about the theme, hosts and guests - ExBulletin", "body": "Fashion's biggest night, held annually at New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art on the first Monday in May, is both an ever-changing spectacle and a carefully crafted event. A parade of stars dress in the theme inspired by the Costume Institute's latest exhibit (some more than others) and walk up the steps to the museum before disappearing inside to enjoy the galleries, dinner, and drinks.\n\nThe Met Gala is Monday night and it's time to bet: What stunning archival piece will Zendaya wear? Who will pull off the weirdest stunt, Jared Letos' twin or Doja Cats' feline prosthetics? Inside, which celebrities will flout the no-photo rule to sneak in bathroom selfies? What time will Rihanna arrive?\n\nThis year's red carpet theme is The Garden of Time, referencing a 1962 short story of the same name by British author JG Ballard. Like the New Wave sci-fi story set in a garden of time-changing flowers, the museum's exhibition, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, highlights the connections between nature and technology, using AI, CGI and other tools to breathe new life into it. hundreds of fragile archive pieces spanning hundreds of years. The theme is chosen each year by Andrew Bolton, curator in charge of the Costume Institute.\n\nExpect fantasy fashion with floral and sci-fi designs on the red carpet, and stylists working with luxury houses to revive older famous looks. The first celebrities to appear will be Gala co-chairs Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth, the last of whom is making his Met Gala debut.\n\nA frenzy of arrivals and A-list photographs, the red carpet portion of the evenings lasts a few hours, but it's the only part the public sees. Inside, guests tour the exhibition, which opens to the public in the days following the gala, and dine seated. Phones at the table are discouraged, and the seating chart is carefully crafted by Anna Wintour, editor-in-chief of American Vogue, who has organized the gala since 1995. (Wintour has final say on every guest in attendance; The New York Times previously reported .)\n\nAlthough the red carpet and afterparties get the most attention of the evening, the gala is primarily a fundraiser, with five-figure tickets bringing in millions of dollars for the museum each year, setting a record at nearly $22 million in 2023, according to the recently published book Fashions Big Night Out.\n\nThe conceptual theme is expected to be a change of pace from last year, when the dress code was to honor the late fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld, who died in 2019. Over the decades, tributes to the legacies of individual designers have included Rei Kawakubo. , Charles James, Christian Dior, Alexander McQueen and Gianni Versace, the latter two planned shortly after the designers' untimely deaths.\n\nTo celebrate Lagerfeld, celebrities like Anne Hathaway, Nicole Kidman and Jenna Ortega flocked to the event in creations from Chanel, Fendi and Chlo, where he left his indelible mark, but some also paid a cheeky tribute to pussy by Lagerfeld, Choupette (hence Doja Cats). mustachioed beauty look). However, not everyone was happy with the theme honoring the controversial designer, given his history of making disparaging remarks about women's bodies and his refusal to advocate for more inclusive beauty standards.\n\nThe Met Gala debuted in 1948 as a fundraiser for the new Costume Institute, organized by fashion journalist Eleanor Lambert. Tickets for the banquet would cost $50 each.\n\nOver the decades, the gala has grown from an industry party at off-site venues like Manhattan's Rainbow Room to a high-profile phenomenon. In the 1970s, Vogue editor-in-chief Diana Vreeland made the gala the opening night of the Institute's major exhibitions and invited the cr\u00e8me de la cr\u00e8me of the world of fashion and new society. Yorkie. Wintour, her successor, favored A-list musicians, actors and entertainment figures, making the gala one of the most-watched events on the fashion calendar and of the year. In 2023, software company LaunchMetrics discovered that the Met Gala generated nearly double the media impact value for brands than Super Bowl, at $995 million.\n\nThe first theme was The World of Balenciaga in 1973, linked to a retrospective of the fashion designer Cristbal Balenciaga; the event featured guests including Halston and Calvin Klein, according to Fashions Big Night Out.\n\nEarly themes included romantic and glamorous Hollywood design, the glory of Russian costume and the 18th century woman. But gala attendees mostly stuck to conventional evening wear until the 2000s, when some guests began having more fun with themes and the Internet made it easier to monitor arrivals. The most memorable themes of the past decade include China: Through the Looking Glass, Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination and The Divide: Notes on Fashion from Celebrities such as Beyonc\u00e9, Lady Gaga, Rihanna, Zendaya and the Kardashian-Jenners. , who take advantage of the red carpet to put on a show.\n\nEvery year, rumors swirl about who might be persona non grata at the gala, whether due to offense to the event or to Wintour herself. But the Vogue editor-in-chief only spoke explicitly about one guest she would never invite in public. Donald Trump, which she mentioned on James Cordens' late-night talk show in 2017 when asked to name names.\n\nHowever, other previous guests have vowed to drop out, including Demi Lovato, Zayn Malik and Tina Fey. In 2015, five years after making an appearance at the event, Fey said on the Late Show with David Letterman that the gala was a parade of assholes.\n\nIf you had a million arms, all the people you wanted to hit in the entire world would all be there, she says. I mean, I was there, clearly I was one of them.\n\nSome celebrities, however, are backtracking. Gwyneth Paltrow famous called the Met Gala was no fun in 2013 and declared it would never come again, but returned in 2017 (and 2019).\n\nMet Gala guests often broke the no-social-media rule to give a more candid insight into who's hanging out with who and what's going on behind closed doors. In 2017, that included smoking, as attendees including Bella Hadid and Dakota Johnson lit cigarettes in the museum's restrooms (to the anger of museum donors, reportedly).\n\nDespite what Jason Derulo meme would have you believe, neither he nor anyone else fell down the stairs. But some guests grumbled that this year marks the tenth anniversary of the infamous elevator brawl between Jay-Z and Solange.\n\nOne last misstep? Wear the same outfit, of course. So that it makes reported While Wintour not only curates the guest list but also participates in their fashion choices, last year Olivia Wilde and Vogue China editor-in-chief Margaret Zhang showed up in the same Chlo violin dress in different combinations of colors. The couple took it in stride, sharing memes on social media about the accident. Great minds, Wilde wrote on Instagram. This year's co-chairs are Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth, and Jennifer Lopez.\n\nThis year, the Met Gala will celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" The Met's Marina Kellen French Director and CEO explained the meaning behind the exhibition:\n\nThe Met's innovative spring 2024 Costume Institute exhibition will push the boundaries of our imagination and invite us to experience the multisensory facets of a garment. 'Sleeping Beauties' will heighten our engagement with these masterpieces of fashion by evoking how they feel, move, sound, smell, and interact when being worn, ultimately offering a deeper appreciation of the integrity, beauty, and artistic brilliance of the works on display.\n\nThis year's 2024 Met Gala dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" so named for J.G. Ballard's 1962 same-named short story. We can expect some flowy florals (groundbreaking!) along with some interesting nature-inspired styles. \"It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,\" Andrew Bolton, the {"uri": "8114244918", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:57:45", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:57:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:57:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5372549295425415, "url": "https://www.themarysue.com/met-gala-guest-list-2024-kpop-guests-rumored-to-appear/", "title": "Should we Get Ready For a K-Pop Takeover of This Year's Met Gala?", "body": "It's the first Monday in May, and that means one thing and one thing only -- the Met Gala. The fashion world is converging on New York to get ready for one of its biggest nights -- the annual fundraising event in favor of the Costume Institute of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, famously organized by Vogue.\n\nAnd then there's everyone on social media, anxiously waiting to give their opinions on the looks sported by the many high-profile celebrities in attendance -- all while wearing their comfiest loungewear or pajamas, as one should for any and all big red carpet events -- and whether or not they have honored the year's theme.\n\nThe theme this year is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" to celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition of the same name, and the official dress code is \"The Garden of Time.\" So hopefully, stylists have managed to pull out every single striking archive piece they could get their hands on. And now that the anticipated strike announced by the union of Cond\u00e9 Nast workers has seemingly been averted with a tentative deal between representatives of the union and Cond\u00e9 Nast itself, everything seems to be ready to go.\n\nOnly two questions remain, really -- who are the celebrities attending? And among those celebrities, will there be any K-Pop idols like in the previous years? Let's see what info we have at the moment.\n\nAmong the most hotly rumored attendees are Ros\u00e9 and Jennie of BLACKPINK, one of the biggest girl groups in the entire K-Pop scene. Both idols have already made their Met Gala debut -- Ros\u00e9 in 2021, the first female idol to so do, and Jennie in 2023 -- and are pretty big ambassadors in the world of fashion, tied to the Yves Saint Laurent and Chanel brands respectively.\n\nIt only makes sense for fans to speculate that they're finally gonna walk up the Met steps in 2024, especially since they have been spotted in New York together. Then again, Ros\u00e9 did post a pretty cryptic Instagram story with the caption \"Bye NY, until next time\" on Sunday evening, so we'll just have to wait and see once the Met Gala actually starts.\n\nThere's a third BLACKPINK member currently stateside and that's the youngest of the group, the main dancer Lisa. She attended the Miami F1 Grand Prix on Sunday, so it's not a stretch to think she might make an appearance in New York this evening. She's also the ambassador of several high-end brands, particularly Celine, so her attendance would very much be justified.\n\nAll eight members of the boy group Stray Kids, one of the most famous currently active on the scene, could also be gearing up to attend this evening's fashion event. In an Instagram live recorded at the beginning of May, member Seungmin stated that the group was getting ready for it, going through several fittings and other preparations.\n\nJust like BLACKPINK, Stray Kids also has a place in the wider fashion industry. The entire group was the Asian ambassador for Tommy Hilfiger in 2023, and members Hyunjin and Felix were chosen as the global ambassador for Versace and the house ambassador for Louis Vuitton, respectively. We'll have to see if all the rumors are true and if the entire group will really make its Met Gala debut tonight.\n\nThere have been several other K-Pop idols who have attended the Met Gala over the years, ever since PSY became the very first South Korean singer to attend the event back in 2013 -- together with Super Junior's Siwon. The 2023 edition saw Jackson Wang of GOT7 among the attendees, alongside Jennie, while Johnny of NCT made his Met Gala debut in 2022 and the iconic soloist CL -- formerly of 2NE1 -- graced the steps of the Met back in 2021. Going even further back, EXO's Lay was in attendance in 2019 and soloist Rain made his appearance in 2015.\n\nI guess there's nothing else to do but see if any of them return to the Met Gala or if any new face will appear in this year's \"Garden of Time.\" I personally will be refreshing the hashtags over on X (formerly Twitter) as soon as the clock strikes 6 PM EST, the scheduled start time for {"uri": "8113659688", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:07:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:07:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:07:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5333333611488342, "url": "https://www.nbcboston.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/the-2024-met-gala-garden-of-time-theme-and-dress-code-explained/3360379/", "title": "What is the 2024 Met Gala dress code?", "body": "\"This innovative show will push the boundaries of our imagination,\" museum CEO Max Hollein said in November, per Vogue. \"And invite us to experience many facets of a work, to learn more about its history, and, ultimately, to gain a deeper appreciation of its beauty.\"\n\nBut before celebrities show off their flower power, keep reading to get the inside details about the 2024 Met Gala.\n\nCelebs Who've Never Been to the Met Gala\n\nThis year's Met Gala celebrates the Costume Institute's new exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nHowever, this isn't a Disney princess reimagining. It's about honoring clothes that are so fragile, they can never be worn again. Thus, these diaphanous fabrics and one-of-a-kind constructions are considered \"sleeping beauties\" in the archives of the museum.\n\nAs Andrew Bolton, the head curator of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, told Vogue, \"It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion.\"\n\nThe exhibition will also have three main zones that emphasize the Earth's elements: Land, Sea and Sky.\n\nThe fashion extravaganza has been inspired by everything from legendary designers to religion and futurism. But this year's Met Gala pays homage to the 1962 short story, \"The Garden of Time,\" written by author J.G. Ballard.\n\nThe book follows Count Axel and his wife, who listen to Mozart in their beautiful villa that's surrounded by a garden of crystal flowers. But outside their gilded cage, is an angry mob that nears their place of solitude. To keep the army at bay, Axel must turn back time by plucking his flowers, one by one, until there is nothing left.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala dress code is \"The Garden of Time,\" which plays off of J.G.'s short story title. While the theme can be interpreted in various ways, it's likely we'll see creations inspired by plants, flowers and other botanicals.\n\nFlorals? For spring? Why, yes, it will be groundbreaking at the Met Gala.\n\nAccording to the MET, the show will feature approximately 250 garments and accessories all connected visually through nature.\n\nSo, expect to be transported, as the exhibit includes several sensory capabilities, like smelling hats with floral notes or touching walls embossed with embroidered fabrics. And prepare to gaze upon the \"illusion technique known as Pepper's ghost,\" the museum website states, which will display how the \"hobble skirt\" restricted women's strides in the early 20th century.\n\nAll in all, the exhibit will span over 400 years of fashion history and showcase designs by Schiaparelli, Dior, Givenchy and others. And the pieces that are too fragile to ever be worn again -- such as a Charles Frederick Worth gown from 1877 -- will be viewed through \"animation, light projection, AI, CGI and other forms of sensory stimulation,\" the museum website reads.\n\n\"By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses,\" Andrew said in a press release, \"the show aims to reconnect with the works on display as they were originally intended -- with vibrancy, with dynamism, and ultimately with life.\"", "source": {"uri": "nbcboston.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "NBC Boston"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Met_Gala", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Met Gala"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vogue_(magazine)", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Vogue (magazine)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Museum", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Museum"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Hollein", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Max Hollein"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "J. {"uri": "8113768034", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "12:19:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T12:19:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T12:18:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.529411792755127, "url": "https://www.vogue.com/live/met-gala-live-updates-2024", "title": "Met Gala 2024 Live Updates: Red Carpet Coverage, News & Highlights", "body": "Every year the Met Gala brings together an incredible crowd of fashion designers, models, and the brightest stars of music and film in celebration of the Costume Institute's latest exhibition. \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" is this year's show, and it draws from the Costume Institute's own permanent collection to highlight the multi-sensory experience of wearing clothes. \"Fashion is one of the most emotional artistic forms because of its connection to the body,\" Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, explained in a recent interview. \"It is imbued with memory and emotions, and we relate to it very much via our senses. One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.\"\n\nOn the red carpet, it is co-chairs Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, and Chris Hemsworth -- all of whom can be frequently found on best-dressed lists -- that will be setting the tone for the evening. This year's dress code, \"The Garden of Time,\" promises a myriad of interpretations, which are sure to yield many looks that surprise and delight. {"uri": "8113643366", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:01:06", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:01:06Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T10:57:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.529411792755127, "url": "https://keyt.com/lifestyle/entertainment/cnn-style/2024/05/06/2024-met-gala-everything-to-know-about-fashions-annual-soiree/", "title": "2024 Met Gala: Everything to know about fashion's annual soiree", "body": "(CNN) -- Fashion's biggest night out -- hosted at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York each year on the first Monday of May -- is both a forever-evolving spectacle and a carefully crafted event. A parade of A-Listers dress according to the theme inspired by the Costume Institute's latest exhibition (some more than others) and walk the steps up to the museum before disappearing inside to enjoy the galleries, dinner and drinks.\n\nThe Met Gala is taking place on Monday night and it's time to place your bets: Which showstopping archival piece will Zendaya wear? Who will pull off the most uncanny stunt, topping Jared Leto's \"twin\" or Doja Cat's feline prosthetics? Inside, which celebs will flout the no-photos rule to sneak bathroom selfies? How late will Rihanna show up?\n\nThis year, the theme for the red carpet is \"The Garden of Time,\" referencing a 1962 short story of the same name by British author J.G. Ballard. Like the New Wave sci-fi story, which takes place in a garden of time-bending florals, the museum's exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" highlights connections between nature and technology, using AI, CGI and other tools to breathe new life into hundreds of fragile archival pieces spanning hundreds of years. The theme is chosen each year by Andrew Bolton, curator-in-charge at the Costume Institute.\n\nExpect fantastical fashion with floral and sci-fi motifs on the red carpet, and stylists working with luxury houses to resurface famous older looks. The first celebrities to appear will be Gala co-chairs Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth, the last of whom is making his Met Gala debut.\n\nA frenzy of A-List arrivals and photographs, the red carpet portion of the evening's proceedings last for a few hours, but that's the only part the public sees. Inside, guests tour the exhibition, which opens to the public in the days following the gala, and have a seated dinner. Phones at the table are discouraged, and the seating chart is carefully crafted by American Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour, who has organized the gala since 1995. (Wintour has \"final say\" over every guest in attendance, the New York Times has previously reported.)\n\nThough the red-carpet and afterparties get the most attention of the night, the gala is above all, a fundraiser, whose five-figure tickets raise millions of dollars for the museum each year -- setting a record at nearly $22 million in 2023, according to the recently-released book \"Fashion's Big Night Out.\"\n\nThe conceptual theme is expected to be a change of pace from last year, when the dress code was set to honor the late fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld, who died in 2019. Over the decades, tributes to the legacies of individual designers have included Rei Kawakubo, Charles James, Christian Dior, Alexander McQueen and Gianni Versace, with the last two scheduled shortly after the designers' untimely deaths.\n\nTo celebrate Lagerfeld, celebrities including Anne Hathaway, Nicole Kidman and Jenna Ortega flocked to the event in designs by Chanel, Fendi and Chlo\u00e9, where he left his indelible mark, but some paid a cheeky tribute to Lagerfeld's cat Choupette as well (hence Doja Cat's whiskered beauty look). Not all were pleased with the theme to honor the controversial designer, however, given his history of disparaging remarks about women's bodies and his refusal to champion more inclusive beauty standards.\n\nThe Met Gala debuted in 1948 as a fundraiser for the nascent Costume Institute, organized by fashion publicist Eleanor Lambert. Tickets for the banquet reportedly cost $50 each.\n\nOver the decades, the gala has transformed from an industry fete at off-site locations like Manhattan's Rainbow Room into an A-List phenomenon. In the 1970s, Vogue editor Diana Vreeland positioned the gala as the opening soiree of the Institute's major exhibitions and invited the cr\u00e8me de la cr\u00e8me of the fashion world and New York society. Wintour, her successor, has favored high-profile musicians, actors and entertainment figures, turning the gala into one of the most-watched events of the fashion calendar -- and the year. In 2023, the software company LaunchMetrics found that the Met Gala generated nearly double the \"media impact value\" for brands than the Super Bowl, at $995 million.\n\nThe first theme was \"The World of Balenciaga\" in 1973, tied to a retrospective of the couturier Crist\u00f3bal Balenciaga; the event was attended by guests including Halston and Calvin Klein, according to \"Fashion's Big Night Out.\"\n\nEarly themes included \"Romantic and Glamorous Hollywood Design,\" \"The Glory of Russian Costume,\" and \"The 18th-Century Woman.\" But gala-goers mostly kept to conventional eveningwear until the 2000s, when some guests began to have more fun with the themes -- and the internet allowed more eyes on the arrivals. The most memorable themes from the past decade have included \"China: Through the Looking Glass,\" \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination\" and the divisive \"Camp: Notes on Fashion\" thanks to celebrities including Beyonc\u00e9, Lady Gaga, Rihanna, Zendaya and the Kardashian-Jenners, who use the red carpet to put on a show.\n\nEach year rumors fly about who may be persona non grata at the gala, whether due to any offense towards the event or Wintour herself. But the Vogue editor has only explicitly spoken about one guest she would \"never invite back\" in public -- Donald Trump, whom she mentioned on James Corden's late night talk show in 2017 when asked to name names.\n\nOther previous guests have sworn it off, however, including Demi Lovato, Zayn Malik and Tina Fey. In 2015, five years after she made an appearance at the event, Fey said on \"Late Show with David Letterman\" that the gala is a \"jerk parade.\"\n\n\"If you had a million arms, all the people you would want to punch in the whole world -- they're all there,\" she said. \"I mean I was there, clearly I was one of them.\"\n\nSome celebrities backtrack, however. Gwyneth Paltrow famously called the Met Gala \"un-fun\" in 2013 and said she'd \"never\" go again, but returned in 2017 (and 2019).\n\nMet Gala guests have often broken the no-social-media rule to give a more candid glimpse of who is hanging with who and what goes on behind closed doors. In 2017, that included smoking, as attendees including Bella Hadid and Dakota Johnson lit up cigarettes in the museum bathroom (to the ire of the museum's donors, reportedly).\n\nDespite what the Jason Derulo meme would have you believe, he -- nor anyone else -- has taken a tumble down the stairs. But some guests have famously rumbled -- this year marks ten years since the infamous after-party elevator fight between Jay-Z and Solange.\n\nA final faux pas? Wearing the same outfit, of course. While it's been reported that Wintour not only arranges the guest list but also has a hand in their fashion choices, last year, Olivia Wilde and departing \"Vogue China\" editor Margaret Zhang showed up in the same throwback Chlo\u00e9 violin dress in different color schemes. The pair took it in stride, sharing memes on social media about the accident. \"Great minds,\" Wilde wrote on Instagram. \"If you're gonna twin with anyone, make it @margaretzhang.\"\n\nThe-CNN-Wire\n\n\u2122 & \u00a9 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.", "source": {"uri": "keyt.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "NewsChannel 3-12"}, "authors": [{"uri": "cnn_newsource@keyt.com", "name": "Cnn Newsource", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_carpet", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Red carpet"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zendaya", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Zendaya"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fashion", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Fashion"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doja_Cat", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Doja Cat"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Wintour", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Anna Wintour"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cat", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Cat"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science_fiction", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Science fiction"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City", "type": "loc", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Bolton_(curator)", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Andrew Bolton (curator)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "J. {"uri": "8114362679", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:44:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:44:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:42:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5215686559677124, "url": "https://www.businessinsider.com/met-gala-tickets-cost-2024-5", "title": "Met Gala tickets, which are invite-only, cost $75,000. Here's what that gets attendees.", "body": "One of the most intriguing qualities of the Met Gala is its exclusivity.\n\nEach year, the guest list is approved by Vogue editor in chief Anna Wintour, but attendance isn't based solely on an invitation -- there's also a hefty entry fee.\n\nTime reported that individual tickets for 2024's Met Gala, which is a fundraiser for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute, cost $75,000, up from $50,000 in 2023. Tables start at $350,000.\n\nTables are usually purchased by design houses, brands, or companies, which then choose who they'd like to invite to the table, which requires approval from Wintour, too.\n\nSo, while only a select group of elite individuals experience the grandeur of the Met Gala, the rest of us are left to wonder what that actually entails.\n\nOf course, there's the famed red carpet and the over-the-top fashion, but here's a peek inside the Met's walls to see the cocktails, menus, exhibits, and exclusive performances attendees get to witness.", "source": {"uri":
