{"uri": "8113296911", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "07:02:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T07:02:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T07:02:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5215686559677124, "url": "https://www.elle.com.au/culture/how-celebrities-get-ready-met-gala-26987/", "title": "Here's What It *Actually* Takes For Celebrities To Prepare For The Met Gala, According To A Stylist", "body": "Celebrities are known for pulling out all the red stops when it comes to nailing a red carpet occasion and creating a memorable look, but the Met Gala? That's a whole different ballgame.\n\nA far cry from your average event, the Gala calls for hair, makeup, theatrics, optics and much, much more. It's not enough to arrive in a dress, every single detail, right down to the last thread has to be carefully thought out, which can take months, if not the entire year, to plan.\n\nIf you've ever wondered what exactly goes into Met Gala prep, read on to discover how stars get ready for the big night.\n\nFrom LED therapy to intense facials, celebrities spare no expense on their skin in the leadup to the Met. Preparation actually starts months before the big night, with many keeping their skin specialists on speed dial to ensure a clear, glowing complexion.\n\nIv\u00e1n Pol is said skin specialist for many A-listers, including Kate Hudson, Zo\u00eb Kravitz and Karlie Kloss who all attend his exclusive skin spa prior to hitting the red carpet. His signature treatment, known as 'The Beauty Sandwich', is known for smoothing skin texture and helping with wrinkle reduction and tightening. Using radio frequency, the treatment provides a much-needed refreshing to have skin shimmering before stepping in front of the cameras.\n\nHailey Bieber is a fan of Dr. Barbara Sturm's Instant Glow Facial, which is said to include 'cleansing, exfoliation, extraction and a lymphatic and firming massage.\n\nWinnie Harlow and Adut Akech have both paid visits to Soma Spa to receive the 24k Gold Facial & Oxygen HydraFacial which promises to suck impurities from the skin while locking in moisture.\n\nCelebrity facialist Joanna Vargas has hosted the likes of Lili Reinhart and Constance Wu, who opted for the Supernova Facial and Triple Crown Facial -- a hydrating, exfoliating treatment offering microdermabrasion, face contouring and hydration.\n\nAccording to celebrity stylist, Jordan Foster, who has worked on several Met Galas (including Ashley Graham's 2019 look), says that outfit preparation starts well in advance of the event itself.\n\n\"The ideal preparation for the Met Gala starts weeks, if not months, before the event. However, as everyone knows, Anna Wintour approves each guest and often who they are attending with. This decision sometimes isn't made until much closer to the event, which means time to scramble and figure it out. Even when you have weeks to plan, things still usually come together at the last minute in the days leading up to the Met Gala and you're usually still perfecting things as the celebrity is getting out of the car to walk the red carpet. It's like the Oscars times 100,\" she told ELLE Australia.\n\nAs for how involved each celebrity is in their final look, it comes down to personal choice, but they put a lot of trust in their stylist.\n\n\"A celebrity can be as involved or uninvolved as they want in choosing and designing their Met Gala looks,\" Jordan explained. \"Celebrities, for the most part though, hire stylists to spearhead the project and put their trust in them. It's usually the stylist who is liaising with the designer or brands and guiding the client through the process. If a celebrity is attending with a designer and that designer is making them a custom look, then generally that designer will have a vision and you trust them on it. The stylist can make tweaks and usually accessorise as they see fit. It's a true collaborative effort. Just as with any other event, celebrities just want to look their best, feel their best, and hopefully have a look that is loved by all!\"\n\n\"It's definitely important for celebrities to stick to the theme in my opinion. Sometimes the theme can be more challenging in terms of interpretation and in those cases you at the very least give a nod to the theme with hair/makeup or accessories,\" stylist Jordan Foster added.\n\n\"In my experience, I've never had a theme completely dictate the look except for in 2019 when I styled Ashley Graham who wore a custom Dapper Dan look and attended with him. We really went with the theme in every way possible for that look. The theme should be respected though in my opinion. Hundreds of people work on the Met Gala and a lot of thought goes into the theme and the exhibition that is part of it. People often forget the Gala is a charity event to raise money for the Metropolitan Museum which is home to the yearly fashion exhibition the theme of the gala is tied to. \"\n\n\"Preparation for the Met Gala on the day of starts in the morning and a 16 hour day can go by in what feels like one hour,\" Jordan explained. \"Don't forget that celebrities also attend after parties and the looks for that are just as important to the team. So you are prepping for two looks, not just one.\n\n\"Often a celebrity is borrowing jewellery worth hundreds of thousands or even millions of dollars and those pieces cannot be borrowed any longer than the event itself. Last minute decisions on shoes and bag are often left to the day of as well. Hair and makeup begins in the early afternoon and any last minute alterations are being done the same day. In 2019, for Ashley Graham's Met Gala look we had someone gluing rhinestones to her tights and gloves and another person sewing her into her dress literally as she was trying to walk out the door. The day is complete chaos but it's so fun and so incredibly satisfying when you see the celebrity walking the red carpet.\"\n\nMost artists will create a mood board which they'll go over with their celebrity, working together to create a look that they're both happy with. On the night, depending on how intense the end result is, it can take anywhere between 1-3 hours to create the finished look. Beauty is usually a secondary feature to the fashion, which is arguably the main event, but sometimes hair and makeup has the ability to steal the show -- it just depends what look they're going for.\n\nMany celebrities have a go-to stylist whom they trust, and they're understandably the go-to for Met Gala looks. Kim Kardashian always has Mario Dedivanovic around for major events, while Nina Park and Kelsey Deenihan are in high demand from the A-listers, too.", "source": {"uri": "elle.com.au", "dataType": Remember, she looked like Cinderella!\n\nThough Zendaya has attended the Met Gala five times over her career, she has never been to the event with her longtime boyfriend, Tom Holland.\n\nActually, Tom Holland has never been to the Met Gala ever! So, seeing as his girlfriend is hosting, 2024 would seem like the perfect time for him to make his debut.\n\nExcept it's very unlikely it will happen. Don't worry, it's not because they've broken up.\n\nYou see, the Met Gala always takes place on the first Monday in May. In 2024, that means Monday May 6.\n\nStarting this spring, Tom Holland will star as Romeo in Jamie Lloyd's new production of Romeo and Juliet at the Duke of York's Theatre in London.\n\nTickets for the production sold out within minutes, as fans are dying to see Tom act up close and in person.\n\nThe production runs from May 11 to August 3, meaning his opening night is 5 days before the Met Gala.\n\nNow, is it physically possible for him to do both? Of course! A flight from London to NYC is 6-7 hours. Nothing like flying from Tokyo to Las Vegas. (Right Taylor Swift?!)\n\nBut will his schedule allow? That's the real question.\n\nIt would be a real shame to miss a beautiful night, but our spidey senses are suggesting he won't have the time to get away.\n\nBesides, he's got a lot of eyes on him for this show - and not just fans!\n\nFrancesca Amewudah-Rivers, Tom's costar in Jamie Lloyd's West End production of Romeo & Juliet, faced a barrage of racial abuse following her casting announcement.\n\nInitially, Tom was put under intense scrutiny for not personally and publicly denouncing the hatred shown to his Juliet. {"uri": "8113954865", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:21:15", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:21:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:20:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5176470875740051, "url": "https://www.nationalgeographic.com/culture/article/met-gala-costume-institute-fashion", "title": "A short history of the Met Gala and its iconic looks", "body": "The Met Gala has raised more than $223.5 million for The Costume Institute since 1999, under the leadership of Anna Wintour (seen here wearing a John Galliano dress at the gala in 1996.)\n\nSince it started in 1948, the Met Gala has delivered boundary-pushing fashion modeled by celebrities and cultural icons, from rock stars to activists. The star-studded event generates millions of dollars for the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute.\n\n\"Fashion's biggest night\" is hosted annually on the first Monday in May. It began as a fundraiser for the newly-founded institute, with tickets at only $50. Instead of modeling looks on the museum's famous steps and partying in the Temple of Dendur as they do today, attendees were hosted at famous New York City venues including the Waldorf Astoria and Central Park for the first 20 years of the event.\n\nStars are dressed by designers according to a theme tied to that year's exhibition at the Costume Institute. The dress code for 2024 is \"The Garden of Time,\" while the exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" uses technology to examine garments and accessories spanning four centuries.", {"uri": "8113662924", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:09:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:09:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:09:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5098039507865906, "url": "https://www.news9live.com/entertainment/hollywood/met-gala-2024-why-are-phones-cameras-banned-inside-the-fashion-event-2525691", "title": "Why are phones and cameras not allowed at MET Gala?", "body": "New Delhi: One of the most anticipated nights in the fashion world, the 2024 Met Gala is set to kick off on Monday (May 6). The theme for this year is 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion'. With approximately 250 rare items from the permanent collection on display, this year's event promises to be a visual feast for fashion enthusiasts.\n\nReportedly, Hollywood royalties including Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Jennifer Lopez, and Chris Hemsworth will lead the charge as co-chairs, ensuring the red carpet shines as bright as ever. While the excitement builds for this star-studded affair, there's one rule attendees must adhere to: No mobile phones allowed inside.\n\nBut why the ban on phones at the Met Gala? The answer lies in a 2015 decision aimed at curbing excessive social media use during the event. A notice sent to all guests made it clear: \"The use of phones for photography and social media will not be permitted inside the gala.\" This rule was enforced to maintain the event's exclusivity. However, it has seen its fair share of flouting, with Kylie Jenner sneaking in a bathroom selfie back in 2017.\n\nHowever, phone restrictions aren't the only rules guests must follow to stay in the good graces of Vogue's Anna Wintour. Entry is restricted to those below 18 years of age, smoking is a no-go inside the museum, and food items featuring onion, garlic, or parsley are off the menu. Seating arrangements are also strictly enforced to ensure the night runs smoothly.\n\nAs celebrities from the world of film, fashion, music, sports, social media, and politics ascend the iconic steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, they'll be embracing the theme, 'The Garden of Time' for the evening's dress code. {"uri": "8113649784", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:01:41", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:01:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:01:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5058823823928833, "url": "https://www.cbsnews.com/news/what-happens-at-the-met-gala/", "title": "Here's what happens inside the Met Gala after the red carpet", "body": "On May 6, 2024, the Metropolitan Museum of Art will host its famous Met Gala to raise funds for The Costume Institute. The event will also kick off the latest costume exhibition titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" with \"The Garden of Time\" as the dress code.\n\nThe institute was renovated in 2014 as the Anna Wintour Costume Center with the help of the Vogue editor-in-chief whose name is at its doors. A trustee of the Met, Wintour has spent decades growing the gala into what the museum calls one of the \"most visible and successful charity events in the world.\"\n\n\"It was a society event. People weren't very excited about going to it,\" Wintour recounted to \"CBS Mornings\" co-host Gayle King in 2023. \"To take it over and try to make a night out of it was quite intimidating.\"\n\nThe Met Gala is a fundraiser that brings together some of the biggest names in the most famed industries. Guests flock to New York City on the first Monday in May to show off collaborations with famous designers and brands on looks that take months to make.\n\n\"The Met Gala, it has always had one mission, and that is to raise money for the important work,\" Wintour said.\n\nGuests follow a yearly theme and work to reference historic garments, incorporate innovative ideas and execute intricate concepts that resonate beyond the walls of the Met.\n\n\"We are always interested in trying to reflect a cultural moment and what we feel is happening at the world in any given time,\" Wintour said about the invitees.\n\n\"Every year is different and we try and curate the guest list in a way that makes sense for whatever the theme of the exhibition is,\" Wintour said.\n\nIt's been the setting of notable and much-discussed pop culture highlights, from Rihanna's 2015 arrival in a lengthy Chinese cape, to Lady Gaga's multi-faceted reveals at the 2019 Camp-themed gala. Within the last decade, fashion nerds, critics and consumers review the red carpet with keen precision to understand, through photos and videos, the efforts -- and at times, mistakes -- that go into preparing for the event.\n\nThough many have walked the steps into the museum and visited its exhibits, very few have done so wearing the finest pieces to party and spend thousands (sometimes millions) among titans in film, sports, business, music and society. That rarified allure is what draws many to follow and dissect the gala.\n\nHanan Besovic, the post-pandemic viral voice behind Instagram's @ideservecouture, will have a seat adjacent to the action. He will join a handful of influencers at the Mark Hotel -- where many gala-goers prep and primp for the event -- on the day of the gala in the Upper East Side, five blocks from the Met.\n\nThere, Besovic will watch the arrivals and make social content alongside a room of other fashion-obsessed creators hosted by Meta.\n\nAs the hotel's guests exit their temporary lair at the Mark after spending hours on hair, makeup and styling, they exit to a crowd of fans and press awaiting a first glimpse of their attire, before it's time to line up by the museum's steps.\n\n\"Everybody has one minute of our attention and then there's the next person,\" Besovic said.\n\nUsually, the first to show up are the event chairs. This year Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth and Jennifer Lopez co-chair with Anna Wintour.\n\nOne by one, celebrities are carefully shuffled through the carpeted steps of the Met, where thousands of global outlets standby to photograph and record every angle. The seamless choreography is seen by what Vogue says is millions via its viral streams.\n\nWhat happens next is what fuels the most intrigue. In a vast contrast to what goes on outside, most of what occurs inside of the Met is not recorded.\n\n\"Those tickets are crazy expensive. The brands buy out tables,\" Besovic said.\n\nIt's widely known the night includes a dinner and a performance. Cher, Rihanna, Madonna and Lady Gaga have performed in years past, among the world's most coveted art and notable artists.\n\nVogue is usually the only publication with the inside scoop. In 2023, they previewed the gala's dinner portion, guided by what they say was one of Karl Lagerfeld's most famous gatherings: Paloma Picasso's wedding reception.\n\nThose dishes look dainty, colorful and healthy in Vogue's images, featuring chilled spring pea soup and \u014cra King salmon served on vintage plates with an assortment of fruit and vegetables for last year's attendees.\n\n\"The only snippets that we get are from social media,\" Besovic says about the event's exclusivity.\n\nViral bathroom videos and selfies taken by celebrities are the only view inside. Katie Perry rushing back into her campy burger outfit for the 2019 gala after running into Jennifer Lopez near the stalls. The Kardashians posing with Paris Jackson and a gaggle of supermodels. Lil Nas X, Erykah Badu and Jack Harlow posing for a picture. Or, celebs post elevator videos, such as the viral moment with Reese Witherspoon chatting with Cara Delevingne, Zooey Deschanel and Kate Upton. These end up being the only glimpses inside the gala to scroll through before common folk hit the hay.\n\nAs the gala ends, guests rush to the after-parties, many of whom bounce around New York City all night long. The Standard Hotel's \"Boom Boom Room\" usually hosts A-listers -- in 2023, singer and actress Janelle Mon\u00e1e was at the helm, according to Women's Wear Daily.\n\nBrands and designers also unleash more fashion moments during the after-parties.\n\nIn 2016, when model Karlie Kloss hit the town after the gala, American designer Brandon Maxwell adapted her outfit for the \"afters\" by cutting her structured gown into a mini. This year, designers Jean Paul Gaultier and Shayne Oliver will debut a capsule collection, featuring about 50 pieces in the collaboration.", "source": {"uri": "cbsnews.com", "dataType": "news", And you can bet that Kim Kardashian is going to be there, bringing the drama as per usual.\n\nKardashian has been attending, and turning heads, at the Met Gala since 2013, and each of her looks has made an imprint on my brain forever. From couch-like floral prints to latex sparklers, you can always count on the SKIMS mogul to get people talking.\n\nHer most recent appearances, however, have been the most controversial of all. ICYMI, Kardashian's 2022 dress went down in Met Gala infamy after she revived an archival Marilyn Monroe gown. The sequin-covered stunner sparked controversy, as many initially thought she damaged it at the event.\n\nThe following year, she traded sequins for pearls in a dramatic number that featured nearly 70,000 of the precious beads. The look inadvertently paid homage to her first Playboy magazine shoot -- another iconic throwback moment.\n\nThis year's Met Gala -- taking place on Monday, May 6 -- asks that guests come dressed for the theme \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" While the motif seems up for interpretation, Kardashian definitely knows how to \"awaken\" fashion -- or at least get the fashion group chats And he said, 'Well, what about 'Garden of Time?'\" she explained. \"So, I fear that we've unleashed a lot of confusion out there, and for which I deeply apologize.\"\n\nAs for what she thinks celebs will sport on the red carpet, Wintour told Bush Hager, 42, \"I imagine we'll see a lot of flowers.\" Wintour remained mum on whether she'll be sporting florals herself, teasing, \"Possibly.\"\n\nThis year's Met Gala celebrates the opening of the Costume Institute's \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibit. The night's official dress code is \"Garden of Time,\" fitting with the exhibit's collection of rare and historical fashion pieces.\n\n\"The idea of 'Sleeping Beauties' is taking these masterpieces from different periods, and because so many of them are very fragile, they are laid flat behind glass walls,\" Wintour shared on Today.\n\nWhile chatting with Bush Hager in the Costume Institute's restoration lab, Wintour gushed about this year's star-studded lineup of Met Gala cochairs. \"We have Jennifer Lopez. (Exclusive)", "body": "Speaking with PEOPLE the morning of the 2024 Met Gala, the 'Outer Banks' star also teases what fans can expect from the couple's debut looks\n\nScoring an exclusive invite to the Met Gala is a rite of passage for many stars. The Super Bowl of style hosts the hottest celebrities from across all industries, and many spend months planning what they will wear for their moment in the spotlight on the Metropolitan Museum of Art's iconic steps.\n\nWhen actor Chase Stokes found out he was going to be on this year's exclusive guest list, he was on a wholesome date with his girlfriend, country star Kelsea Ballerini.\n\n\"This is actually a crazy story,\" the Outer Banks star, 31, tells PEOPLE exclusively ahead of his big debut at the 2024 Met Gala on May 6.\n\n\"I had just flown from Morocco to Atlanta to do re-shoots for a movie with Netflix. It was a 26-hour travel day. I worked all day and then I had the next morning to do something. I was on the way to the aquarium with my girlfriend and we got the call. I was like, 'Oh my God, we're going to the Met.'\"\n\nHe adds that receiving the news was a \"very wild moment, but nonetheless, one that I will never, ever forget.\"\n\nRelated: 'Sleeping Beauties': The 2024 Met Gala Theme Explained -- and How Stars Will Interpret the Dress Code\n\nSpeaking of the \"Heartfirst\" singer, Stokes says he and Ballerini, who confirmed her Met Gala debut on Instagram Monday morning, have \"f--king awesome looks\" that are \"very individual,\" represent both their personalities and overall mesh well together. \"I think what we like to do is just complement versus coordinate,\" he says.\n\nAs for his look, Stokes can't say too much before the red carpet reveal, which he's doing in partnership with Motorola and its Flip the Script campaign.\n\nHowever, he does tell PEOPLE that he will be wearing Michael Kors. \"We had our final fitting last night. We hung out with Michael for a little while,\" Stokes says of spending time with the legendary designer.\n\nThis year's Met Gala dress code is \"The Garden of Time\" while the theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nRelated: The Best Met Gala Looks of All Time\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.\n\nStokes admits that he's a tad \"nervous\" about the night ahead, but he's keeping an open mind going in. \"It's one of those events where you just got to let the night take it and run with it. There's just this inevitability to it. I'm staying open and trying to see where it's going to go.\"\n\nFor the rest of the day, Stokes is making sure he has a \"good vibe\" going on. He's prepping with \"style tips, good music, good people and good experiences\" -- and lots of SZA's songs on his getting-ready playlist. (P.S. C'est la vie! The Met Gala is the most coveted fashion event of the year, and while A-listers like Zendaya and Bad Bunny work \ud83d\udc4f that \ud83d\udc4f red \ud83d\udc4f carpet \ud83d\udc4f in stunning archival pieces, others see it as an opportunity to make major announcements and debut their relationships on the Met Steps.\n\nThere's a chance we'll see some celeb couples step out together (yes, we are still holding out for a #BriGi hard launch, tysm), but the real question is: will they want to? Over the years, fans have noticed that certain celebs have broken up after making their red carpet debut at the event, and dubbed it the Met Gala Curse. No, seriously -- it's such a common occurrence that this gallery exists. So, what is the Met Gala Curse? Let's take a walk down memory lane and hope that none of our faves are affected. \ud83d\ude4f\n\nTo put it simply, the theoretical Met Gala Curse claims that once a celebrity couple makes their red carpet debut at the highly-coveted event, they end up calling it quits sometime after. {"uri": "8113725700", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "11:51:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T11:51:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T11:51:24Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4941176474094391, "url": "https://people.com/celebrity-couples-who-broke-up-after-met-gala-debuts-8641799", "title": "Is the Met Gala Cursed? 13 Couples Who Broke Up After Making Their Debut at the Event", "body": "Tabitha Parent is an editorial intern at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2024. Her work has previously appeared in The San Francisco Bay Times and The Daily Northwestern.\n\nThe Met Gala is a big night for the stars -- and not just because of the fashion.\n\nFrom on-the-carpet costume changes to engagement announcements and baby bump reveals, celebrities often use fashion's biggest night to make a statement -- sartorial or otherwise. And it's become one of the most important nights of the year for our favorite celebrities to reveal another thing that everyone is dying to know (besides who they're wearing): their relationship statuses.\n\nBut are celebrity couples who make their red carpet debut at the Met Gala doomed? It's possible: these 13 famous pairs made the Met Gala red carpet their first together, only to break up not long after.", "source": {"uri": "people.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "PEOPLE.com"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Daily_Northwestern", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "The Daily Northwestern"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internship", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Internship"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gala_(magazine)", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Gala (magazine)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco", "type": "loc", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "San Francisco"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "San Francisco"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tailor", "type": "wiki", "score": 2, "label": {"eng": "Tailor"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Met_Gala", "type": "wiki", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "Met Gala"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_carpet", "type": "wiki", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "Red carpet"}}], "categories": [{"uri": "dmoz/Society/Relationships", "label": "dmoz/Society/Relationships", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "news/Arts_and_Entertainment", "label": "news/Arts and Entertainment", "wgt": 74}], "image": "https://people.com/thmb/71WJimjL0o8O5qmOO8EfKcWra6Y=/1500x0/filters:no_upscale():max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():focal(524x209:526x211)/zayn-malik-gigi-hadid-met-gala-032423-f819b352407e4b57be6710bd6704bd34.jpg", "originalArticle": null, "storyUri": "eng-9541694", "eventUri": "eng-9541694", "location": null, "extractedDates": null, "sentiment": 0.05882352941176472, "wgt": 126, "relevance": 1}
{"uri": "8113528966", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "09:43:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T09:43:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T09:43:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4941176474094391, "url": "https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/most-controversial-outfits-met-gala-2024-b2540217.html", "title": "The most controversial outfits worn to the Met Gala", "body": "{{ #verifyErrors }}{{ message }}{{ /verifyErrors }}{{ ^verifyErrors }}Something went wrong. Please try again later{{ /verifyErrors }}\n\nThe Met Gala is \"fashion's biggest night out\" and Hollywood's greatest excuse to dress completely out of the ordinary. Standard accessories include floating heads, green babies, capes, and canes, while furry catsuits, spikey head wraps, and stiff sculpture-esque garments are the norm. Year after year, a look book of bizarre glamour unfolds on the red carpet between spurts of simple tuxedos and clean-cut gowns.\n\nHonouring the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute, the event is, of course, a display of opulence, gathering A-list elite and offering coveted invitations with a $50,000 price tag. But unlike the average black-tie gala, costumes and chaos are expected on the first Monday in May as the fashion emulates components of a brand-new spring exhibit - at least it's supposed to. In other words, a healthy serving of whimsical elegance is warranted so long as it is understood to be on theme and within dress code. But as the years have gone by, it's become overtly noticeable just how many attendees show up in void looks, making little attempts to dress in accordance with the motif.\n\nThis year, an ode to fashion's \"sleeping beauties\" will be paid with over 250 archive pieces, some dating back 400 years to the Elizabethan period, on display and reimagined through CGI, soundscaping, light projection, illusion techniques, and video animation. \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" will drive attention to the structural concepts of fragile pieces, emboldening the fragmented garments categorised under three main natural elements - land, sea, and sky.\n\nAccording to Vogue, invitees are meant to follow the dress code, \"The Garden of Time\" - telling the story of Count Axel, his countess, and their dwindling garden. From this, guests should know to represent fleeting beauty and refrain from wearing princess dress or pajama sets.\n\nUnfortunately, there'll likely be one (usually more than one) that'll ignore the memo and go rogue, donning a designer piece so far from the intention that it's pointless to even question their thought process.\n\nAs we ready ourselves to watch creativity and absurdity simultaneously spill out on the red carpet, speculation over who'll fall short of the mark swirls. Though the argument that every celebrity look worn to the Met Gala is subjected to criticisms and contrasting opinions, some've come out over the last 25 years that were undeniably a point of contention.\n\nHere are the most controversial and off-theme looks worn to the Met Gala over the years.\n\nKim Kardashian - 2022\n\nFor the 2022 Met Gala, \"In America: An Anthology of Fashion,\" guests were meant to pay homage to the gilded age. Finding inspiration in old Hollywood, Kim took a cue from icon Marilyn Monroe, donning the exact dress she wore when she sang \"Happy Birthday Mr President\" to John F Kennedy. The delicate nude gown, embelished with tiny jewels, had been on display inside Ripley's Believe It Or not in Orlando, Florida.\n\nKim plucked the token garmet and wore it to walk up the Met steps, prompting immediate controversy. People were angered by the Skims creator's decision to wear the actual dress, a piece that was already so fragile. Some claimed she tore the back of the dress until Ripley's confirmed the garment wasn't at all damaged.\n\nDoja Cat - 2023\n\nThe 2023 theme \"Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty\" sparked criticisms as soon as it was announced. A testament to the Chanel designer was disputed due to the sheer number of crude comments and conservative views Lagerfeld offered throughout his career. Doja Cat was one of the handful of celebrities who honoured Lagerfeld with a nod to his Birman cat, Choupette.\n\nThe \"Say So\" artist dressed in a custom Oscar de la Renta gown with more than 350,000 hand-embroidered silver beads. The dress had a hood and cat-like ears to match her makeup prosethetics designed to resemble Lagerfeld's furry friend. Not only did Doja Cat dress the part, she acted like a cat too, meowing instead of talking. Some viewers were put off by this entire facade, labelling it as the \"worst\" of the night.\n\nKylie Jenner - 2022\n\nJust six months after Off-White's creative director and founder Virgil Abloh suddenly passed away, Kylie Jenner honoured her close friend at the 2022 Met Gala. The dress code was \"Gilded Glamour,\" and the Sprinter founder wore the fall/winter 2022 finale Off-White couture wedding gown completed with an attached short sleeve T-shirt and a backward baseball hat fashioned on top of a veil.\n\nWhile Kylie's intention was to pay tribute to Abloh, wearing a design from his final collection, many questioned her for wearing the frilly-bottom gown. More specifically, critics were angered that she seemed to ignore the theme entirely knowing she could get away with it and still get invited back the next year.\n\nTaylor Swift - 2016\n\nThe Midnights performer has been criticised for her style choice on and off the red carpet for years. One of her most questionable ensembles, the custom Louis Vuitton dress for the 2016 Met Gala, majorly struck a cord with passionate fashion fans. For the \"Manus x Machina: Fashion in an Age of Technology\" theme, Swift tapped the French fashion house. The concept was centered around innovation, focusing on the future of the digital age and how it intersected with clothing design.\n\nSwift opted for an intergalactic metallic, three-tiered frill dress with leather wrap pumps. She decorated the look with a brand new bleach bob and purple lipstick. This would be a marker for the beginning of her Reputation era, and it wasn't well-received, with many divided on her \"Bleachella\" red carpet moment.\n\nFrank Ocean - 2021\n\nThe \"Ivy\" singer's 2021 Met Gala outfit has been deemed one of the most outrageous in the event's history. Ocean was accompanied by an unusual and unexpected accesory for the \"In America: A Lexicon of Fashion\" exhibit - a plastic neon green baby. His outfit was quite simple and understated, donning a black Prada suit and vest with a plain white shirt peaking out from underneath. However, Ocean channelled a whimisical nature by bringing a doll to match his green hair. With a theme that elicited expressions to American fashion, the artist's response was largely misunderstood.\n\nAmy Schumer - 2022\n\nOn the night meant to honour the beauty of fashion through the golden age in America, the comedian donned a conservative, all-black coat dress by Gabriela Hearst. While others dazzled in sparkly garments reminscent of classic cinema and old Manhattan, Schumer looked like she was protesting the dress code choosing a dark monochromatic outfit. Fans bashed the celebrity's look online, arguing she appeared like she was attending a \"funeral\" in the double-breasted jacket.\n\nKaty Perry - 2010\n\nThe 2010 Met Gala, \"American Woman: Fashioning a National Identity,\" celebrated a cultural shift in the country at the start of a new decade. Most attendees showed national spirit in red, white, and blue, but the \"Roar\" singer went off in a different direction. The vibrant artist chose to wear a multi-colour LED strapless gown designed by Cute Circuit with a geometric pink crystal statement necklace. Her motivation was to represent fearless women with the astonishing glow-up garment. However, critics claimed her look was too loosely connected to the theme.\n\nDan Levy - 2021\n\nThe Schitt's Creek star may not have upset the masses with a plastic baby accessory, but the TV actor wasn't a favourite from the 2021 Met Gala either. Levy stepped onto the cream-coloured carpet in a Jonathan Anderson original. He embodied the globe, donning ballooned puffer sleeps, a polo shirt with an embroidered queer couple kissing in the centre, and grid leggings. The ensemble was finished with what could only be described as \"Jane Birkini-fyed\" double buckle combat boots and a piece of literature in hand. Levy's look, bedazzled with Cartier diamonds, was an ode to the LGBTQ+ community in America. The powerful message spewed on the carpet in blue, green, and pink hues.\n\nSarah Jessica Parker - 2016\n\nAs Sex and the City's Carrie Bradshaw, Sarah Jessica Parker usually got away with wearing almost anything (emphasis on the almost). She's a model for fashion risk-takers in television and on the street, in and out of character. But Parker seemingly misinterpreted the dress code for the 2016 Met Gala, \"Manus x Machina: Fashion in an Age of Technology\".\n\nHer take on the digital age in white capris, a matching corset, and double-breasted gold button military jacket with pleated chiffon sleeve cuffs didn't translate. The entire look, an ode toHamilton, was by Laura Kim and Fernando Garcia. Their idea played on innovation in a non-technical sense: thought and fabrication. Parker decorated the all-white ensemble with a large gold pendant necklace and blue pumps that could've been easily mistaken for the cherised blue Manolos she wears to her courthouse wedding with Mr Big in SATC.\n\nJared Leto - 2022\n\nEvidently, every celebrity at the 2022 Met Gala had a different interpretation of oppulence in the golden age. The 52-year-old musician saw a double entendre in gilded glamour. Leto showed up to the Metropolitan Museum in a get-up that excited and upset viewers all at once. He wore a tweed tuxedo with stitched flower bouquets, pink bow ties, studded hair broach, dark shades, and a red clutch with a gold metal clasp. Next to him was no plastic accessory but a real life copy. Leto brought Gucci's then creative director, Alessandro Michele, as his twin for the night. He called it, \"Double Victorian Gilded Trouble\".", "source": {"uri": "independent.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Independent"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8114187122", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:09:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:09:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:09:03Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4901960790157318, "url": "https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/fashion/anna-wintour-met-gala-theme-b2540351.html", "title": "Anna Wintour apologises for 'confusion' over 2024 Met Gala theme", "body": "The Vogue editor spoke candidly about this year's fashion extravaganza during an interview with Today, which aired hours before this year's Met Gala. During her conversation with Jenna Bush Hager, Wintour explained the complications with the theme of the 2024 event, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" and the inspiration behind its dress code, \"The Garden of Time.\"\n\n\"This exhibition broke my cardinal rule,\" she said. \"When we came up with the title 'Sleeping Beauties,' it's wonderful and poetic and romantic, but actually, it could be many, many things.\"\n\nThe editor-in-chief of Vogue recalled that when establishing the theme, she turned to curator in charge of The Costume Institute, Andrew Bolton, for advice on what celebrities could wear. She also acknowledged that amid those conversations about outfits, the public was then confused about that dress code.\n\n\"I said, 'What are we gonna say to people to wear to this night?' And he said, 'Well, what about 'Garden of Time?'\" she explained. \"So, I fear that we've unleashed a lot of confusion out there, and for which I deeply apologise.\"\n\nShe then shared how she believes people will follow the dress code at the gala, adding: \"I imagine we'll see a lot of flowers.\" When Bush Hager asked her if she'd be wearing flowers, Wintour simply responded: \"Possibly.\"\n\nDuring her conversation with Bush Hager, the 74-year-old editor further detailed the theme of the event, infamously held the first Monday in May, which this year falls on 6 May.\n\nIn November, Vogue first announced the theme of The Costume Institute's 2024 exhibition as \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" The reveal was met with a myriad of confused individuals online, predicting a display of designer jammies on the red carpet for the famed opening as well as a parade of princesses on the museum steps thinking \"Sleeping Beauties\" was a reference to the classic Disney animation. Yet, neither are correct.\n\nAccording to Bolton, the entire exhibit is centered around 50 historical garments, latent and so fragile they can never be worn again - the \"sleeping beauties\" of the exhibit. The main motivating piece was a Charles Frederick Worth original, an 1877 silk satin ball gown. Each delicate piece, some no longer in their true form, will be reimagined inside innovative casings made to bring the garments back to life.\n\n\"The idea of 'Sleeping Beauties' is taking these masterpieces from different periods, and because so many of them are very fragile, they are laid flat behind glass walls,\" Wintour said.\n\nRegarding what to wear, Met Gala guests must follow a dress code that resembles fleeting beauty. Of course, attendees can embrace the obvious by wearing florals -- or even real life flowers -- to represent an actual garden. For this option, Vogue recommended looking at the \"Sleeping Beauties\" exhibition itself, which has a black evening coat by Charles Frederick Worth from 1889 on display. Another motif in the Met Gala's \"The Garden of Time\" dress code is time, or the passing of it. Attendees could consider wearing items featuring clocks, such as Moschino's grandfather clock gown from Fall 2022.\n\nThe co-chairs for tonight's fashion extravaganza include Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny, while Vogue's red-carpet hosts will be La La Anthony, Gwendoline Christie, and Ashley Graham, alongside special correspondent Emma Chamberlain. Additionally, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson, Cara Delevingne, and Olivia Rodrigo are rumoured to be at the gala, according to a 13 April Page Six report.", "source": (The showing will include approximately 250 garments and accessories spanning over four centuries -- including archival pieces by Dior, Givenchy, Schiaparelli, and Saint Laurent.) After telling Vogue in April that she was \"still deciding\" on her look this year, Lopez -- who has attended the Met more than a dozen times -- dished about tonight's outfit on Good Morning America earlier today.\n\n\"You'll have to tune in to see,\" Lopez coyly said of her ensemble. \"But it's exciting, it's exciting. It's a fun night for fashion.\" Host Lara Spencer then asked Lopez if she'll \"be able to walk in your look,\" to which Lopez responded \"Barely, ever. The Met Gala looks are not about comfort.\"\n\nLopez said of co-chairing the event that \"I was really honored to be asked to host it alongside Zendaya and Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth,\" she said. \"Anna was gracious enough to ask me. We're going to have a good time.\" She added of the event that \"It's always a nice time there. It's such an interesting mix of artists and businesspeople. It's not just music or film, it's everybody -- fashion, film, music, business -- and you get to have some really interesting interactions.\"\n\nLast year, Lopez wore a Ralph Lauren midriff-baring halter gown and pink satin skirt; no word yet on who is dressing her tonight. \"I'm also one of those people who chooses at the last minute,\" she told Vogue last month. \"Like, I like choices, and then I go, 'Okay, this is how I feel today.' {"uri": "8114072875", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "15:43:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T15:43:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T15:43:24Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4901960790157318, "url": "https://www.mid-day.com/celebrity-life/fashion-and-beauty/article/met-gala-2024-from-donald-trump-to-demi-lovato-celebs-banned-23347814", "title": "Met Gala 2024: From Donald Trump to Demi Lovato - celebs who have been banned, or just don't wish to attend", "body": "A certain chunk of celebs have been banned from entering the elite premises of MET Gala, while others have shared their resentment openly.\n\nAs the world eagerly anticipates the forthcoming Met Gala, fashion enthusiasts are gearing up for what promises to be a spectacle of style, creativity, and cultural resonance. The Met Gala, renowned as the pinnacle of fashion events, annually brings together the creme de la creme of the entertainment, fashion, and art worlds under one roof. With each iteration, the Gala encapsulates a theme that serves as a canvas for designers and attendees to unleash their sartorial imagination. That being said, a certain chunk of celebs have been banned from entering the elite premises, while others have shared their resentment openly. Here's a list of celebs who have been cancelled or simply won't show up.\n\nThe former US president was a frequent at the Met Gala. It was also where he proposed to his wife Melania Trump. However, when Anna Wintour appeared on The Late Show with James Corden, she confirmed that she would never invite Trump to the event again, confirming that he was banned for real.\n\nTim Gunn\n\nAuthor and fashion presenter Tim Gunn confirmed that he was banned in a 2016 interview with E! Entertainment's Fashion Police. He said, \"I was asked what is the most unforgettable thing I've ever seen in fashion and I said, 'It's easy. It was watching Anna Wintour being carried down five flights of stairs by two bodyguards -- two big hulking men -- from a fashion show.' All hell broke loose. It was insane. We've had an open war ever since.\"\n\nAmerican actor Lili Reinhart, known for portraying Betty Cooper in the series 'Riverdale' has been vocal about promoting body positivity. She missed the invitation to the 2023 Met Gala despite attending it in 2018, 2019, and 2021. This was because she slammed Kim Kardashian's extreme diet to fit into Marilyn Monroe's gown which the reality TV star wore in 2022.\n\nJosh Hartnett\n\n'Pearl Harbour' actor Josh Hartnett was rejected from the event for being irrelevant. A 2016 documentary featuring behind the scenes of the Met showed Calvin Klein asking to dress Josh and having him on his table, a Vogue employee was heard remarking, \"What has he done lately? Nothing. You guys are all set.\"\n\nFormer One Direction star Zayn Malik attended the Met in 2016 with his then-girlfriend Gigi Hadid. Two years later when he was asked if he'd make an appearance again, Zayn told GQ, \"Now it's not something I would go to, I'd rather be sitting at my house doing something productive than dressing up in really expensive clothes and being photographed on a red carpet...to do the self-indulgent 'look at me, I'm amazing' thing on the red carpet, it's not me.\"\n\nAmy Schumer\n\nActor-comedian Amy Schumer may have not been banned but she was very opinionated on what she thought of the fashion extravaganza. In an interview with Howard Stern in 2016, she said, \"It's people doing an impression of having a conversation. I don't like the farce...We're dressed up like a bunch of f***ing assholes. I don't like it. I have no interest in fashion...I don't care.\"\n\nSinger Demi Lovato who went to the Met Gala in 2016 spoke about the experience two years later in an interview with Billboard. They said, \"I had a terrible experience. This one celebrity was a complete bitch and was miserable to be around. It was very cliquey. {"uri": "8113843577", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:08:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:08:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:08:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4823529422283173, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/mark-hotel-where-biggest-celebrities-130000612.html", "title": "All About The Mark Hotel, Where the Biggest Celebrities Get Glam for the Met Gala", "body": "\"As the day progresses, the intensity is palpable,\" The Mark's General Manger Etienne Haro tells PEOPLE of the hours leading up to the star's Met Gala departures\n\nIf there's one hotel synonymous with the Met Gala, it's The Mark.\n\nThe five-star hotel located on New York City's Upper East Side draws a slew of stars to its suites to primp and prep for the biggest night in fashion held on the first Monday in May in each year.\n\nConveniently located just four blocks away from the Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Mark has served as a luxurious space for celebrities, designers and their glam squads to perfect their looks prior to hitting the museum's famed steps and heading inside to the Anna Wintour-hosted ball.\n\nThis year's no different! Etienne Haro, general manager of The Mark, tells PEOPLE exclusively that they're expecting around 60 celebrity guests on May 6 in addition to their respective talent and glam teams. Previous guests on Met Gala day include Cardi B, Kendall and Kylie Jenner, Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade and Gigi Hadid.\n\n\"The Mark is booked out well ahead of Met Gala day,\" he says, noting that the hotel's sales team starts \"receiving enquiries from the moment the annual theme is revealed.\" (The Met Gala's theme for 2024, titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" was announced back in November 2023.)\n\nRelated: All About the 2024 Met Gala, from the Co-Chairs to the Theme\n\nThe sixteen-story building offers 106 rooms, 46 suites and 1 penthouse suite -- but among the busiest quarters of the nearly-century old hotel is its striking lobby, particularly in the hours leading up to the fashion f\u00eate.\n\n\"The energy on the day is incredible. It goes crescendo starting with the positioning of the red carpet early in the morning, followed by the delivery of the flowers and the arrival of the glam squads,\" Haro says. \"As the day progresses, the intensity is palpable.\"\n\nBeing fashionably late the ball is simply not an option for the Met Gala, which explains why Haro says \"there is a real sense of urgency\" up until the stars' head on their way. \"Minutes before the first departure, the lobby suddenly clears. What follows is two hours of the most incredible display of fashion.\"\n\nHaro adds: \"The Met Gala's reputation as 'fashion's biggest night' is certainly not an overstatement -- and nor is ours, as 'the starriest hotel lobby in the world.'\"\n\nRead on for everything to know about The Mark ahead of the highly-anticipated sartorial scene.\n\nBuilt in 1926, The Mark was designed in a neo-Italian Renaissance-style and erected by architects Schwartz & Gross. The landmark building blends modern luxury with quintessential charm of old New York.\n\nThe hotel is located at 25 East 77th Street, on the corner of 77th Street and Madison Avenue on New York's Upper East Side. Its neighborhood is perfectly situated near Manhattan hotspots, including the \"The Met\" and Central Park. Plus, a number of art galleries, restaurants and high-end shops are in the vicinity.\n\nRelated: Gabrielle Union Is Saving Her Met Gala Outfits for Kaavia So She'll Have a 'Little Bit of Her Mom' (Exclusive)\n\nCelebrities grace The Mark red carpet prior to hitting the Met Gala's covered steps, a tradition that began when the hotel reopened in 2009. It serves as the ultimate sartorial send off of stars following their anticipated outfit reveals.\n\nHaro tells PEOPLE the \"natural light, elegance, comfort, privacy and ultra-personalized service\" of The Mark are \"key attributes\" that celebrities and their glam teams enjoy as they prepare for the big night. Plus, he says guests can \"rest, dress and celebrate all in the same space.\"\n\nSnagging an invite to the Met Gala is hard, but booking a room on Met Gala day is equally exclusive! Haro says the hotel is \"booked out well ahead\" of the ball, with inquiries starting when the \"theme is revealed\" and the \"first guests receive confirmation of their attendance.\"\n\nThe Mark's interior houses 106 rooms and 46 suites. \"We host about 60 celebrity guests over the period,\" Haro tells PEOPLE, noting that the \"the finest talents of the fashion world\" including designers, make-up artists, facialists, jewelers and more also fill up the space.\n\n\"The 153 rooms at The Mark are a rare commodity on Met Gala day,\" Haro says. Fortunately, he praises the sales team's \"tremendous job\" throughout the booking process to understand their guests' needs and requirements ahead of the rush to \"avoid disappointment.\"\n\nParisian interior designer Jacques Grange is the mastermind behind The Mark's sophisticated, yet vibrant inside. The mesmerizing black and white striped floors synonymous with the hotel were conceived by the French visionary, who's portfolio of clients includes everyone from late fashion icon Yves Saint Laurent to the Princess of Monaco.\n\nIn addition to its 106 rooms and 46 suites, The Mark houses 1 penthouse suite. In fact, it's the largest penthouse in the United States at more than 10,000 square feet including 2,500 square feet of rooftop terrace overlooking Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and breathtaking cityscape.\n\n\"The Mark Penthouse is nothing short of spectacular!\" says Haro, noting its five-bedroom suite over two floors and panoramic views over N.Y.C. \"It is a highly coveted accommodation on Met Gala [Monday], and one of the first suites we book each year.\"\n\nHaro was tight lipped on some of the starriest celebrities who have stayed in the penthouse suite, though he revealed, \"The booker has actually been the same for the past few years and it is the venue of one of the Gala's famous afterparties.\"\n\nRelated: All of Taylor Swift's Met Gala Looks Through the Years\n\nThe Mark Restaurant By Jean-Georges and Caviar Kaspia are two high-end dining options in The Mark hotel -- and on Met Gala day, they're on go mode.\n\n\"Room Service runs on a tight flow,\" Haro says, noting that the majority of the guests remain on the property. Plus, abcV, the plant-forward concept from Jean-Georges will have a pop-up on Met Gala day, offering guests exciting, plant-based dishes.\n\nHaro pointed out a few memorable \"special requests\" guests had in years past. He said someone once asked for \"a continuous flow of fried chicken!\"\n\nAs for the \"most ordered\" item on Met Gala day? Surprisingly not champagne, says Haro, rather coffee. \"We serve an average of three cups per minute throughout the day!\" he reveals.\n\nThe elevators in The Mark are strategically monitored on Met Gala day. \"This is one of the most critical aspects of the day,\" Haro says.\n\nFrom the floors to the streets surrounding the hotel and everywhere in between, he says The Mark has a \"core team of forty collaborators\" who help coordinate a celebrity's departure from the building.\n\n\"Elevators are operated manually and sent for pick-up as soon as the floor team advises of an imminent departure,\" Haro explains. \"The celebrity's journey is monitored so that our transportation coordinators can get the right car in front of the hotel at the right time and ensure the process is flawless.\"\n\nHaro says \"timing is essential on the day,\" so for the system to work seamlessly, he says \"it requires a perfect coordination between many stakeholders.\"\n\nDue to the large number of notable names and prominent figures staying at The Mark during the Met Gala, Haro says \"securing the event is critical\" to ensure everyone \"feels safe and comfortable\" as they prepare for the big night.\n\n\"On the day itself, the street is cleared and access to The Mark is limited to our guests and their teams,\" he explains. \"The Mark has established itself as the home of many high-profile guests, so our security team is trained to handle the crowds that such a day brings.\"\n\nHaro adds, \"We also receive the support of the NYPD, whose officers do an incredible job.\"\n\nThe Mark has many standout amenities, including a salon home to the flagship of celebrity hairdresser Frederic Fekkai. \"He and his team have a very big day,\" Haro says in reference to the Met Gala.\n\nThe hotel also prides itself in providing guests the quintessential N.Y.C. experience, but making it luxurious at the same time! The Mark Hautedog Cart is among the highlights, serving up guests the classic barbecued dish but prepared in the gourmet kitchen of Jean-Georges.\n\nRelated: Zendaya's Met Gala Dress Hasn't Even Been Made Yet, According to Her Stylist\n\nAll members of a guest's family are invited to stay at The Mark -- dogs, too! Known to be \"one of the most dog-friendly hotels in New York,\" it offers amenities for your four-legged friends to enjoy (including a special dog menu curated by Jean-Georges!).", "source": {"uri": Wintour still oversees the event and decides everything from the theme to the guest list.\n\nThroughout the years, the Met Gala has transformed into a multimillion-dollar fundraiser -- last year's event reportedly raised $22 million -- filled with unforgettable fashion, controversies, and canon-level pop-culture moments.\n\nAs the world awaits all that this year's party has to offer on May 6, {"uri": "2024-05-346569051", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:55:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:55:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T09:31:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.47843137383461, "url": "https://www.thehollywoodgossip.com/2024/05/taylor-swift-travis-kelce-not-attending-met-gala/", "title": "Why Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce Won't Be At The Met Gala", "body": "Both Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have declined their Met Gala invitations. And the world is sad/heaves a collective sigh of relief.\n\nAfter taking weeks to nest with Travis out of the spotlight, the Eras superstar got back to work and Taylor Swift dropped a double album.\n\nThis is a huge time for Taylor's career. And, in between football seasons, this is a major time for Travis.\n\nSo why are they thumbing their noses at the Met Gala instead of showing up together? They have very good reasons.\n\nBoth Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce received Met Gala invitations\n\nTurns out,as TMZ reports, both Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce RSVP'ed \"no\" to the biggest celebrity fashion event of the year.\n\nNotably, Taylor and Travis received separate invitations. So this would not have been a case of Taylor bringing Travis as her Plus One.\n\nSo they both, separately, turned it down. That's not quite the same as Taylor turning it down for both of them.\n\nWhy did Taylor Swift turn down the Met Gala?\n\nNo one needs an excuse to turn down an invite, even though the star-studded Met Gala is a charity event. However, Taylor has a solid reason.\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala takes place on May 6.\n\nTaylor resumes her Eras World Tour on May 9 -- that same week. She'll need to travel to Europe and get everything set up in France. Especially because it's rumored she has to work in a whole new Era into the set list.\n\nYes, it's looking very plausible The Tortured Poets Department will be included for the first time in her first show back. And one does not simply slip in new music. The Eras tour is a very precise production.\n\nIn short, she's skipping the Met Gala to make sure her fans are better served!~\n\nWhy did Travis Kelce turn down the Met Gala?\n\nUnlike Taylor, Travis' professional obligations are (mostly) on pause. One of the many football facts that Taylor's fans have learned against our will is that the season ended before the Super Bowl and will not resume until late this summer.\n\nSo while Travis might be doing endorsements and other projects, he won't need to grace any sportsball fields with his presence the week of the Met Gala. You might've thought so given the big pay raise he got to play for 3 more years, but no.\n\nThe most likely explanation for Travis' absence is that he plans to travel to Europe to support Taylor as her Eras World Tour continues. He already said as much.\n\nThey may have a shared reason for turning down the invite\n\nFrom the moment that the public first linked the two, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have been one of the most famous couples on the planet.\n\nTaylor of course is a household name on multiple continents. And Travis was very well-known within the subculture of sports fans.\n\nHowever, they have yet to make a \"red carpet debut\" of any kind. They've vacationed together and embraced on the field of the Super Bowl. But, if they attended the Met Gala arm-in-arm, it would be a major relationship milestone.\n\nThe Met Gala will still be a star-studded spectacle\n\nEven without Taylor Swift and her athletic arm candy, the Met Gala will boast big names -- including both fan-favorites and some exciting newcomers.\n\nTaylor would be a welcome sight. So would Travis. It would be fascinating to see if Travis would stick to the prompt or pull a \"looking camp right in the eye\" ridicule-worthy flop like Karlie Kloss did in 2019.\n\nIt would be amazing if a football player outdid a bunch of alleged fashion icons at a fashion event. He paired it with plain trousers and shining dress shoes.\n\nNevertheless, there was one interesting feature of his outfit, which was the phrase \"novus ordo seclorum,\" written across the back of his jacket but because it was stitched in white, the words were barely noticeable.\n\nThe phrase translates from Latin to \"new world order\".\n\nThe Norwegian billionaire, whose net worth sits around $3.8 billion, is known to be one of the most stylish.\n\nHowever, the black-and-white striped Palomo suit he wore to the 2023 Met Gala wasn't his best fashion choice.\n\nIts structured jacket had a unique bodice that bubbled at the hips. {"uri": "8113229149", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "06:08:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T06:08:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T06:07:57Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.47843137383461, "url": "https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/met-gala-2024-best-rihanna-looks-ever-red-carpet_uk_663258a1e4b05f96b016c5ed", "title": "This Is Our Definitive Ranking Of All The Outfits Rihanna Has Ever Worn To The Met Gala", "body": "When it comes to the Met Ball red carpet, there's no mistaking who the queen is.\n\nFans of fashion and celebrity gossip both have a big reason to get excited this Monday, as the red carpet is rolled out for the annual Met Gala.\n\nThe star-studded event is a real playground for the rich and famous when it comes to fashion, but few ever have quite as much fun - or get people talking quite as much - as Rihanna.\n\nIn the last decade, the chart-topping singer and beauty entrepreneur has cemented herself as the true queen of the Met Ball thanks to her show-stopping fashion choices - and all signs point to us getting another RiRi moment on this year's red carpet.\n\nSo, while we wait for all the red carpet snaps from the 2024 Met Ball (including Rihanna's herself!), here's our definitive ranking of the looks the musician has worn to the Met Gala over the years...\n\nFresh from the success of her then-recent chart-topping single Umbrella, Rihanna attended her very first Met Gala in 2007 (still rocking the Good Girl Gone Bad hairstyle, no less).\n\nWe have to be honest, this outfit really isn't one for the history books, particularly in comparison to how cutting-edge Rihanna's fashion choices would become in the years that followed.\n\nStill, even if we're not blown away by the white dress, we have to give a shout-out to those gloves, which do bring a certain something to the outfit.\n\nAgain, this isn't our favourite Rihanna look by any stretch of the imagination, but we are very into this red fish-braid moment.\n\nWhat saves this outfit from being bottom of the list is that the dress is a lot more innovative than it might look on first glance, although you do have to see it...\n\n...from all angles to get the full effect.\n\nShe certainly stepped things up the following year, didn't she?\n\nIn tight black snakeskin, this look is definitely more reminiscent of \"Rihanna the fashion icon\" that would emerge in the not-too-distant future after this was taken\n\nStill, although this outfit is a little too simple to have it any higher than eighth place on our definitive ranking, we still have to give her props for the cool material (and, of course, her fabulous hairstyle).\n\nAnother very pretty outfit from Rihanna. What we like most about her 2014 ensemble is just how youthful, fresh and fun it is, particularly at an event where we secretly suspect laughs are actually few and far between.\n\nOf course, having fun with fashion would eventually become RiRi's forte, as we're about to discover later down this list...\n\nThis outfit might not be to everybody's tastes, but if anyone on earth can pull off this enormous Balenciaga coat with a matching bejeweled beanie, it's Rihanna - and we're big fans of the makeup and jewellery.\n\nIn 2021, Rih walked the red carpet with A$AP Rocky, marking their first ever public appearance as a couple, and within a few months, the We Found Love singer would confirm she was expecting their first child.\n\nA pregnant Rih certainly made an entrance when she and A$AP Rocky arrived late at the Met Ball in 2023, with most guests already seated at their tables by the time the Grammy winner made her way down the red carpet.\n\nStill, what an outfit this was. Between the massive flower coat (which turned into a completely different look when she took down the hood) and those white gloves, there was a lot to love, but we all know the true star of the show...\n\n...were those incredible sunglasses.\n\nBack in 2009, Rihanna was still in the early days of experimenting with a more avant-garde and daring style than we had been used to seeing from her at that time.\n\nMixing masculine and feminine, with her suit trousers, bow tie and towering heels, Rihanna gave one of the stand-out looks of the night that year, and she would carry on serving similar fashion moments to this while promoting her fourth album Rated R, which was released later that year.\n\nIt's also worth noting that this was the then-21-year-old's first red carpet appearance after being physically assaulted by ex-boyfriend Chris Brown just a few months earlier, making this already powerful (and, in our opinion, underrated) look even more impactful.\n\nRihanna was one of the co-chairs of the Met Gala in 2018, so the stakes were especially high when it came to the red carpet.\n\nFortunately, she more than delivered, giving us the stand-out moment of the whole night.\n\nWhat's funny about this outfit is that while some critics on social media suggested it was blasphemous or in poor taste, the Vatican actually endorsed the theme that year, and Rihanna herself borrowed part of her outfit from an actual Catholic Cardinal.\n\nThe dress that spawned a thousand memes, whether you thought it looked like a pizza, an omelette or a tribute to Big Bird, Rihanna's 2015 look was one that got absolutely everyone talking.\n\nRihanna later revealed that shex actually stumbled on the dress while Googling Chinese couture online, telling Vanity Fair: \"I'm so in love with this dress, but the train is insane!\n\n\"I can't really walk in it without any help -- but it's so worth it. I love this dress so much! It's Chinese couture and it's made by Guo Pei. It's handmade by one Chinese woman and it took her two years to make. I found it online.\"\n\nIt was a big year for Rihanna at the 2015 Met Gala, not only winning the red carpet but performing during the event (in a much more stage-friendly ensemble, obv).\n\nThere are always one or two cop-outs on the Met Gala red carpet, with celebs preferring to wear something pretty or flattering rather than actually stick to the event's theme - but 2016 was next level.\n\nBecause the night was inspired by Comme Des Gar\u00e7ons, the fashion house known for their elaborate and outlandish silhouettes, many of the stars in attendance opted for something a little more simple than the invitation requested.\n\nNot Rihanna, though.\n\nShe hit the red carpet in this enormous creation, ensuring all eyes were on her and serving us a look so iconic it's literally the one that's used to illustrate the Met Gala on Wikipedia.\n\nNot only is it stunning and inventive (and actually nails that year's theme, when so many opted not to even try), it's also tonnes of fun, completely exemplifying everything we love about Rihanna's fashion.", "source": {"uri": "huffingtonpost.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "HuffPost UK"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8114232681", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:49:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:49:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:46:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.47843137383461, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/met-gala-2024-whats-theme-174242902.html", "title": "Met Gala 2024: What's the theme, how to watch and how much does a ticket cost?", "body": "A-listers are getting ready to sashay down the red carpet for fashion's biggest night out - the Met Gala.\n\nActors, musicians and business magnates will be among those dressing to impress at the Metropolitan Museum of Art fundraiser in New York City.\n\nThe 2024 edition of the black-tie extravaganza is inspired by The Garden of Time, a short story by the British New Wave sci-fi author JG Ballard.\n\nThe annual gala raises money for the museum's Costume Institute.\n\nThis year's theme has been chosen to complement the Costume Institute's forthcoming exhibit Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\n\nThe BBC didn't get a ticket either - but here's a quick guide to the event.\n\nThose outside of fashion's inner sanctum never get to see the private cocktail and dinner events that comprise this multimillion-dollar fundraiser.\n\nBut fashion critics everywhere do get to watch their favourite actors, artistes and influencers walk a lengthy red carpet.\n\nGuests begin arriving at the Met and walk up the iconic New York landmark's grand staircase to the click of a thousand cameras from 18:00 EST (22:00 GMT).\n\nBut expect late arrivals - we're looking at you, Rihanna.\n\nThe event is organised by Vogue and its explosion in popularity has been overseen by the fashion magazine's global editorial director Anna Wintour.\n\nVogue will exclusively livestream the red carpet on its website and all of its digital platforms. Streams will also be available to US viewers on NBC's Peacock streaming platform and E!.\n\nInternational viewers can tune in via Instagram, X and TikTok.\n\nYou can follow the BBC's live blog for updates.\n\nThe Met Gala's theme often serves as a prelude to the Costume Institute's spring 2024 exhibition - and this year is no different.\n\nThe exhibit - Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion - uses technology to \"breathe new life\" into garments from the Met's archives so fragile they can no longer be worn and must remain under glass.\n\nArtificial intelligence, computer-generated imagery, X-rays, soundscapes and other formats will be used in \"creative and immersive activations designed to convey the smells, sounds, textures, and motions\" of these items, according to the museum's website.\n\nThe dress code for Monday's red carpet is The Garden of Time, which shares its name with a dystopian tale written in 1962 by JG Ballard, in which the last bastion of the super-rich is overrun by a working-class mob of the \"great unwashed\".\n\nCommentators are calling it an exploration of rebirth and renewal, and of humanity's tendency towards cycles of creation and destruction.\n\nFor an event that celebrates affluence and excess in an age of economic uncertainty and global volatility, the theme may sound a little on the nose.\n\nThe short answer is no. Fashion's biggest night is a cocktail and dinner party for about 400 to 450 invited guests.\n\nWealthy celebrities and brands snap up all the available tickets and tables at the charity benefit.\n\nAn individual ticket goes for around $75,000 (\u00a340,000), more than the average down payment on a house.\n\nA 10-seat table starts at $350,000.\n\nLast year, the gala - whose theme paid tribute to late design legend Karl Lagerfeld - raised about $22m.\n\nIn 1995, Ms Wintour's first year overseeing the event, a ticket cost just $1,000.\n\nMs Wintour has tapped four big names to serve as co-chairs at this year's event.\n\nThey are Latino music stars Bad Bunny and Jennifer Lopez, US actress Zendaya and Australian actor Chris Hemsworth, making his debut at the gala.\n\nCo-chairs help promote the event, plan its theme and dinner, and arrive at the beginning of its red carpet portion.\n\nServing as honorary chairs are Shou Zi Chew, chief executive officer of TikTok, and Jonathan Anderson, the creative director of the Loewe's fashion house.\n\nTikTok - currently under the threat of a nationwide ban - and Loewe's are also sponsoring the gala and exhibition.\n\nThe guest list is always top secret, but several celebrities have already confirmed their attendance.\n\nPower couple Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are currently not slated to attend. Neither is Jared Leto, who often stands out among the male attendees.\n\nSpeculation is also rife over the likelihood of appearances by Sean \"Diddy\" Combs, who is facing multiple sexual misconduct lawsuits, and Kendrick Lamar, who is locked in a heated war of words with rival rapper Drake.", "source": {"uri": "ca.news.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_carpet", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Red carpet"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "J. {"uri": "8114160900", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:48:38", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:48:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:48:15Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4745098054409027, "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/where-do-celebrities-get-dressed-before-the-met-gala/", "title": "Where Do Celebrities Get Dressed Before the Met Gala?", "body": "Every year, fashion fans around the world await impatiently behind screens (or barricades) to catch the first glimpse of their favorite celebrities as they make their way onto the Met Gala red carpet.\n\nBut it's not always the red carpet where attendees first debut their looks. Often, it's outside of the Mark and Carlyle Hotels in New York City, where countless celebrities get ready before heading to the event.\n\nThe hotels, both located on the Upper East Side in Manhattan and conveniently situated one block away from each other, have rich histories.\n\nThe Mark was built nearly 100 years ago in 1926 and began hosting Met Gala attendees in 2009. It has housed innumerable celebrities over the years, including Anna Wintour, Kendall Jenner, Selena Gomez, Cara Delevigne, Blake Lively and many more. It features an impressive 106 rooms and 46 suites.\n\n\"The energy on the day is incredible,\" Etienne Haro, the general manager of The Mark, told People in an interview published on May 6. \"It goes crescendo starting with the positioning of the red carpet early in the morning, followed by the delivery of the flowers and the arrival of the glam squads. As the day progresses, the intensity is palpable.\"\n\nLike The Mark, The Carlyle goes above and beyond to ensure that its Met Gala guests are comfortable.\n\n\"It's everything from the small touches of the pillowcases to the amenities that we place into the guest rooms, to the red carpet that goes out the morning of the Met Gala,\" hotel manager Tony Mosca told Women's Wear Daily in April 2023.\n\nEvery year, both hotels are booked months in advance by celebrities in the lead up to the Met Gala. This year is sure to have been no exception. On the day, their elevator traffic is tightly monitored to coordinate each celebrity's entrance and departure. The security outside each hotel is also heavily amped up to protect celebrities as they pass by throngs of fans and photographers behind the barricades.", "source": {"uri": "usmagazine.com", Especially, if it's Met Gala, she has to be unique. Ahead of her red carpet appearance at the prestigious event, Natasha took to Instagram and dropped pictures of her look.\n\nNatasha donned a quilt-like gown with a thigh-high slit and a pillow attached to her back. She wrote, \"Sleeping Beauty Met Day!!! I couldn't think of anything better than this Viktor and Rolf piece from their AW2018 collection to honour the opening of The Met's latest exhibition; resuscitating iconic fashion and honouring legendary mastery in craft and design. She opted for a sleek ponytail that she adorned with silver accessories.\n\nBefore that, she wore designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee's ensemble. Her saree with bustier and elaborate jewellery gave the red carpet a dash of Indian elegance. The designer wrote on Instagram, \"Sabyasachi contributed to Natasha's vision by celebrating Indian craftsmanship with a gold handcrafted printed tulle sari and trail embroidered with silk floss thread and embellished with bevel beads, semi-precious stones, crystals, sequins, and applique printed velvet.\"\n\nThe Met Gala, often hailed as 'Fashion's Biggest Night', will uphold its tradition by returning on the first Monday of May. This year's theme is 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion'. Unlike previous themes, this year's focus will be on reviving unique garments from various centuries, offering a novel perspective to fashion enthusiasts. While the gala will celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition, 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,' the official dress theme is 'The Garden of Time.'\n\nThis year's exhibition will feature significant pieces spanning over 400 years of fashion history, showcasing iconic designers such as Elsa Schiaparelli, Christian Dior, Yves Saint Laurent, and Hubert de Givenchy. Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth, and Bad Bunny will serve as the night's co-chairs. A figure up 50 percent from last year's still astronomical $50,000 per ticket price.\n\nAccording to the Met, pricing for a 10-person table starts at $350,000.\n\nOne hotly-debated question each time the first Monday in May rolls around is: who ultimately foots the bill for the celebrities who populate the carpet?\n\nThe process begins with obtaining an invite - of course, not just anyone can purchase a ticket, even those willing to fork over handfuls of cash.\n\nOften, design houses, the backbone of the Met Gala's cultural relevancy, buy up tables and invite high-profile figures they hope to host.\n\nFor that reason, even the hottest celebrities, are rarely paying full freight for their spots atop the staircase.\n\nThe event is ultimately a fundraiser and has, to date, under the leadership of Anna Wintour, raised some $223.5million for the museum's Costume Institute.\n\nLast year, the gala raised about $22million.\n\nShe put on a perky display in the racy ensemble and Costume Institute's execution of its new exhibit: 'Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.'\n\nThe exhibit, which attendees will get an early viewing of this evening, celebrates the 'reanimation' of pieces from the institute's collection that have long-lived as 'motionless' artwork, as opposed to dynamic pieces that can be 'worn or heard, touched, or smelled.'\n\n'The exhibition endeavors to reanimate these artworks by re-awakening their sensory capacities through a diverse range of technologies, affording visitors sensorial 'access' to rare historical garments and rarefied contemporary fashions,' said exhibit curator Andrew Bolton.\n\n'By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses, the show aims to reconnect with the works on display as they were originally intended -
