{"uri": "8114431112", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "20:50:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T20:50:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T20:49:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4705882370471954, "url": "https://www.smh.com.au/lifestyle/fashion/met-gala-2024-live-updates-what-to-expect-from-this-year-s-gala-20240506-p5fpa4.html", "title": "Met Gala 2024 LIVE updates: What to expect from this year's gala", "body": "Each year, Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour appoints a number of celebrities to act as her co-chairs of the Met Gala, based on who is trending - fashionably, culturally, or in the sporting arena - at the time.\n\nThe co-chairs are ambassadors for the event but also play a hands-on role in deciding the theme, guest list and decorations - all of which is signed off by Wintour.\n\nFor 2024, there are four co-chairs, including Australian-born actor Chris Hemsworth, who joins Nicole Kidman (2003, 2005) and Cate Blanchett (2007) on the small list of Aussies who've had the honour.\n\nThis year's group also includes Challengers star Zendaya, rapper Bad Bunny and singer-actress Jennifer Lopez.\n\nYou may be wondering, \"Why these four?\" Well, aside from being one of the major cultural and fashion events of the year, the Met Gala is a fundraiser for the Met museum's costume institute, so it's ideal if the event can reach new audiences. Cue Hemsworth's 59 million Instagram followers, and that may give you a clue. Surprisingly, this is his first time attending the gala, so to be elevated straight to co-chair is quite a feat. {"uri": "8114275515", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "18:23:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T18:23:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T18:23:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4549019634723663, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/entertainment/hollywood/here-are-the-most-unforgettable-looks-from-past-met-galas20240506235221/", "title": "Here are the most unforgettable looks from past Met Galas", "body": "Washington [US], May 6 (ANI): As the fashion world eagerly awaits the 2024 Met Gala, known for its avant-garde themes and extravagant red carpet looks, let's take a trip down memory lane and revisit some of the most unforgettable and strangest outfits from past Met Galas:\n\n1. Rihanna's Iconic 'Omelette' Dress (2015): Rihanna turned heads in a yellow gown by Chinese designer Guo Pei, which drew comparisons to a luxurious omelette. The voluminous train and intricate detailing made it one of the most talked-about looks of the night.\n\n2. Katy Perry's Chandelier Ensemble (2019): Katy Perry lit up the red carpet in a chandelier-inspired outfit by Moschino. Complete with working lights and crystal embellishments, the whimsical ensemble perfectly captured the gala's theme of 'Camp: Notes on Fashion.'\n\n3. Bjork's Swan Dress (2001): Icelandic singer Bjork made a surreal entrance at the Met Gala in a swan-shaped dress designed by Marjan Pejoski. The avant-garde ensemble, complete with a nest-like headdress, left a lasting impression on attendees and fashion enthusiasts alike.\n\n4. Sarah Jessica Parker's Flame Headdress (2015): Known for her bold fashion choices, Sarah Jessica Parker made a statement at the Met Gala with a flaming headdress by Philip Treacy. Paired with a black gown by H&M, the fiery accessory added drama to her ensemble.\n\n5. Jared Leto's Head-Turning Gucci Ensemble (2019): Jared Leto embraced the theme of 'Camp: Notes on Fashion' with a striking Gucci ensemble that featured a replica of his own head as an accessory. The surreal look sparked a mix of awe and confusion among onlookers.\n\n6. Katy Perry's Moschino Hamburger Dress (2019): Katy Perry returned to the Met Gala in another attention-grabbing ensemble, this time dressed as a larger-than-life hamburger. Designed by Jeremy Scott for Moschino, the playful outfit showcased the singer's sense of humour.\n\n9. Billy Porter's Egyptian-Inspired Entrance (2019): Billy Porter stole the show at the 2019 Met Gala with a jaw-dropping entrance carried by six shirtless men, channelling ancient Egyptian royalty. The custom-made ensemble by The Blonds featured intricate gold embellishments and a dramatic wingspan, solidifying Porter's status as a fashion icon.\n\n10. Kim Kardashian's all-black Balenciaga look (2021): Kim caused a stir by donning a full black ensemble that concealed her well-known visage. She appeared fully made up underneath the face covering. This choice wasn't her favourite, as she resisted it initially, questioning the need to obscure her face. However, Balenciaga's creative director, Demna Gvasalia, and the team insisted that the outfit was appropriate for a costume gala, emphasizing the theme over conventional notions of beauty, as per E! News.\n\nAs we eagerly await the fashion spectacle that is the 2024 Met Gala, these unforgettable and often bizarre looks serve as a reminder of the event's ability to push the boundaries of creativity and self-expression.\n\nThe Met Gala 2024 will be held on May 6 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City. {"uri": "8114123955", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:20:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:20:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:19:23Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4509803950786591, "url": "https://wegotthiscovered.com/events/the-met-gala-theme-2024-explained/", "title": "The Met Gala theme 2024, explained", "body": "The biggest fashion event of the year falls on the first Monday of May. Since 1948, stars have graced the Metropolitan Museum of Art with themed looks that range from dazzling to completely jaw-dropping.\n\nFans will see their favorite celebrities walk the carpet of this year's Met Gala on May 6.\n\nEach year the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York produces an exhibit honoring a theme, person, or moment in fashion. The gala itself honors the opening of the exhibit every year by creating a dress code that alignment with its subject. This year's exhibit is titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nThe actual exhibition within the museum is centered around honoring pieces of fashion that are so old or delicate that they can never be worn again. Meaning that these masterpieces have been forever put to rest or sleep.\n\nAccording to NBC News, not only is it an ode to one-of-a-kind craftsmanship, but the exhibition is divided into three sections: earth, land, and sea. Each will have unique relics dedicated to celebrating that aspect of nature, emphasizing the emotional art of design and its ties to our natural world, according to MET curator Andrew Bolton in Vogue.\n\nObviously, stars can't wear pieces that have been retired from carpet couture, although Kim Kardashian has tried. That's where the dress code differs from the theme itself. The dress code for the past several years has been created by Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour and her co-hosts. The dress code aligns with the exhibition theme but it's never exactly the same.\n\nThis year's is \"The Garden of Time.\"\n\nThe dress codes are usually very illusive and interpretable, making it so that each look can be different. Too tight of a dress code makes for a boring carpet. The dress code was inspired by J.G. Ballard's short story by the same name, which is a science fiction story about the brevity of nature.\n\nOnline sleuths are already creeping on celebrity stylists to find hints about potential interpretations and celebrity appearances. Stylists could lean into the short story reference and make allusions to climate change, wilting flowers, or changing seasons. They could take inspiration from the exhibition theme itself, as some people have done in the past, with nods to floral fairytales. Or even dress as nature itself.\n\nDesigners including Alaia, Simone Rocha, Balenciaga, and Loewe are all rumored, or at least hoped to make high-fashion appearances on the red carpet this evening.\n\nOf course, we can hope, pray, and predict all we want, but the intrigue of the Met Gala is nobody knows what will happen until those stars step out onto the red carpet.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8113947210", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "14:18:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T14:18:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T14:16:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4509803950786591, "url": "https://www.usanews.net/entertainment/met-gala-2024-what-time-can-it-be-seen-in-spain-theme-presenters-and-h154067.html", "title": "Met Gala 2024: what time can it be seen in Spain, theme, presenters and guests", "body": "Like every May, thousands of people around the globe look forward to one of the most important events of the year: the MET gala.\n\nLike every May, thousands of people around the globe look forward to one of the most important events of the year: the MET gala. Since 2005, this event has been held on the first Monday of the fifth month of the year, so it will be tonight when the most famous figures on the international scene show off their best clothes on the famous stairs of the Metropolitan Museum in New York.\n\nThe party organized by Anna Wintour aims to raise money for the Costume Institute of the New York museum, but it also serves as the opening for the temporary exhibition that can be seen from May 10 to September 2.\n\nAs we all know, every year there is a different theme that inspires the outfits of many of the guests at the celebration. Last year, the outfits revolved around designer Karl Lagerfeld, but this time they wanted to give a title that gives rise to more interpretations. The chosen theme is titled The Garden of Time and is inspired by the story of the same name by J.G. Ballard from 1962. It should be noted that the museum's spring exhibition is called ''Sleeping Beauties: Fashion Awakens'', so expect lots of flowers and vintage clothing.\n\nThe Met Gala starts around six in the afternoon in New York City, so in Spain we can see the first shows around midnight. The event will last until dawn from Monday to Tuesday, which is why only Spaniards who go to bed late will be able to enjoy the live show.\n\nAs for the broadcast, Vogue has the exclusive, so the red carpet can be followed through its website Vogue.com and its different digital platforms (TikTok, YouTube, etc.). The event can also be seen from some media outlets such as The Associated Press or E!, which will broadcast live on their social networks.\n\nEach year, Wintour and her team choose different figures to take on the role of hosts of the Met Gala. In the last edition, Dua Lipa, Michaela Coel, Pen\u00e9lope Cruz, Roger Federer and Wintour herself had the honor of playing this role.\n\nThis year, the expectation is enormous, since those chosen for said title are great figures from the world of cinema, television and music: Bad Bunny, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez and Chris Hemsworth.\n\nAlthough the official list of attendees is a mystery that is revealed as the different figures appear on the red carpet of the event, it is expected that the hosts will bring their partners (Tom Holland, Ben Affleck and Elsa Pataky), as well as many take for granted the stellar appearance of Rihanna.\n\nThe presence of some of the Kardashian-Jenner sisters is also inevitably expected, who usually attract everyone's attention thanks to their extravagant outfits and their stunning outfits.", "source": {"uri": "usanews.net", "dataType": "news", "title": "USANews Press Release Network"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Wintour", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Anna Wintour"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City", "type": "loc", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "New York City"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaniards", "type": "wiki", "score": 2, "label": {"eng": "Spaniards"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 2, "label": {"eng": "J. up with a belt.\n\nThe actress slung a taupe tote accessorized with a scarf over her shoulder and also rocked a flawless black manicure.\n\nShe was greeted by adoring fans as she emerged from the Chris Hemsworth.\n\nThe Costume Institute's spring exhibition falls on the first Monday in May every year and is held at New York City's Metropolitan Museum of Art.\n\nThis year the event is titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion while the dress code is The Garden of Time.\n\nThe honorary chairs for the evening are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi approximately 250 items drawn from The Costume Institute's permanent collection - with many of the pieces too fragile to ever be worn again.\n\nThe pieces will all be displayed using elements such as AI, GCI, and more while playing up themes of land, sea, and sky.\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.'\n\nThe Euphoria star made her way into her awaiting vehicle with Ballard's 1962 short story of the same title. According to Vogue, \"the most obvious interpretation would be to embrace the 'garden' part of 'The Garden of Time.' {"uri": "8113916192", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:56:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:56:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:55:55Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4470588266849518, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-13386653/best-met-gala-looks-kim-kardashian-doja-cat.html", "title": "A look back at the Met Gala's most memorable looks over the years", "body": "READ MORE: The night that bra-free Diana stormed New York's Met Gala\n\nUndisputedly the hottest night in fashion - the Met Gala 2024 is set to take hold in just a few hours and will welcome some of the world's biggest entertainers and VIPs.\n\nNicknamed 'fashion's biggest night out', the glamorous fundraising gala holds at the Metropolitan Museum in New York City on the first Monday in May, with this year's spectacle taking place on the 6th.\n\nYet the cult event has become renown for its stylish extravagance, with past invitees like Rihanna, Lady Gaga and Doja Cat shocking the world with their uncensored style.\n\nOf course the most wanted fashion ticket in town - scratch that the world - would be a miss without enormous pressure on glitterati to carve out fashion history with just one look.\n\nIn past years Katy Perry, Kim Kardashian and Lil Nas X - who showed up in nothing but a skintight silver thong last year - have caused quite a stir with their eccentric wardrobe choices.\n\nKaty Perry: The Roar singer's look was hot off the press - in more ways than one - when in 2019 she rocked a chandelier look with accompanying candle-style light bulbs. The outfit was the star's answer to the theme: 'Camp: Notes on Fashion'\n\nDoja Cat: In 2023 the gala asked its guests to pay homage to designer Karl Lagerfield who passed away in 2019 from pancreatic cancer. The theme was 'Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty' - prompting the rapper to pay tribute to his cat, Choupette. The stunning feline-inspired hooded gown was designed by Oscar de la Renta\n\nSimilarly, in 1996, a newly divorced Princess Diana sent shockwaves through the globe when she opted to go braless in a \u00a310,000 midnight blue Dior dress.\n\nTonight, the gala will have Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, Zendaya and Chris Hemsworth as fashion co-chairs, along with Anna Wintour who has served as chair since 1995.\n\nAs excitement brews for the star-studded affair, FEMAIL takes a look back at the celebs who didn't disappoint and along the way have forged the most memorable looks in fashion.\n\nPrincess Diana: In 1996 a newly-divorced Diana attended the Met Gala in a Dior midnight blue dress, trimmed with black lace. The gown - rumoured to cost \u00a310,000 - was the sensation of the night. John Galliano, Dior's new designer, said that Diana had deliberately removed the interior bustier from the dress as 'it was a reflection of how she was already feeling'\n\nRihanna: The singer and mother-of two, 36, topped fashion lists in this delicately beaded ensemble by Maison Margiela complete with mitre and cropped cope. The stunning look was chosen for the gala's 2018 theme - 'Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination'\n\nBlake Lively: Also in 2018, the star actress turned heads across the globe in this gilded bodice and a sheer-panelled crimson skirt designed by Atelier Versace\n\nKim Kardashian: The reality superstar, 43, carved out a memorable fashion moment in this Balenciaga number, but the outfit choice has since received mixed reviews. The all black look, worn in 2021, included a face-concealing balaclava\n\nLady Gaga: In 2019 the Poker Face popstar commanded attention by stripping off layer after layer of haute couture clothing, all the way down to her sequined underwear. The star originally wore a fuchsia pink cape gown designed by Brandon Maxwell before undressing to reveal her lingerie\n\nCardi B: Also in 2019 The I Like It rapper struck a new chord in the fashion world when she donned this extravagant wine red number. The flamboyant gown - designed by Moschino - was complete with huge feathered shoulders and a jewelled red headpiece\n\nBeyonc\u00e9: The megastar turned heads in a striking see-through Givenchy number when she attended the Met Gala with husband Jay Z back in 2015. The theme was China: Through the Looking Glass\n\nLil Nas X: The controversial singer showed up to the Met Gala last year in nothing but a skintight silver thong to celebrate the theme: 'Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty'. The silver body paint and encrusted jewels emphasised his sculpted physique\n\nJaden Smith: In 2017 the superstar son of Will Smith and Jada Pinkett famously quipped 'Since I couldn't bring my sister as a date, I brought my old hair'. To celebrate the 'Rei Kawakubo/Comme des Gar\u00e7ons: Art of the In-Between' theme, the star, 25, donned a Louis Vuitton suit and heeled boots - and accessorised with his shaved dreadlocks\n\nDavid and Victoria Beckham: Known for her impeccable style, Victoria opted for a sleek Giorgio Armani lace dress with silver strappy sandals despite 2008's theme being named as 'Superheroes: Fashion and Fantasy'. David attended the gala in a suave black suit by the same designer\n\nRihanna: Years before she would go on to become a household name, the singing sensation made waves at her second ever Met Gala. Dressed in a fresh-off-the-runway Dolce & Gabbana suit, black leather gloves and donning a cropped haircut, the look became one of the most memorable from 2009\n\nBilly Porter: The American Horror Story: Apocalypse star, 54, stunned onlookers as he was carried by six shirtless men draped in gold Ancient Egyptian-inspired chokers, necklaces, face masks and jeans back in 2019\n\nJared Leto: 2019 saw many shocking firsts, including the actor's wild accessory - a sculpture of his head. Wearing Alessandro Michele for Gucci, the actor made a memorable mark in the red satin bejewelled number\n\nZendaya: Never one to shy away from best-dressed lists, the actress caused a stir in this illuminated Cinderella gown custom made by Tommy Hilfiger. The look was Zendaya's interpretation of the gala's 'Camp: Notes on Fashion' theme\n\nKate Moss: In 2009 the theme was 'The Model as Muse: Embodying Fashion' which Kate Moss made utterly memorable in {"uri": "2024-05-346768008", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:06:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:06:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T17:03:04Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4431372582912445, "url": "https://www.theolympian.com/entertainment/article288350545.html", "title": "Most Iconic Met Gala Looks", "body": "The Met Gala is fashion's biggest night of nights, with the 2024 edition taking place on Monday, May 6.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which will celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition of the same name. Actor Zendaya is co-chairing the event with Vogue editor Anna Wintour.\n\nBefore celebrities show off their impressive outfits for this year, Newsweek has taken a look at some of the most iconic Met Gala outfits that have graced the red carpet over the years.\n\nRihanna Wearing Guo Pei, 2015\n\nA variety of Rihanna's outfits could be included in this list but one that stands out the most is her outfit for the 2015 Met Gala theme \"China: Through the Looking Glass.\" For the event, the singer and businesswoman donned a canary yellow cape gown designed by Chinese couturier Guo Pei.\n\nIt took 20 months to make the embroidered fur-trimmed outfit, which weighed about 55 pounds and had a train that was three meters long. It quickly gained notoriety online, with many saying it was their favorite outfit from the event that year.\n\nBlake Lively Wearing Atelier Versace, 2022\n\nIn 2022 Blake Lively wore an Atelier Versace gown inspired by the Statue of Liberty for the theme \"In America: An Anthology of Fashion.\" On the night, the once bronze-colored dress changed to reveal a mint green color to show off the process of oxidation the statue has undergone.\n\nZendaya Wearing Versace, 2018\n\nFor 2018 the Met Gala theme was \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination,\" for which Zendaya and stylist Law Roach channeled Joan of Arc with a chain mail outfit. The custom gown featured armor-like details and a slinky train and the look was finished with an auburn wig.\n\nKate Moss Wearing Marc Jacobs, 2009\n\nFor the theme of \"The Model as Muse: Embodying Fashion\" Kate Moss-who was the co-chair that year-wore Marc Jacobs, who was her date for the evening.\n\nThe gold metallic minidress had a matching head wrap and the outfit was finished off with custom YSL shoes. This is the perfect example of how a simple but well-executed outfit can do wonders.\n\nDoutzen Kroes Wearing Zac Posen, 2010\n\nFor the theme \"American Woman: Fashioning a National Identity\" Doutzen Kroes, a Victoria's Secret Angel at the time, created Cinderella-inspired magic with the help of designer Zac Posen. The pastel blue gown with its heavily bodied tulle skirt is a timeless piece of fashion.\n\nBeyonc\u00e9 Wearing Givenchy, 2015\n\nJust when everyone thought the 2015 Met Gala red carpet had finished, Beyonc\u00e9 arrived fashionably late wearing a sheer Givenchy gown that featured strategically placed crystals.\n\nLady Gaga Wearing Brandon Maxwell, 2019\n\nThe pop superstar was co-chair of the event in 2019, where she arrived in a series of outfits from designer Brandon Maxwell. While walking the red carpet Lady Gaga disrobed one layer at a time to reveal four separate outfits. The 2019 theme was \"Camp: Notes on Fashion\" inspired by Susan Sontag's 1964 essay \"Notes on Camp.\"\n\nRihanna Wearing Maison Margiela, 2018\n\nIt's impossible to not include Rihanna for a second time in this list, as she wowed viewers with her 2018 outfit. This year the theme was \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination\" and she went above and beyond.\n\nThe outfit was custom-made for the businesswoman and took 250 hours to sew and 500 hours to hand-embroider.\n\nEmma Watson Wearing Calvin Klein, 2016\n\nEmma Watson hit the 2016 theme \"Manus x Machina: Fashion in an Age of Technology\" on its head with her gown made from recycled plastic bottles. She collaborated with Calvin Klein and Eco Age for the outfit.\n\nElizabeth Hurley Wearing Gianni Versace, 1995\n\nBack in 1995, Elizabeth Hurley was considered one of the best-dressed stars at that year's Met Gala, then known as the Costume Institute Gala. The theme was simply \"Haute Couture\" and it was the first time that Wintour co-chaired the event.", "source": {"uri": "theolympian.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The  Olympian"}, "authors": {"uri": "8114341725", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:23:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:23:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:22:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4431372582912445, "url": "https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/2024-met-gala-theme-time-streaming-1234706115/", "title": "Everything to Know about the 2024 Met Gala", "body": "The museum hosts the art-and-fashion ball each year on the first Monday of May to support its Costume Institute, which holds around 33,000 objects across seven centuries of fashion history. Guests are invited to the gala by invitation and a single ticket can cost up to $50,000. Despite the price may seem steep, there are expected to be roughly 450 guests in attendance this evening.\n\nThis year's theme centers around the exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which boasts roughly 250 rare pieces spanning 400 years of fashion history from the institute's permanent collection. The show includes pieces designed by Dior, Givenchy, and Schiaparelli, with some garments that are too fragile to be put on display, like a Charles Frederick Worth ball gown from 1877, being shown via video animation, light projection, AI, and CGI. The highly sensorial show is split into three categories from the natural world: land, sea, and sky.\n\nThe gala's official dress theme \"The Garden of Time\" was inspired by J.G. Ballard's titular short story from 1962. (The writer's texts also served as a source of inspiration for this year's Whitney Biennial.) As such, the red carpet will likely see a number of ensembles incorporating flora and fauna.\n\nThe star-studded event is expected to deliver, with celebrities Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, Bad Bunny, and Chris Hemsworth serving as the night's co-hosts.\n\nOf course, the entire celebration would not exist without Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour, who started it, and has become synonymous with the Met Gala since 1995.\n\nViewers can tune in via livestream on Vogue.com (and on the publication's associated digital platforms) to see the red carpet arrivals, beginning at 6 p.m.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "2024-05-346763182", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "17:01:15", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T17:01:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:24:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4392156898975372, "url": "https://www.newsweek.com/met-gala-most-iconic-looks-1897587", "title": "Most iconic Met Gala looks", "body": "The Met Gala is fashion's biggest night of nights, with the 2024 edition taking place on Monday, May 6.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" which will celebrate the Costume Institute's new exhibition of the same name. Actor Zendaya is co-chairing the event with Vogue editor Anna Wintour.\n\nBefore celebrities show off their impressive outfits for this year, Newsweek has taken a look at some of the most iconic Met Gala outfits that have graced the red carpet over the years.\n\nRihanna Wearing Guo Pei, 2015\n\nA variety of Rihanna's outfits could be included in this list but one that stands out the most is her outfit for the 2015 Met Gala theme \"China: Through the Looking Glass.\" For the event, the singer and businesswoman donned a canary yellow cape gown designed by Chinese couturier Guo Pei.\n\nIt took 20 months to make the embroidered fur-trimmed outfit, which weighed about 55 pounds and had a train that was three meters long. It quickly gained notoriety online, with many saying it was their favorite outfit from the event that year.\n\nBlake Lively Wearing Atelier Versace, 2022\n\nIn 2022 Blake Lively wore an Atelier Versace gown inspired by the Statue of Liberty for the theme \"In America: An Anthology of Fashion.\" On the night, the once bronze-colored dress changed to reveal a mint green color to show off the process of oxidation the statue has undergone.\n\nZendaya Wearing Versace, 2018\n\nFor 2018 the Met Gala theme was \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination,\" for which Zendaya and stylist Law Roach channeled Joan of Arc with a chain mail outfit. The custom gown featured armor-like details and a slinky train and the look was finished with an auburn wig.\n\nKate Moss Wearing Marc Jacobs, 2009\n\nFor the theme of \"The Model as Muse: Embodying Fashion\" Kate Moss -- who was the co-chair that year -- wore Marc Jacobs, who was her date for the evening.\n\nThe gold metallic minidress had a matching head wrap and the outfit was finished off with custom YSL shoes. This is the perfect example of how a simple but well-executed outfit can do wonders.\n\nDoutzen Kroes Wearing Zac Posen, 2010\n\nFor the theme \"American Woman: Fashioning a National Identity\" Doutzen Kroes, a Victoria's Secret Angel at the time, created Cinderella-inspired magic with the help of designer Zac Posen. The pastel blue gown with its heavily bodied tulle skirt is a timeless piece of fashion.\n\nBeyonc\u00e9 Wearing Givenchy, 2015\n\nJust when everyone thought the 2015 Met Gala red carpet had finished, Beyonc\u00e9 arrived fashionably late wearing a sheer Givenchy gown that featured strategically placed crystals.\n\nLady Gaga Wearing Brandon Maxwell, 2019\n\nThe pop superstar was co-chair of the event in 2019, where she arrived in a series of outfits from designer Brandon Maxwell. While walking the red carpet Lady Gaga disrobed one layer at a time to reveal four separate outfits. The 2019 theme was \"Camp: Notes on Fashion\" inspired by Susan Sontag's 1964 essay \"Notes on Camp.\"\n\nRihanna Wearing Maison Margiela, 2018\n\nIt's impossible to not include Rihanna for a second time in this list, as she wowed viewers with her 2018 outfit. This year the theme was \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination\" and she went above and beyond.\n\nThe outfit was custom-made for the businesswoman and took 250 hours to sew and 500 hours to hand-embroider.\n\nEmma Watson Wearing Calvin Klein, 2016\n\nEmma Watson hit the 2016 theme \"Manus x Machina: Fashion in an Age of Technology\" on its head with her gown made from recycled plastic bottles. She collaborated with Calvin Klein and Eco Age for the outfit.\n\nElizabeth Hurley Wearing Gianni Versace, 1995\n\nBack in 1995, Elizabeth Hurley was considered one of the best-dressed stars at that year's Met Gala, then known as the Costume Institute Gala. The theme was simply \"Haute Couture\" and it was the first time that Wintour co-chaired the event.", "source": {"uri": "newsweek.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Newsweek"}, "authors": [{"uri": {"uri": "8113877011", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:31:18", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:31:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:30:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4392156898975372, "url": "https://exbulletin.com/fashion/2687600/", "title": "Met Gala 2024: Sleeping Beauties theme, explained - ExBulletin", "body": "Stay ahead of the curve with our weekly guide to the latest trends, fashion, relationships and more.\n\nOn November 8, 2023, Vogue announced the theme of The Costume Institutes 2024 exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the theme of the Met Gala entitled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion. The revelation was met with a myriad of confused individuals online, predicting a display of designer pajamas on the red carpet for the famous opening as well as a parade of princesses on the museum steps thinking Sleeping Beauties was a reference to the classic Disney cartoon. Yet neither is correct.\n\nSo, if the theme doesn't involve nighties or knights, what does Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion mean?\n\nFirst, let's dive into the intention of the exhibition.\n\nThe new exhibition promises to feature 250 archival pieces from the Costume Institutes' permanent collection, some dating back 400 years to the Elizabethan period. According to Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu curator in charge of the Costume Institute, the entire exhibition centers on 50 historical garments, latent and so fragile that they can never again be worn by the sleeping beauties of the exhibition. The main motivator piece was a Charles Frederick Worth original, a silk satin ball gown dating from 1877. Each delicate piece, some no longer in their true form, will be reimagined in innovative cases designed to bring new life to the clothes.\n\nWhile the movement inherent in each piece is apparent even in a state of stillness, computer-generated images, sound design, light projection, Peppers' ghost illusion technique and video animation will be installed to propel these pieces out of their decor.\n\nJust as a 17th-century bodice is meant to be contextualized alongside a modern acquisition, each archival treasure will be juxtaposed with more current designs from renowned designers like Stella McCartney, Phillip Lim, Yves Saint Laurent, Elsa Schiaparelli and Christian Dior , all mimicking the same structural concept as its counterpart.\n\nThrough careful conservation, the organic essence of each textile piece will be classified into three zones or sections: land, sea and sky. In doing so, the idea is to highlight views of the natural world, how the perception of these spaces has changed and how they have been configured in fashion. In other words, we will be able to see the evolution of nature and how it was developed by the inventors of the industry.\n\nStandout pieces from Alexander McQueen, such as the knife-shaped dress from Voss' Spring/Summer 2001 collection and the mesmerizing butterfly dress from Sarah Burton's debut collection at the fashion house in 2011, will be featured.\n\nOverall, Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion intends to unearth tangible pieces of history, some of which were buried years ago, to motivate conversation about natural elements and emotion, as well as to pay homage to the intimacy between a garment and its wearer with the transformative power of today's technology.\n\nAs for this year's dress code, Voguelooked at the romantic notion of eternal beauty with The Garden of Time. The title is the same as JG Ballard's 1962 story, inspired by a devastating dystopian vision detailing the story of Count Axel, the Countess, and their intrinsic crystalline garden with time-controlling properties. Count Axel is forced into a paradox: he must pick each flower to reverse time and prevent an angry mob from destroying the peaceful estate.\n\nDepending on the focus of the exhibition and the dress code of the gala, we can expect to see the stars attending the Met Gala, the Costume Institute's annual benefit held on the first Monday in May, in period pieces on measure or revisited that channel all or one of the sections with embellishments reflecting on the preservation of the environment.\n\nDesigners often collaborate with celebrities to create interpretations of looks from past runway shows, but this time they will most likely imagine traditional structures, constructed with organic fabrics and materials. Looks should implement a historical aspect, recalling the evolution of fashion in tandem with conversations and feelings about climate and landscape. We can see many creatives exploiting figures from the Elizabethan era, playing with long, full silhouettes. Floral details or rosettes are also to be expected. But one guarantee for the Met Gala every year is that the stars dress up with absolutely no intention of being themed. Rihanna's Iconic 'Omelette' Dress (2015): Rihanna turned heads in a yellow gown by Chinese designer Guo Pei, which drew comparisons to a luxurious omelette. The voluminous train and intricate detailing made it one of the most talked-about looks of the night.\n\nAlso Read | Director Harikumar Dies at 70: From Ashokan's Jaalakam to Mammootty's Sukrutham, 7 Notable Malayalam Films Made By Late Filmmaker and Where to Watch Them Online.\n\n2. Katy Perry's Chandelier Ensemble (2019): Katy Perry lit up the red carpet in a chandelier-inspired outfit by Moschino. Complete with working lights and crystal embellishments, the whimsical ensemble perfectly captured the gala's theme of 'Camp: Notes on Fashion.'\n\n3. Bjork's Swan Dress (2001): Icelandic singer Bjork made a surreal entrance at the Met Gala in a swan-shaped dress designed by Marjan Pejoski. The avant-garde ensemble, complete with a nest-like headdress, left a lasting impression on attendees and fashion enthusiasts alike.\n\nAlso Read | Preity Zinta Is Waiting for 'Good Script' to Collab With Salman Khan, Reveals Her Fave Film With Superstar.\n\n4. Paired with a black gown by H&M, the fiery accessory added drama to her ensemble.\n\n5. Jared Leto's Head-Turning Gucci Ensemble (2019): Jared Leto embraced the theme of 'Camp: Notes on Fashion' with a striking Gucci ensemble that featured a replica of his own head as an accessory. The surreal look sparked a mix of awe and confusion among onlookers.\n\n6. Katy Perry's Moschino Hamburger Dress (2019): Katy Perry returned to the Met Gala in another attention-grabbing ensemble, this time dressed as a larger-than-life hamburger. Designed by Jeremy Scott for Moschino, the playful outfit showcased the singer's sense of humour.\n\n9. Billy Porter's Egyptian-Inspired Entrance (2019): Billy Porter stole the show at the 2019 Met Gala with a jaw-dropping entrance carried by six shirtless men, channelling ancient Egyptian royalty. The custom-made ensemble by The Blonds featured intricate gold embellishments and a dramatic wingspan, solidifying Porter's status as a fashion icon.\n\n10. Kim Kardashian's all-black Balenciaga look (2021): Kim caused a stir by donning a full black ensemble that concealed her well-known visage. She appeared fully made up underneath the face covering. This choice wasn't her favourite, as she resisted it initially, questioning the need to obscure her face. However, Balenciaga's creative director, Demna Gvasalia, and the team insisted that the outfit was appropriate for a costume gala, emphasizing the theme over conventional notions of beauty, as per E! {"uri": "8113838796", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "13:06:10", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T13:06:10Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T13:05:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4313725531101227, "url": "https://people.com/all-about-the-mark-hotel-in-new-york-city-where-stars-get-glam-for-met-gala-2024-8641107", "title": "All About The Mark Hotel, Where the Biggest Celebrities Get Glam for the Met Gala", "body": "The five-star hotel located on New York City's Upper East Side draws a slew of stars to its suites to primp and prep for the biggest night in fashion held on the first Monday in May in each year.\n\nConveniently located just four blocks away from the Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Mark has served as a luxurious space for celebrities, designers and their glam squads to perfect their looks prior to hitting the museum's famed steps and heading inside to the Anna Wintour-hosted ball.\n\nThis year's no different! Etienne Haro, general manager of The Mark, tells PEOPLE exclusively that they're expecting around 60 celebrity guests on May 6 in addition to their respective talent and glam teams. Previous guests on Met Gala day include Cardi B, Kendall and Kylie Jenner, Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade and Gigi Hadid.\n\n\"The Mark is booked out well ahead of Met Gala day,\" he says, noting that the hotel's sales team starts \"receiving enquiries from the moment the annual theme is revealed.\" (The Met Gala's theme for 2024, titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" was announced back in November 2023.)\n\nThe sixteen-story building offers 106 rooms, 46 suites and 1 penthouse suite -- but among the busiest quarters of the nearly-century old hotel is its striking lobby, particularly in the hours leading up to the fashion f\u00eate.\n\n\"The energy on the day is incredible. It goes crescendo starting with the positioning of the red carpet early in the morning, followed by the delivery of the flowers and the arrival of the glam squads,\" Haro says. \"As the day progresses, the intensity is palpable.\"\n\nBeing fashionably late the ball is simply not an option for the Met Gala, which explains why Haro says \"there is a real sense of urgency\" up until the stars' head on their way. \"Minutes before the first departure, the lobby suddenly clears. What follows is two hours of the most incredible display of fashion.\"\n\nHaro adds: \"The Met Gala's reputation as 'fashion's biggest night' is certainly not an overstatement -- and nor is ours, as 'the starriest hotel lobby in the world.'\"\n\nRead on for everything to know about The Mark ahead of the highly-anticipated sartorial scene.\n\nBuilt in 1926, The Mark was designed in a neo-Italian Renaissance-style and erected by architects Schwartz & Gross. The landmark building blends modern luxury with quintessential charm of old New York.\n\nThe hotel is located at 25 East 77th Street, on the corner of 77th Street and Madison Avenue on New York's Upper East Side. Its neighborhood is perfectly situated near Manhattan hotspots, including the \"The Met\" and Central Park. Plus, a number of art galleries, restaurants and high-end shops are in the vicinity.\n\nCelebrities grace The Mark red carpet prior to hitting the Met Gala's covered steps, a tradition that began when the hotel reopened in 2009. It serves as the ultimate sartorial send off of stars following their anticipated outfit reveals.\n\nHaro tells PEOPLE the \"natural light, elegance, comfort, privacy and ultra-personalized service\" of The Mark are \"key attributes\" that celebrities and their glam teams enjoy as they prepare for the big night. Plus, he says guests can \"rest, dress and celebrate all in the same space.\"\n\nSnagging an invite to the Met Gala is hard, but booking a room on Met Gala day is equally exclusive! Haro says the hotel is \"booked out well ahead\" of the ball, with inquiries starting when the \"theme is revealed\" and the \"first guests receive confirmation of their attendance.\"\n\nThe Mark's interior houses 106 rooms and 46 suites. \"We host about 60 celebrity guests over the period,\" Haro tells PEOPLE, noting that the \"the finest talents of the fashion world\" including designers, make-up artists, facialists, jewelers and more also fill up the space.\n\n\"The 153 rooms at The Mark are a rare commodity on Met Gala day,\" Haro says. Fortunately, he praises the sales team's \"tremendous job\" throughout the booking process to understand their guests' needs and requirements ahead of the rush to \"avoid disappointment.\"\n\nParisian interior designer Jacques Grange is the mastermind behind The Mark's sophisticated, yet vibrant inside. The mesmerizing black and white striped floors synonymous with the hotel were conceived by the French visionary, who's portfolio of clients includes everyone from late fashion icon Yves Saint Laurent to the Princess of Monaco.\n\nIn addition to its 106 rooms and 46 suites, The Mark houses 1 penthouse suite. In fact, it's the largest penthouse in the United States at more than 10,000 square feet including 2,500 square feet of rooftop terrace overlooking Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and breathtaking cityscape.\n\n\"The Mark Penthouse is nothing short of spectacular!\" says Haro, noting its five-bedroom suite over two floors and panoramic views over N.Y.C. \"It is a highly coveted accommodation on Met Gala [Monday], and one of the first suites we book each year.\"\n\nHaro was tight lipped on some of the starriest celebrities who have stayed in the penthouse suite, though he revealed, \"The booker has actually been the same for the past few years and it is the venue of one of the Gala's famous afterparties.\"\n\nThe Mark Restaurant By Jean-Georges and Caviar Kaspia are two high-end dining options in The Mark hotel -- and on Met Gala day, they're on go mode.\n\n\"Room Service runs on a tight flow,\" Haro says, noting that the majority of the guests remain on the property. Plus, abcV, the plant-forward concept from Jean-Georges will have a pop-up on Met Gala day, offering guests exciting, plant-based dishes.\n\nHaro pointed out a few memorable \"special requests\" guests had in years past. He said someone once asked for \"a continuous flow of fried chicken!\"\n\nAs for the \"most ordered\" item on Met Gala day? Surprisingly not champagne, says Haro, rather coffee. \"We serve an average of three cups per minute throughout the day!\" he reveals.\n\nThe elevators in The Mark are strategically monitored on Met Gala day. \"This is one of the most critical aspects of the day,\" Haro says.\n\nFrom the floors to the streets surrounding the hotel and everywhere in between, he says The Mark has a \"core team of forty collaborators\" who help coordinate a celebrity's departure from the building.\n\n\"Elevators are operated manually and sent for pick-up as soon as the floor team advises of an imminent departure,\" Haro explains. \"The celebrity's journey is monitored so that our transportation coordinators can get the right car in front of the hotel at the right time and ensure the process is flawless.\"\n\nHaro says \"timing is essential on the day,\" so for the system to work seamlessly, he says \"it requires a perfect coordination between many stakeholders.\"\n\nDue to the large number of notable names and prominent figures staying at The Mark during the Met Gala, Haro says \"securing the event is critical\" to ensure everyone \"feels safe and comfortable\" as they prepare for the big night.\n\n\"On the day itself, the street is cleared and access to The Mark is limited to our guests and their teams,\" he explains. \"The Mark has established itself as the home of many high-profile guests, so our security team is trained to handle the crowds that such a day brings.\"\n\nHaro adds, \"We also receive the support of the NYPD, whose officers do an incredible job.\"\n\nThe Mark has many standout amenities, including a salon home to the flagship of celebrity hairdresser Frederic Fekkai. \"He and his team have a very big day,\" Haro says in reference to the Met Gala.\n\nThe hotel also prides itself in providing guests the quintessential N.Y.C. experience, but making it luxurious at the same time! The Mark Hautedog Cart is among the highlights, serving up guests the classic barbecued dish but prepared in the gourmet kitchen of Jean-Georges.\n\nAll members of a guest's family are invited to stay at The Mark -- dogs, too! Known to be \"one of the most dog-friendly hotels in New York,\" it offers amenities for your four-legged friends to enjoy (including a special dog menu curated by Jean-Georges!).", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8113490182", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "09:18:57", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T09:18:57Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T09:18:23Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4235294163227081, "url": "https://www.independent.co.uk/tv/culture/met-gala-2024-phone-rule-ban-b2540201.html", "title": "This is the one rule celebrities must not break at the Met Gala", "body": "The Met Gala 2024 is set to get underway this evening (6 May), but for the A-lister attending, there's still rules they have to follow.\n\nArguably the most infamous of the event's history is that no phones are allowed - which makes the iconic 'bathroom selfies' over the years even more special for fans.\n\nAnna Wintour wants all of the details inside the Met Museum kept under wraps, and anyone caught even sneaking a peek at their phone could risk a permanent ban from all future Met Galas.", "source": {"uri": "independent.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Independent"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Wintour", "type": "person", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "Anna Wintour"}}], "categories": [{"uri": "dmoz/Recreation/Humor/Useless_Pages", "label": "dmoz/Recreation/Humor/Useless Pages", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "dmoz/Society/Transgendered/Coming_Out", "label": "dmoz/Society/Transgendered/Coming Out", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "dmoz/Recreation/Pets/Free_Services", "label": "dmoz/Recreation/Pets/Free Services", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "dmoz/Recreation/Collecting/Autographs", "label": "dmoz/Recreation/Collecting/Autographs", "wgt": 100}], "image": "https://cdn.jwplayer.com/v2/media/chPZIjqY/poster.jpg?width=720", "originalArticle": null, "storyUri": "eng-9541694", "eventUri": "eng-9541694", "location": null, "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "imp": true, "date": "2024-05-06", "textStart": 55, "textEnd": 60}], "sentiment": -0.2470588235294118, "wgt": 108, "relevance": 1}
{"uri": "8114126383", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:21:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:21:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:21:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4235294163227081, "url": "https://expressdigest.com/met-gala-2024-anna-wintours-very-cryptic-response-when-asked-about-taylor-swift-attending-fashions-hottest-night-of-the-year/", "title": "Met Gala 2024: Anna Wintour's very cryptic response when asked about Taylor Swift attending fashion's hottest night of the year", "body": "Anna Wintour has reignited speculation that Taylor Swift could be in attendance at this year's Met Gala, an annual fundraising event known as 'fashion's biggest night out.'\n\nJenna Bush Hager conducted a face-to-face interview with Vogue's global editorial director, and later confirmed to her Today cohosts that she had asked the 74-year-old whether or not Taylor, 34, would be walking the famous steps on Monday evening.\n\nRecalling how the exchange went down, Jenna, 42, referred to her eldest daughter and said: 'I also had to ask, because Mila Hager asked if Taylor was gonna be there, and she (Anna) said, \"I hope she comes and enjoys the exhibit.\"\n\n'So that could be yes, that could be no, which is what the reports are sort of saying,' Jenna added, with cohosts Hoda Kotb, Savannah Guthrie, Sheinelle Jones, and Craig Melvin appearing to be very intrigued.\n\nAnna Wintour has reignited speculation that Taylor Swift could be in attendance at this year's Met Gala\n\nTaylor, 34, last attended the prestigious NYC fashion event back in May 2016\n\nAnna sat down for an exclusive interview with Today's Jenna Bush Hager\n\n'And your accent is on point,' Hoda, 59, joked as Sheinelle, 46, - who is attending the Met Gala on Monday evening - admitted: 'You just made me excited.'\n\nElsewhere in the exclusive interview, Jenna asked Anna to confirm whether or not itt was true that chives, onion and garlic had been banned from the menu on the star-studded night.\n\n'Those are three things I'm not particularly fond of, and so yes, that's true,' she replied with a grin on her face.\n\nAnna also admitted that there may have been some 'confusion' when it came to this year's theme, which was Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, and said that this year's exhibition broke her 'cardinal rule.'\n\n'We came up with the title Sleeping Beauties. It's wonderful, it's poetic, its romantic, but actually it could be many, many things,' she told Jenna.\n\nThat, paired with the Garden of Time dress code, she said, may have caused mixed signals.\n\n'I fear we have unleashed a lot of confusion out there for which I deeply apologize,' she added.\n\nWhen asked how she feels in the days leading up to the Met Gala, Anna revealed: 'It's relatively quiet. Everything is in the details. We plan these exhibitions in the evening so far in advance that if we're not relatively calm in this point, we're in big, big trouble.'\n\nJenna (left) explained to her Today cohosts what Anna said The stunning ensemble featured a sheer pink floral top embroidered with butterflies, which is most likely a nod to this year's dress code being \"The Garden of Time,\" inspired by a short story by JG Ballard.\n\nThe Dune star completed the glamorous get-up with a pair of white Christian Louboutin pointed heels, wearing her hair in loose waves around her shoulders.\n\nMeanwhile, Lopez opted for a black strapless gown designed by Diana Qerimi. The dress featured crystal-like detailing all over and she added some extra height with a pair of black Casadei platform heels. The singer completed the look with a chic ponytail and a pair of dangling diamond statement earrings.\n\nHemsworth, who attended the dinner with his wife Elsa Pataky, 47, looked dapper in an animal-print design blazer that he wore over a black satin shirt for the dinner. The Thor actor added a pair of dark trousers and some orange-tinted glasses.\n\nPataky opted for a glittering blue sequin blazer and matching hot pants that she teamed with a purple silk blouse and a high ponytail for the evening.\n\nCo-chair Bad Bunny was also pictured arriving for the dinner wearing a dark blazer that he teamed with a simple white T-shirt. It was revealed in January that the pair had welcomed their first child together. So this is, like, my first time back at the Met in quite a while,\" she said during an appearance on Live with Kelly and Mark on April 23.\n\nSpeaking about her stylist Law Roach, who she's been working with since she was 14, the star said, \"It's fun in the sense that I like to look at fashion as creativity.\"\n\n\"Even in press tours, it's a way to continue the creativity from the film. ... I like to just create characters, because ultimately sometimes, doing this for a living feels a little weird and awkward and I'm more of a shy, introverted person, so I get to create these characters. You'll have to tune in to see, but it's exciting.'\n\nAs for whether Lopez will be able to walk in the mystery look, she scoffed: 'Barely, ever. The Met Gala looks are not about comfort.'\n\nIt will mark the This Time Around singer's 12th time attending Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour's annual Costume Institute benefit beginning in 1999's 'Rock Style' event wearing a cut-out halter gown beside her then boyfriend Sean 'Diddy' Combs.\n\nIn 2021, Jennifer and her then boyfriend Ben Affleck kissed each other while wearing COVID-19 masks at the 'In America'-themed Met Gala - just two years after she kissed then fianc\u00e9 Alex Rodriguez at the 'Camp'-themed 2019 Met Gala while clad in fringed Versace.\n\nLast year was definitely Lopez's best look overall - wearing Ralph Lauren in honor of the late designer Karl Lagerfeld.\n\nDue to alleged poor ticket sales, the Emmy-nominated producer had to cancel shows dated August 20-31 and rebrand her 30-date This Is Me... The Met Gala looks are not about comfort'\n\nIt will mark Jennifer's 12th time attending Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour's annual Costume Institute benefit beginning in 1999's 'Rock Style' event wearing a cut-out halter gown beside her then boyfriend Sean 'Diddy' Combs (L)\n\nIn 2021, Lopez wore western-style Ralph Lauren at the In America-themed Met Gala and she wore silver-fringed Versace at the campy-themed 2019 Met Gala\n\nLast year was definitely the Emmy-nominated producer's best look overall - wearing Ralph Lauren in honor of the late designer Karl Lagerfeld\n\n'It's a small tour. It's like 28 shows. I'm going to hit a few cities. I'm excited! I haven't been out [since] like 2019? Yeah, since before the pandemic. So I'm excited to see the fans and interact with the people again. It's always a good time.'\n\nAs for whether or not Lopez's 16-year-old fraternal twins - Emme Mu\u00f1iz and Max Mu\u00f1iz (with ex-husband #2 Marc Anthony) - will be joining her on the road, she revealed they're still negotiating the terms.\n\n'I'm out for like two months from June to August, so I was like, \"You have to come out for the whole month of July. You can, like, go to camp and do whatever you want with your friends in June, and then at the end of August before you start school you can go back and hang out with your friends again. But you have to come with Mommy for a little while!\"' the former Fly Girl - who turns 55 in July - recalled telling them.\n\n'I feel like this is the last time that I'll get to do something like this with them. They're 16. And next time, they're going to be like, \"No, Mom.\" I'm going to use the last little bit of force I have over them and control to be like, \"You have to come at least for a little while, so hopefully they'll acquiesce to that.'\n\nJennifer is currently facing substantial online backlash stemming from her overall unrelatability and cringey, over-the-top vanity projects including This Is Me... Now album, movie, documentary, and tour.\n\nIf you check any of Lopez's TikTok/Instagram posts the comments are filled with people dragging her so-called Bronx roots, blaming her for the death of a TikToker she had shut down, and passing off the vocals of African-American singers (Ashanti, Christina Milian, and Brandy) as her own.\n\nFor instance in 2002, The Greatest Love Story Never Told producer-star not only kept the entire Jenny from the Block chorus and bridge performed by her back-up vocalist Natasha Ramos on the finished record, she even kept her giggles and 'from the Bronx' shout out from the original demo.\n\nDue to alleged poor ticket sales, Jennifer had to cancel shows dated August 20-31 and rebrand her 30-date This Is Me... Now: The Tour (supporting her album that peaked at No. 38 on the Billboard 200) to 'This is Me... Live: The Greatest Hits' tour kicking off June 26\n\nLopez confessed of the tour: 'I wish I could have had the summer off. It's a small tour. It's like 28 shows. I'm going to hit a few cities. The emblematic space will host the fashion exhibition Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion this year and celebrities must follow the dress code The Garden of Time.\n\nRosal\u00eda, Pen\u00e9lope Cruz, Kendall Jenner and Rihanna will be some of the celebrities who will parade down the stairs with their impressive outfits. The hosts of the night will also walk the red carpet: Zendaya, Bad Bunny, Jennifer Lopez and Chris Hemsworth.\n\nThese celebrities did not miss the dinner organized this Sunday night by Anna Wintour, who has been in charge of the gala since 1995. A meeting where they talked about the role that the protagonists will have on Monday night and which was marked by spectacular looks.\n\nZendaya, accompanied by her stylist Law Roach, shone in a vintage dress from John Galliano's Haute Bohemia collection, from 1998. A beautiful slip dress that followed the Coquette trend, with a bow at the neckline and with butterflies and flowers embroidered on the tulle that left her back exposed.\n\nThe protagonist of Challengers completed her look with white pumps with very high heels, her hair combed with a lot of volume and waves, and makeup in pink tones.\n\nChris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky caused a sensation with their looks featuring animal prints. The actor wore a leopard-print velvet jacket, satin shirt and striking aviator-style sunglasses with orange lenses, while the actress joined the controversial No Pants fashion with a very suggestive outfit.\n\nPataky wore a purple blazer with shiny snake-print fabric, a lavender satin shirt and micro shorts, matching the jacket, with which she showed off her toned and tanned legs. She finished off the disco-inspired look with high-heeled sandals and a highly polished ponytail that showed off her hoop earrings.\n\nJennifer Lopez opted for elegant velvet with a design by Diana Qerimi that stood out for its original neckline and for its stones embedded throughout the entire dress that provided a shiny touch. The protagonist of Marry Me also chose to gather her hair in a ponytail to show off some spectacular jewelry.\n\nAnother celebrity who didn't miss the dinner at Wintour's apartment was Sienna Miller, who came with her boyfriend Oli Green. Now will be co-chairing the event for Anna Wintour along with Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth and Bad Bunny.\n\nThe Met Gala returns on May 6 at The Metropolitan Museum of Art.\n\nThe 2024 Costume Institute exhibition, titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion, will feature approximately 250 items drawn from the Costume Institute's permanent collection.\n\nHere is a look back at what JLo has worn during the most important night in fashion.\n\n-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\n1999\n\nThe first time she went to the Met Gala was in 1999.\n\nThe singer was on the arm of her boyfriend at the time, rapper and music producer P Diddy, also known as Puff Daddy and Sean Combs.\n\nThe beauty from the Bronx wore a pink dress with a matching fur jacket with one clasp.\n\nHe was dashing in a white turtleneck and button free coat. The theme was Rock Style.\n\nThe first time Jennifer Lopez attended the Met Gala the singer was on the arm of rapper and music producer P Diddy, also known as Puff Daddy and Sean Combs\n\n2004\n\nLopez had plenty of hits under her belt like Maid In Manhattan and Enough by the time she attended the Met Gala in 2004.\n\nAnd the box office dynamo knew to look her very best when hitting the carpet.\n\nThe diva was in a black lace tiered dress when she posed with Stefano Gabbana and Domenico Dolce at the event.\n\nHer hair was up in a Swedish braid and she wore ruby red lipstick that made her look like a world class movie icon.\n\nThe diva was in a black lace tiered dress when she posed with Stefano Gabbana and Domenico Dolce at the event\n\n2006\n\nLopez hit her stride in 2006.\n\nThe star, whose recent hit was El Cantante, was polished to perfection.\n\nThe Jenny From The Block crooner opted for a one-shoulder gown in a soft white color with a sheer mermaid finish and her hair down.\n\nThe designer was Versace.\n\nShe added long earrings and carried a clutch purse for a very slick look.\n\nThe theme was Anglomania: Tradition and Transgression in British Fashion.\n\nIt was a drastic change in 2006 as Jenny From The Block opted for a one-shoulder gown in a soft white color with a sheer mermaid finish and her hair down\n\n2007\n\nLopez was promoting her drama Bordertown when she hit the Met Gala in 2007.\n\nThere was a 1920s influence for her look which was a stunning show of metallic.\n\nThe brown-eyes babe had on a shimmery silver dress from Marchesa that was off the shoulder and had a dazzling belt.\n\nHer glam was perfect too. She added a sparkly hair clip on her curly bob. The clip matched her earrings and clutch purse.\n\nThe theme was Poiret: King of Fashion.\n\nThere was a 1920s influence for this shimmery silver dress that was off the shoulder and had a dazzling belt as she added a hair clip that matched her earrings and clutch purse\n\n2008\n\nIn the year 2008 the Wedding Planner actress went with a more feminine look from Alberta Ferretti.\n\nLopez had on a dusty green one-strap gown with heavy embellishments on the neckline and several folds.\n\nHer strawberry red hair was worn in soft waves and she had on an oversized cuff that matched her drop earrings earrings.\n\nAt the time, she was about to start filming her romantic comedy movie The Backup Plan.\n\nIn the year 2008 the Wedding Planner actress went with a more feminine look as she had on a dusty green one-strap gown with heavy embellishments on the neckline and several folds\n\n2010\n\nThis year the star returned to dramatic Hollywood glamour.\n\nJennifer looked toned and tanned in a remarkable sparkly strapless silver Cinderella style dress with a sweetheart neckline.\n\nThe designer was Zuhair Murad.\n\nThe songbird wore her hair up with bangs framing her face as she added diamond earrings.\n\nShe held onto a dazzling clutch purse.\n\nThis year the Back-Up Plan star returned to Hollywood glamour with a sparkly strapless silver Cinderella style dress as she wore her hair up\n\n2011\n\nThe Parker star made sure to stand out in 2011 with a look from Gucci.\n\nShe was red-y for her closeup!\n\nThe silver screen goddess went for a ruby look with a halter dress and flowers on her shoulders with a matching pout.\n\nLopez had her hair pulled back dramatically so the focus could be on her face.\n\nHer date was husband Marc Anthony whom she wed in 2004 and had twins Max and Emme with.\n\nThe Parker star went for a ruby look with a halter dress and flowers on her shoulders with a matching pout as she had her hair pulled back dramatically; seen with Casper Smart\n\n2015\n\nIt was a Versace moment for the Boy Next Door star as she modeled a red hot Versace gown.\n\nThe movie icon had on mostly sheer dress with red sequins over her private parts; the design to be of a dragon.\n\nAgain, she went with only one strap.\n\nHer hair was worn down and she had on gold earrings with red eye shadow.\n\nThe theme was China: Through the Looking Glass.\n\nIt was a Versace moment for the Boy Next Door star who had on mostly sheer dress with red sequins. {"uri": "8112438623", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "14:20:56", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T14:20:56Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T14:18:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.3803921639919281, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/every-time-jennifer-lopez-went-141500840.html", "title": "Every Time Jennifer Lopez Went to the Met Gala", "body": "The multi-hyphenate has made more than a dozen appearances at fashion's biggest night ahead of her co-chair gig this year\n\nJenny from the Block is headed back to the Met!\n\nWhile Jennifer Lopez is no stranger to fashion's biggest night -- making her first appearance way back in 1999 -- this year will be different for the star, as she is one of the event's four co-chairs.\n\nJoining the likes of Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth, Lopez will be on hand to lead the stream of A-list guests for the event, which this year comes with a dress code of \"The Garden of Time\" for the Costume Institute's spring exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\nAhead of this year's big event on May 6, take a look back on two decades of J.Lo's Met Gala looks.\n\nAfter walking the Met Gala steps with Sean \"Diddy\" Combs in 1999, Jennifer Lopez made her solo carpet debut in 2004 in Dolce & Gabbana alongside Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana for the year's theme of \"Dangerous Liaisons: Fashion and Furniture in the 18th Century.\"\n\nTwo years later, Jenny from the Block was back and this time in a one-shoulder gown by Versace for the soir\u00e9e themed \"AngloMania: Tradition and Transgression in British Fashion.\"\n\nIn 2007, Jennifer Lopez wore a metallic Marchesa ensemble and her hair styled into an Old Hollywood-inspired 'do for the night titled: \"Poiret: King Of Fashion.\"\n\nJennifer Lopez went for the asymmetrical look once again in 2008 with this blue Alberta Ferretti dress. The year's theme was \"Superheroes: Fashion and Fantasy.\"\n\nFor 2010's \"American Woman: Fashioning a National Identity,\" the \"On the Floor\" singer wore a sparkling strapless Zuhair Murad dress featuring a tulle skirt covered in sequined pieces that certainly reflected the flashbulb lights.\n\nJennifer Lopez went for a pink and feminine Gucci gown for her 2011 choice for the night honoring \"Alexander McQueen: Savage Beauty.\"\n\nIn 2013, Jennifer Lopez styled her hair high on her head to go along with her sequined Michael Kors gown for \"PUNK: Chaos to Couture.\"\n\nWhen it was time to pay homage to \"China: Through The Looking Glass\" in 2015, Jennifer Lopez wore a sheer Versace dress that featured the image of a red dragon.\n\nJennifer Lopez was goddess-like in this blue flowing gown by Valentino for 2017's \"Rei Kawakubo/Comme des Garcons: Art Of The In-Between.\"\n\nIn 2018, Jennifer Lopez was on theme in this dramatic Balmain gown complete with a bedazzled cross for \"Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination.\"\n\nJ.Lo showed off her dress' high slit as she posed on the 2019 pink carpet surrounded by matching florals. For the event, themed \"Camp: Notes On Fashion,\" Lopez was dripping in dazzling strands and accessorized with equally sparkly jewelry -- including a headpiece.\n\nJennifer Lopez tipped her hat to Western influences with her Ralph Lauren ensemble in 2021 that was complete with a couture bustier, crystal embroidery and braided leather trim. Lopez topped off the look -- which was chosen for \"In America: A Lexicon Of Fashion,\" with a wide-brimmed hat.\n\nAnd the star was back in Ralph Lauren for last year's big event in this ab-baring pink and black gown, which she accessorized with a leather beret trimmed with fishnet material. She told La La Anthony at the event, which honored the late Karl Lagerfeld, that while at first she \"wasn't sure about the hat,\" she had come around to it: \"But now I'm kinda feeling it.\"", made her Met Gala red carpet debut in 1999 and has been in attendance more than a dozen times since -- often with a partner or her gown's designer in tow.\n\nThis year will be especially exciting for Lopez because she, alongside Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth, will act as co-chair for the event, a hosting role that involves working months in advance with longtime Met Gala driving force and Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour, as well as showing up early to help set the tone for the evening.\n\nThe co-chairs -- as well as this year's dress code, \"Garden of Time\" -- were announced in a collaborative Instagram video between the Met and the Costume Institute in February that portrayed a cheeky group chat between the four stars and Wintour.\n\nIn anticipation of Lopez's arrival, we took a trip down memory lane to see several of her most iconic looks, from last year's ultra-feminine ensemble featuring a velvet bow train all the way back to 2004 when she posed with designers Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana while wearing one of their signature black lace gowns.\n\nRead on to see more, and check back May 6 to see what's in store for this year's biggest night in fashion.\n\nLopez went for a dramatic black and baby pink look by Ralph Lauren for the gala's 2023 edition honoring the late designer Karl Lagerfeld.\n\nDazzling in another Ralph Lauren look, Lopez channeled the American theme with Western-inspired couture.\n\nFor the Camp ball, the multi-hyphenate star donned a glimmering Versace number complete with a matching beaded fringe wig.\n\nLopez's Catholic upbringing came in as handy inspiration when she wore an opulently beaded Balmain gown complete with a cross chest plate and black feather train.\n\nAt the 2017 installment of the gala to pay homage to Japanese design icon Rei Kawakubo, Lopez went full-on \"Valley of the Dolls\" in a '60s-inspired Valentino gown with an era-perfect updo and makeup look.\n\nSkin was in for J.Lo as she strutted the red carpet alongside Donatella Versace wearing one of the designer's creations, a cascading red sequin dragon that swirled down her body and landed in illusion netting dotted with matching sequin \"flames.\"\n\nThe Met Gala's Punk year inspired Lopez to pull out a sequin animal print gown from Michael Kors, topped with a fauxhawk and smoked-out eyes to capture the spirit of the theme.\n\n2011's gala honored the late Alexander McQueen and inspired Lopez to wear a gown dripping in florals from Gucci, the design house with whom McQueen made a deal that allowed him to expand his empire.\n\nLopez donned a strapless dress by Zuhair Murad that dazzled with its simple A-line silhouette and extravagant appliques.\n\nWearing a very of-its-era Alberta Ferretti gown, Lopez was on trend with the one-shoulder design and voluminous hair for the superheroes-themed night.\n\nThe star shone brighter than ever in her 2007 Marchesa look for the gala, a gown that draped beautifully in keeping with the vision of the paradigm-shifting designer.\n\nPerhaps her least on-theme look came while wearing a relatively conservative, Italian-made Versace gown to the gala meant to honor transgressive British fashion (she looked gorgeous anyway, of course).\n\nLopez wore a showstopping Dolce & Gabbana look -- pictured with a modest fur shawl here -- while posing with the designers for {"uri": "2024-05-345356776", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-05", "time": "09:39:42", "dateTime": "2024-05-05T09:39:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-05T09:30:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.3607843220233917, "url": "https://www.justjared.com/2024/05/05/ranking-rihannas-met-gala-looks-revisit-her-iconic-looks-see-which-one-is-the-best/", "title": "Ranking Rihanna's Met Gala Looks - Revisit Her Iconic Looks & See Which One is the Best!", "body": "After all, few celebrities are as daring and willing to push the boundaries of fashion as the \"Diamonds\" diva. She makes a lasting impression every time that she walks the red carpet. The co-chairs for the evening include Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny, while Vogue's red-carpet hosts will be La La Anthony, Gwendoline Christie, and Ashley Graham, alongside special correspondent Emma Chamberlain.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" - which is not a reference the Disney fairytale. Inside the exhibit, 250 pieces from the Costume Institute's permanent collection will be showcased, some dating back to the Elizabethan period. The idea is to reimagine fragile designs that can never be worn again in new ways through CGI, light projections, soundscaping, and video animation.\n\nGuests will follow a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" a nod to JG Ballard's 1962 tale. The story details Count Axel, his Countess, and their dwindling garden as an angry mob descends on their peaceful home and nursery of crystalline flowers.\n\nAlong with all four co-chairs and the event's organiser Anna Wintour, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson, Cara Delevingne, and Olivia Rodrigo are expected to be at tonight's Met Gala, according to a 13 April {"eng-9541694": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114434224", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "20:53:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T20:53:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T20:53:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/fashion/gigi-hadid-met-gala-2024-thom-browne-b2540464.html", "title": "Gigi Hadid teases her 'Met prep' with Thom Browne outfit for Met Gala 2024", "body": "Gigi Hadid is gearing up for fashion's biggest night of the year: the Met Gala.\n\nJust hours before the 2024 Met Gala, which takes place on Monday 6 May at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City, the 29-year-old supermodel shared a behind the scenes look at her preparation for the annual fashion extravaganza.\n\nOn her Instagram Story, Hadid posted a selfie in the car with a gold foil sheet mask on her face. The mother of one sported a blunt blonde bob hairstyle and sunglasses as she added a sticker of a clock to her Story, signalling the countdown to the Met Gala.\n\nHadid's second Story post showed a glimpse at her supposed Met Gala ensemble for the evening, which appeared to be custom made by American fashion designer Thom Browne. The black and white label included \"Gigi Hadid\" written across it, along with the tagline: \"Met Gala 2024\".\n\n\"Met Prep,\" the Guest In Residence founder captioned another Instagram Story of her pre-Met Gala skincare. Her final social media post featured a close-up image of yellow roses, seemingly a nod to this year's Met Gala dress code, \"The Garden of Time\".\n\nThe Met Gala dress code takes inspiration from a short story of the same title, written by JG Ballard in 1962, which focuses on the theme of fleeting beauty. Attendees can embrace the obvious by wearing florals to represent an actual garden, or wear items that signify the passing of time, like clocks.\n\nIt coincides with the opening of the Costume Institute's annual exhibit, titled \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\", which will be centred around 50 historically significant pieces of fashion - some too fragile ever to be worn again. Nearly 250 items were drawn from the Costume Institute's permanent collection, featuring designs from Elsa Schiaparelli, Yves Saint Laurent, Christian Dior, and Givenchy to span 400 years of fashion history.\n\nThe exhibition will be focused on three main zones: land, sea, and sky. Each \"zone\" will symbolise the natural materials used within it to create garments. By emphasising the natural world and how its been used in fashion throughout time, sustainability will remain a key focus throughout the exhibit.\n\nAlong with Hadid, celebrities confirmed to be in attendance at this year's Met Gala are its co-chairs: Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour, Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Zendaya.\n\nFashion lovers can tune in to the Met Gala 2024 red carpet live stream at 6pm ET on Vogue's website and YouTube account. {"eng-9541694": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114435211", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "20:55:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T20:55:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T20:54:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5921568870544434, "url": "https://www.vogue.com/slideshow/met-gala-2024-red-carpet-see-every-celebrity-look-outfit-and-dress", "title": "Met Gala 2024 Red Carpet: See Every Celebrity Look, Outfit, and Dress", "body": "It's fashion's biggest night! The 2024 Met Gala red carpet is officially underway at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. This year's exhibit, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" examines how technology can breathe new life into garments that are too old and fragile to be worn again.\n\nTonight, guests will ascend the museum's famed steps wearing outfits that nod to the event's \"The Garden of Time\" dress code, and you can see all of the Met Gala 2024 looks right here as the night unfolds. The night's sartorial theme gets its name from a J.G. Ballard story about a count who -- to stave off an angry mob nearing his castle -- cuts a rose from his garden to slow down time until there are no flowers remaining. With the story's dystopian undertones in tandem with the exhibit's emphasis on old and new, we can expect a red carpet filled with everything from florals to techno-inspired fashion -- and maybe even a Sleeping Beauty reference or two.\n\nThe gala, which fundraises for the Metropolitan Museum's Costume Institute, is known for having a very secretive guest list. But while the attendees' names are kept tightly under wraps, we do know of a few people who will grace the carpet in their garden party finery: Bad Bunny, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Zendaya, who are serving as co-chairs alongside Vogue's Anna Wintour.
