All 6 of her outfits, ranked", "body": "The fashion world is waiting with bated breath to see if Taylor Swift will attend this year\u2019s Met Gala, which is titled \u2018Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\u2019 with the dress code The Garden of Time\n\nAlthough the pop icon \u2013 who just released new album The Tortured Poets Department \u2013 was a Met Gala co-chair in 2016, she hasn\u2019t attended the event since \u2026\n\nThe fashion world is abuzz as the 2024 Met Gala is swiftly approaching.\n\nOn May 6 \u2013 the first Monday in May \u2013 stars will gather at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City for the \u201cSleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\u201d gala. The Met Gala red carpet is always exciting, as celebrities reveal their interpretations of the event\u2019s dress code \u2013 which is The Garden of Time for 2024.\n\nBut it\u2019s also thrilling to see which stars ultimately attend the event, since the guest list is kept under wraps. For instance, there have been conflicting reports on whether Taylor Swift will attend the gala after releasing her record-breaking album The Tortured Poets Department.\n\nWhether she attends in 2024 or not, Swift\u2019s legacy at the Met Gala looms large. Take a look back at all the outfits she\u2019s worn to the event, ranked from least to most iconic.6. Taylor Swift\u2019s dress for the 2010 Met Gala was too simple\n\nSwift looked angelic in this white Ralph Lauren Collection gown with its off-the-shoulder sleeves and ruffled hem.\n\nBut the dress was too simple, and instead of elevating it with accessories, Swift instead wore minimal jewellery and kept her hair in a demure updo.\n\nThe look also didn\u2019t explicitly speak to the \u201cAmerican Woman: Fashioning A National Identity\u201d theme, making it a bit of a letdown \u2026 although Ralph Lauren is admittedly a quintessentially American designer.8 of the richest female athletes of 2024 \u2013 net worths, ranked5. The singer\u2019s dress fit the Savage Beauty theme for the 2011 Met Gala, but she could have done more with the look\n\nSwift upped her game for the 2011 \u201cAlexander McQueen: Savage Beauty\u201d gala, arriving in a one-shoulder J. Mendel gown with a mermaid skirt.\n\nThe dress fit the theme thanks to its mix of sheer fabric, layered skirt and contrasting colours.4. Swift\u2019s semi-sheer gown for the 2013 Met Gala was eye-catching\n\nIn one of her most daring looks up to that point, Swift sported another J. Mendel gown for the 2013 \u201cPunk: Chaos to Couture\u201d Met Gala.\n\nThe bodice of the black, floor-length gown was covered in cut-outs of sheer, webbed fabric. A jewelled collar and dramatic, smoky eye make-up completed the daring look, which was well suited to the punk theme.3. Swift\u2019s dress for the 2008 Met Gala hinted at her second album, Fearless\n\nSwift attended her first Met Gala in 2008 wearing a gold ombr\u00e9 gown from Badgley Mischka.\n\nThe dress suited the event\u2019s theme, \u201cSuperheroes: Fashion and Fantasy\u201d, as the head-to-toe embellishments and shape nodded to a mermaid tail. She paired the look with her signature curls worn loose.Who is the richest Sex and the City star in 2024? Net worths, ranked2. Swift stunned in an old Hollywood-inspired look at the 2014 Met Gala\n\nThe theme of the 2014 Met Gala was \u201cCharles James: Beyond Fashion\u201d. Swift arrived in a soft pink Oscar de la Renta gown that was embroidered with delicate flowers. The column dress had a low back and a dramatic train that flowed out from an oversized bow.1. Taylor Swift wore a robot-inspired dress to the 2016 Met Gala\n\nSwift was a Met Gala co-chair in 2016. She walked the Met Gala red carpet in a metallic dress custom designed by Louis Vuitton, a look perfect for the \u201cManus x Machina: Fashion in an Age of Technology\u201d theme. Swift paired the dress with heels that wrapped to her knees.\n\nBleached hair and black lipstick completed the futuristic look, and the departure from Swift\u2019s typically softer looks made it a stand-out.\n\nThis article originally appeared on Business Insider", "source": {"uri": "scmp.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "South China Morning Post"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": Also on the committee is Vogue's Anna Wintour.\n\nThe honorary chairs for the evening are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.\n\n'This year's co-chairs reflect a variety of career achievements, and all have distinct style histories with the Met Gala,' Vogue shared.\n\nThe showcase will feature approximately 250 items drawn from The Costume Institute's permanent collection - with many of the pieces too fragile to ever be worn again.\n\nThe pieces will all be displayed using elements such as AI, GCI, and more while playing up themes of land, sea, and sky.\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.'\n\nGuests expected to attend include the Kardashians, Blake Lively, Hailey Bieber, Sarah Jessica Parker and Timothee Chalamet.\n\nGwendoline Christie, La La Anthony and Ashley Graham are hosting while YouTuber Emma Chamberlain is expected to interview stars on the red carpet.\n\nLast year's gala honored late sky.\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I {"eng-9541694": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114446038", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:05:41", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:05:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:05:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.529411792755127, "url": "https://www.cbsnews.com/sanfrancisco/news/met-gala-2024-theme-explained/", "title": "What is the 2024 Met Gala theme? \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" explained", "body": "NEW YORK - If you're trying to explain the 2024 Met Gala theme, you can look to the classic fable, \"Sleeping Beauty.\"\n\nThis year's theme for the Met Gala stems from the Costume Institute of the Metropolitan Museum of Art's the latest exhibition, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\"\n\n\"When an item of clothing enters our collection, its status is changed irrevocably. What was once a vital part of a person's lived experience is now a motionless 'artwork' that can no longer be worn or heard, touched, or smelled. The exhibition endeavors to reanimate these artworks by re-awakening their sensory capacities through a diverse range of technologies, affording visitors sensorial 'access' to rare historical garments and rarefied contemporary fashions,\" curator Andrew Bolton said. \"By appealing to the widest possible range of human senses, the show aims to reconnect with the works on display as they were originally intended -- with vibrancy, with dynamism, and ultimately with life.\"\n\nThe 2024 theme goes hand-in-hand with the dress code, dubbed \"The Garden of Time.\"\n\nThe Met Gala's dress code is usually quite loosely interpreted by guests and is used as a jumping off point for outfits, making for some memorable red carpet moments.\n\n\"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" is the name of the exhibit the Met Gala will be celebrating.\n\nThe story behind the name has to do with the garments that will be on display. Roughly 250 garments will be shown from the Costume Institute's collection of 33,000 pieces. Many of the ones that will be on display are typically never shown. Some are said to be too fragile to hang, for fear of them falling apart.\n\nInstead, they will lie in glass cases, like the fabled Sleeping Beauty.\n\n\"The Met's innovative spring 2024 Costume Institute exhibition will push the boundaries of our imagination and invite us to experience the multisensory facets of a garment, many of which get lost when entering a museum collection as an object. Sleeping Beauties will heighten our engagement with these masterpieces of fashion by evoking how they feel, move, sound, smell and interact when being worn, ultimately offering a deeper appreciation of the integrity, beauty and artistic brilliance of the works on display,\" Met Museum Director Max Hollein said.\n\nIn an interview Monday before the big event, Hollein said the garments are \"being reawakened using both traditional as well as cutting edge technologies.\"\n\n\"Sleeping Beauty\" is a classic fable of a beautiful princess who is sent into a magical sleep only to be reawakened by the kiss of her true love. It is frequently interpreted as being about how true love will conquer all.\n\n\"The Garden of Time\" is a short story by J.G Ballard that concerns a couple living in a beautiful home.\n\nA mob is slowly making its way toward them, bringing destruction. In the couple's garden grow \"time flowers,\" and each one that is plucked sends the mob back in time, further away from their inevitable arrival at their home. But the garden is no longer growing new flowers, and the destruction of their exquisite home and life together is inevitable.\n\nThe exhibition itself, like a garden, will also be a multisensory experience, designed to stimulate all the senses. The galleries will be arranged \"exploring a different theme inspired by the natural world,\" the Met said. As an example, the floors of one gallery space will be animated with snakes, and the ceiling of another with a projection of birds.\n\n\"Punctuating the exhibition will be a series of 'sleeping beauties' -- garments that can no longer be dressed on mannequins due to their extreme fragility -- that will be displayed in glass 'coffins' allowing visitors to analyze their various states of deterioration as if under a microscope,\" the Met said.\n\nThe Met Gala has had many memorable themes over the years. Last year's theme honored fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld.\n\nIn 2021 and 2022, the \"In America\" theme served as parts one and two of a look back at American fashion through the years.", "source": {"uri": "cbsnews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "CBS News"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleeping_Beauties_(novel)", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Sleeping Beauties (novel)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Metropolitan Museum of Art"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Met_Gala", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Met Gala"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleeping_Beauty", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Sleeping Beauty"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Wintour_Costume_Center", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Anna Wintour Costume Center"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dress_code", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Dress code"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fashion", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Fashion"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Bolton_(curator)", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Andrew Bolton (curator)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fable", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Fable"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curator", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Curator"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_carpet", "type": "wiki", "score": 2, "label": {"eng": "Red carpet"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Museum", "type": "wiki", "score": 2, "label": {"eng": "Museum"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Hollein", "type": "person", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "Max Hollein"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._G._Ballard", "type": "person", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "J. {"eng-9541694": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114460716", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:18:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:18:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:18:06Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.501960813999176, "url": "https://expressdigest.com/met-gala-2024-ashley-graham-kicks-off-the-red-carpet-in-style-rocking-a-busty-black-sequin-floral-gown-on-fashions-biggest-night-in-nyc/", "title": "Met Gala 2024: Ashley Graham kicks off the red carpet in style rocking a busty black sequin floral gown on fashion's biggest night in NYC", "body": "Ashley Graham kicked off the red carpet in style for the 2024 Met Gala on Monday in New York City, dazzling in a busty black sequin gown with floral accents along her waist.\n\nThe model posed up a storm in the dramatic look - which she styled with a very short fringe - as she headed toward the famous steps.\n\nThe Costume Institute's spring exhibition falls on the first Monday in May every year and is held at New York City's Metropolitan Museum of Art.\n\nThis year the event is titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion while the dress code is The Garden of Time.\n\nAshley Graham kicked off the red carpet in style for the 2024 Met Gala on Monday in New York City, dazzling in a black sequin gown and striking bangs\n\nThe model posed up a storm in the dramatic look - which included a very short fringe - as she headed toward the famous steps at the glamorous event\n\nLa La Anthony wore an interesting outfit - which consisted of a mermaid style black and red dress with a closeup of a rose at the bottom half, with lace on her torso and arms. She held a single white pearly rose in her hands\n\nJennifer Lopez, Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth are this year's co-chairs. Also on the committee is Vogue's Anna Wintour.\n\nThe honorary chairs for the evening are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.\n\n'This year's co-chairs reflect a variety of career achievements, and all have distinct style histories with the Met Gala,' Vogue shared.\n\nThe showcase will feature approximately 250 items drawn from The Costume Institute's permanent collection - with many of the pieces too fragile to ever be worn again.\n\nThe pieces will all be displayed using elements such as AI, GCI, and more while playing up themes of land, sea, and sky.\n\nThis year the event is titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion while the dress code is The Garden of Time\n\nLa La Anthony wore an interesting outfit - which consisted of a mermaid style black and red dress with a closeup of a rose at the bottom half, with lace on her torso and arms. She held a single white pearly rose in her hands\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.'\n\nGuests expected to attend include the Kardashians, Blake Lively, Hailey Bieber, Sarah Jessica Parker and Timothee Chalamet.\n\nGwendoline Christie, La La Anthony and Ashley Graham are hosting while YouTuber Emma Chamberlain is expected to interview stars on the red She held a single white pearly rose in her hands\n\nJennifer Lopez, Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth are this year's co-chairs. Also on the committee is Vogue's Anna Wintour.\n\nThe honorary chairs for the evening are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.\n\n'This year's co-chairs reflect a variety of career achievements, and all have distinct style histories with the Met Gala,' Vogue shared.\n\nThe showcase will feature approximately 250 items drawn from The Costume Institute's permanent collection - with many of the pieces too fragile to ever be worn again.\n\nThe pieces will all be displayed using elements such as AI, GCI, and more while playing up themes of land, sea, and sky.\n\nThis year the event is titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion while the dress code is The Garden of Time\n\nLa La Anthony wore an interesting outfit - which consisted of a mermaid style black and red dress with a closeup of a rose at the bottom half, with lace on her torso and arms. She held a single white pearly rose in her hands\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.'\n\nGuests expected to attend include the Kardashians, Blake Lively, Hailey Bieber, {"eng-9541694": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114464813", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:23:31", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:23:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:22:46Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4745098054409027, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/galleries/article-13388933/Met-Gala-2024-Ashley-Graham-kicks-red-carpet-style.html", "title": "Met Gala 2024: Ashley Graham kicks off the red carpet in style", "body": "Ashley Graham kicked off the red carpet in style for the 2024 Met Gala on Monday in New York City, dazzling in a busty black sequin gown with floral accents along her waist. The model posed up a storm in the dramatic look - which she styled with a very short fringe - as she headed toward the famous steps.\n\nThe Costume Institute's spring exhibition falls on the first Monday in May every year and is held at New York City 's Metropolitan Museum of Art. This year the event is titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion while the dress code is The Garden of Time.\n\nLa La Anthony wore an interesting outfit - which consisted of a mermaid style black and red dress with a closeup of a rose at the bottom half, with lace on her torso and arms. She held a single white pearly rose in her hands Gwendoline Christie chose a red and black gown as well - which consisted of a black sheer lace cap and a velvet red frock, adding a dramatic hairstyle.\n\nJennifer Lopez, Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth are this year's co-chairs. Also on the committee is Vogue's Anna Wintour . The honorary chairs for the evening are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.\n\n'This year's co-chairs reflect a variety of career achievements, and all have distinct style histories with the Met Gala ,' Vogue shared.\n\nThe showcase will feature approximately 250 items drawn from The Costume Institute's permanent collection - with many of the pieces too fragile to ever be worn again. The pieces will all be displayed using elements such as AI, GCI, and more while playing up themes of land, sea, and sky.\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.' Guests expected to attend include the Kardashians, Blake Lively, Hailey Bieber, Sarah Jessica Parker and Timothee Chalamet.\n\nGwendoline Christie, La La Anthony and Ashley Graham are hosting while YouTuber Emma Chamberlain is expected to interview stars on the red carpet. Last year's gala honored late designer Karl Lagerfeld.\n\nWant more stories like this from the Daily Mail? {"eng-9541694": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114464813", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:23:31", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:23:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:22:46Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4745098054409027, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/galleries/article-13388933/Met-Gala-2024-Ashley-Graham-kicks-red-carpet-style.html", "title": "Met Gala 2024: Ashley Graham kicks off the red carpet in style", "body": "Ashley Graham kicked off the red carpet in style for the 2024 Met Gala on Monday in New York City, dazzling in a busty black sequin gown with floral accents along her waist. The model posed up a storm in the dramatic look - which she styled with a very short fringe - as she headed toward the famous steps.\n\nThe Costume Institute's spring exhibition falls on the first Monday in May every year and is held at New York City 's Metropolitan Museum of Art. This year the event is titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion while the dress code is The Garden of Time.\n\nLa La Anthony wore an interesting outfit - which consisted of a mermaid style black and red dress with a closeup of a rose at the bottom half, with lace on her torso and arms. She held a single white pearly rose in her hands Gwendoline Christie chose a red and black gown as well - which consisted of a black sheer lace cap and a velvet red frock, adding a dramatic hairstyle.\n\nJennifer Lopez, Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth are this year's co-chairs. Also on the committee is Vogue's Anna Wintour . The honorary chairs for the evening are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.\n\n'This year's co-chairs reflect a variety of career achievements, and all have distinct style histories with the Met Gala ,' Vogue shared.\n\nThe showcase will feature approximately 250 items drawn from The Costume Institute's permanent collection - with many of the pieces too fragile to ever be worn again. The pieces will all be displayed using elements such as AI, GCI, and more while playing up themes of land, sea, and sky.\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.' Guests expected to attend include the Kardashians, Blake Lively, Hailey Bieber, Sarah Jessica Parker and Timothee Chalamet.\n\nGwendoline Christie, La La Anthony and Ashley Graham are hosting while YouTuber Emma Chamberlain is expected to interview stars on the red carpet. Last year's gala honored late designer Karl Lagerfeld.\n\nWant more stories like this from the Daily Mail? The model posed up a storm in the dramatic look - which she styled with a very short fringe - as she headed toward the famous steps.\n\nThe Costume Institute's spring exhibition falls on the first Monday in May every year and is held at New York City 's Metropolitan Museum of Art. This year the event is titled Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion while the dress code is The Garden of Time.\n\nLa La Anthony wore an interesting outfit - which consisted of a mermaid style black and red dress with a closeup of a rose at the bottom half, with lace on her torso and arms. She held a single white pearly rose in her hands Gwendoline Christie chose a red and black gown as well - which consisted of a black sheer lace cap and a velvet red frock, adding a dramatic hairstyle.\n\nJennifer Lopez, Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Chris Hemsworth are this year's co-chairs. Also on the committee is Vogue's Anna Wintour . The honorary chairs for the evening are Loewe creative director Jonathan Anderson and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.\n\n'This year's co-chairs reflect a variety of career achievements, and all have distinct style histories with the Met Gala ,' Vogue shared.\n\nThe showcase will feature approximately 250 items drawn from The Costume Institute's permanent collection - with many of the pieces too fragile to ever be worn again. The pieces will all be displayed using elements such as AI, GCI, and more while playing up themes of land, sea, and sky.\n\n'It is very much an ode to nature and the emotional poetics of fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, of the upcoming exhibition.\n\n'One thing I hope this show will activate is that sensorial appreciation of fashion.' {"eng-9541694": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8114458371", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "21:24:38", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T21:24:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T21:16:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7568627595901489, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/met-gala-2024-stream-red-170828965.html", "title": "Met Gala 2024 live updates: Anna Wintour arrives in all black as 'Sleeping Beauties' red carpet begins", "body": "The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City will be filled this evening by beloved musicians, transformative artists, emblem designers, famed actors, and celebrity influencers to celebrate The Costume Institute's spring 2024 exhibit, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\". The co-chairs for the evening include Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny, while Vogue's red-carpet hosts will be La La Anthony, Gwendoline Christie, and Ashley Graham, alongside special correspondent Emma Chamberlain.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" - which is not a reference the Disney fairytale. Inside the exhibit, 250 pieces from the Costume Institute's permanent collection will be showcased, some dating back to the Elizabethan period. The idea is to reimagine fragile designs that can never be worn again in new ways through CGI, light projections, soundscaping, and video animation.\n\nGuests will follow a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" a nod to JG Ballard's 1962 tale. The story details Count Axel, his Countess, and their dwindling garden as an angry mob descends on their peaceful home and nursery of crystalline flowers.\n\nAlong with all four co-chairs and the event's organiser Anna Wintour, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson, Cara Delevingne, and Olivia Rodrigo are expected to be at tonight's Met Gala, according to a 13 April Page Six report.\n\nThe broadcast of the 2024 Met Gala red carpet will begin at 6pm ET, with the event streaming on Vogue's TikTok and YouTube account.\n\n22:13 , Chelsea Ritschel\n\nAlthough Gigi Hadid has not yet arrived at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, she's teasing her look for the night.\n\nThe supermodel has revealed that she will be wearing Thom Browne on the green and white carpet. You can find everything we know about Hadid's look below.\n\nGigi Hadid teases her 'Met prep' with Thom Browne outfit for Met Gala 2024\n\n22:06 , Chelsea Ritschel\n\nAnna Wintour has officially arrived at the Met Gala. The Vogue editor chose a white and black look for the fashion extravaganza, with Wintour posing on the green and white carpet in a white gown and a black floral-embroidered jacket.\n\nWintour's arrival means the Met Gala is officially underway!\n\n22:00 , Amber Raiken\n\nDuring an interview with People, published on 6 May, actor Chase Stokes opened up about being cordially invited to the fashion event. He also specified that when he received the invitation, he was with his girlfriend, Kelsea Ballerini.\n\n\"This is actually a crazy story,\" the Outerbanks star told the publication, as he'll be attending the Met Gala for the first time tonight. \"I had just flown from Morocco to Atlanta to do re-shoots for a movie with Netflix. It was a 26-hour travel day. I worked all day and then I had the next morning to do something. I was on the way to the aquarium with my girlfriend and we got the call. I was like, 'Oh my God, we're going to the Met.'\"\n\nHe added that when he and his partner got the call, it was \"a very wild moment\" that he would \"never, ever forget\".\n\n21:47 , Chelsea Ritschel\n\nIt's still early in the night, which means we have hours yet before some of the biggest names grace the steps of The Met. However, fans outside of the museum are hopeful for glimpses of their favourites.\n\nSpeaking to Kaleigh Werner from across the street of the museum, Carly Fox said she is not entirely sure who she's most excited to see tonight, but she's eager to see Zendaya.\n\n\"Definitely Zendaya for sure, but I'm eager to see Sabrina Carpenter,\" she said.\n\nClaire, who also lined up for the chance to see A-listers as they enter the gala, said she's \"hoping to see Taylor Swift\" but she's \"not sure she'll go\".\n\n\"I'm also hoping to see Blake Lively because she's consistently one of my favourite dressed at The Met.\"\n\n21:43 , Amber Raiken\n\nZendaya will be walking the red carpet at the Met Gala tonight, as this is the first time she's attended the event since 2019. During an episode of Live with Kelly & Mark last month, the Euphoria star described why she's nervous about going to the 2024 Met Gala, where she's one of the co-chairs.\n\n\"I first went when I was 18 years old, and Law [Roach] and I, my stylist, we've been working together since I was like 14 years old. But I remember being 18 and it was such an exciting and new experience,\" she said. \"But still terrifying.\"\n\nZendaya continued: \"Going up the steps is very daunting, and I haven't been back for maybe four or five years. So this is, like, my first time back at the Met in quite a while.\"\n\nZendaya reveals why it's 'terrifying' to go to the Met Gala\n\n21:39 , Chelsea Ritschel\n\nThe red carpet has officially begun, with celebrities beginning to make their way to the famous Metropolitan Museum of Art.\n\nYou can find all of the best-dressed stars on this year's green and white carpet below.\n\nDuring an episode of Today, which aired on 6 May, Jenna Bush Hager opened up about her one-on-one chat with Anna Wintour, leading up to the 2024 Met Gala. She noted that when she took the opportunity to ask Wintour if Taylor Swift would be at the fashion event this year, the Vogue Editor-in-Chief simply responded: \"I hope she comes and enjoys the exhibit.\"\n\nBush Hager then acknowledged how Wintour's comment left room for interpretation about Swift's attendance, adding: \"So that could be yes, that could be no.\"\n\nWhile nothing is confirmed yet, Wintour's remark came as there have been various reports that Swift won't be at the Met Gala. According to a report shared by TMZ last month, Swift and her boyfriend, Travis Kelce, both received invitations to the event, which is in support of the Metropolitan Museum of Art's coveted costume institution.\n\nHowever, Swift will not be attending because the gala falls during the same week her Eras Tour will be returning from its break with a concert in Paris. This is no definitive reason why Kelce will not be going to the Met Gala, but TMZ reported he's likely skipping it because his girlfriend won't be there.\n\n21:23 , Kaleigh Werner\n\nWith just a few hours left until attendees begin to arrive on the red carpet, the streets outside of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City have filled with fans eager to see their favourite A-listers.\n\n21:00 , Amber Raiken\n\nDuring an appearance on Good Morning America, hours before the Met Gala, event co-chair Jennifer Lopez made a quip about her look for the red carpet. When asked if she'll be able to walk in her outfit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art tonight, she said: \"Barely, ever.\"\n\nHowever, she expressed that she didn't necessarily have an issue with that lack of mobility, adding: \"The Met gala looks...are not about comfort.\"\n\n20:15 , Amber Raiken\n\nDuring a conversation with Today host Jenna Bush Hager, aired on 6 May, Anna Wintour confirmed that chives, onion, and garlic are never a part of the food menu at the Met Gala. \"Those are three things I'm not fond of,\" she said.\n\nShe also opened up about cell phone use being banned from inside the gala, specifically during dinner time.\n\n\"It's often wonderful to hear after dinner, people say, 'Oh we had the most wonderful conversations,'\" Wintour said. \"That's the idea, that life can exist without a picture on your cell phone.\n\n19:45 , Amber Raiken\n\nHours before the fashion extravaganza, Marc Jacobs took to Instagram to tease that he'll be styling celebrities at this year's Met Gala. Along with a photo of four black silhouettes on Instagram, the caption of the post reads: \"Can you guess who Marc's dressing for tonight's Met Gala?\"\n\nIn the comments, many fans have gone on to guess which celebrity Jacobs could be styling, such as influencer Alex Consani, YouTube star Emma Chamberlain, model Hailey Bieber, or actor Jenna Ortega.\n\n19:00 , Amber Raiken\n\nFans have lined up outside the Metropolitan Museum of Art this afternoon, in anticipation of celebrities' upcoming arrival at the fashion extravaganza. While outside of the museum in New York City, people were also given pieces of tonight's red carpet, which were green and beige.\n\n18:15 , Amber Raiken\n\nDuring an interview with Jenna Bush Hager for Today, which aired on 6 May, Anna Wintour discussed the theme of the 2024 gala: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" and the inspiration behind its dress code, \"The Garden of Time.\"\n\n\"This exhibition broke my cardinal rule,\" she said. \"When we came up with the title 'Sleeping Beauties,' it's wonderful and poetic and romantic, but actually, it could be many, many things.\"\n\nThe Editor-in-Chief of Vogue recalled that when establishing the theme, she turned to the Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, Andrew Bolton, for advice on what celebrities could wear. She also acknowledged that amid those conversations about outfits, the public was then confused about that dress code.\n\n\"I said, 'What are we gonna say to people to wear to this night?' And he said, 'Well, what about 'Garden of Time?'\" she explained. \"So, I fear that we've unleashed a lot of confusion out there, and for which I deeply apologise.\"\n\n17:30 , Amber Raiken\n\nOver the weekend, the Metropolitan Museum of Art prepared for its annual fashion extravaganza by setting up its iconic tent, which celebrities step into when entering the gala.\n\nThis year, the front of the white tent includes a graphic of a rose, as it reads: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" The tent name is a reference to the theme of the gala, which intends to dig up tangible pieces of history, some of which were put to rest years ago, to motivate conversation about natural elements and emotion, as well as pay homage to the intimacy between a garment and its wearer with the transformative power of current technology.\n\n16:54 , Amber Raiken\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala co-chairs - Chris Hemsworth, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny - are guaranteed to be at the event tonight, along, with the gala's hosts and sponsors: Loewe's creative director, Jonathan Anderson and TikTok's CEO, Shou Zi Chew.\n\nAccording to a 13 April Page Sixreport, Lily Gladstone and Ayo Edebiri are two newcomers to the Met Gala invite list this year. Additionally, a source speaking to the outlet said Gisele B\u00fcndchen, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Cara Delevingne, Sarah Paulson, and Olivia Rodrigo will be gracing the Met steps too. Barry Keoghan is said to have gotten an invite for the second year in a row.\n\nWith these select individuals, we can also assume Vogue's two red carpet hosts, La La Anthony and Emma Chamberlain, will be back again.\n\nWho is going to the 2024 Met Gala and who will skip the event?\n\n16:04 , Amber Raiken\n\nWhenever the Met Gala is held, there are certain guidelines that guests will be expected to follow, should they want to stay in event organiser Anna Wintour's good books. And when we think about all the celebrities attending the event, some rules are a bit unexpected.\n\nFor example, one would think that all who attend an event as glitzy as the Met Gala would be forgiven for taking the odd photograph to capture special moments of the occasion. However, in 2015 it was reported that the use of social media had been banned from the event, to clamp down on celebrities spending the majority of the evening on their phones.\n\nHere are four other surprising rules guests are expected to follow when entering the Met Gala tonight.\n\nAccording to Vogue, invitees to tonight's event are meant to follow the dress code, \"The Garden of Time\" - telling the story of Count Axel, his countess, and their dwindling garden. From this, guests should know to represent fleeting beauty and refrain from wearing princess dress or pajama sets.\n\nHowever, not everyone opts to abide by the dress code's memo. Though the argument that every celebrity look worn to the Met Gala is subjected to criticisms and contrasting opinions, some've come out over the last 25 years that were undeniably a point of contention.\n\nFor example, Kim Kardashian wore one of Marilyn Monroe's iconic dresses to the Met Gala in 2022, prompting immediate controversy. People were angered by the Skims creator's decision to wear the actual dress, a piece that was already so fragile. Some claimed she tore the back of the dress until Ripley's confirmed the garment wasn't at all damaged.\n\nHere are some of the most memorable looks at the Met Gala over the years that were met with intense criticism.\n\nThe most controversial outfits worn to the Met Gala\n\n14:32 , Amber Raiken\n\nVogue will live-stream the highly-anticipated fashion event on its TikTok and YouTube accounts. While the broadcast is expected to begin at 6 pm, some celebrities will walk the red carpet on the museum's iconic steps a bit earlier than that.\n\nIn addition, E! News will also be covering the gala for its Live From E! broadcast tonight. As noted by E! News, the broadcast will \"give a sneak peek at stars' Met Gala 'fits as they depart from The Mark Hotel and The Pierre Hotel\" in New York City. TV host Ross Mathews will also be interviewing celebrities when they arrive at the museum, with the broadcast expected to run from 6 pm ET to 9:30 pm ET.\n\n13:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nWhile some may argue Anna Wintour's mandated approval makes the Met Gala one of the most exclusive events, the hefty \"cover fee\" makes it even more restrictive.\n\nThis year, the New York Times reported a single ticket price was $75,000, while the cost of a table was at a minimum of $350,000. In 2023, the cost was $25,000 less for a single ticket.\n\nThere's no denying the Kardashian-Jenner women are show-stoppers on the Met Gala red carpet. Year after year, the reality TV sisters make a splash on the big day, whether praised for their styles or ridiculed for their attempts.\n\nLast year, Kim, Kylie, and Kendall were the only three to show up on the first Monday in May. The year before, all five sisters and their self-proclaimed \"momager,\" Kris Jenner, attended the Met Gala, marking the first year everyone was invited. Considering Khloe and Kourtney's 2023 absence, fans aren't betting they'll be coming this year. Kim and Kylie are usually mainstays, but as of now, their arrival isn't guaranteed.\n\nAnna Wintour has made her list, checked it twice, and sent out the invites, but who will show up?\n\nEvery year, the editor-in-chief of Vogue has the final say on who will be allowed to grace the red carpet on the first Monday in May for \"fashion's biggest night out\". Of course, we all have our favourites, but they ultimately have to be the British tastemaker's favourites too.\n\nThe four co-chairs - Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny - and the four hosts - La La Anthony, Ashley Graham, Gwendoline Christie, and Emma Chamberlain - will be in attendance. According to a Page Six report, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Olivia Rodrigo, Sarah Paulson, and Cara Delevingne will also arrive on 6 May for the annual Met Gala. Additionally, Barry Keoghan, Lily Gladstone, and Ayo Edebiri have allegedly been invited.\n\nWho is going to the 2024 Met Gala and who will skip the event?\n\n04:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nDespite initial predictions, A-listers and attendees hopefully won't arrive in designer jammies or Disney princess garb. The theme, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" shouldn't be taken literally. Guests will abide by a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" referencing JG Ballard's 1962 story.\n\nBased on the dystopian tale of the dwindling crystalline garden, celebrities should be motivated by natural elements relating to eternal beauty. Florals, rosettes, and live greenery are just a few embellishments expected to be stitched into designer looks on the red carpet. From Loewe's sprouted grass coat to Simone Rocha's chiffon dress with pink stemmed roses, guests will carefully select and craft pieces that model tender cues in nature, while minding a \"passing time\" motif.\n\nThe theme of the 2024 Met Gala, scheduled for 6 May, focuses on bringing archival forms back to life by reimagining them in digital forms. Of course, the unofficial concept of the night will likely be floral galore under a dress code of \"The Garden of Time\".\n\nThe \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibition will feature 250 pieces from The Costume Institute's collection. According to Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in charge of The Costume Institute, Charles Frederick Worth's 1877 silk satin gown was a motivating piece. From there, 50 designs became the center of the exhibit. These pieces are the \"sleeping beauties,\" so fragile they can never be worn again. Textiles and fabrics will be categorised under three zones relating to the environment: land, sea, and sky.\n\nWhat does the 2024 Met Gala theme 'Sleeping Beauties' actually mean?\n\nAllegedly, the 2024 co-chair's outfit is still in production. While many stars are scheduling their final fittings two days before the main event, the Euphoria star's stylist, Law Roach, claimed they haven't even seen her dress yet.\n\n\"I haven't seen Zendaya's dress! We've been on two press tours - Dune 2 and Challengers - and doing two Vogue covers,\" Roach told The New York Times. \"The dress isn't even made. They won't fit until Saturday.\"\n\nLaw Roach reveals Zendaya's Met Gala dress hasn't been made yet\n\nSunday 5 May 2024 22:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nAhead of the big night, Rihanna teased her 2024 Met Gala look, admitting it was a completely different one than she's gone for in the past. The \"Diamonds\" singer plans to make a modest statement.\n\nSpeaking to Vogue, Rihanna confirmed she would be sporting her Fenty brands. \"I'm gonna wear Fenty something! Fenty Beauty, Fenty Skin, Fenty Savage,\" she told the outlet.\n\nAs for her outfit, fans should expect the unexpected. \"I've done so much sh** in my life. I've had my nipples out, my panties out,\" she admitted. \"But now, those are the things which, I guess as a mum and an evolved young lady - emphasis on young - there are things I feel like I would never do. Like: 'Oh my God, I really did that? Nips out?\"\n\nWhile some may argue Anna Wintour's mandated approval makes the Met Gala one of the most exclusive events, the hefty \"cover fee\" makes it even more restrictive.\n\nThis year, the New York Times reported a single ticket price was $75,000, while the cost of a table was at a minimum of $350,000. The co-chairs for the evening include Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny, while Vogue's red-carpet hosts will be La La Anthony, Gwendoline Christie, and Ashley Graham, alongside special correspondent Emma Chamberlain.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" - which is not a reference the Disney fairytale. Inside the exhibit, 250 pieces from the Costume Institute's permanent collection will be showcased, some dating back to the Elizabethan period. The idea is to reimagine fragile designs that can never be worn again in new ways through CGI, light projections, soundscaping, and video animation.\n\nGuests will follow a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" a nod to JG Ballard's 1962 tale. The story details Count Axel, his Countess, and their dwindling garden as an angry mob descends on their peaceful home and nursery of crystalline flowers.\n\nAlong with all four co-chairs and the event's organiser Anna Wintour, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson, Cara Delevingne, and Olivia Rodrigo are expected to be at tonight's Met Gala, according to a 13 April Page Six report.\n\nThe broadcast of the 2024 Met Gala red carpet will begin at 6pm ET, with the event streaming on Vogue's TikTok and YouTube account.\n\n22:13 , Chelsea Ritschel\n\nAlthough Gigi Hadid has not yet arrived at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, she's teasing her look for the night.\n\nThe supermodel has revealed that she will be wearing Thom Browne on the green and white carpet. According to a report shared by TMZ last month, Swift and her boyfriend, Travis Kelce, both received invitations to the event, which is in support of the Metropolitan Museum of Art's coveted costume institution.\n\nHowever, Swift will not be attending because the gala falls during the same week her Eras Tour will be returning from its break with a concert in Paris. This is no definitive reason why Kelce will not be going to the Met Gala, but TMZ reported he's likely skipping it because his girlfriend won't be there.\n\n21:23 , Kaleigh Werner\n\nWith just a few hours left until attendees begin to arrive on the red carpet, the streets outside of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City have filled with fans eager to see their favourite A-listers.\n\n21:00 , Amber Raiken\n\nDuring an appearance on Good Morning America, hours before the Met Gala, event co-chair Jennifer Lopez made a quip about her look for the red carpet. While outside of the museum in New York City, people were also given pieces of tonight's red carpet, which were green and beige.\n\n18:15 , Amber Raiken\n\nDuring an interview with Jenna Bush Hager for Today, which aired on 6 May, Anna Wintour discussed the theme of the 2024 gala: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" and the inspiration behind its dress code, \"The Garden of Time.\"\n\n\"This exhibition broke my cardinal rule,\" she said. \"When we came up with the title 'Sleeping Beauties,' it's wonderful and poetic and romantic, but actually, it could be many, many things.\"\n\nThe Editor-in-Chief of Vogue recalled that when establishing the theme, she turned to the Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, Andrew Bolton, for advice on what celebrities could wear. She also acknowledged that amid those conversations about outfits, the public was then confused about that dress code.\n\n\"I said, 'What are we gonna say to people to wear to this night?' And he said, 'Well, what about 'Garden of Time?'\" she explained. \"So, I fear that we've unleashed a lot of confusion out there, and for which I deeply apologise.\"\n\n17:30 , Amber Raiken\n\nOver the weekend, the Metropolitan Museum of Art prepared for its annual fashion extravaganza by setting up its iconic tent, which celebrities step into when entering the gala.\n\nThis year, the front of the white tent includes a graphic of a rose, as it reads: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" The tent name is a reference to the theme of the gala, which intends to dig up tangible pieces of history, some of which were put to rest years ago, to motivate conversation about natural elements and emotion, as well as pay homage to the intimacy between a garment and its wearer with the transformative power of current technology.\n\n16:54 , Amber Raiken\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala co-chairs - Chris Hemsworth, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny - are guaranteed to be at the event tonight, along, with the gala's hosts and sponsors: Loewe's creative director, Jonathan Anderson and TikTok's CEO, Shou Zi Chew.\n\nAccording to a 13 April Page Sixreport, Lily Gladstone and Ayo Edebiri are two newcomers to the Met Gala invite list this year. Additionally, a source speaking to the outlet said Gisele B\u00fcndchen, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Cara Delevingne, Sarah Paulson, and Olivia Rodrigo will be gracing the Met steps too. Barry Keoghan is said to have gotten an invite for the second year in a row.\n\nWith these select individuals, we can also assume Vogue's two red carpet hosts, La La Anthony and Emma Chamberlain, will be back again.\n\nWho is going to the 2024 Met Gala and who will skip the event?\n\n16:04 , Amber Raiken\n\nWhenever the Met Gala is held, there are certain guidelines that guests will be expected to follow, should they want to stay in event organiser Anna Wintour's good books. And when we think about all the celebrities attending the event, some rules are a bit unexpected.\n\nFor example, one would think that all who attend an event as glitzy as the Met Gala would be forgiven for taking the odd photograph to capture special moments of the occasion. However, in 2015 it was reported that the use of social media had been banned from the event, to clamp down on celebrities spending the majority of the evening on their phones.\n\nHere are four other surprising rules guests are expected to follow when entering the Met Gala tonight.\n\nAccording to Vogue, invitees to tonight's event are meant to follow the dress code, \"The Garden of Time\" - telling the story of Count Axel, his countess, and their dwindling garden. From this, guests should know to represent fleeting beauty and refrain from wearing princess dress or pajama sets.\n\nHowever, not everyone opts to abide by the dress code's memo. Though the argument that every celebrity look worn to the Met Gala is subjected to criticisms and contrasting opinions, some've come out over the last 25 years that were undeniably a point of contention.\n\nFor example, Kim Kardashian wore one of Marilyn Monroe's iconic dresses to the Met Gala in 2022, prompting immediate controversy. People were angered by the Skims creator's decision to wear the actual dress, a piece that was already so fragile. Some claimed she tore the back of the dress until Ripley's confirmed the garment wasn't at all damaged.\n\nHere are some of the most memorable looks at the Met Gala over the years that were met with intense criticism.\n\nThe most controversial outfits worn to the Met Gala\n\n14:32 , Amber Raiken\n\nVogue will live-stream the highly-anticipated fashion event on its TikTok and YouTube accounts. TV host Ross Mathews will also be interviewing celebrities when they arrive at the museum, with the broadcast expected to run from 6 pm ET to 9:30 pm ET.\n\n13:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nWhile some may argue Anna Wintour's mandated approval makes the Met Gala one of the most exclusive events, the hefty \"cover fee\" makes it even more restrictive.\n\nThis year, the New York Times reported a single ticket price was $75,000, while the cost of a table was at a minimum of $350,000. In 2023, the cost was $25,000 less for a single ticket.\n\nThere's no denying the Kardashian-Jenner women are show-stoppers on the Met Gala red carpet. Year after year, the reality TV sisters make a splash on the big day, whether praised for their styles or ridiculed for their attempts.\n\nLast year, Kim, Kylie, and Kendall were the only three to show up on the first Monday in May. The year before, all five sisters and their self-proclaimed \"momager,\" Kris Jenner, attended the Met Gala, marking the first year everyone was invited. Considering Khloe and Kourtney's 2023 absence, fans aren't betting they'll be coming this year. Kim and Kylie are usually mainstays, but as of now, their arrival isn't guaranteed.\n\nAnna Wintour has made her list, checked it twice, and sent out the invites, but who will show up?\n\nEvery year, the editor-in-chief of Vogue has the final say on who will be allowed to grace the red carpet on the first Monday in May for \"fashion's biggest night out\". Of course, we all have our favourites, but they ultimately have to be the British tastemaker's favourites too.\n\nThe four co-chairs - Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny - and the four hosts - La La Anthony, Ashley Graham, Gwendoline Christie, and Emma Chamberlain - will be in attendance. According to a Page Six report, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Olivia Rodrigo, Sarah Paulson, and Cara Delevingne will also arrive on 6 May for the annual Met Gala. Additionally, Barry Keoghan, Lily Gladstone, and Ayo Edebiri have allegedly been invited.\n\nWho is going to the 2024 Met Gala and who will skip the event?\n\n04:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nDespite initial predictions, A-listers and attendees hopefully won't arrive in designer jammies or Disney princess garb. The theme, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" shouldn't be taken literally. Guests will abide by a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" referencing JG Ballard's 1962 story.\n\nBased on the dystopian tale of the dwindling crystalline garden, celebrities should be motivated by natural elements relating to eternal beauty. Florals, rosettes, and live greenery are just a few embellishments expected to be stitched into designer looks on the red carpet. From Loewe's sprouted grass coat to Simone Rocha's chiffon dress with pink stemmed roses, guests will carefully select and craft pieces that model tender cues in nature, while minding a \"passing time\" motif.\n\nThe theme of the 2024 Met Gala, scheduled for 6 May, focuses on bringing archival forms back to life by reimagining them in digital forms. Of course, the unofficial concept of the night will likely be floral galore under a dress code of \"The Garden of Time\".\n\nThe \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibition will feature 250 pieces from The Costume Institute's collection. According to Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in charge of The Costume Institute, Charles Frederick Worth's 1877 silk satin gown was a motivating piece. From there, 50 designs became the center of the exhibit. These pieces are the \"sleeping beauties,\" so fragile they can never be worn again. Textiles and fabrics will be categorised under three zones relating to the environment: land, sea, and sky.\n\nWhat does the 2024 Met Gala theme 'Sleeping Beauties' actually mean?\n\nAllegedly, the 2024 co-chair's outfit is still in production. While many stars are scheduling their final fittings two days before the main event, the Euphoria star's stylist, Law Roach, claimed they haven't even seen her dress yet.\n\n\"I haven't seen Zendaya's dress! We've been on two press tours - Dune 2 and Challengers - and doing two Vogue covers,\" Roach told The New York Times. \"The dress isn't even made. They won't fit until Saturday.\"\n\nLaw Roach reveals Zendaya's Met Gala dress hasn't been made yet\n\nSunday 5 May 2024 22:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nAhead of the big night, Rihanna teased her 2024 Met Gala look, admitting it was a completely different one than she's gone for in the past. The year before, all five sisters and their self-proclaimed \"momager,\" Kris Jenner, attended the Met Gala, marking the first year everyone was invited. Considering Khloe and Kourtney's 2023 absence, fans aren't betting they'll be coming this year. Kim and Kylie are usually mainstays, but as of now, their arrival isn't guaranteed.\n\nAnna Wintour has made her list, checked it twice, and sent out the invites, but who will show up?\n\nEvery year, the editor-in-chief of Vogue has the final say on who will be allowed to grace the red carpet on the first Monday in May for \"fashion's biggest night out\". Of course, we all have our favourites, but they ultimately have to be the British tastemaker's favourites too.\n\nThe four co-chairs - Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny - and the four hosts - La La Anthony, Ashley Graham, Gwendoline Christie, and Emma Chamberlain - will be in attendance. According to a Page Six report, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Olivia Rodrigo, Sarah Paulson, and Cara Delevingne will also arrive on 6 May for the annual Met Gala. Additionally, Barry Keoghan, Lily Gladstone, and Ayo Edebiri have allegedly been invited.\n\nWho is going to the 2024 Met Gala and who will skip the event?\n\nSunday 5 May 2024 14:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nDespite initial predictions, A-listers and attendees hopefully won't arrive in designer jammies or Disney princess garb. The theme, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" shouldn't be taken literally. Guests will abide by a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" referencing JG Ballard's 1962 story.\n\nBased on the dystopian tale of the dwindling crystalline garden, celebrities should be motivated by natural elements relating to eternal beauty. Florals, rosettes, and live greenery are just a few embellishments expected to be stitched into designer looks on the red carpet. From Loewe's sprouted grass coat to Simone Rocha's chiffon dress with pink stemmed roses, guests will carefully select and craft pieces that model tender cues in nature, while minding a \"passing time\" motif.\n\nA former Met Gala worker, Eugenio Casnighi, has revealed he's been fired from this year's event for upstaging Kylie Jenner at the 2023 celebration.\n\nThe 26-year-old worked as a greeter for the museum's previous two events and suggested that he'd been excluded by organisers after his looks stole the show last year.\n\n\"I've been fired from the Met Gala... They blamed me,\" the model said in a video obtained by the Daily Mail. \"They said, 'You made it about yourself, so we don't want to work with you anymore.'\"\n\nSunday 5 May 2024 12:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nThe theme of the 2024 Met Gala, scheduled for 6 May, focuses on bringing archival forms back to life by reimagining them in digital forms. Of course, the unofficial concept of the night will likely be floral galore under a dress code of \"The Garden of Time\".\n\nThe \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibition will feature 250 pieces from The Costume Institute's collection. According to Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in charge of The Costume Institute, Charles Frederick Worth's 1877 silk satin gown was a motivating piece. From there, 50 designs became the center of the exhibit. These pieces are the \"sleeping beauties,\" so fragile they can never be worn again. Textiles and fabrics will be categorised under three zones relating to the environment: land, sea, and sky.\n\nWhat does the 2024 Met Gala theme 'Sleeping Beauties' actually mean?\n\nSunday 5 May 2024 10:51 , Louis Chilton\n\nFor anyone feeling nostalgic, here's a look back at the best outfits from last year\n\nThe good, the bad and the downright crazy looks from the Met Gala\n\nAllegedly, the 2024 co-chair's outfit is still in production. While many stars are scheduling their final fittings two days before the main event, the Euphoria star's stylist, Law Roach, claimed they haven't even seen her dress yet.\n\n\"I haven't seen Zendaya's dress! We've been on two press tours - Dune 2 and Challengers - and doing two Vogue covers,\" Roach told The New York Times. \"The dress isn't even made. They won't fit until Saturday.\"\n\nLaw Roach reveals Zendaya's Met Gala dress hasn't been made yet\n\nSaturday 4 May 2024 17:45 , Kaleigh Werner\n\nAhead of the big night, Rihanna teased her 2024 Met Gala look, admitting it was a completely different one than she's gone for in the past. The \"Diamonds\" singer plans to make a modest statement.\n\nSpeaking to Vogue, Rihanna confirmed she would be sporting her Fenty brands. \"I'm gonna wear Fenty something! Fenty Beauty, Fenty Skin, Fenty Savage,\" she told the outlet.\n\nAs for her outfit, fans should expect the unexpected. \"I've done so much sh** in my life. I've had my nipples out, my panties out,\" she admitted. \"But now, those are the things which, I guess as a mum and an evolved young lady - emphasis on young - there are things I feel like I would never do. Like: 'Oh my God, I really did that? Nips out?\"\n\nWhile some may argue Anna Wintour's mandated approval makes the Met Gala one of the most exclusive events, the hefty \"cover fee\" makes it even more restrictive.\n\nThis year, the New York Times reported a single ticket price was $75,000, while the cost of a table was at a minimum of $350,000. In 2023, the cost was $25,000 less for a single ticket.\n\nThere's no denying the Kardashian-Jenner women are show-stoppers on the Met Gala red carpet. Year after year, the reality TV sisters make a splash on the big day, whether praised for their styles or ridiculed for their attempts.\n\nLast year, Kim, Kylie, and Kendall were the only three to show up on the first Monday in May. The co-chairs for the evening include Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny, while Vogue's red-carpet hosts will be La La Anthony, Gwendoline Christie, and Ashley Graham, alongside special correspondent Emma Chamberlain.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" - which is not a reference the Disney fairytale. Inside the exhibit, 250 pieces from the Costume Institute's permanent collection will be showcased, some dating back to the Elizabethan period. The idea is to reimagine fragile designs that can never be worn again in new ways through CGI, light projections, soundscaping, and video animation.\n\nGuests will follow a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" a nod to JG Ballard's 1962 tale. The story details Count Axel, his Countess, and their dwindling garden as an angry mob descends on their peaceful home and nursery of crystalline flowers.\n\nAlong with all four co-chairs and the event's organiser Anna Wintour, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson, Cara Delevingne, and Olivia Rodrigo are expected to be at tonight's Met Gala, according to a 13 April Page Six report.\n\nThe broadcast of the 2024 Met Gala red carpet will begin at 6pm ET, with the event streaming on Vogue's TikTok and YouTube account.\n\n22:13 , Chelsea Ritschel\n\nAlthough Gigi Hadid has not yet arrived at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, she's teasing her look for the night.\n\nThe supermodel has revealed that she will be wearing Thom Browne on the green and white carpet. While outside of the museum in New York City, people were also given pieces of tonight's red carpet, which were green and beige.\n\n18:15 , Amber Raiken\n\nDuring an interview with Jenna Bush Hager for Today, which aired on 6 May, Anna Wintour discussed the theme of the 2024 gala: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" and the inspiration behind its dress code, \"The Garden of Time.\"\n\n\"This exhibition broke my cardinal rule,\" she said. \"When we came up with the title 'Sleeping Beauties,' it's wonderful and poetic and romantic, but actually, it could be many, many things.\"\n\nThe Editor-in-Chief of Vogue recalled that when establishing the theme, she turned to the Curator in Charge of The Costume Institute, Andrew Bolton, for advice on what celebrities could wear. She also acknowledged that amid those conversations about outfits, the public was then confused about that dress code.\n\n\"I said, 'What are we gonna say to people to wear to this night?' And he said, 'Well, what about 'Garden of Time?'\" she explained. \"So, I fear that we've unleashed a lot of confusion out there, and for which I deeply apologise.\"\n\n17:30 , Amber Raiken\n\nOver the weekend, the Metropolitan Museum of Art prepared for its annual fashion extravaganza by setting up its iconic tent, which celebrities step into when entering the gala.\n\nThis year, the front of the white tent includes a graphic of a rose, as it reads: \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.\" The tent name is a reference to the theme of the gala, which intends to dig up tangible pieces of history, some of which were put to rest years ago, to motivate conversation about natural elements and emotion, as well as pay homage to the intimacy between a garment and its wearer with the transformative power of current technology.\n\n16:54 , Amber Raiken\n\nThe 2024 Met Gala co-chairs - Chris Hemsworth, Zendaya, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny - are guaranteed to be at the event tonight, along, with the gala's hosts and sponsors: Loewe's creative director, Jonathan Anderson and TikTok's CEO, Shou Zi Chew.\n\nAccording to a 13 April Page Sixreport, Lily Gladstone and Ayo Edebiri are two newcomers to the Met Gala invite list this year. Barry Keoghan is said to have gotten an invite for the second year in a row.\n\nWith these select individuals, we can also assume Vogue's two red carpet hosts, La La Anthony and Emma Chamberlain, will be back again.\n\nWho is going to the 2024 Met Gala and who will skip the event?\n\n16:04 , Amber Raiken\n\nWhenever the Met Gala is held, there are certain guidelines that guests will be expected to follow, should they want to stay in event organiser Anna Wintour's good books. And when we think about all the celebrities attending the event, some rules are a bit unexpected.\n\nFor example, one would think that all who attend an event as glitzy as the Met Gala would be forgiven for taking the odd photograph to capture special moments of the occasion. However, in 2015 it was reported that the use of social media had been banned from the event, to clamp down on celebrities spending the majority of the evening on their phones.\n\nHere are four other surprising rules guests are expected to follow when entering the Met Gala tonight.\n\nAccording to Vogue, invitees to tonight's event are meant to follow the dress code, \"The Garden of Time\" - telling the story of Count Axel, his countess, and their dwindling garden. From this, guests should know to represent fleeting beauty and refrain from wearing princess dress or pajama sets.\n\nHowever, not everyone opts to abide by the dress code's memo. Though the argument that every celebrity look worn to the Met Gala is subjected to criticisms and contrasting opinions, some've come out over the last 25 years that were undeniably a point of contention.\n\nFor example, Kim Kardashian wore one of Marilyn Monroe's iconic dresses to the Met Gala in 2022, prompting immediate controversy. People were angered by the Skims creator's decision to wear the actual dress, a piece that was already so fragile. Some claimed she tore the back of the dress until Ripley's confirmed the garment wasn't at all damaged.\n\nHere are some of the most memorable looks at the Met Gala over the years that were met with intense criticism.\n\nThe most controversial outfits worn to the Met Gala\n\n14:32 , Amber Raiken\n\nVogue will live-stream the highly-anticipated fashion event on its TikTok and YouTube accounts. While the broadcast is expected to begin at 6 pm, some celebrities will walk the red carpet on the museum's iconic steps a bit earlier than that.\n\nIn addition, E! News will also be covering the gala for its Live From E! broadcast tonight. As noted by E! News, the broadcast will \"give a sneak peek at stars' Met Gala 'fits as they depart from The Mark Hotel and The Pierre Hotel\" in New York City. TV host Ross Mathews will also be interviewing celebrities when they arrive at the museum, with the broadcast expected to run from 6 pm ET to 9:30 pm ET.\n\n13:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nWhile some may argue Anna Wintour's mandated approval makes the Met Gala one of the most exclusive events, the hefty \"cover fee\" makes it even more restrictive.\n\nThis year, the New York Times reported a single ticket price was $75,000, while the cost of a table was at a minimum of $350,000. In 2023, the cost was $25,000 less for a single ticket.\n\nThere's no denying the Kardashian-Jenner women are show-stoppers on the Met Gala red carpet. Year after year, the reality TV sisters make a splash on the big day, whether praised for their styles or ridiculed for their attempts.\n\nLast year, Kim, Kylie, and Kendall were the only three to show up on the first Monday in May. The year before, all five sisters and their self-proclaimed \"momager,\" Kris Jenner, attended the Met Gala, marking the first year everyone was invited. Considering Khloe and Kourtney's 2023 absence, fans aren't betting they'll be coming this year. Kim and Kylie are usually mainstays, but as of now, their arrival isn't guaranteed.\n\nAnna Wintour has made her list, checked it twice, and sent out the invites, but who will show up?\n\nEvery year, the editor-in-chief of Vogue has the final say on who will be allowed to grace the red carpet on the first Monday in May for \"fashion's biggest night out\". Of course, we all have our favourites, but they ultimately have to be the British tastemaker's favourites too.\n\nThe four co-chairs - Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny - and the four hosts - La La Anthony, Ashley Graham, Gwendoline Christie, and Emma Chamberlain - will be in attendance. According to a Page Six report, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Olivia Rodrigo, Sarah Paulson, and Cara Delevingne will also arrive on 6 May for the annual Met Gala. Additionally, Barry Keoghan, Lily Gladstone, and Ayo Edebiri have allegedly been invited.\n\nWho is going to the 2024 Met Gala and who will skip the event?\n\n04:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nDespite initial predictions, A-listers and attendees hopefully won't arrive in designer jammies or Disney princess garb. The theme, \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion,\" shouldn't be taken literally. Guests will abide by a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" referencing JG Ballard's 1962 story.\n\nBased on the dystopian tale of the dwindling crystalline garden, celebrities should be motivated by natural elements relating to eternal beauty. Florals, rosettes, and live greenery are just a few embellishments expected to be stitched into designer looks on the red carpet. From Loewe's sprouted grass coat to Simone Rocha's chiffon dress with pink stemmed roses, guests will carefully select and craft pieces that model tender cues in nature, while minding a \"passing time\" motif.\n\nThe theme of the 2024 Met Gala, scheduled for 6 May, focuses on bringing archival forms back to life by reimagining them in digital forms. Of course, the unofficial concept of the night will likely be floral galore under a dress code of \"The Garden of Time\".\n\nThe \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" exhibition will feature 250 pieces from The Costume Institute's collection. According to Andrew Bolton, Wendy Yu Curator in charge of The Costume Institute, Charles Frederick Worth's 1877 silk satin gown was a motivating piece. From there, 50 designs became the center of the exhibit. These pieces are the \"sleeping beauties,\" so fragile they can never be worn again. Textiles and fabrics will be categorised under three zones relating to the environment: land, sea, and sky.\n\nWhat does the 2024 Met Gala theme 'Sleeping Beauties' actually mean?\n\nAllegedly, the 2024 co-chair's outfit is still in production. While many stars are scheduling their final fittings two days before the main event, the Euphoria star's stylist, Law Roach, claimed they haven't even seen her dress yet.\n\n\"I haven't seen Zendaya's dress! We've been on two press tours - Dune 2 and Challengers - and doing two Vogue covers,\" Roach told The New York Times. \"The dress isn't even made. They won't fit until Saturday.\"\n\nLaw Roach reveals Zendaya's Met Gala dress hasn't been made yet\n\nSunday 5 May 2024 22:30 , kaleigh werner\n\nAhead of the big night, Rihanna teased her 2024 Met Gala look, admitting it was a completely different one than she's gone for in the past. I've had my nipples out, my panties out,\" she admitted. \"But now, those are the things which, I guess as a mum and an evolved young lady - emphasis on young - there are things I feel like I would never do. The co-chairs for the evening include Zendaya, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lopez, and Bad Bunny, while Vogue's red-carpet hosts will be La La Anthony, Gwendoline Christie, and Ashley Graham, alongside special correspondent Emma Chamberlain.\n\nThis year's theme is \"Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion\" - which is not a reference the Disney fairytale. Inside the exhibit, 250 pieces from the Costume Institute's permanent collection will be showcased, some dating back to the Elizabethan period. The idea is to reimagine fragile designs that can never be worn again in new ways through CGI, light projections, soundscaping, and video animation.\n\nGuests will follow a dress code of \"The Garden of Time,\" a nod to JG Ballard's 1962 tale. The story details Count Axel, his Countess, and their dwindling garden as an angry mob descends on their peaceful home and nursery of crystalline flowers.\n\nAlong with all four co-chairs and the event's organiser Anna Wintour, Rihanna, A$AP Rocky, Kendall Jenner, Uma Thurman, Sarah Paulson, Cara Delevingne, and Olivia Rodrigo are expected to be at tonight's Met Gala, according to a 13 April Page Six report.\n\nThe broadcast of the 2024 Met Gala red carpet will begin at 6pm ET, with the event streaming on Vogue's TikTok and YouTube account.\n\n22:13 , Chelsea Ritschel\n\nAlthough Gigi Hadid has not yet arrived at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, she's teasing her look for the night.\n\nThe supermodel has revealed that she will be wearing Thom Browne on the green and white carpet.
